About Greenworks Lending
Greenworks Lending is a rapidly growing company with the goal of changing how our country’s buildings produce and use energy. We finance clean energy retrofits and clean new construction on commercial building through an innovative program called C-PACE (Commercial Property Assessed Clean Energy). C-PACE is a public-private financing mechanism through which private lenders provide low-cost, long-term funding for energy efficiency, renewable energy and water conservation projects in commercial properties. C-PACE financing is repaid as an assessment on the property’s regular tax bill and processed the same way as other local public benefit assessments have been for decades. C-PACE is gaining traction among real estate owners and developers who are incorporating this specialty financing into their capital stacks.
Greenworks Lending is the nation’s leading C-PACE provider, currently active in 23 states and the District of Columbia. We have offices in Darien, CT (HQ), New York, NY, Bethesda, MD and San Francisco, CA. This position is remote and the expectation is that the ideal candidate would be located in Colorado, California, Illinois, Texas or New York and could travel as needed.
Role Summary
The Associate Director of Market Activation and Strategy plays a critical role in all aspects of market development throughout the country. The position sits within the nexus of clean energy, finance and commercial real estate development.
The Associate Director will benefit from rapid on-the-job learning, unparalleled strategic input, access to company executives and tremendous growth potential.
Key responsibilities include:
Creating interest in Greenworks and the C-PACE asset class from a blank or nearly blank canvas in multiple markets across the country.
Creating a strategy and executing on an overarching framework for establishing markets and bringing them to further maturation.
Breaking into new relationships and “getting your foot in the door” via any effective means necessary.
Aligning a pitch and navigating to a strong value proposition for the needs of that particular stakeholder to increase the odds of success.
Effortlessly walking through - even for the most sophisticated audiences – the Greenworks and C-PACE value and process so as to win new deal flow for the firm.
From one’s efforts, generating deal flow into the firm’s pipeline and handing off the execution of deals and channels to the proper parties at Greenworks.
From one’s immersion in the markets, working with senior leadership to refine channel strategy, marketing activities, product orientation and overall firm efforts.
Qualifications:
The Associate Director’s role is suited for a mid-career (5-10 years’ experience) professional with experience in market/product/policy development work. Top candidates will have the following characteristics:
Ability to self-manage and generate activity, momentum and success on their own.
Creative thinker and the ability to generate new manners and methods to arrive at fundamental end-goals and needs of the position.
Natural ability to establish and maintain personal and business relationships as a means to create deal flow for Greenworks.
The political instincts to see relationships and networks and to extract value for the firm through pro-active engagement.
Emotionally nuanced and able to “read an audience” and empathize with counterparties interests and goals.
Ability to engage positively with both external and internal stakeholders
Excellent interpersonal skills (phone and in-person) and written and verbal communication skills
High level of adaptability to a quickly changing environment
Demonstrated interest in sustainability and/or clean energy deployment
Details:
Competitive salary and outsized bonus potential based on exceeding revenue goals
Paid time off; health care, dental, vision, FSA, HSA, commuter benefits, 401K
Social activities and a flexible schedule/work life balance philosophy
This is an excellent opportunity for motivated individuals to grow with a rapidly expanding company and further their career path.
Greenworks Lending is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Overview:

Communications Intern, Geocycle

Company Description:
Geocycle, as LafargeHolcim affiliate, dedicates itself to advancing a zero-waste future. Our approach to industrial waste management helps solve the global waste challenge. By providing responsible, sustainable solutions, we contribute to a cleaner environment and better, more appealing living spaces. We work with our stakeholders in communities around the world to advance a circular economy and ensure a brighter, zero waste tomorrow. Our co-processing solution, which utilizes the cement kiln for disposal, prevents residues and reduces the need for landfills. It frees up valuable land for more profitable human use. It also eliminates toxins that can find their way into soil and ground water.
Responsibilities:

customers, and all other aspects of service

social platforms

Join a global team of highly engaged and collaborative software and marketing experts to help drive our continued growth in the analytical science markets. The eCDS product marketing team promotes Chromeleon through impactful marketing programs, sales enablement activities and regularly interactions with customers through seminars or targeted 1:1 activities.
We are looking for a marketing specialist for Chromeleon’s quantitative MS/MS software capabilities to expand our eCDS team. This role is fully remote based from Western Europe or Eastern/Central United States.
The ideal candidate
Has practical experience with ThermoFisher Scientific’s GC-MS or/and LC-MS QQQ instruments in the Food Safety, Environmental or Pharma Contract Testing Lab applications.
Is willing to travel up to 25% of their time
Is self-motivated and used to work towards challenging goals
Enjoys collaboration and interaction with their team and peers

Market and promote Chromeleon capabilities for quantitative MS/MS analysis in Analytical Science markets to internal and external customers:
Create Value-Add Chromeleon marketing collateral for Analytical Science segments in Environmental, Food Safety and Contract Testing Labs
Develop and deliver agreed sales tactics on time as defined in the annual marketing plan and the rolling Marcom planning calls

Identify promotion opportunities and drive value-add promotions around Quan MS/MS Software
Support commercial teams in their sales activities for Chromeleon
Become the primary interface for Quan MS/MS software related interactions to sales and BU peers
Reply to written or phone requests for sales support activities from commercial contacts
Closely work with the eCDS and CoE pre-sales channel to educate them on best practices how to demo Chromeleon software, create scripts and pre-recorded short, canned demo versions with pre-configured systems
Head regular remote and if necessary f2f meetings with the pre-sales channel to enable sharing of best practices, collect feedback and drive continuous education
Assist eCDS sales channel to drive generalist and specialist training
Conduct joint remote and f2f visits with commercial at key customers or for key deals
Provide market insights, application understanding and Sales Messaging for WiAS segment:
Be the key subject matter expert and “go-to” person to eCDS BU peers on all quantitative MS/MS market and application topics

Understand market/customer dynamics to suggest portfolio adjustments

Associate Director, Development (Remote)
 - (2100000L)
The American Diabetes Association is seeking an experienced fundraising professional to develop and steward corporate and individual relationships. Primary duties of the Associate Director, Development include the development and stewardship of existing and new corporate partners, individuals and volunteers.
This individual will identify new opportunities to grow portfolio engagement across all fundraising channels to increase revenue, including corporate partnerships, commercial co-ventures, special events, and individual giving. A successful Associate Director will manage and steward a portfolio of corporate and individual relationships and work as a team player to drive growth that achieves our mission and revenue goals. This position is accountable for significant revenue targets and will influence the strategic implementation of local and nationwide initiatives.
The ideal candidate must have a proven track record of success in fundraising and/or sales and relationship management. Exceptional organizational and written and verbal communication skills are necessary for this position. Must have ability to multitask, meet deadlines, and achieve results in a team environment.
This position will work remotely within 100 miles of the assigned market.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Creates and executes fundraising strategies to raise $500,000–$750,000 annually from corporations; works to grow additional sources of revenue
 Serves as a key member of the development team, influencing and driving strategy, relationships and best practices to accomplish market and region financial goals
 Responsible for developing and stewarding a portfolio of relationships to provide funding for our mission (sponsorship, retail campaigns, event teams, grants, donations and other partnerships)
 Develops revenue projections and provides financial analysis
 Oversees stewardship activities; ensures a high-touch response to partners and donors
Recruits and leads high-level volunteers to provide local leadership, resources and partnerships
Drives donor-centric partnerships to support financial goals of market events, programs and prioritized initiatives.
Delivers a high level of customer service to all constituents
 Ensures compliance with Association policies, including employment, risk management, event and cash handling, and financial controls
Demonstrates integrity, collaboration and stewardship
Performs other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree and 3 years of nonprofit, fundraising and/or sales experience preferred
Experience in peer to peer fundraising is strongly preferred.
Established success in fundraising and nonprofit leadership
Proven record of success in account management and developing corporate partnerships that result in exceeding revenue targets
Knowledge of product marketing/sales concepts
Outcome driven with ability to respond to changing circumstances and priorities
Ability to manage and motivate groups and individuals
Excellent oral and written communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
Strong market, community and constituent perspective
Proficiency in computer-based information systems
Ability to work some nights and weekends
Take Your Career On A Mission

Are you looking for a career that directly impacts your community and beyond?

Over 34 million Americans have diabetes and over 84 million have prediabetes. The American Diabetes Association (ADA) offers a rewarding career working for one of the premier voluntary health organizations in the world supporting people with type 1 & type 2 diabetes.

Our employees like working at the ADA because of our mission, the inclusive environment, work-life balance, our benefits and our culture. Joining our dedicated team affords the gratification of knowing beyond a doubt that you will impact the lives and well-being of millions.
Equal Employment Opportunity

It is the policy of the American Diabetes Association to provide equal employment opportunity to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

To find out more about the ADA as well as other exciting and fulfilling career opportunities please visit us at www.diabetes.org/careers. For full consideration, you must apply directly to the Association’s Careers Page.
There’s nothing we can’t do when we’re Connected for Life!

As the only global provider of commercial solutions, IQVIA understands what it takes to deliver nationally and internationally. Our people help biopharma get their medicines to the people who need them. We help customers gain insight and access to their markets and ultimately demonstrate their product's value to payers, physicians and patients. A significant part of our business is acting as the biopharma's sales force to physicians or, providing therapy area educational input to physicians and patients. With the right experience, you can help deliver medical breakthroughs in the real world.
Virtual Sales Professional – Cardiology
IQVIA is looking for high performing, results-oriented sales professional with a track record of success to join our team as a Virtual Sales Professional. This role is responsible for selling Biopharmaceutical products directly to cardiologists and working collaboratively with a field-based sales team on behalf of our client, AstraZeneca.
The Virtual Sales Professional (VSP) engages health care professionals (HCPs) in virtual discussions to promote assigned client products, maximize the products’ selling potential and meet program and Client objectives. The VSP achieves this by developing and maintaining relationships with HCPs and educating them about product features, benefits, safety profile and approved indications to ensure appropriate patient use. The VSP utilizes approved tools and resources for product promotion and maintains a competent level of product, territory and customer activity knowledge.
Responsibilities:
Create and implement strategically sound business plans and tactical strategies within the assigned customer base to achieve individual and company goals for sales, market share, call metrics, appropriate sample distribution, etc.
Manage daily sales call activity according to defined expectations, with the purpose of influencing customers and increasing product sales:
On behalf of Client, promote Client's products via virtual interactions with assigned HCP targets, engaging them in in-depth program.
Profile and manage a list of HCP targets and provide value-added benefits to grow product volume.
Maintain call productivity and metrics that are required by program.
Manage promotional budget.
Maintain thorough knowledge of AstraZeneca’s products and programs.
Fully comply with all laws, regulations and Supplier Policies, Code of Conduct, all privacy and data guidelines, relevant state and federal laws and regulations, and terms and conditions prescribed in the Sample Administration Agreements and PDMA Guidelines.
Participate in teleconference and live National, regional and district meetings and training sessions and represent client at National and/or local conventions when requested.
Requirements:
Results-oriented with a track record of success.
Bachelor’s degree required.
1+ years sales experience required with:
Experience in inside sales/ contact center required
Pharma/biotech and/or B2B sales experience preferred
Demonstrated success in prior roles i.e. sales rankings, awards & achievements
Superior verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to clearly articulate via phone in a professional and grammatically proficient manner, with the ability to adapt tone, volume, and pace to most effectively communicate
Ability to travel to work related meetings and functions (including overnight and/or weekend).
Must be able to successfully complete client training and meet training expectations in order to proceed to servicing client’s customers within the parameters of the program.
Qualifications, Skills and Abilities:
Results-oriented with a track record of success.
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Clear, articulate and grammatically sound speech and professional appearance.
Strong rapport building skills and active listening skills.
Excellent selling, closing, persuasion and presentation skills.
Ability to learn, understand and communicate complex technical/medical terminology and to maintain the required technical expertise including competitive product knowledge.
Self-motivated and disciplined.
Good organizational and planning skills, strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Demonstrated technical aptitude with computer technology and devices (e.g. iPad, apps).
At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 67,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.

JobTitle: Market Researcher - Opportunity for Working Remotely Chicago, IL
Text:
Title: Market Researcher, Customer Insights (Qualitative/Quantitative)
Job Description
At VMware, we are preparing for the transformation to an even more customer-centric, cloud-ready company, which has resulted in a newly created and unified Customer Experience and Success Team. This has been as a result of many months of talking to our customers, as well as studying best practices in the software industry. This new organization will help to take VMware to the next level of customer satisfaction and success. This newly formed group has brought together various key functions and roles that are crucial to our customer experience. This includes Customer Success, Global Services, Technical Support, Premier Support, Technical Account Management and Professional Services.
In the Customer Success Innovation & Intelligence team, our vision is to enable the organization to deliver repeatable customer experiences that drive outcomes and value for our customers. As a Senior Researcher, you will be responsible for leading qualitative and quantitative research to advise our business partners on key decisions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop hypotheses, design custom research studies, and analyze customer feedback to drive actionable recommendations.
This position requires strong business acumen and ability to distill actionable insights from disparate data sources. If you love data, are a strategic thinker, and want to drive business impact, we would like to hear from you!
Job Requirements
Develop and lead market research initiatives end-to-end
Identify and translate business questions into research/analysis design
Design, launch, and fully execute complex market research/insights initiatives
Analyze data from qualitative, quantitative, and operational data with high accuracy, to uncover findings with business impact
Summarize key findings into compelling data stories and deliverables
Provide actionable recommendations to business units based on findings from analysis
Present and communicate insights to executive stakeholders
Qualifications
5+ years of experience in qualitative and quantitative market research
2+ years of experience in the technology industry
Ability to design, conduct, and analyze qualitative/quantitative market research studies
Experience/interest in writing discussion guides and conducting customer interviews
Experience developing and delivering presentations to executive audiences
Excellent at visualizing data, synthesizing insights, and storytelling with data
Proficient with data analytics, particularly customer feedback and survey data
Strong organizational skills; excellent execution and follow-through
Strong written and verbal communication; demonstrable ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint
Interest in Python, R, SPSS, SAS, and/or similar analytics tools
Knowledge of Voice of the Customer, Customer Success, and Customer Experience strategies preferred
BS/BA degree (or equivalent) in a quantitative or a business field

Founded by The Allstate Corporation in 2016, Arity is a data and analytics company focused on improving transportation. We collect and analyze enormous amounts of data, using predictive analytics to build solutions with a single goal in mind: to make transportation smarter, safer and more useful for everyone.
At the heart of that mission are the people that work here—the dreamers, doers and difference-makers that call this place home. As part of that team, your work will showcase both your intelligence and your creativity as you tackle real problems and put your talents towards transforming transportation.
That’s because at Arity, we believe work and life shouldn’t be at odds with one another. After all, we know that your unique qualities give you a unique perspective. We don’t just want you to see yourself here. We want you to be yourself here.
The Team

Looking to join a strong team with a vision to build the future of transportation? At Arity, achieving our goals requires a product manager eager to work in the trenches with the development team to solve tough problems and produce great results. Just as importantly, they’ll need to collaborate regularly with our engineers, designers, customers, and stakeholders to understand what must be done and why. We’re looking for a dynamic new teammate who’s comfortable scoping out the use cases of a new API one moment, providing design critique the next, and finishing up by building out a roadmap around a new feature—or has the willingness to learn these skills. Above all, an Arity product manager should possess insatiable curiosity and attention to detail. Want to join our team? Let’s chat!
The Role
We are looking for a collaborative and innovative Group Product Manager to drive strategy and vision forward for our Insurance segment. You will get to work closely with designers, data scientists and engineers to translate customer insights, business imperatives and technological advances into great experiences for our customers in the Insurance space.
You have a strong technical and analytical background that can think holistically about customer pain points. You will be involved in continuing to shape the strategic product vision as well as manage product managers who work on product discovery, roadmaps, and manage backlogs to maximize the customer value provided by Arity’s Insurance products.
GPMs at Arity actively coach and mentor product managers to ensure that they are thinking critically, gaining empathy for their users and growing in their roles. Because of this senior responsibility, Group Product Managers must be excellent coaches; proficient at orchestrating efforts across a portfolio; and experts at breaking down problems, identifying assumptions, and executing product discovery techniques.
Responsibilities
Strategize: Create, drive and execute product strategy for a one or more products in Arity’s insurance product portfolio. Use customer feedback, detailed market analysis, and data gathering to make decisions about product strategy. Use metrics to measure and inform the overall product strategy.
Execute: Work with design, data science, engineering, and marketing teams to implement and build new product features that deliver great solutions for our customers.
Analyze: Define and analyze key metrics that will inform decision-making and measure success of product-driven initiatives.
Be Customer-centric: Invest significant time speaking with your current and potential customers to understand their needs & habits.
Lead: Manage a small team of product managers to execute a on a shared vision.
Qualifications
7-10 years of product management experience.
Demonstrated success in delivering new products and features from concept to launch.
Ability to define product strategy, prioritize and articulate the rationale behind your decisions.
Proven analytical skills and ability to use data to drive decision-making and feature prioritization.
Clear passion for topics of insurance products and an ability to identify possibilities to innovate in our product space.
Understanding of and experience working in an agile development environment.
Knows how to cut through ambiguity to identify the core priorities.
A drive to collaborate, learn and “get things done” while balancing multiple projects.
Experience hiring, coaching and managing a high-performing team of product managers.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Strong background in an engineering discipline or related field that enables you to understand & easily communicate with a technical team.
Experience in the insurance industry strongly desired including telematics data collection for insurers as well as an understanding of the insurance marketplace, economic atmosphere, and regulatory environment.
Demonstrated ability to communicate across multiple levels of leadership.
Compensation Data
The minimum salary for this position is $140,000. The salary offered will be commesurate with experience.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.
That’s the day-to-day, now let’s talk about the rest of it. As we mentioned, Arity was founded by The Allstate Corporation. But you’ll be working for—and at—Arity. It’s the best of both worlds. You’ll get access to the full suite of Allstate benefits and work in a fast-paced startup culture. That’s more than just free breakfasts and brain breaks. It’s a culture that encourages you to be you.
Sound like a fit? Apply now! We can’t wait to meet you.

About Guaranteed Rate:
Guaranteed Rate is the 5th largest retail mortgage lender in the U.S. By offering industry-leading tools, low-rate mortgages and unparalleled customer service, we’ve become the Home Purchase Experts®. At Guaranteed Rate, we think big—pushing beyond what most people believe is possible. We strive to work with the best of the best, building business with the best referral partners and hiring the best employees—allowing us to deliver world-class customer service. Our goal is to make sure every customer has a great experience. Headquartered in Chicago with 5,000+ employees in 300+ offices across the U.S. and licensed in all 50 states, we’ve helped thousands of homeowners with more than $37 billion in home purchase loans and refinances in just the past year alone.

Job Description:
The Regional Operations Manager is responsible for ensuring that all loan files in their region are processed, closed, and funded according to Guaranteed Rate’s established quality, efficiency and customer service standards. A successful ROM will partner with multiple departments (Closing, UW, Appraisal, Compliance, etc.) to proactively identify, isolate and resolve problems, and will ensure adequate staffing, strategic planning and load balancing on a branch and regional level. ROMs will support coordinated onboarding strategies with Production Managers, the Transition Team, Recruiting and Regional or Branch Sales Managers, and effectively leverage pipeline, production and quality reports to promote both employee and customer satisfaction.

Pipeline risks are identified and solved

Start Date: February 2021

The Mission of Distinctive Schools, an educational practice leader committed to social justice and the elevation of access and achievement in historically marginalized communities, is to support each child in becoming an engaged and curious learner, a confident self-advocate, and a creative problem-solver by setting high expectations and nurturing a positive culture that honors diversity, collaboration, and optimism.

Position Description:
Distinctive Schools is looking for a Client Services Representative to temporarily support our network of charter schools in Chicago and Detroit. This position is being created to help families, students, and staff impacted by COVID-19 that are participating in remote learning and work. This position will serve as a first point of contact for calls into the Distinctive Schools Support Hotline.

This position will report to the Director of IT Strategy and work alongside our team of Technology Coordinators to provide friendly customer service and basic troubleshooting for common technology issues from students, parents/guardians, and staff. This position will provide basic support services to include initial triage, ticket creation and call routing. This person will:
Call Center
Operate as the first point of contact for calls to the Distinctive Schools support hotline
Provide basic tech support utilizing provided call center scripts and resources
Operate a cloud based phone application in web browser or mobile app
Handle call routing during to technology coordinators for escalation
Creation of Help Center tickets utilizing our centralized ticketing system
Track and record calls that are resolved without ticket creation in spreadsheet
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned

Requirements:
Required:
Experience with some area of customer service in any capacity
Strong familiarity with using Google based software (Docs, Sheets, Chat, Gmail)
Ability to help provide basic support services utilizing a call script
Preferable:
Fluent in Spanish both spoken and written
2-3 Years experience working within customer services role
Experience working with a central ticketing system
Experience using a software phone apps like Google Voice
Calm and friendly demeanor working with families as they are experiencing issues
Experience supporting in a school environment or similar public service industry
Ability to manage productivity in a remote environment with minimal supervision
Why Join the Distinctive Schools Team:
We are a collaborative team of professionals supporting each other to instill a love of learning in our students
We empower students, families and staff to contribute to our mission in a meaningful way
We make an impact in our communities by serving some of the most historically marginalized in the city
We offer a great benefits package for full time employees (Medical; Dental; Vision; PTO; 403b match, discounted gym membership, tuition reimbursement options, referral bonus)

Content Production Specialist - Writer
Neil Patel Digital – San Diego, Chicago or Remote - US
www.npdigital.com

About Neil Patel Digital
Neil Patel has been recognized by the Wall Street Journal, Forbes, and the United Nations, to name a few, as one of the most influential and successful marketers and entrepreneurs in the world. NP Digital is the agency that brings his passion and insights to life for the world’s more important brands.
NP Digital focuses on creating innovative, adaptive, and data-driven digital marketing plans for our clients. Obsessed with helping companies grow and exceed their goals, NP Digital delivers on the mission of continually helping brands connect and engage with their audience.
NP Digital combines proprietary platforms with best in class talent to deliver leading edge experiences centered around: paid and organic search, social, content, retargeting, performance display, feed management and conversion rate optimization.

About the Opportunity:
Neil Patel Digital (NP Digital) is seeking a skilled, professional, and detail-oriented Content Writer to join our production team for ongoing writing needs in various industries. The ideal candidate has knowledge/experience writing and editing website copy with an understanding of search engine optimization (SEO) best practices. Our ideal writer has the capacity to write educational, often technical, research - backed copy in an informative, clear, accessible way to help readers understand complex information.
In this role, you will be expected to brainstorm, research, create, and transform ideas into the following types of deliverables:
Blogs
Product descriptions
FAQ pages
Landing pages
Infographics
Sales copy
 This team member should have a well-rounded understanding of multiple digital marketing techniques, the ability to clearly communicate and collaborate, effective time management skills, and the ability to self-edit all work.
Responsibilities:
Reporting to the Content Manager, the Content Production Specialist - Writer will work closely with the content production team to help bring a client’s digital marketing strategy to life with the written word.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Own content creation and editing for our clients across website and blog copy, with ability to apply SEO-best practices. Tasks may include writing core pages (website copy), landing pages, and larger content pieces deemed important to the client’s business, with Content Lead’s assignment direction.
Collaborate with Content Manager/Content Leads on numerous accounts, attending regular meetings with clients and internal teams to fully understand a client’s copy needs, assist with maintaining client content briefs, and to establish strong relationship with client/point-of-contact.
Conduct research on current and prospective markets and competitors in order to create well-written and well-researched copy.
Research the technical properties of clients’ products and services to determine what makes products appealing to consumers in order to develop unique, new concepts.
Ensure that deliverables meet or exceed all deadlines.
Assist with creating comprehensive, informative content briefs to help writers create copy that aligns with client tone, voice, style points, and goals.
Revise, edit, and proofread content for spelling and grammar errors, tone and voice, and client’s preferred style.
Communicate with management, Client Services, and other internal teams on key project metrics, timelines, and campaign goals.
Daily use of project management tools, reporting, analytics, and trend tools.
Requirements:
At least 2 years of writing/editing experience, with an established SEO/writing portfolio. In-house or freelance Content Writing experience for clients within a digital marketing agency highly preferred.
Bachelor’s degree in journalism, communication, English or similar specialty preferred.
Proficient in using various writing styles and guidelines, including Associated Press (AP) and AMA Manual of Style, and familiarity with using brand style guides.
Extensive knowledge and experience using Microsoft Word, including track changes.
Proficient in using Microsoft Excel.
Ability to receive feedback from multiple internal teams and client point-of-contact.
Overall knowledge and experience of major digital marketing strategies.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple priorities and complete assignments within deadline.
A passion for writing.
Personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and commitment to the mission of NP Digital.
We value our best-in-class company culture, which is results-driven, innovative, fast-paced and fun. We encourage our employees to work with an entrepreneurial spirit while applying a businesslike approach. We provide comprehensive benefits including medical (100% coverage for employees and 50% for dependents on base HMO plan) and 100% coverage for employee-only dental. Other benefits offered include flexible paid time off, vision, FSA, life insurance, company paid parking and/or commuter program (depending on location), and a 401k program with employer match and immediate vesting. As an organization, we take a proactive role in investing in our employee’s professional development. We believe our employees are our greatest asset and welcome those who share our vision and drive to build great things together.

About Our Team
Near North Title Group is a fully integrated title, escrow, construction and 1031 exchange company that has been providing clients with a comprehensive portfolio of commercial and residential services across the country for over 30 years. One of the largest title agents in the Midwest, we facilitate over $7 billion in yearly transaction volume throughout more than 20 offices as we continuously expand our market presence.
Position Summary
Our growing multistate operation of 150+ employees throughout five states seeks a leader to enhance our Human Resources team. The Human Resources Manager is a hands-on generalist working on employee issues, benefits, payroll, compliance, company policies, vendor management, payroll and the overall administration of the human resources department. This individual will directly supervise four HR team members including a recruiter, payroll specialist, junior generalist and admin, and will report to the Chief Administrative Officer. The ideal candidate is tech savvy, innovative and eager to utilize our HR Information System and other technology to capture additional bandwidth that will allow the HR team to focus on initiatives that enhance the culture of our operations. We are seeking a strong generalist who can grow with the position as we grow, potentially moving up to a VP-level and joining our leadership team as we add staff to the department.
Responsibilities
 Utilize HR Information System and other technology to implement enhancements and workflows benefitting the department and the company
 Administer day-to-day human resource functions including payroll, benefits, policies, leave and general employee relations
 Establish and manage process for annual reviews and compensation adjustments
 Assist managers with personnel performance issues and disciplinary action
 Develop reports to identify opportunities to increase productivity in the department and share with executive leadership team
 Work with newly created recruiter position to maximize the recruitment, pipeline development and onboarding process for the company
 Manage claims for unemployment, EEOC, etc. and participate in hearings as needed
 Prepare and update policies, procedures and handbooks
 Implement policies and procedures, and distribute and track employee acknowledgement
 Maintain knowledge of federal, state, and local laws and regulations, interpret those rules for employees and managers
 Manage leave programs and oversee the payroll & benefits administrator
 Ensure that HR staff is maintaining accurate personnel and certification data in the HRIS, comply with record-keeping requirements
 Work with CAO to develop internal HR procedures, improving workflows where opportunities arise
 Work with legal counsel, HR vendors including benefits brokers, and third-party administrators
 Keep current with benefits deadlines
 Perform benefits administration including new hire benefits onboarding and open enrollment
 Substantial cultivation of Diversity & Inclusion initiatives and Near North Title Giving philanthropic efforts including Day of Giving program
Qualifications
 Bachelor's degree in HR or Business; MS/MBA preferred
 PHR or SHRM-CP certification; SPHR or SHRM-SCP preferred
 7-10 years of broad-range HR experience with increasing responsibilities
 3+ years of experience in an HR leadership role
 Experience in a professional services industry (e.g. consulting, finance, legal, real estate)
 Experience leading the design, development, and implementation of HR programs
 Experience collaborating with executive business leaders to identify and achieve business goals
 Experience supporting multiple worksites and/or remote employees
 Experience in negotiating, designing, and implementing benefits and retirement plans
 Strong knowledge of HR laws and regulations (e.g. EEO, FLSA, PPACA, FMLA, ADA, COBRA)
 Superior written and verbal communication skills
 Advanced HRIS technical skills; Paycor experience is preferred
 High level of organization, accountability, accuracy, and attention to detail
Benefits
Diverse benefits package including complementary use of company-owned Colorado vacation condo, Day of Giving PTO incentive program and flexible work policy.
 Medical, dental, and vision
 401(k) with company match
 Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
 Short-term disability and voluntary life insurance
 Company-paid life insurance and long-term disability
 Generous PTO and holiday pay
 Bonus Day of Service PTO Day
 Access to company-owned ski condo in Beaver Creek, CO

Guaranteed Rate Insurance is an independent insurance brokerage offering an unmatched value proposition to our customers, our referral partners, and our team members. JobTitle: Technical Product Manager - Data Infrastructure (Permanent Remote, US)
Text:
We are actively recruiting for a Technical Product Manager who works within our Data Infrastructure Product Management team. This position will be full time, and includes full benefits and an equity option. We are open to remote, US-based candidates. The Technical Product Manager is a key member of the team that helps to design technical, service and content solutions to support Aledade’s various lines of business. The Technical Product Manager works alongside business owners, data analysts, designers and engineers to define integration goals, solution design, implementation approach and rollout plans. They are the interface between strategic business owners and engineering; they ensure that Aledade creates a high-quality product with the ability to scale. We are flexible with respect to geographic location, and the ideal candidate will be comfortable working remotely/work from home within the US.
Your Footprint:
Partner with business owners to cultivate a shared vision for the problem space, constraints, priorities and ideal end state, and be able to articulate and advocate for this perspective.
Facilitate engineering projects in the data infrastructure domain by participating in or leading daily stand ups, project kickoffs, stakeholder advisory groups and sprint retrospectives.
Coordinate multiple concurrent engineering projects across various engineering teams. For each project, manage timelines, identify blockers and regularly communicate status to an executive audience.
Work with internal teams and end users to develop a deep understanding of requirements, perform thoughtful solution design, use data to test hypotheses, and support teams throughout execution.
Write detailed user stories for new projects, capturing detailed descriptions of business rationale, requirements, and success criteria that are defined by measurable outcomes.
Develop short- and long-term roadmaps that deliver maximum value with minimum risk and assume ongoing iteration.
Review support issues related to projects and monitor utilization and expected outcomes.
What We Value:
Minimum of 3 year experience in healthcare technology or healthcare services industry.
Experience using data and primary research to inform solution design and build internal business understanding.
Excellent organizational and communication skills, with an emphasis on problem-solving and building subject matter expertise.
Experience with and understanding of the software development lifecycle and software development methodologies. Preferably experience with participating in Agile / Scrum teams.
Experience designing workflows and operational processes as well as experience identifying process inefficiency.
Preferred Experience:
2+ years product management experience in technology, technology-enabled services industry, or a SaaS product.
Product development experience in the context of the development of a healthcare technology product, especially with clinical and staff end users.
Understanding of healthcare administrative and clinical workflows for inpatient, ambulatory or ancillary services.
Experience building and maintaining data pipelines at scale.
Knowledge of alternative payment models related to primary care such as MSSP ACOs, Pioneer ACOs and commercial insurance shared savings programs
If you are passionate about transforming the healthcare system into one that best serves the needs of patients, doctors, and society, we’d love for you to join us!
Who We Are:
Aledade is a leader in population health that is using innovative, value based solutions to transform the way physicians interact with their patients. We are on a mission to change healthcare for the better and solve complex problems within the healthcare system.
We follow the simple but radical idea that Aledade only succeeds when our partner practices succeed. From our cutting-edge technology platform to practice transformation services, we provide physicians with everything they need to create and run an accountable care organization (ACO), revamping the way they practice and getting them back to where they should be: quarterbacking their patients’ health care!
Our customized solutions help clinicians in communities across America preserve their autonomy, deliver better care to their patients, reduce overall costs, and keep independent physician practices flourishing.
What Does This Mean for You?
At Aledade, you will be part of a creative culture that is driven by a passion for tackling complex issues with respect, open-mindedness, and a desire to learn. You will work with team members that bring a wide range of experiences, interests, backgrounds, beliefs, and achievements to their work, united by a shared passion for public health and a commitment to the Aledade mission.
We’ve recently been recognized as a Top Workplace by The Washington Post, Best Workplace in HealthCare & Biopharma, Top 100 Best Small & Medium Workplaces, Glassdoor Best Places to Work, a Best and Brightest Companies to Work for in the Nation, a Tech Tribune 10 Best Tech Startups in Maryland and Bethesda, Best Tech for Good, Best Workplaces for Millennials, Best Workplaces for Women, Best Workplaces for Parents, and a 2020 Inno on Fire by DC Inno.

That’s because the things that matter to you also matter to us!
In addition to time off to support work-life balance and enjoyment, we offer the following comprehensive benefits package designed for the needs of our team-members:
Flexible work schedules and ability to work remotely available for many roles
Educational Assistant Program
Robust time off plan (21 days of PTO in your first year!)
Paid Volunteer Days
10 paid holidays
12 weeks paid Parental Leave for all new parents
6 weeks paid sabbatical
Health, dental and vision insurance paid at 80% for employees, dependents, and domestic partners
401(k) with up to 4% match
Stock options
Monthly cell phone stipend
Weekly catered lunches
Jeans everyday workplace
Gender neutral bathrooms
And more!
At Aledade, we don’t just accept differences, we celebrate them! We strive to attract, develop, and retain highly qualified individuals representing the diverse communities where we live and work. Aledade is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Employment policies and decisions at Aledade are based on merit, qualifications, performance, and business needs. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), gender identity or expression, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

Yelp’s mission is to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s Midmarket team partners with established and growing multi-location businesses to provide industry leading digital advertising solutions. Yelp has become an essential part in clients’ local advertising mix and the Midmarket team is growing fast.

The Midmarket Account Executive works with multi-location regional and national corporate clients selling Yelp's diverse advertising products. You will develop an understanding of your clients’ needs, educate them on Yelp's platform and develop Yelp Ad campaigns that will help them better connect with their customers and drive in-store sales. We are looking for someone with relevant digital, media, or advertising sales experience and a demonstrated track record of exceeding goals. This role is key to Yelp’s success and offers significant career growth opportunities within Yelp’s Multi-Location Sales team.

#LI-REMOTE

Where You Come In:
You will work across a territory of key accounts at are a strong fit for Yelp’s advertising solutions
You will have ownership and autonomy over the full sales cycle from prospecting to close
You will map out the client organization and build relationships with multiple contacts, with a focus on decision-makers within the organization
You will understand your clients’ business objectives/challenges and align Yelp’s proven advertising solutions to accomplish their goals
You will partner with clients to develop a cohesive local strategy utilizing branding and conversion products, local search campaigns and customer engagement tools
You will partner with Yelp’s customer success and account management teams to ensure strong client experience and program performance post-sale

What it Takes to Succeed:
You have 3+ years selling to Midmarket clients
You have experience selling to franchises (preferred)
You have experience selling digital advertising, media, or SaaS to franchises
You are hungry to grow your career and tackle new challenges with a clear desire to have a big impact on Yelp’s revenue and client set
You have a proven track record of exceeding revenue targets and comfortable closing deals $10,000+
You have strategic selling skills
You have strong time management skills
You are a creative problem solver and self-sufficient worker
You have a solid understanding of online media and metrics
You have successful experience presenting to mid to large size groups over the phone
You are proficient in Powerpoint, Excel and Salesforce
You are fearless, relentless and with an unwillingness to settle for anything less than your best

What You'll Get:
Guaranteed base salary plus uncapped commission
Effective your first day: Full medical, vision, and dental (100% paid employee only coverage)
15 days PTO (accrual begins on date of hire and increases with 2+ years of tenure thereafter), 12 paid holidays, plus one floating holiday
Up to 14 weeks of parental leave
Monthly wellness subsidy
Flexible spending account
401(k) retirement savings plan
Employee stock purchase plan

Summary

We are looking for a Lead QA Engineer with 5+ years of experience (minimum 2 years in leading the teams) for assessing quality issues and solving challenges utilizing automation and best practices.

Location: Remote
What You'll Do

People

Build strong QA teams with strong analytical skills to analyze potential issues/bugs in the early stage of the release cycle.

Cross-functional collaboration with Engineering, Product & DevOps teams.

Build teams capable of doing impact analysis of features and different areas of products.

 Processes & Systems

Work together with Development, Product, and DevOps teams to provide quality assurance methodologies, processes, and tooling.

Identify the gaps in the Quality Assurance process and propose plans to improve the process.

Participate in Sprint planning, execution, and retrospectives. Prior experience working in an agile environment including familiarity with Scrum and KanBan is expected.

Proven track record to strategise and implement successful processes for QA teams and guide them to work smoothly.

Utilize JIRA and the Atlassian toolchain for collaboration and project management. Must have prior JIRA user-level experience.

Provide quantified measurement of the quality process in order to drive measurable improvements.

 Product Deliverables

Eliminate manual testing and implement industry-standard automated solutions based on prior experience.

Provide QA support for product and feature development including contributing to the acceptance criteria, assessing and flagging risks.

Implement processes to minimize the gaps and improve the product return on investment.

Own the UAT(User Acceptance Testing) process as part of features and releases.

Participate in improvements to the CI/CD process for integrating automated tests and quality checks. Prior experience with a tool such as Jenkins or Bamboo required.

Implement and standardize all levels of testing: Unit, Integration, Acceptance, and Exploratory.

Work in a fast-paced environment with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.

Communicate effectively with stakeholders including maintaining technical and project documentation.

What We're Looking For

We are looking for a candidate with strong analytical skills to determine, drive, and optimize the team's efforts to areas that need most attention without compromising on the quality of releases. The candidate should have a proven track record of building a QA team capable of delivering quality and timely releases using industry best practices, processes, and test automation.

Nice-to-Haves

Prior development experience in J2EE and Javascript technologies.

Experience with performance and load testing.

Worked on cloud-based environments such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Digital Ocean, etc.

Experience with building automated tests using HTTP, REST APIs, Micro-services, and SOA(Service Oriented Architecture).

Who We Are

Addteq is a company with products and services focused on DevOps. The goal of ** DevOps is to change and improve the relationship by advocating better communication and collaboration between these two business units. Addteq looked at the market strategically and addressed some critical needs within the burgeoning Atlassian ecosystem. We build software to heal customer pains and ease frustrations. The response has been 250% YOY growth and a successful launch of a suite of products that are quickly becoming ubiquitous in the Atlassian ecosystem.

Addteq is proud to be a Platinum Atlassian Solution & Marketplace Partner and our marketplace products are being utilized by some of the largest banks in the US, Japan, and Australia. We serve enterprise organizations by delivering the solutions our Fortune 500 client base has come to expect. We have offices in Princeton NJ, NYC NY, Pune India, and Singapore.

If you feel the same as we do about software automation, please join us!

Job Description
Cognex is looking for Project Managers based out of Arizona or the Chicago, IL area to work remote but we are also open to other locations in the US!
The Company : Cognex Corporation
Cognex is the global leader in the exciting and growing field of machine vision. With over $600 million of cash in the bank and no debt, we are a financially strong international company with a culture that maintains the fast paced, creative environment of a startup. Our employees, proudly called “Cognoids,” take their work seriously, but don't take themselves seriously. Our Work Hard, Play Hard, Move Fast culture recognizes our employees for their innovation, perseverance and hard work in a fun, rewarding, and quirky environment.
The Team
Delivering Cognex ID and Vision Automation Solutions into various Retail/Commercial/Freight Distribution Centers, Parcel & Postal and Airport Baggage Handling Industries is one of the fastest growing segments in Cognex, what we define as our Logistics business. The Logistics Business Unit (LBU) is chartered to lead the engineering, delivery and acceptance of our ID and Vision Automation Solutions to some of the largest global customers in these industries. This demands strong competencies in both customer facing Program/Project Management and Technical disciplines.
Job Summary
The LBU is searching for a Project Manager with external customer facing experience who will flourish in our “Work Hard, Play Hard, Move Fast” culture.
The Project Manager will be interacting and managing customers who are the global leaders in the e-commerce, retail distribution, parcel delivery and airport baggage handling market segments. Engaging within the pre-sales phase of potential project lifecycle’s, you’ll be responsible to prepare accurately, assess risks and subsequently deliver the hottest technology in this market, ensuring we meet customer expectations for quality, delivery and service, while delivering Cognex high standards for growth and profitability. To achieve this, you’ll lead a cross-functional team of sales, operations, engineering and service personnel throughout the execution phase of the project.
The projects to be managed will involve the integration of Cognex designed solutions into material handling applications and equipment common to the industry. Our solutions are used to automate parcel and pallet conveyor systems and sorters and involve interfacing with in-motion scales, dimensioners, label printers/applicators and industrial sensors and controls (eg. PLC's/proximity sensors...etc)
If you thrive in a fast-paced environment requiring leadership, technical acuity as well as commercial savvy – this is a great place to be!
Essential Functions
Lead assigned customer projects achieving customer expectations for quality and delivery by continually aligning the customer requirements with all internal stakeholders (sales, project pursuit, order administration, logistics engineering, operations, logistics services).
Achieve project profitability targets by executing a structured project planning and execution methodology that includes managing scope, risk mitigation and thoughtful resource planning and execution. Utilizing PMI standards of project management.
Ensure timely communications with the customer on project status, as well as updates to all internal stakeholders
Support revenue and profitability planning and management by providing regular estimates for project revenue, profitability and timing. Drive timely project closure and coordinate with finance on revenue recognition per established guidelines.
Drive continuous improvement in the quotation and delivery process through thoughtful post-project reviews with clear and timely actions.
Travel to sites as needed, to perform the tasks as described for this position. Extended travel periods may be required during the commissioning and acceptance phase of each project.
Other responsibilities as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Strong customer focus, attention to detail, fast acting, excellent communicator.
Proven conflict resolution and mediation skills.
Strong time management and organizational skills.
Ability to sort through competing priorities, anticipate risks and develop effective mitigation actions.
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional departments and influence them to achieve project objectives.
Able to rapidly learn new technology and understand new markets.
Experience with, or familiar with PMI project management standards, possessing a desire to achieve project management qualifications.
Available to travel ~30%
Minimum education and work experience required
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent relevant experience, Project Management, Engineering, or business is desired.
3 years’ experience as a project manager within the automated materials handling industry or for projects in a related field, or equivalent experience.
Relevant Professional and Industry specific certifications (PMP, CSCP, etc.) are a plus.
Experience in the materials handling industry a significant plus.
Additional Job Description
Equal Employment Opportunity

JobTitle: Behavioral Health Care Advocate (Utilization Review) - Telecommute
Text:
You're looking for something bigger for your career. How about inventing the future of health care? UnitedHealthcare is offering an innovative new standard for care management. We're going beyond counseling services and verified referrals to behavioral health programs integrated across the entire continuum of care. Our growth is fueling the need for highly qualified professionals to join our elite team. Bring your skills and talents to a role where you'll have the opportunity to make an impact on a huge scale. Join us. Take this opportunity to start doing your life's best work.(sm)
As a Facility Based Care Advocate you will be responsible for case management and utilization review of behavioral health and substance abuse cases. You'll have a direct impact on the lives of our members as you recommend and manage the appropriate level of care throughout the entire treatment plan.
What makes your clinical career greater with UnitedHealth Group? You can improve the health of others and help heal the health care system. You will work within an incredible team culture; a clinical and business collaboration that is learning and evolving every day. And, when you contribute, you'll open doors for yourself that simply do not exist in any other organization, anywhere.
You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Focus on initial inpatient admission for psychiatric and chemical dependency patients
Make patient assessments and determining appropriate levels of care (could include inpatient, residential, and partial levels of care)
Obtain information from providers on outpatient requests for treatment
Determine if additional clinical treatment sessions are needed
Manage inpatient and outpatient mental health cases throughout the entire treatment plan
Administer benefits and review treatment p
Coordinate benefits and transitions between various areas of care
Identify ways to add value to treatment plans and consulting with facility staff or outpatient care providers on those ideas
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
State-issued Clinical Licensed Master's degree in Psychology, Social Work, Counseling or Marriage or Family Counseling, or Licensed Ph.D., or an RN with 2 or more years of experience in behavioral health
Licenses must be active and unrestricted
2+ years experience in a related mental health environment
Proficient Microsoft skills (Word, Excel, Outlook) with the ability to toggle between multiple systems
Experience with utilization management/utilization review within either a managed care organization or a facility (hospital) or behavioral health facility setting
If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. When in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are required to wear a mask in common areas. In addition, employees must comply with any state and local masking orders.
Preferred Qualifications:
Dual diagnosis experience with mental health and substance abuse
Experience working in an environment that required coordination of benefits and utilization of multiple groups and resources for patients
Experience with the Medicaid population
Previous facility-based experience
Careers with Optum . Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)
Colorado Residents Only: The salary/hourly range for Colorado residents is $53,300 to $95,100 (add additional reference for sales and physicians). Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. As of the date of this posting, In addition to your salary, UHG offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Health, dental, and vision plans; wellness program; flexible spending accounts; paid parking or public transportation costs; 401(k) retirement plan; employee stock purchase plan; life insurance, short-term disability insurance, and long-term disability insurance; business travel accident insurance; Employee Assistance Program; PTO; and employee-paid critical illness and accident insurance.
*All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.
Job Keywords: case manager, care advocate, social worker, therapist, counselor, mental health, behavioral health, managed care, substance abuse, inpatient, LP, LCSW, MFT, LMFT, LMHC, LPC, LCPC, RN, registered nurse, utilization review, telecommute

Company Description

FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. Learn more about FireEye's world-class solutions and global footprint at https://www.fireeye.com/company.html.

Job Description

FireEye Mandiant Security Consulting Services ensures the long-term success of our clients by providing talented, passionate, and specialized security expertise. Our Consultants partner with FireEye clients to evaluate, create, develop, improve, and mature information security operations and programs. By utilizing the latest industry standards and combining experience and knowledge gained from Mandiant Incident Response, Intelligence and Managed Defense practices, we are able to develop defense forward information security programs for our clients.
As an Information Security Consultant, you will be responsible for helping our clients assess, design and build effective security programs. As an established trusted advisor, you will span operational, tactical, and strategic levels as well as tasks that tackle difficult problems that businesses are facing when building out and improving their security posture. This is an opportunity for you to showcase your strong communication skills and experience in security governance, security risk management, security operations, security architecture, and/or cyber incident response programs. This is a regional specific role which must be based out of Illinois.
What You Will Do:
Provide guidance on building and/or maturing information security programs and the implementation of tools and technologies used for enterprise security
Evaluate client needs, coordinate design for a solution, and clearly communicate the value proposition of complex and highly technical subjects
Implement and/or assess existing security controls
Provide knowledge of tools and technologies used for enterprise security
Interface with clients to address concerns, issues or escalations; track and drive to closure any issues that impact the service and its value to clients

Qualifications

Requirements:
Basic knowledge of tools used in penetration testing, security event analysis, incident response, computer forensics, network and endpoint architecture, malware analysis or other areas of security operations
Basic understanding of security frameworks, such as ISO 27001, NIST 800-53, HIPAA/HITECH, or PCI DSS Fundamental understanding of networking, including TCP/IP protocols and network topology
Fundamental understanding of operating systems, including Windows, Linux, and OSX
Basic understanding of security controls for common platforms and devices, including Windows, Linux, OSX and network equipment
Basic understanding of the components that comprise a successful information security program
Ability to travel up to 50%
Additional Qualifications:
Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without sponsorship
Minimum five years of professional information security experience
Ability to successfully interface with clients and manage expectations
Ability to document and explain technical details in a clear and concise manner
Additional Information

This is a regionally-based role that must be located in Illinois.
At FireEye we are committed to our #OneTeam approach combining diversity, collaboration, and excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.
