Who else has got what it takes to speak with clients and manage their successful projects all while working from home?We are looking for a real client service professional to ensure that our executive-level resume projects exceed expectations.Q: Do you enjoy speaking with high-level clients?Q: Are you highly responsive and clear with your communication?Q: Do you consider yourself to be organized and self-motivated?Q: Do you want to work from home and set your own schedule?Q: Do you take great pride in your work?Q: And are you looking to join a growing company that serves a successful and exclusive client base?If you answered yes to these questions, Executive Resume Writers (ERW) may be the right opportunity for you!Sound good? Then keep reading...HERE’S YOUR OPPORTUNITY TO DO WHAT YOU ARE BEST AT.We need a team player with an engaging personality and who loves connecting with people and helping them succeed.As a Client Success Manager, you won’t be writing resumes, instead you will:Complete client 1-on-1 consultation calls and follow a proven consultation process.Actively engage clients to understand what makes them unique.Help clients understand what makes them unique and develop their unique value proposition.Be the single point of contact for the client and communicate with them regularly via phone, email, and text messages.Review the client’s rough draft of their resume and complete a follow-up call with the client to understand changes they would like to see.Communicate with resume writers and editors via the project management system, providing revisions as requested by the client.Manage follow up communications with client post project completion.WE ARE A TRUE PROFESSIONAL SERVICES FIRM.ERW is a leading provider of executive-level personal branding services and we are looking for people who can communicate effectively and play well with others.We’ve nearly doubled over last year and are on track to surpass that in the coming year with our proprietary methodology and a team of A-players.The question is… will you be part of the team to take us there?THE WORK-AT-HOME OPPORTUNITY IS REAL.Working from home is nothing new to our team… we’ve been a remote team since the beginning and our entire system is optimized around remote work.We will support you from Day 1. We'll go over the processes together to ensure you have a good handle on what we do and how we do it.YOU BRING THE EXPERIENCE. WE PROVIDE THE SYSTEMS.What about you?You do not need resume writing or human resources (HR) experience as our processes include our proven approach to client success.You need to have client service and/or client project management experience… ideally with clients at the decision-maker level (Director, VP, C-level).You’re an achiever and making sure tasks are completed promptly and efficiently is a priority for you. Procrastination is not part of your DNA.Ideal candidates will embody an entrepreneurial spirit and have a passion for client service.You’ll complete several client onboarding calls per day. On the calls, you’re actively engaged and interested in learning the client’s career story. You enjoy speaking with clients and helping them quantify and uncover their unique value. The clients, in return, appreciate your efforts and are grateful for your interest in their success.Your schedule is flexible and you typically work Monday-Friday. You have the client’s busy schedule at heart and understand that you will occasionally complete calls in the evening or weekends.You work remotely and already have a reliable and professional home office set up.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?If you are selected, you will be personally trained and mentored by our Senior Client Success Manager who is a master at managing client expectations.For the right person, this is the opportunity to do what you love, on your own schedule all while working from home.As a Client Success Manager, you will receive:Competitive compensationTraining in our systemsConsistent weekly project activityA full time work-from-home opportunityFlexible work scheduleAchieve work/life balance on your own termsHOW TO APPLYYou should know we have an “A-players only” hiring model, so if you're not a real professional, please don't waste your time (or ours) by applying.This position is for winners and those who believe in themselves. If you have what it takes and want to learn more, then you are invited to apply.As a next step, we will respond back asking you to complete a survey to help us learn a little bit about you.Then, we will review your application and, if there is a good fit, we will invite you to take the next step, which will include several phone interviews.Ready to get started?APPLY NOW by sending an email to: CSMjobs [at] executiveresumewriters [dot] comThen simply follow the instructions in our email reply.Job Type: Full-timePay: $45,000.00 - $55,000.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offPaid trainingWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Client Management: 2 years (Required)Work Location:Fully RemoteThis Job Is:A job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to applyCompany's website:https://executiveresumewriters.com/careers/were-hiring-client-success-manager/Benefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

JobTitle: Associate Manager, Multi-Location Customer Success - Remote
Text:
*Please note that while this role is a remote position, it is required that the candidate resides in the Midwest Region and within 50 miles of a major airport. States included in Yelp's defined Midwest Region include: North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Kansas, Minnesota, Iowa, Illinois, Missouri, Indiana, Ohio, Michigan and Wisconsin.*

Yelp is seeking a results driven Associate Manager, Multi Loc Customer Success to manage a team of CS reps while driving forward key initiatives for the organization.

Our Mloc Customer Success management team partners with peers, Directors and sales counterparts to manage their team book of business towards clients objectives and KPIs. In addition to managing a team of 9-11 representatives, you will also be responsible for managing against broader org objectives and partnering with other managers to roll out new initiatives.

** This is a remote position #LI-REMOTE**
Where You Come In:
You will manage and coach a team of Customer Success reps to develop successful customer success strategies and succeed in all aspects of their responsibilities to enable revenue retention and growth; including campaign set up, management, and optimization, serving as the voice of the customer to all internal teams, troubleshooting technical issues, and partnering with multiple stakeholders.
You will provide regular updates to management on your team’s book of business; including team activities, risk of key accounts, and forecasted fulfillment.
You will assist in hiring, training, and onboarding of new hires into the Multi Loc CS org
You will partner with the Multi Loc Sales leadership team to analyze data and communicate valuable client insights on multi million dollar deals
You will assist your team in the strategy and campaign execution of key Enterprise accounts, working with multiple stakeholders to optimize campaign and hit client KPIs.
You will understand the entire customer and sales life-cycle of large complex deals, anticipating needs and delivering solutions to both parties in a effective manner
You will understand goals of multi loc sales and CS departments and anticipate future needs of both to retain and grow revenue in the Multi loc segment
You will Identify areas of improvement in all areas of productivity, process, and efficiency
You will be promoting and enhancing a safe, inclusive and successful Yelp culture
You will participate in coaching, developing, and inspiring all members of your team
You will be conducting effective team meetings and 1:1s with direct reports, quarterly conversations
You will be responsible for communication and engagement with a variety of internal stakeholders, including sales, finance, product, and legal

What it Takes to Succeed:
You have 2-5 years as a programmatic ad trafficker (preferably at an agency) and 1-2 years as a team lead or manager
You have the ability to inspire and motivate others
You are analytical and results driven
You showcase excellent written and verbal communication skills; succinct and action oriented in nature
You will showcase the ability to communicate well and develop meaningful relationships with a variety of internal stakeholders including sales, finance, product, legal, engineering, marketing, and operations
You are well versed in the ability to think strategically and critically when handling large complex advertising campaigns
You have a track record of success as an individual contributor with specific strengths in communication, organization, and leadership
You are comfortable and capable of providing feedback that challenges and provides growth
You have comprehension of org metrics & big picture

What You'll Get:
Effective your first day: Full medical, vision, and dental (100% paid employee only coverage)
15 days PTO (accrual begins on date of hire and increases with 2+ years of tenure thereafter), 12 paid holidays, plus one floating holiday
Up to 14 weeks of parental leave
Monthly wellness subsidy
Flexible spending account
401(k) retirement savings plan
Employee stock purchase plan

Cadre Substitute(Job Number: CadreSubREQ189)
Description

Cadre Job Description

Characteristics of the Class: Under the supervision of the school principal and in the absence of the assigned teacher, responsible for the instruction, progress, and discipline of all pupils in assigned classes. Performs related duties as required.


Please note: This role is in support of our new framework for reopening for the school year 2020-2021. In the event, we begin the school year fully remote, newly hired Cadre Substitutes will be converted to day-to-day substitutes

Essential Functions:
Follows existing lesson plans to provide instruction to assigned students
Responsible for establishing positive learning expectation standards for all pupils
Applying contemporary principles of learning theory and teaching methodology, drawing from the range of instructional materials available in the school
Establishes and maintains reasonable rules of conduct within the classroom and on school grounds, including but not limited to, playgrounds, corridors, and lunchrooms, consistent with the provisions of the Chicago Public Schools' Uniform Discipline Code
Maintains accurate attendance records and seating charts
Encourages student growth in self-discipline and positive self-concept; ensures fairness in teacher-pupil relationships and exhibits an understanding and respect for students
May coordinate and attend class field trips; may work in extracurricular and after-school activities
Utilizes appropriate resources available in the school
Minimum Qualifications: Cadre candidates are not required to live in Chicago but are required to provide proof of either a Professional Educator License or Substitute Teaching License issued by the Illinois State Board of Education Knowledge, Abilities and Skills: Cadre Substitutes in Chicago Public Schools must have a strong desire and commitment to urban education.

Knowledge of subject matter consistent with state certification requirements, knowledge of and skill in the application of contemporary principles and practices of teaching, knowledge of classroom and behavior management techniques. Ability to modify instruction to meet student needs, ability to cooperate with the school faculty and administration in the development and implementation of an articulated program of instruction, ability to work effectively with pupils, parents and guardians, staff members and community representatives in providing an appropriate educational program; ability to understand the physical, intellectual, social and emotional patterns of pupils. Good oral and written communication skills, good interpersonal skills, skill in exercising sound, and professional judgment.

Physical Requirements: Light Work: Exerting up to twenty (20) pounds of force occasionally, or up to ten (10) pounds of force frequently, or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects. Physical demands include the ability to stoop occasionally, reach frequently, handle and finger objects occasionally, talk and hear constantly, frequent use of near visual acuity and occasional use of visual acuity

ABOUT USAt Vida, we empower individuals to overcome chronic mental and physical health conditions, once and for all. The impact of chronic conditions on healthcare is immense: in the US alone, chronic diseases like diabetes and heart disease drive 80% of the $3 trillion healthcare spending, which is at 18% of GDP. One in 3 individuals has a chronic health condition, and 1 in 4 struggles with mental health.Vida provides expert, personalized, on-demand health coaching and programs from a network of experienced health care providers and leading medical institutions. Vida is a next generation continuous care platform for both consumers and businesses, combining a consumer mobile app, an enterprise care platform offering on demand 24/7 solutions for chronic conditions. Vida platform runs in the cloud, captures real-time data from 100+ devices and apps, and integrates back to the employer, payer, and provider. We are trusted by Fortune 1000 companies, major national payers and large providers to enable their employees live their healthiest lives.Our Sales team is growing and we are looking for a talented and experienced Sales Recruiter to join our team as a contractor for 6 months.RESPONSIBILITIESBring your experience in recruiting top sales talent across the USBe a head-hunter –source candidates on job boards, through referrals, and social mediaManage the full cycle of recruiting candidates from sourcing through close, with primary ownership for the growth of our sales teamBecome a trusted strategic partner to our Sales leaders to scale the Sales org in a timely fashionWork with our existing Talent Team to help scale processes and implement best practices across hiring top talent in sales rolesHelp us improve and scale a world-class candidate experienceQUALIFICATIONS4+ years sourcing and closing sales professionals, ideally for a tech or healthcare companyProven track record of successfully closing requisitions within reasonable time-to-fill metrics, while providing a world class candidate experienceExperience building strategic partnerships with hiring managers and cross-functional team membersStrong communicator across all levels and verticals of the organizationExperience working on a small team in a high-growth, rapidly changing environmentExperience leveraging an ATS (we use Lever) to track and manage candidates, and regularly reporting on recruiting metricsBONUS SKILLSBonus points if you have experience recruiting in the healthcare industryVida is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer._Diversity is more than a commitment at Vida—it is the foundation of what we do. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.__We seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. We don’t just accept differences — we celebrate them, we support them, and we thrive on them for the benefit of our employees, our platform and those we serve. Vida is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures._Job Type: Contract

Westport Commercial, a successful Commercial Real Estate Mortgage Broker offers experienced Intermediaries higher splits, lower friction and more freedom.Westport Commercial is growing, seeking individuals who possess the desire to work remotely, using tools and support provided by Westport CommercialThis is NOT an employment offer but an opportunity to build a business for yourself using our methods, tools, team and track record.Origination positions are full commission, nonsalaried with no caps on your income.Westport Commercial Provides the Following Tools for Success:Branded e-mailOngoing support, guidance and business insightAnalytical support including branded forms and templatesInsights into assessing probable opportunitiesBusiness development methods, marketing, metrics and targetsAccess to proprietary lender relationshipsInsights into lender idiosyncrasies & underwriting methodsParticipation in webinars and team calls, sharing best practicesFinancing memo templates and techniques for getting noticedPublic Relations releasesWeb site placement for credibility buildingUse of various data sourcesUse of Trademarked Logo for business cards, signature block and e-stationary and moreBrand Standard GuidelinesCRMDigital marketingExperienced Originators generally close $25 to $50MM+ of middle market loans, annually. The expectation is Westport Commercial Originators new to the business can close $10MM +/- in 12 months. A Mortgage Originator can earn 1 to 2% per transaction. Keeping the bulk of these earned fees should be an Originator's goal. Please note, Origination opportunities are non-salaried.REQUIREMENTSWe are not a bank.We are called Intermediaries, ‘Brokers’ or Originators. We work with dozens of banks arranging loans for borrowers from $1MM to $30MM. No special license is required.Our clients are mostly private owners.Ours is a ‘remote’ business model. Originators work from a home office or executive suite. If you are seeking a full service physical office, we are not a fit.All Originators are independent contractors paying a nominal set-up and service fee for access to our platform, training, proprietary information, contacts and methods. This fee may be reimbursed based on production targets.Westport Commercial pays out 50% to its Intermediaries accelerating to 60% based upon production. Splits for experienced Originators with verifiable historical commercial real estate mortgage production.Your ability to prospect for new business and to confidently communicate our value will determine your success.Are you comfortable with prospecting and possibly even cold calling warm prospects? If no, this is not a good fit.As with any business proposition, there is risk, such as wasted time if you fail. On the other hand, the upside is yours to develop. If you are seeking no risk, this is not a fit.BENEFITSNo other origination platform offers the advantages Westport Commercial provides its professional originators.If you are looking for a great challenge and the opportunity to earn $200,000+++ while having fun and freedom, learning and growing in the BEST business for long term wealth creation, then please apply in confidence.Affiliating with a professional nationally recognized commercial real estate mortgage brokerage company is meaningful to potential clients and lenders. This cannot be taken for granted! Trust is a key component when financing real estate.Enjoy the prestige of arranging loans on commercial real estateNo territory restrictionsNo restrictions on incomeHigh splitsPotential for lead opportunities passed along to youPayouts wired within hours of proof of receipt of fundsWestport Commercial Professional E-mailSharing of Commercial Real Estate Intel and NewsAccess to Processor supportMonthly market overview to share with clientsExpand your current business, make more moneyJob Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: $100,000.00 - $175,000.00 per yearSupplemental Pay:Commission payWork Location:Fully RemotePaid Training:NoThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedAggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedStable -- traditional, stable, strong processesCompany's website:Westportcomm.comWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Business Development Representative (Inside Sales) Business Development Representative (Inside Sales) – Medical Device / SaaS - Based Midwest (Central Time Zone)This position is not a traditional inside sales role. In this role, you will not only be reaching out to existing customers and partnering with both ImpediMed’s Sales Operations and Strategic Account Managers to gain direction on which accounts to targets to be successful in your hunting, but you will also be providing in-house and remote SOZO® device demonstrations and trainings to internal and external customers. You will also work on creating SOZO® training materials as you become one of our in-house subject matter experts.This position is ideal if you’re excited to both flex your technical knowledge and people skills. It requires fantastic active listening, presentation, and communication skills as you will be spending a great deal of time on the phone with customers and doing remote product demos.The ideal candidate should possess a strong commercial orientation, experience selling services – ideally SaaS platforms and must possess a demonstrable track record and a desire to win. At ImpediMed, you will bring disruptive solutions to market, extend and build strong relationships with clients and make and change the future of healthcare!ImpediMed’s Core Values:  Integrity, Accountability, Collaboration, Respect, Quality, and Compliance.ImpediMed’s Company Vision:  Leave no patient untested who could benefit from our technology.POSITION SUMMARYThe Business Development Representative is responsible for seeking new business opportunities in the market by analyzing potential opportunities, and then contacting and developing relationships with potential customers. You will be entirely responsible for initiating, driving, executing, and supporting all outbound lead generation campaigns and building sales opportunities for the ImpediMed Sales Account Managers within your region. This position acts as a liaison between our Marketing and Sales team.PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES(Essential Functions of the Position) Include but are not limited to the following. Other duties may be assigned.Responsible for development of new business opportunities within assigned territory.Meet month, quarter, and annual assigned sales quotas for revenue growth and strategic objectives in assigned territory, with ultimate discretion as to how to achieve these goals.Establish and build productive, long-term, trusting professional relationships with customers/prospects in assigned territory. Includes executive, administrative, and clinical relationships.Be an active participant in overall sales results within assigned territory and collaborate with territory Strategic Account Manager to ensure maximum lead close rate and optimize the end user experience.Identify and qualify leads from marketing and public relations campaigns as sales opportunities; prioritizing National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) and National Accreditation Program for Breast Centers (NAPBC) accredited centers.Drive sales through cold calls to physicians and hospitals, emails, device demonstration, presentations and other sales selling techniques. Support Master Service Agreement (MSA) accounts.Present ImpediMed, the Lymphedema Prevention Program (LPP), and our solutions to potential customers using SOZO demonstrations and presentations.As a subject matter expert, maintain knowledge of ImpediMed products/services and new pricing/payment plans to sell customers the right solution.Effectively communicate SaaS product features and functionalities, verbally, in writing and through presentations/demonstrations to potential customers.Customize product solutions to increase customer satisfaction.Partner with Customer Experience team during new software upgrades for base customers to ensure complete customer satisfaction.Initiate upgraded license opportunities to base customers with SOZO demonstrations and presentations.Demonstrate CRM discipline in pipeline management, sales activity and forecast accuracy.Review, analyze, and report on base business analytics for tracking progress.Actively engage on Social Media platforms to support brand awareness.Facilitate in person and virtual meetings between prospective customers and Strategic Account Managers.ACCOUNTABILITIES AND PERFORMANCE MEASURES Achieves assigned sales quota.Meets and maintains company expectations for average sales pricing and profitability.Completes customer/prospect account plans that meet company standard.Maintains high customer satisfaction ratings that meet company standards.QUALIFICATIONS GUIDELINES Typical Knowledge, Skills, & AbilitiesExcellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, interact with Sales team members, Customer Experience team and others within the organization.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Ability to project professionalism and credibility; build rapport quickly in a virtual environment.Proficient in virtual sales demonstrations/presentations with video camera turned on to build stronger customer relationships.Ability to use technology effectively. Can diagnose technical problems, while remaining professional. Instils calm and confidence so customer will stay engaged.Excellent time management skills.Demonstrated business development and solution selling skills (SaaS). Strong consultative, value-based, and principles of successful selling skills.In-depth experience with Microsoft Office tools and CRM.Skilled in discovery, conducting presentations, online web demos, and capturing deal progress in CRM.Solid understanding of SaaS (software as a service): SaaS business modeling and revenue streams.Negotiation, contracting, and problem-solving skills.Self-motivated to succeed and understands that every “no” brings you closer to the “yes”.Strong organization and planning skills with an attention to detail and accuracy.Must understand, follow, and comply with regulatory requirements as applicable to various processes. An understanding of FDA Quality System Regulations and ISO Standards (ISO 13485) is required.Must possess a thorough understanding of work-related standards and regulations, including but not limited to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Quality System Regulations (QSRs), both US and international.Able to be a “big picture” thinker.MINIMUM EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCEA Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution (Marketing, Business Administration, or relevant field) required.Minimum of five (5) years of experience as a Business Development Representative, Sales Account Representative or Inside Sales.Minimum of 3 years of experience in healthcare sales (medical device, connected device, bio-tech, digital health), technology solution-based selling (SaaS), Cloud applications preferred.Track record of developing leads from marketing campaigns and achieving sales quotas.Hands on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls to physicians and hospitals).Proven track record of success, demonstrating and presenting digital health applications.High proficiency with MS Office and CRM applications. Familiarity with MS Excel (creating, analyzing spreadsheets and charts a plus).Strong aptitude for scientific learning. Prefer candidates with extensive sales experience and industry background in oncology, cancer survivorship, healthcare, or related industry.WORK ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS Travel: This position may require domestic business travel up to 5%. Valid driver’s license is required.Physical Demand: Moderate physical effort. For example, standing, bending, or stooping for extended periods, operating light office equipment, e.g., personal computer, copier etc. The employee must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds of equipment.Mental Demand: Moderate to high degree of concentration due to volume, complexity, and/or “pressure” of work.BENEFITSFull healthcare benefits include: Medical PPO/HMO/HSA Plan Choices, Dental Plan, Vision Plan; 401(k) with employer match for full-time employees once vested in plan.Basic Life, AD&D, STD/LTD, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)ABOUT IMPEDIMEDBased in Brisbane, Australia with its principal office located in Carlsbad, CA, USA and a European office in Thessaloniki, Greece, ImpediMed is the world leader in the design and manufacture of medical devices employing bioimpedance spectroscopy (BIS) technologies for use in the non-invasive clinical assessment and monitoring of tissue composition and fluid status. ImpediMed Limited is a public company listed on the Australian Stock Exchange (ASX: IPD).ImpediMed devices are currently used in both the clinical and research settings with future applications being developed for home use. ImpediMed has over 15 years of clinical experience supporting healthcare professionals in the assessment of secondary unilateral lymphedema of the limbs. ImpediMed’s devices are used in a variety of settings to aid surgeons, oncologists, therapists, and radiation oncologists. Our research devices are thought of as a gold standard measurement system for non-invasive fluid and body composition measurement, used in both animals and human research.We were the first company to receive FDA clearance in the U.S. to aid healthcare professionals to clinically assess unilateral lymphoedema of the arm and leg in women and the leg in men, for our L-Dex® U400 device. ImpediMed’s products are unique in the field of BIS which is the gold standard in bioimpedance. They scan the full frequency range from 3kHz to 1000kHz taking readings from 256 unique points. In BIS, ImpediMed has developed devices which are the most accurate and clinically useful in this field. ImpediMed is respected in the BIS field for the strong scientific foundation of its approach to BIS with over 400 peer-reviewed journal articles. ImpediMed’s products are designed and manufactured to an ISO 13485 Medical Devices Quality System.The company is advancing the state of the art in BIS technology with our new product platform called SOZO®. Only SOZO® by ImpediMed uses proprietary bioimpedance spectroscopy technology to gather and retain thousands of unique data points related to fluid status and tissue analysis, then applies indication-specific algorithms to produce accurate, detailed and actionable results in only 20 seconds. SOZO® identifies opportunities for early interventions that may prevent certain conditions and slow or reverse the progression of others, resulting in better health and quality of life. A single, powerful SOZO® reading allows individualized, proactive care across multiple specialties for improved clinical and economic outcomes. SOZO® is the world’s first interactive health monitor to use ImpediMed’s patented bioimpedance spectroscopy (BIS) technology to monitor a person’s fluid status and tissue analysis.ImpediMed produces a family of FDA cleared and CE Marked medical devices, including SOZO®, sold in select markets globally. For more information, see our website at www.impedimed.com.ImpediMed’s management team includes executives who have international experience in successfully introducing innovative medical products to global markets. The organization is dynamic and professional and has been built from the ground up with a strong team of enthusiastic and dedicated senior managers, researchers and employees. The company is on a dramatic growth path with the strong demand for its unique product offerings and offers exciting career opportunities.ImpediMed is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action EmployerRelated keywords: business development, sales, remote work from homeJob Type: Full-timePay: Up to $0.99 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceEmployee assistance programEmployee discountFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offReferral programRetirement planVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:As an essential healthcare business, the safety of ImpediMed employees and our customers is our top concern. Employees are required to follow ImpediMed COVID-19 policies, those of our customers, local and state laws, taking all precautions to be safe.Education:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:Selling: 5 years (Required)Medical sales: 3 years (Preferred)Work Location:Multiple locationsPaid Training:YesCompany's website:www.impedimed.comCompany's Facebook page:http://mfacebook.com/impedimed.comWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

JobTitle: Remote Mortgage Loan Processor ($100k+ total annual take home)
Text:
Remote Mortgage Loan Processor ($100k+ total annual take home)
If you are a Remote Mortgage Loan Processor with experience, please read on!
What You Will Be Doing
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

The primary role of the Loan Processor is to administer and review new loan applications, closely manage their pipeline to ensure loans close as quickly and accurately as possible, and to interact both with our internal teams as well as customers and brokers outside the firm. You will be expected to prioritize and problem solve daily.

This role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:

Act as the primary interface with PMP clients, updating them on loan statuses, working with them to obtain closing conditions, and ensuring a seamless and efficient lending experience.
Must be familiar with DU/LPA
Work directly with consumer to obtain documentation to ensure timely turn times and meet client SLAs
Ensure information in the LOS is accurate and updated in a timely manner.
Review files for completeness and ensure required items are obtained quickly to ensure an accurate loan decision is rendered by the underwriter.
Follow up with third party services to ensure required items are received promptly.
Work directly with client to orchestrate deal changes and ensure modifications to the loan are processed quickly/efficiently.
Deliver top-notch client service both to the clients of PMP as well as to the mortgage customers themselves.
Function as part of a deal team that requires focused participation and contribution. Exert leadership as required to keep deals moving and escalate issues to management as required.
What You Need for this Position
EXPERIENCE:

Minimum of 3-5 years processing experience in a front-line origination production environment.
Prior experience working with FHA, VA, USDA loans
Understanding and applicability of recent regulatory changes is important.
Strong computer skills and familiarity with Microsoft Office suite of products is preferred.
You will be working with some of the newest technology in the mortgage industry. As it evolves, we will ask you for your feedback to improve our products.
Outstanding communication and problem-solving skills.
Must be experienced in Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac policies and procedures
Flexible schedule to support clients in different time zones
Ability to work in a time sensitive, deadline oriented environment
Broad understanding of the regulatory landscape and required disclosures/timing.
Ability to perform quality work and adhere to timeliness standards established by management.
Proactive, energetic and resourceful.
Strong attention to detail and organization, and ability to develop an in-depth understanding of the products/programs of our clients.
Bilingual: English/Spanish (preferred)
What's In It for YouCompetitive base salary/hourlyVacation/PTOMedicalDentalVision401(k)Solid work-life balanceAnd More
So, if you are a Remote Mortgage Loan Processor with experience, please apply today!Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.


Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

The Care Advisor serves as a point contact (phone, email, SMS) for patients to provide resources and assistance with accessing clinical and supportive care activities offered for the program. The Care Advisor provides patients with education and information to understand product and their disease, to educate patient about side effect management, and support patient adherence to prescribed therapy. The Care Advisor will offer only approved services and program materials.
Additional CARE ADVISOR Duties:
Respond to inbound calls and make scheduled outbound call for patients. Interactions utilize scripts and approved FAQs.
Provide patient support information for patients on prescribed therapy
In conducting calls with patients, the Care Advisors will identify potential barriers to treatment; may utilize approved assessments or other approved techniques to help mobilize patients to access Patient Services.
Care Advisors will use proprietary CRM and telephony to maintain information and track patient progress and to trigger calls, correspondence, or other program directed activities.
Provide education to help patients better communicate with their respective health care providers.
Education to support prescribed therapy consistent with FDA approved indication and dosing: disease state information, side-effect management.
Any additional duties as assigned by program management.
Job Qualifications:
Associates degree required; Bachelor’s degree Preferred
Licensed Clinical Social Worker preferred
Direct patient education/patient support experience required
Experience in remote/virtual call center providing patient education and support preferred
Experience in case management or AIDS Service Organization (ASO) highly preferred
Knowledge of HIV patients and issues required
Experience in motivational interviewing preferred
Demonstrated time management skills; planning and prioritization skills; ability to multi-task
Demonstrated ability to work with enthusiasm
Demonstrated ability to effectively build positive relationships
Demonstrated ability to be adaptable to changing work environments and responsibilities
Fully competent in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Flexibility to work evenings
Dedicated home workspace
Bilingual on English/Spanish preferred

As Prevail Health Solutions talent partner, we have been retained to help identify an experienced Creative Design Manager/ Designer for their growing team. Prevail Health's mission is to provide clinically-proven health and wellness programs combined with a best-in-class, caring support network. With a proven, evidence-based model Prevail is positioned to drastically improve behavioral health outcomes and access to care. This is an opportunity to grow within an organization and to build a team out in the future.

About the Role

Prevail is seeking a Creative Manager to lead design process and execution across multiple design functions including product, marketing and interactive content production. This is a high growth position for an experienced and passionate designer, which provides the opportunity to expand and become Prevail's Head of Design. As the most senior member of Prevail's design team, you will be responsible for user experience research, testing, design operations, as well as interactive content production. You will lead the team in creating and enhancing the experience for our users, providers and others using the Prevail platform.

Responsibilities:

Organize a creative process that fosters collaboration, productivity and positivity that will empower a growing design team
Partner to organize product vision and core metrics
Ensure we discover and understand our users and the problems they are trying to solve, then integrate that shared understanding into the team
Define the human-centered operations in design and ensure the creation and delivery of great user experiences quickly and predictably
Maintain and advance Prevail's design workflow, including style guides and extremely high-quality standards
Continuously improve the experience for users, both visually and by measurable user outcomes

Requirements:

You are a pragmatic thinker who understands outcomes and has the ability to empower and manage a creative team
3-5 years of design experience on a fast-paced, mission-oriented team (startup experience a plus)
1-3 years of management experience where you managed a shared understanding as well as the outcomes of the design process
You have a track record of designing exception products that deliver a high-quality user experience
You have strong written and oral communication skills to communicate clearly across multi-functional teams to foster and develop confidence and buy-in to initiatives

If you're ready to take on new challenges in a dynamic fast-paced atmosphere that is changing the way we access support in health and wellness, then don't hesitate to reach out and apply for the position. We take a holistic approach to hiring and consider the unique qualifications of each candidate.

As Prevail Health Solutions talent partner, we have been retained to help identify an experienced Product Owner for their growing team. Prevail Health's mission is to provide clinically-proven health and wellness programs combined with a best-in-class, caring support network. With a proven, evidence-based model Prevail is positioned to drastically improve behavioral health outcomes and access to care. This is an opportunity to grow within an organization and to build a team out in the future.

Position is based remotely with someone ideally being based in Chicago, Nashville, TN OR Denver, CO - however all locations will be considered.

About the Role:

Prevail is looking for a Product Owner to take over the delivery of our flagship Veterans program. The role will require a strong emphasis on data analytics, and a background with relevant experience in generating and analyzing data will be a strong plus. Our Product Owners are responsible for rallying our teams around our business and product goals and driving the process from project scoping through product delivery and user feedback analysis.

Our Product Owners gather and analyze data on program delivery, prioritize feature requests generated from that analysis, and then work with the development & design team and coordinate releases. To be successful in this role, you must have a keen ability and desire to 'put yourself in the shoes' of the user and understand/anticipate how to make their journey with Prevail go better. You should be able to identify user needs and work cross-functionally to manage products and their releases. You must be a master at writing clear product spec – we're big fans of minute details – and easily communicate product specs to all team members.

As a Product Owner you will:

Be responsible for the delivery and oversight of one of our product lines
Help generate, and then analyze data, drawing conclusions on iterative improvements required to improve the product and delivery
Define features that connect business and user goals in all areas of your product, creating processes and specifications for your cross-functional teammates in design, engineering and delivery
Work with key stakeholders to develop and manage product road maps, you will have the final say in prioritization and what goes out when
Work with design, engineering, QA and delivery teammates to develop specs and implement features
Gather insights from research, teammate communications, and user feedback
Test features to ensure anything going out to our users will meet our product goals

Requirements:

2-4 years of experience in a product role (startup experience strongly preferred)
Veteran a strong plus
Technical background with knowledge of software development
Working knowledge of Azure DevOps or similar tools (JIRA, etc.) required
Background in Data Analytics a strong plus
Experience working hands on with design and development in an Agile and/or Waterfall environment
Experience translating customer requests into clear and concise user stories for engineering and QA consumption
Comfortable manipulating and analyzing large sets of data
Proven ability to self-motivate and drive towards tangible outcomes
Comfortable interacting and leading meetings with clients

Benefits:

Remote work for the indefinite future
Competitive salary
Health and dental insurance
Competitive benefits (401K, etc.)
Monthly virtual Happy Hour
Relaxed and collaborative working environment
Rapid growth opportunity

JobTitle: New Business Healthcare IT Sales Executive
Text:
Agfa HealthCare, is a division of the Agfa-Gevaert Group which is headquartered in Mortsel, Belgium and traded on Euronext Brussels (AGFB).

At Agfa HealthCare, we support healthcare professionals across the globe to transform the delivery of care. Our focus is 100% on providing best-of-suite Imaging IT software solutions that enable secure, effective and sustainable imaging data management.

From product development to implementation, our unified Enterprise Imaging Platform is purpose-built to reduce complexity, improve productivity and deliver clinical value. We use our proven track record as an innovator, our in-depth medical knowledge and our strategic guidance to help healthcare providers achieve their clinical, operational and business strategies.


The New Business Sales Executive is responsible for selling Agfa HealthCare’s portfolio of IT to hospitals and health systems in assigned geography. Individual will be responsible for growing new business market share, funnel development, strategic planning, territory management and achieving annual sales quota and MBO targets.
This is a remote position and can be based in the Chicago and surrounding areas, closed to a major airport. The position will be covering the Great Plains area.

Main responsibilities:
Achieving annual sales plan by prioritizing prospecting, customer facing selling time and driving sales strategy execution to generate sales volume of new business
Managing the future market opportunity potential of the assigned geography/territory
Developing consultative sales relationships with all key buying influences in each prospective opportunity, including multiple levels within the customer's organization including key management and executive management, CFO, CIO, CEO, CMIO etc.
Adhering to sales process by owning funnel management in the CRM system, driving territory development and account strategy to closing deals in territory and any assigned existing customer accounts
Developing and executing an annual business/territory plan supporting attainment of quota, key performance metrics, market share growth and reviewing progress on a quarterly basis
Collaborating with AGFA colleagues and business partners on closing business and growth strategies in assigned territory and accounts
Developing and maintaining product knowledge of AGFA Healthcare’s portfolio of IT and competitive products
Maintaining complete knowledge of the market drivers in the geographic territory, as well as each prospective and assigned customer account's current and strategic objectives, purchase plans and key buying influences

Education:
Bachelor’s degree and direct sales experience selling enterprise IT solutions to hospitals, academic medical centers and large health systems
Experience:
A minimum of five years experience working in a complex selling environment, where multiple people and/or committees involved in the purchasing decision

Specific skills:
Active and Advanced C-Level relationships within assigned geography
Ability to create value proposition to support a portfolio wide customer solution
Experience selling multi-million dollar enterprise imaging and/or software solutions in the healthcare vertical market
Proficiency in Strategic Selling concepts and/or comparable sales process and tools
Competitive enterprise imaging and/or software product experience/knowledge

JobTitle: Provider Practice RCMS Solution Specialist (Pre-Sales Subject Matter Expert) #771
Text:
Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
**Allscripts Provider Practice RCMS Solution Specialist #771**

Ambulatory Rev Cycle Pre-Sales Subject Matter Expert

Remote role / May live anywhere in the continental U.S. - near a major airport

**Touchworks/ambulatory rev cycle sales expert - providing subject matter expertise in support of the sales team**

The primary purpose of this key, client-facing role is to provide in-depth, revenue cycle subject matter expertise and to support to the sales team.

Responsibilities:
Consult with potential ambulatory revenue cycle customers and salespeople to drive new business
Integral part of the sales process, contributing to the success of the overall team, by learning and staying informed on the complex and comprehensive Information Business product line; developing and maintaining expert level knowledge of practice area; following a sophisticated consultative selling model; leading new customer projects to ensure quality and timing of results; serving as a practice area subject matter expert to individuals within the organization; contributing to product development within the practice area that meets customer needs
Subject Matter Expert
Expert level knowledge of products in practice area, including features, benefits, pricing, intended use, value proposition and competitive position in order to effectively serve clientsEducate sales executives on solutions, to ensure knowledge is shared and disseminated into the organization; and conducting formal training sessions upon request
Sales Process
Consults with customers and salespeople to drives new business developmentMeet quarterly and annual sales goals by meeting with clients when called in by a Consulting Sales Executive (CSE) to discuss, document and fully understand specific needs identified by the CSE; determining if an standard product/deliverable will meet the client needs or if a customized deliverable is requiredCraft methodological approaches to meet client objectives, including design and documentation, if a customized deliverable is required; effectively articulating the value of proposed deliverable/solution through a formal client presentation and addressing objections; appropriately price deliverable to ensure acceptable margin; and creating a detailed work plan that will drive the solutionLeads new customer projects to ensure quality and timing of resultsContributes to new product development that meets customer needsParticipate in the project kick-off and status meetings; ensuring a smooth, providing consultation and leadership to ensure design, fulfillment, and execution of projects; and presenting the final work product to the customer upon completionIdentify gaps where current products do not meet client requirements; providing creative focus and impetus for new product concepts and context solutions (e.g., dashboards, executive summaries, audits, query tools); working with product managers and business unit team to translate unmet client requirements into business and functional specifications; participating in product design discussions; evaluating prototypes; and engaging in beta testing
Administration of Salesforce.com
Lead nurturing/scoringData cleansingReports/dashboardsAnalysis of Sales Activities
Assist in development of Sales Collateral and Events
PowerPoint presentationsSell SheetsWhite Papers / Case StudiesTradeshow exhibition management
Marketing activity tracking
Assist in Proposal Development

RFIsRFPsMSA / GSAsSOWs
Customer Satisfaction
Responsiveness to customer issues and management of escalations and critical deliverablesMinimizes customer attrition through high quality customer support/relationships
Market Awareness
Knowledge of competitive and relevant market dataUnderstanding of current overall trends in the business sectorUnderstanding of customers specific business goals, strategy, financials and challenges

Academic and Professional Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in business/finance, sales, marketing, or equivalent experience

Experience:
In-depth knowledge of ambulatory revenue cycle processes and practicesPersuasive communication/presentation skillsProven track record of success in sales and/or strategic product support over a sustained period

Post Covid, approx. 50%. Candidates must live near a major airport in the continental U.S.

Remote, home-office

HireArt is helping our client find a Technical Recruiter to strategize on ways to successfully build talent pipelines for multiple, complex searches. The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of experience hiring technical talent.
You'll work with the recruiting and engineering teams to attract and hire world-class software engineers and technologists. You will partner with hiring managers to understand and anticipate their needs and priorities in order to help grow one of the best engineering teams in NYC. You will work to identify and engage passive candidates and manage the full-cycle recruiting process for technical hires.
This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 8-month contract position with the possibility of extension and will be fully remote.
As Technical Recruiter, you will:
Strategize on ways to successfully build talent pipelines for multiple, complex searches.
Directly source candidates through research, messaging campaigns, social media, referral generation, and events.
Conduct preliminary conversations with potential candidates about the company and the role that they are interested in.
Ensure that candidates are seamlessly moving through the interview process.
Manage offers by negotiating, acting as an internal advocate for candidates, and extending offers.
Work closely with senior stakeholders in our engineering, people, and recruitment operations teams to effectively drive change and propose process improvements.
Requirements
5+ years of experience hiring technical talent by sourcing, pitching, and closing candidates
2+ years of experience independently closing engineering candidates
Experience working as part of an in-house internal recruitment team
Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
Extremely organized and detail-oriented
Passion for technology and the fight against cancer
Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 8-month contract position with the possibility of extension through HireArt and will be fully remote.
HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.

Agfa HealthCare, is a division of the Agfa-Gevaert Group which is headquartered in Mortsel, Belgium and traded on Euronext Brussels (AGFB).

At Agfa HealthCare, we support healthcare professionals across the globe to transform the delivery of care. Our focus is 100% on providing best-of-suite Imaging IT software solutions that enable secure, effective and sustainable imaging data management.

From product development to implementation, our unified Enterprise Imaging Platform is purpose-built to reduce complexity, improve productivity and deliver clinical value. We use our proven track record as an innovator, our in-depth medical knowledge and our strategic guidance to help healthcare providers achieve their clinical, operational and business strategies.

As a Sales Development Representative (SDR) you will be responsible for generating interest in Agfa HealthCare products through identifying, developing, nurturing and qualifying leads. The Sales Development Representative plays a critical role on the sales team. We are looking for candidates that are eager and interested to build a career in the healthcare technology sector with a passion for technology.

Drive and manage role requirements, which are listed below, with high-level independence and autonomous decision making for best outcomes related to generating net new revenue opportunities
Assistance with CRM integrity, tracking, and analytics, with Sales directors on Strategic Sales team.

Generate new business opportunities to fuel the pipeline through executing lead generation strategies

Lead follow up and nurturing following all trade shows, digital events and programs
Collaborate with Sales Management and individual Sales Directors to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities for new business
Bi-Weekly calls with all new business reps
Collaborate with Sales management and the Marketing Department to create and deliver monthly campaigns to drive revenue
Manage and create quotes for assigned accounts
Achieve or exceed monthly/quarterly quotas of Qualified Leads and Closed Business
Minimal travel required
Other duties as assigned

Undergraduate degree in healthcare or related field preferred
Cold-calling experience preferred
Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment on sales initiatives required
Digital outreach and marketing experience preferred
Experience selling healthcare technology systems or products preferred
Sugar CRM experience preferred
Excellent written/verbal communication skills required
Goal-oriented, highly motivated, self-starter attitude required
Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment required
Ability to understand customer requirements and identify potential solutions to fulfill these needs required
Excellent time management with strong organizational skills required

Compensation and Benefits:
The position offers a competitive base salary, bonus and attractive benefits package including healthcare, 401K and paid time off.
We offer a rewarding career in a field that impacts lives, the opportunity to work with a talented and committed team of individuals, training and career development programs, and a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you want to be part of this experience, we'll take you there!

Position Purpose
Acting on own initiative, the Area Sales Manager is responsible for meeting and exceeding company objectives and sales goals as well as maintaining strong wholesaler relationships and customer interactions within the local market. This position may have single state or multiple state area responsibilities.

Essential Duties
Promotes and sells all Delicato Family Wines brands to meet and/or exceed company sales quotas, while also identifying sources of new business opportunities
Develops effective wholesaler objectives based on plan, monitors and measures performance versus goals, communicates set objectives and priorities to wholesaler partners, and takes appropriate corrective action if goals are not being met
Develops and maintains key account and target lists; develops relationships at top level accounts both individually as well as with the wholesaler partners
Executes assigned programs as directed and, upon approval, introduces creative programs based on market needs and conditions
Follows pricing policies that capitalize on market opportunities while delivering company profitability
Schedules and leads effective wholesaler sales meetings involving all levels of management; coordinates monthly meetings with wholesaler sales teams
Coordinates tracking reports with wholesalers based on agreed upon goals, tracks programs, and ensures solid program execution
Submits required reports and expenses in a timely manner, meets all prescribed deadlines
Responsible for managing activities in compliance with state and federal laws and regulations

Other duties may be assigned

Non-Essential Duties
Manages point of sale (POS) and marketing materials needed for accounts; orders sales tools to ensure a timely and effective market execution
Assists in quarterly business reviews with wholesalers
Educates wholesaler and customers on products and merchandising priorities
Conducts wine tastings, fund raisers, trade shows and other wine events for and with wholesalers
Monitors inventory and shipment levels to ensure depletion and profit goals are achieved
Encourages cross-functional relationships throughout the organization with different departments

Other duties may be assigned

Minimum Requirements
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree with emphasis in Business Administration, Sales and Marketing, or related field strongly preferred
3-5 years combined experience with wine suppliers and/or wholesalers in selling wines, building brands, and customer relations

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Market knowledge, wholesaler relationship building and management skills, excellent verbal and written communication
Strong presentation, analytical, planning, organizational, merchandising, and negotiation skills
Ability to successfully execute sales plans and marketing strategies
Ability to understand and apply market intelligence to sales strategy; read and evaluate sales and marketing reports, analysis, and trends
Ability to stay current with company brands, programs, initiatives, policies, and procedures as well as products offered by the company’s competition
Genuine and persuasive presence to influence decision-makers
PC literate with solid knowledge in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) and knowledge of Syndicated Data
Knowledge of wine and wine industry required

Certificates and Licenses
Valid driver’s license, auto insurance, and vehicle required with an acceptable driving record
Working Conditions
Requires ability to travel frequently and flexibility in schedule to work evenings and weekends as needed
This is a remote position that requires working from home
Occasionally may be required to lift and carry cases of wine
Required to talk & listen
May need to determine color, taste and smell of wine using eyes, tongue, and nose
May be exposed to weather-related temperature & humidity extremes
Operates keyboard & mouse
Work Standards
Acts in a manner reflective of the Company culture of High Moral Standards, Innovation and Continuous Evolution, Trust in Team, Continuous Improvement, and Sustainable Relationships
Communicates, interacts, and works effectively with others; receptive to feedback and coaching; voices concerns in a constructive manner
Demonstrates commitment to safety first; communicates safety concerns; promotes a safe work environment based on established safety standards and training
Follows all Company policies and procedures
Additional Comments
Management retains the discretion to add to or change the duties of the position at any time.

Delicato Family Wines offers its employees a generous and comprehensive benefits package. The core health insurance components include medical, dental and vision, where Delicato covers nearly the entire cost for employees and a large percentage for dependents. Additional health benefits include life, disability and flexible spending accounts. Other benefits include 401(k) with generous company match, discretionary profit sharing, paid time off (PTO), paid holidays, wine & merchandise discounts, tuition reimbursement, gym discounts & many more.

Job Title: Risk Solution Sales Executive
Location(s): Remote, VA/Remote, PA/Remote, NC

ServiceNow is changing the way people work. We make work work better for people. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before. It is because of this mission that we were named the most innovative company in the world by Forbes in 2018.
We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.
The Risk Solutions Sales Executive will be responsible for market success of ServiceNow’s Risk and Compliance products. This product is built on ServiceNow’s market leading platform and creates a single source of truth and engagement that allows processes across the enterprise to execute with uniform information.
You will be responsible for communicating the risk and compliance value proposition to prospects. You will develop a strong partnership with your designated Account Executives and Solution Consultant to provide a comprehensive and compelling message across all industries within your region. You will focus on targeting your risk and compliance message to specific customer needs and will focus on being a trusted advisor to our community of customers and partners. Finally, you will represent ServiceNow at local and regional events to drive your message into the broader market.
 What you get to do in this role:
Provide subject matter mentoring and training to peers and other colleagues in the organization.
Communicate competitive intelligence and activity to manager and BU to ensure we keep ahead of opportunities, obstacles, and challenges
Work closely with sales teams to accelerate opportunities by meeting directly with customers to provide comprehensive product and industry insight
In partnership with assigned Account Executive and Solution Consultant, present our risk and compliance solutions directly to prospects, customers and at industry events and seminars
Support the regional ServiceNow partner channels to drive an effective customer experience
Articulate customer success strategies (and losses) to the field in order to streamline and standardize risk and compliance solution presentations and value propositions
Become a trusted advisor to our community of customers and partners

In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:

5-7 years of sales experience for risk and compliance products, ideally with a focus on products with leadership status in the Governance, Risk, and Compliance and Integrated Risk Management Markets.
Preferred domains of expertise include:
Corporate Compliance and Oversight
Risk Management (Cyber, IT, Operational, and Enterprise)
Audit Management
3rd Party Risk management
Privacy Program Management
Business Continuity, Resiliency, Crisis Management, and Disaster Recovery
A strong understanding of the integrated risk management market and integrated risk related business processes.
Willingness to do whatever it takes to help define a new market and differentiate us from historical approaches.

Works well in a team environment.

Travel required.
We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

JobTitle: Closer - Nationwide Search - Remote Positions Available
Text:
The POWER of a CAREER! Northpointe Bank is seeking a detail oriented, customer service minded individual to join our Retail Lending Team as a Closer. This position requires an individual who has the desire to make a difference within the organization. An exceptional ability to grasp new concepts and learn while providing excellent service is critical for this position.
If you have been looking for an opportunity in the mortgage industry, have the desire to work hard, are dedicated to your individual success, and take pride in the achievement and growth within a team, then we want to hear from you!!!
This position will focus on preparing closing packages for Conventional, FHA, RD, VA Construction, HELOC and Portfolio loans, closing instructions, disbursement/booking sheets and disbursing funds. The loan closer will conduct comprehensive reviews of all loan packages in order to ensure that loans are closed and disbursed in accordance with the Investor Loan Policy as well as Northpointe Bank's policy.
Responsibilities:

Monitor dashboard to ensure superior service level delivery to both internal and external clients.Review and audit pre-closing mortgage loan file.Prepare required documents necessary for the loan to close in compliance with regulations and investor requirements.Review closing documents for accuracy.Work under tight deadlines and time constraints while maintaining a low error rateExtensive knowledge of the different requirements for closing Conventional, FHA, RD and VA loans as well as the differences of a refinance and purchase.Assist Post-Closing team to clear any suspense conditions when applicable.Prepare closing packages for all product types Northpointe Bank offers
Prepare final CDs according to specific product and UW requirements.
Determine funding amount and send wire to title company upon disbursement.Assist Construction Draw Specialist as necessary.
Requirements:
High school diploma or equivalent.At least one year of customer service experience preferred.At least 1 year retail mortgage experience required.At least 3-5 years mortgage closer experience required.Proficient computer skills (i.e., Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, any other mortgage/banking software, etc.).Professional demeanor and interaction with all customers (internal and external).
Effective interpersonal and communications (written and verbal) skills.Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment as well as independently.Ability to pay attention to detail while handling a high volume of work with multiple interruptions.
Our Hiring Philosophy:
Northpointe Bank recognizes that the quality of our people is the foundation for our success. Attracting individuals who value a challenging work environment that rewards the contributions of its people is the cornerstone of our hiring philosophy.
It is the policy of Northpointe Bank and its subsidiaries to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, race, sex, religion, national origin, handicap, marital status, or other attributes not pertinent to the job requirements. This policy reflects our practice of making all employment decisions, from recruitment to promotions, based on an individual's qualifications without discrimination on any basis.
Benefit Information:
MedicalDentalVisionLife, LTD, & AD&DDependent Care Spending Plan (DCSA)Employer Stock Ownership Plan with 401(k) feature and company matchComplimentary Banking ServicesTuition Assistance

Realogy Insurance Agency is looking for an Insurance Sales Representative to join our world class company!
Why work at Realogy Insurance Agency?
This is the opportunity to be a part of a rapidly growing, cutting edge organization!
We offer a highly competitive compensation package including an enticing base salary and the ability to obtain UNCAPPED commissions! Realogy Insurance stresses the importance of a healthy work-life balance (yes, that means no weekends or overtime) and offers some of the best full-benefits package in the market (even your birthday is a holiday here).
Realogy Insurance Agency will take a proactive role in your success as an Insurance Account Executive by providing industry-leading training, licensing, and mentoring from the company’s most successful sales leaders. Using the latest technology, Realogy Insurance Agency maintains relationships with their family of companies to generate leads for their Account Executives allowing you to be an expert in the industry. At Realogy Insurance Agency, we thrive on your success and love promoting from within!
If you possess:
Inside sales experience (big plus)
A strong work ethic
A great personality
Strong verbal, written and presentation skills
High energy and motivation
Coachability and willingness to learn
Strong computer navigation skills
Thrive in a fast-paced environment, then this is the role for you!
As a Realogy Insurance Agency Sales Account Executive, you will:
Source new sales opportunities through outbound calls and emails and through inbound lead follow-up
Interact with prospects to understand customer needs and requirements to generate and present quotes
Quickly build rapport with prospects over the phone
Achieve production goals while working with a variety of tools and applications such as comparative raters, insurance carrier systems, CRM and agency management systems
Be accountable for sales production goals
Navigate multiple websites while conversing with clients
Your background includes:
1 to 3 years of sales experience (preferable from a call center environment)
Personal Lines Insurance license or the Property and Casualty Insurance Licenses (or willingness to acquire during the first 30 days of employment)
A passion for sales
Ability to learn new software programs and technology

About Us
Realogy Holdings Corp. (NYSE: RLGY) is the leading and most integrated provider of U.S. residential real estate services, encompassing franchise, brokerage, and title and settlement businesses as well as a mortgage joint venture. Realogy’s diverse brand portfolio includes some of the most recognized names in real estate: Better Homes and Gardens® Real Estate, Century 21®, Coldwell Banker®, Coldwell Banker Commercial®, Corcoran®, ERA®, Sotheby's International Realty®. Using innovative technology, data and marketing products, best-in-class learning and support services, and high-quality lead generation programs, Realogy fuels the productivity of independent sales agents, helping them build stronger businesses and best serve today’s consumers. Realogy's affiliated brokerages operate around the world with approximately 190,000 independent sales agents in the United States and more than 112,000 independent sales agents in 113 other countries and territories.
At Realogy, diversity fuels success – for our company and for our employees. We strive to be the preferred company for diverse talent, committed to creating an inclusive environment that encourages everyone to succeed. We pursue talent – strategic thinkers who are eager to innovate, focused on execution and accountable for results. We value diversity – respecting backgrounds, cultures, perspectives.
You’ll find our commitment to diversity reflected in our achievements:
Forbes 2020 Best Employers for Diversity.
Recognized on the 2020 Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index .
Recognized for gender diversity on our board of directors by Executive Women of New Jersey and Women’s Forum of New York.
First residential real estate company to endorse the Equality Act and fully support H.R. 1447 amending the Fair Housing Act to include LGBTQ+ as protected classes.
With diversity, we succeed together. We hope you’ll join us.

ABOUT USAt Vida, we empower individuals to overcome chronic mental and physical health conditions, once and for all. The impact of chronic conditions on healthcare is immense: in the US alone, chronic diseases like diabetes and heart disease drive 80% of the $3 trillion healthcare spending, which is at 18% of GDP. One in 3 individuals has a chronic health condition, and 1 in 4 struggles with mental health.Vida provides expert, personalized, on-demand health coaching and programs from a network of experienced health care providers and leading medical institutions. Vida is a next generation continuous care platform for both consumers and businesses, combining a consumer mobile app, an enterprise care platform offering on demand 24/7 solutions for chronic conditions. Vida platform runs in the cloud, captures real-time data from 100+ devices and apps, and integrates back to the employer, payer, and provider. We are trusted by Fortune 1000 companies, major national payers and large providers to enable their employees live their healthiest lives.Our Marketing team is growing and we are looking for a talented and experienced Marketing Recruiter to join our team as a contractor for 6 months.RESPONSIBILITIESBring your experience in recruiting top marketing talent across the USBe a head-hunter –source candidates on job boards, through referrals, and social mediaManage the full cycle of recruiting candidates from sourcing through close, with primary ownership for the growth of our sales teamBecome a trusted strategic partner to our Marketing leaders to scale the Marketing org in a timely fashionWork with our existing Talent Team to help scale processes and implement best practices across hiring top talent in sales rolesHelp us improve and scale a world-class candidate experienceQUALIFICATIONS4+ years sourcing and closing Marketing professionals, ideally for a tech or healthcare companyProven track record of successfully closing requisitions within reasonable time-to-fill metrics, while providing a world class candidate experienceExperience building strategic partnerships with hiring managers and cross-functional team membersStrong communicator across all levels and verticals of the organizationExperience working on a small team in a high-growth, rapidly changing environmentExperience leveraging an ATS (we use Lever) to track and manage candidates, and regularly reporting on recruiting metricsBONUS SKILLSBonus points if you have experience recruiting in the healthcare industryVida is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer._Diversity is more than a commitment at Vida—it is the foundation of what we do. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.__We seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. We don’t just accept differences — we celebrate them, we support them, and we thrive on them for the benefit of our employees, our platform and those we serve. Vida is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures._Job Type: Contract
