Company: Center for Autism and Related Disorders, Inc.
Text: ORGANIZATIONThe Center for Autism and Related Disorders (CARD), LLC, is among the world’s largest and most experienced organizations effectively treating individuals with autism and related disorders. With US and international reach, CARD touches the lives of thousands of people affected by autism and their families. Through a network of trained therapists, supervisors, and researchers, we develop and implement quality, comprehensive, and personalized treatment programs that produce measurable results for every patient.CARD has designed a unique treatment curriculum using the principles and procedures of applied behavior analysis (ABA) and built a global organization of dedicated and highly trained staff. Currently, CARD has over 250 centers across the U.S. and affiliate sites across the globe.Department: RecruitingSupervisor: Recruiting ManagerExemption: Non-Exempt or ExemptDESCRIPTIONThe Recruiter will play an important part in the recruitment process. They will work closely with CARD’s recruiters and provide them with major support services. The Recruiter will spend a large portion of their time conducting internet research, creating and maintaining therapist job postings on various job boards, sourcing for therapist candidates and scheduling phone interviews for CARD recruiters. Modes of sourcing include, but are not limited to the following: Indeed, LinkedIn, Better Team, Handshake, and Facebook. The Recruiter will also make contact with community venues and local colleges to set up recruiting-related events. The Recruiter will also use social media as a means to recruit therapist candidates. Due to the sensitivity of the department, the Recruiter must be able to maintain a high level of confidentiality.RESPONSIBILITIESImplement and represent CARD policyRepresent CARD professionally and ethically to internal and external stakeholdersResearch and recommend new sources for active and passive candidate recruitingHandle classified advertising and utilize the Internet for recruitmentUse social and professional networking sites to identify and source candidatesHelp with college recruiting initiativesSchedule phone interviewsSource suitable candidates through various sourcing channelsSubmit weekly activity reports to recruiting supervisorConsistently meet weekly and monthly goalsActively participate in weekly recruiting meetings with assigned CARD location personnel and recruitersQUALIFICATIONSHigh school Diploma required, bachelor’s degree preferred1-2 years of recruiting experienceExcellent inter-personal relationship skills and ability to work with individuals of all levelsGood time management skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to multi-task and handle large phone correspondencesDetail-oriented, organized and have the ability to work independently and as part of a teamKnowledge of all computer applications, such as: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and OutlookAbility to make cold calls and source talent at all levels of the organization.Must be a confident self-starter who can develop effective business relationships, both internally & externally.Work from home positionJob Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:Recruiting: 1 year (Required)

National News Editor This position is responsible for overseeing national coverage for the National Catholic Reporter, working with the national correspondent, other NCR correspondents, interns/fellows and a cadre of freelance writers to cover breaking news, features and analysis about the church in the U.S. The National News Editor works with other NCR editors (executive, managing, opinion and international) to make content decisions for the entire publication, and serves on the editorial-writing team. Although the national correspondent has primary responsibility for this expansive beat, this editor can also occasionally contribute content on the U.S. Catholic Church, religion and spirituality, social trends, politics and public policy issues. This person reports directly to the executive editor.The responsibilities are as follows:Maintain and expand area of expertise, in this case, the U.S. Catholic Church, religion and spirituality, social trends, politics and public policy issues; bring and continue to cultivate a network of sources, especially within institutions such as national and state bishops’ conferences, Catholic colleges and universities, parishes, Catholic think tanks and advocacy groups;Working with the executive editor, develop coverage plans for innovative coverage of national beat, with an emphasis on NCR’s mission of transparency and accountability and those on the margins;Work with national correspondent, other NCR correspondents, interns/fellows on story assignments and story ideas; commission freelance writers for articles in the national beat; review pitches in those beats;Review and edit manuscripts, in conjunction with other editors, as well as provide feedback on articles being considered for publication;Write occasional editorials in the area(s) of expertise;Occasionally contribute stories: Envision and execute breaking news, in-depth analysis and investigative stories for print, online publication and social media, through written content, multimedia, data journalism and alternative storytelling;Collaborate with EarthBeat and Global Sisters Report editors and teams;Occasionally post breaking news and/or wire stories, using Drupal;Work with production and engagement editors to expand NCR's presence on social media and with multimedia content; interact regularly on social media platforms that grow traffic and reach across generations;Represent the publication through speaking engagements, at conferences and through media appearances;Work from a home base and through pre-approved travel;Maintain high standards of accuracy, accountability and integrity.Other duties as assigned by executive editor.The ideal candidate for this position will be able to demonstrate:Bachelor's degree or higher, five years of experience reporting on Catholic issues, with a known range of contacts in the field;A successful track record of editorial leadership;Knowledge of the Catholic Church, social issues and political issues;Experience as an assigning editor on a variety of story forms including breaking news, profiles, investigations and interactive formats;Capacity to achieve fluency in a content management system (NCR currently uses Drupal);Ability to work collegially with a geographically-dispersed staff;Excellent communication skills;Capacity to self-motivate and work both independently and as part of a team;Ability and willingness to travel regularly; residence in or near a major urban center a plus.Organizational overview:The National Catholic Reporter Publishing Company (NCR) is a non-profit, independent, lay-led news organization that reports on the Catholic Church and wider moral issues facing the human family. It publishes the National Catholic Reporter 26 times a year in print and daily at ncronline.org. It also publishes Global Sisters Report and EarthBeat online. These publications are committed to shaping a world that recognizes the sacredness and dignity of every human being, regardless of religious belief, gender, race, ethnicity, or sexual orientation. Throughout our history, NCR has been a voice for the voiceless, disadvantaged and marginalized. It has held authority, secular or religious, accountable.COMPANY NAME: National Catholic ReporterCONTACT INFORMATION & APPLICANT INSTRUCTIONS:To apply:Interested parties should submit a cover letter explaining their interest and describing their qualifications. Please include a resume with career history and three writing samples. Women and journalists of color are encouraged to apply.Position carries full benefits and salary commensurate with experience. All communications will be treated confidentially. All nominations, applications and inquiries should be directed electronically by Feb. 26, 2021.The National Catholic Reporter Publishing Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and will not discriminate in the hiring process on the basis of race, gender, sexual orientation, color, age, national origin/ethnicity or religion.Job Type: Full-timePay: Up to $1.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offParental leaveVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Editorial: 4 years (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Stable -- traditional, stable, strong processesPeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedCompany's website:https://www.ncronline.org/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/NCRonline/Benefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligible

The Analytic Consulting Group partners with internal and external clients and data providers, leveraging predictive analytics and advanced statistical techniques to drive strategic thought process and effective decision making. As the Lead Analytic Consultant, you’ll aid in analyzing client data to presenting findings or recommendations to helping to steer the strategic direction in solving a variety of business problems.
Responsibilities:
Use your analytics and machine learning expertise to research and recommend the best analytic approaches to solving the marketing problems facing our clients
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand the client’s business situation and develop data driven insights that can be understood and implemented to drive marketing strategies
Conduct analysis by qualitatively and/or quantitatively preparing data and analyzing data/information. Prepare reports and analyses, uncovering insights and developing business recommendations based on data findings
QA/QC data and report or analyses output to ensure accuracy
Create compelling presentations that provide actionable insights and recommendations
Present analyses/ reports to key internal and external stakeholders, effectively communicating the key findings and recommendations
Assist in the development of project requirements, analytic plans, project timelines, and other related materials for the management of deliverables
Support sales process by assessing prospective clients’ needs and crafting/ presenting proposals that meet those needs; Explore and capitalize on opportunities to cross-sell and up-sell existing clients
Communicate and engage with key internal business partners and Epsilon clients to collaboratively solve business problems. Collaborate with leadership to devise strategic direction
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor degree in a quantitative discipline (statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science, electrical engineering, or a related scientific discipline)
5+ years of experience manipulating large data sets, both structured & unstructured, with natural curiosity for exploring data and finding the untold story
Strong understanding of statistics, modeling and machine learning techniques
Able to present advance analytic concepts, algorithms and approaches to variety of audiences
Possess exceptional technical skills in one or more the following programming languages: Python, R, SQL, SAS. Familiarity with cloud based, open source computing environment a plus
Exposure with distributed computing, such as Hadoop, Spark, AWS or related technologies
Desire to work in a highly collaborative environment and highly motivated
Solid planning, priority setting, and project management skills with experience managing multiple projects and resources concurrently
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to display data visually, creating powerful presentations which effectively demonstrate the value of analytic deliverables
Desirable Qualifications:
Advanced degree (Masters) in Statistics, Economics or other quantitative discipline
Experience in marketing analytics field, with strong understanding of quantification of consumer behavior, marketing measurement process, tools and statistical algorithms (e.g. lifetime value, customer segmentation, control groups, A/B testing, multi-variate testing, time-series, media mix modeling, paid media optimization, predictive analytics, supervised/ unsupervised learning)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and strong ability at developing relationships across diverse teams (including statistical, technical, and marketing resources)
Mastery programming experience in Advanced SQL, R, Python or related language (SAS, PySpark, knowledge of statistical packages for statistical modelling, parsing large quantity of data, AWS)
Visualization experience in Tableau preferred
Additional Information
Great People, Deserve Great Benefits
We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.

Sharetown RepresentativeSharetown is looking for part-time hustlers in different cities and towns all over the US. As a leading reverse logistics company for many of the top online brands and retailers in the country, we work hard to help reduce costs, provide great customer service, build partner brands, reduce waste in the environment, and generate revenue opportunities for individuals and families.Have you ever wondered how people return bulky furniture items that they purchased online? Well, that’s where Sharetown comes in. We have incredible representatives scattered across the US that do the following:1. PICK UP these lightly used large furniture items.2. STORE these items (In your garage, a local storage unit, or extra space in your home) for a short period of time.3. SELL the like-new furniture on your favorite local online marketplaces like Facebook Marketplace, OfferUp, Craigslist, and other classified ad platforms.4. EARN some serious cash (Over $100/sale).If you just read those four things above and think that this sounds like a pretty sweet side gig, it’s because it really is. One of the best things about being a Sharetown Representative is that you create your own schedule and will have the flexibility of working whenever you want. That’s why we are looking for entrepreneurial minded people who can treat this as if this were their own little side business and are motivated to succeed. Here are some other skills or things that we are really looking for in a great representative:- Great customer service skills- Some kind of sales experience- Ability to lift over 50 Pounds- Own a Smartphone- Vehicle to transport bulky items (any type of mid or full-size SUV or truck will do)- Have a helper at all pick-ups (Spouse, friend, or family member?)If you feel like this is something that sounds like a great overall fit for you, please fill out the application found on the following page:https://share.hsforms.com/1orbhwQPSTBOfJ_yZSY39HA3qjzwThis is a contract position. If we are interested in moving forward, one of our awesome hiring managers will reach out to you to set up a phone interview. They will not only answer any questions or concerns that you may have, but will be able to see if it would be a good fit on both sides. Every hire will have to go through a background check and we will provide training and support to help you be an effective part of the Sharetown team. Come see what we are all about!Job Types: Part-time, ContractPay: $1,500.00 - $5,000.00 per monthBenefits:Employee discountFlexible scheduleSupplemental Pay:Commission payContract Renewal:LikelyFull Time Opportunity:YesWork Location:Multiple locationsPaid Training:NoManagement:Team LeadThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Innovative -- innovative and risk-takingCompany's website:https://sharetown.com/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/ShareTownIncWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

HireArt is helping a healthcare technology and services company find a Talent Acquisition Sourcer, Diversity to help build diverse teams that will further its mission to impact more lives and deliver better outcomes for patients.
As a Talent Acquisition Sourcer, you’ll bring your expertise in diverse talent acquisition to support our client's needs and provide talent acquisition partners by developing a pipeline of candidates with the goal of diverse representation across all levels of roles.
This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 8-month contract position with the possibility of extension and will be fully remote.
As Talent Acquisition Sourcer, Diversity, you will:
Develop candidate pipelines for recurring and one-off hiring needs.

Partner with talent acquisition partners to analyze job requirements and identify candidate profiles to target.
Create and execute sourcing strategies that leverage your knowledge and networks, as well as industry best practices to attract underrepresented talent.
Screen, advise, and present candidates to talent acquisition partners and hiring managers.
Engage with a network of potential candidates by building a rapport and advocating for candidates throughout the hiring process.
Analyze sourcing and conversion data to drive sourcing strategy improvements.
Requirements
2+ years of relevant experience in a sourcing or talent research role

Experience recruiting for software engineers, IT, product managers, data scientists, or technology-oriented roles a plus
An ability to proactively come up with creative sourcing strategies
Exceptional dedication to the candidate experience
Passionate about networking, leveraging, establishing professional relationships and existing relationships with a professional network and affinity groups a plus
Must be detail-oriented and autonomous
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Dedication towards diversity and inclusion
Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 8-month contract position with the possibility of extension through HireArt and will be fully remote.
HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.

Overview:

Guidehouse is a leading management consulting firm serving the public and commercial markets. We guide our clients forward towards new futures that build trust in society and your professional skills along the journey. Join us at Guidehouse.
Responsibilities:

Lead teams to grow sustainability consulting and deliver meaningful change to our clients.
Our Managing Consultants/Associate Directors provide wide-ranging support for client engagements. They organize their own and team’s tasks and schedules, working on multiple projects simultaneously. They manage core components of projects including quality reviews, work plans, staffing, deadlines and scope or budget issues. They are responsible for developing teams and individuals through coaching and feedback and always promote a culture of excellence.
They demonstrate advanced technical and subject matter capability and continue to gain credentials that are recognized and valued at our company and within the industry. They actively support and drive key pieces of business development, sales activities, and identifying new business development opportunities both within and outside client engagements. Participation in industry and networking events is expected and encouraged. Work may be remote or involve extended times at the client site, depending on the engagement.
Tailor our decarbonization and sustainability offerings to specific clients
Provide content expertise and corporate insights on a daily basis
Lead project teams on engagements in partnership with Directors
Be active in the delivery of projects (we are looking for team players who roll up their sleeves and work with teams, not people who just want to ‘direct’)
Develop internal network to pull in resources from across our global team and across market teams (e.g., with Energy Providers and Public Sector)
Build and maintain relationships with clients
Publish a blog per quarter to keep a strong external profile
Stay up to date on topics relevant to clients (especially on topics related to sustainability and agriculture, F&B, apparel)
Be active on a local or global internal initiative to contribute to the team and culture,be a role model for consultants
Qualifications:
Master’s/MBA or higher (or equivalent)
5+ years plus of relevant experience
Experience in the energy/sustainability/ESG space
Ability to lead teams to create executive level presentations with insight and impact
Specific sectors, including:
Food and beverage (F&B)
Apparel
Agriculture (which is a key input to the two sectors above)
Corporate environments (we are looking for someone who understands the key functions of and dynamics between different departments, and how to develop relationships across them to meet sustainability objectives)
GHG and climate topics (we are looking for someone who understand the key policies, protocols and standards in this field)
Fluency in English (working language).
Agility in presentation storyboarding and development
Strong communication skills withing the project team and at board level
Clarity in business writing
Ability to lay out an analytical project approach and carry it forward with a team
Ability to oversee data-heavy work is a plus
Demonstrated success working within high performing team
Experience in consulting, especially at a large firm preferred
PMP certification preferred
Additional languages (e.g., Spanish and Portuguese) preferred
Additional Requirements:

The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.

JobTitle: Manager, Domestic Field Application Scientists - US remote
Text:
Position can be based anywhere in the US, in close proximity to an airport.

Position Summary:
Field Application Scientists (FAS) for Thermo Fisher Scientific’s Transplant Diagnostics (TDX) division are responsible for supporting TDX’s annual initiatives and priorities through key activities that center around facilitation of field-based product demonstrations, product training, and product troubleshooting.
The Manager, Domestic Field Application Scientists’ primary responsibility will be to manage the activities of an FAS team. In addition, this individual will be required to maintain a deep understanding of, and practical familiarity with, key product lines. The candidate will make routine use of this product line knowledge when working closely with TDX’s Domestic and LATAM customer base. Further use of TDX product line knowledge and application will be instrumental in the development and subsequent execution of worldwide technical workshops, to drive the TDX division’s long history of providing continued education in the field of Transplantation/HLA.
Key Responsibilities:
Coordinate and approve FAS activity and planning. Understand commercial initiatives and assist in prioritization during scheduling conflicts
Maintain metric-driven success and accountability through SFDC and Concur
Ownership of experimental plan creation and facilitation of field-based product line troubleshooting. Collaborate with the Technical Application Specialists when troubleshooting is required as part of a Customer Inquiry.
Assign and perform customer demonstrations/trainings to facilitate sales of new products and development of KOLs
Travel as needed to tradeshows, workshops and customer laboratories in support of commercial activities
Increase FAS visibility to the organization by showcasing success stories and accomplishments
Champion the practice of maintaining close relationships with FAS colleagues, with the intent to promoting collaboration, sharing of best-practices, learning, and overall communication across the FAS team
Implement and manage strong relationships between FAS and Account Managers by working closely with commercial management to develop best practices and rules of engagement within a matrixed environment.
Maintain proficiency in legacy TDX product lines, software applications, equipment and keep current with advancements in the field of transplantation/HLA. Coordinate with internal tech support to arrange for continuing education opportunities to develop staff technical acumen for all product lines.
Search for and identify opportunities for clinical studies and white papers
Maintain an up-to-date understanding of current Commercial initiatives and strategies; maintain close collaboration with TDX Commercial team to act on current initiatives and opportunities
Lead and/or participate in cross divisional customer experience teams to scope and design standardized business processes
Collect team feedback of ‘voice of the customer’ and provide product feedback to departments such as R&D, Marketing and Tech Support
Manage team T&E forecasting and budget
Develop PMD plans and goals with FAS team
Minimum Qualifications:
A Bachelor’s degree, or greater, from an accredited higher learning institution in the Biological or Chemical Sciences.
At least seven (7) years of related working experience required, preferably in an HLA Laboratory or related HLA establishment
At least five (5) years management experience is preferable.
Preferred Qualifications:
Direct experience and knowledge of TDX’s Antibody Detection and/or Molecular Typing products is preferable.
Strong knowledge and comfort with Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Demonstrate success and comfort with creation and facilitation of technical programs and curriculums to both small and large audiences.
Schedule and complete customer or channel partner visits on short notice to provide urgent product assistance.
Take complex subjects and communicate the subject clearly and effectively to an audience of differing levels of familiarity.
Effectively able to multi-task responsibilities and activities, and adapt to sudden changes in expectations and job needs.
Exercise independent discretion and judgment in execution of duties and decisions.
Effectively communicate, both orally and in writing, to management, customers, and third parties.
Communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal. (Ability to speak additional languages would be an advantage, but not required.)
TDX Customer Service Centers, and TDX Channel Partners. Occasional lifting of office and/or laboratory equipment up to 50 lbs.

We have expert energy insurance teams in London, Houston Singapore, all of whom are backed up by AGCS's market-leading capacity and our ability to underwrite risks in over 200 countries and territories.
Our client base and expertise is diverse, spanning upstream, midstream and downstream organizations and operations

As an intern, you will work in a virtual environment and gain real employee experience from a top Insurance organization. We place a high value on our interns and involve them in real work with a real business impact, making our internships in a class of their own. The intern will participate with and contribute to the Energy & Construction teams. The internship program is designed to provide the intern with an opportunity to apply a macro understanding of risk in the real world by working side-by-side with our underwriting and operational support team professionals. Interns will participate in a wide range of learning and development opportunities including job shadows, attendance at internal meetings, speaking engagements and events designed to expose the intern to other areas of AGCS.
Underwriting
Participate in the underwriting process including but not limited to risk analysis, pricing, modeling, terms and conditions negotiation and agreement, quoting, booking, invoicing, policy construction, and post-bind endorsement handling. 
Special Projects
Will collaborate on the development and legacy servicing of underwriting tools, processes, and wordings. 
On the Job Learning
Develop an understanding of engineering and construction concepts, the role of insurance in project financing and risk management, the role of an underwriting department and how it interacts and supports the functions of a global insurance company.
Allianz is the home for those who dare – a supportive place where you can take the initiative to grow and to actively strengthen our global leadership position. By truly caring about people – both its 100 million private and corporate customers and more than 147,000 employees – Allianz fosters a culture where its employees are empowered to collaborate, perform, embrace trends and challenge the industry. Our main ambition is to be our customers’ trusted partner, instilling them with the confidence to grow. If you dare, join us at Allianz Group.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

 Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty (AGCS) is a leading global corporate insurance carrier and a key business unit of Allianz Group. We provide risk consultancy, Property-Casualty insurance solutions and alternative risk transfer for a wide spectrum of commercial, corporate and specialty risks across 10 dedicated lines of business.
Our customers are as diverse as business can be, ranging from Fortune Global 500 companies to small businesses, and private individuals. Among them are not only the world’s largest consumer brands, tech companies and the global aviation and shipping industry, but also wineries, satellite operators or Hollywood film productions. They all look to AGCS for smart answers to their largest and most complex risks in a dynamic, multinational business environment and trust us to deliver an outstanding claims experience.

 Worldwide, AGCS operates with its own teams in 32 countries and through the Allianz Group network and partners in over 200 countries and territories, employing over 4,300 people. As one of the largest Property-Casualty units of Allianz Group, we are backed by strong and stable financial ratings. In 2019, AGCS generated a total of €9.1 billion gross premium globally.
For more information, visit www.agcs.allianz.com or follow us on Twitter @AGCS_Insurance and LinkedIn.

The IT Service Management practice is looking for an Associate Architect with expertise in Cloud Services, with a solid background in IT leadership, IT Service Management principles, executive presence and consulting skills.
The Associate Architect role requires deep IT Service Management knowledge, broad technical knowledge (including Microsoft and non-Microsoft products), and the ability to design solutions by mapping customer business problems to reusable end-to-end process, and process-combined-with-technology, solutions. Demonstrated ability to engage in IT and business executive discussions related to availability, agility, business value, costs, security management, disaster recovery, and the value of process in an enterprise environment is required.
Responsibilities
Microsoft’s ACM and MSM practice maximizes the business impact of Microsoft solutions and the value of Digital Transformation by providing cross domain expertise and experience to deliver the best of Microsoft and the most complete solution to our customers. Within, the Modern Service Management (MSM) practice lights up Digital Transformation through improvement to People, Process and Governance. In this role you will:
Lead clients through ITSM driven improvements. Deliver IT Service Management services including Workshops, Assessments, Service Improvement Programs and other IT operations consulting services.
Architect works closely with other Services team(s) to develop and define the Complex Solution for the customer. Participate in project kick-off and quality assurance as needed.
Architect must be effective in fostering executive level relationships, translating Complex Solutions into contractual documents and/or engaging in contract negotiations.
Architect works with Services and Sellers team(s) to qualify, pursue and close the most strategic opportunities.
Architects own delivery of the estimates to the stakeholders and customer.
Share best practices with team members to help enhance the quality and efficiency of customer support.
Build lasting relationships with the Microsoft Business Groups by working through appropriate escalation channels.
Key Success Factors:
Effective communication, facilitation and influencing skills – ability to present ideas clearly, concisely and comfortably.
Presenting complex development topics to both executive and technical personnel.
Collaborative leadership skills - exhibits willingness to engage other business partners within the organization, is innovative, creative and a team player with a solution-based approach to capture opportunities and remove barriers.
Clear and Critical Thinker - strong decision-making skills: take proactive steps to generate results, uses data and other inputs to make decisions, owns decision, and takes accountability for work using strong organizational and analytical skills together with leveraging multiple methodologies to ensure customer success.
Playing a vital part in business strategy by providing internal practice management risk assessment and review.
Driving successful solution deployments by ensuring proper business value and customer/partner satisfaction.
Growing the business through mentoring, talent pipeline development, and community evangelism.
Provide technical mentoring, assessment and development to consultants in related technical communities.
Contribute to IP development, reuse initiatives, and drive proven practices in architecture, planning, and customer relationships.
Self-starter, energizing, results oriented, and able to multi-task.
Providing customer guidance during product and services sales cycle.
Driving operational excellence and innovation.
Ability to solve challenging problems and deliver timely and high-quality design solutions when presented with conflicting requirements, business demands, and technical risks.
Business Development and Pre-sales
Working as the immediate contact and opportunity owner, you will work with the new Global Pursuit team to effectively answer and address engagement requests from the new Global Domains and direct from Account Aligned teams within the different domain Areas.
Drive business development; scope value-add MSM consulting solutions; and support presales motions, including writing statements of work and customer presentations
Quantify the needs of the business to achieve value outcomes; champion required methodology; capture/reuse IP; and share recommended practices
Mentor and coach MSM Consultants and customer change teams
Develop and maintain strong stakeholder relationships across the adoption ecosystem both internally and within the customer environment
Manage consulting delivery risk effectively and coordinate project governance; including managing project scope, delivery schedules, and issue resolution
Delivery Oversight
Deliver high quality architectural solutions centered on the organizational change management and adoption services required to enable the Microsoft Platform and achieve maximum return on investment
Provide strong leadership of MSM delivery teams, with an ability to influence high performance and collaboration between all parts of the Enterprise services organization
Evangelism
You will be responsible for evangelizing the need and impact of Modern Service Management, both internally through field readiness, internal conferences, team/functional meetings etc. and externally through EBCs, speaking engagements, conferences, blogs etc.
Offering and IP Development
A strong understanding of solution selling; previous experience selling transformation/change management, business change through technology, or similar consulting offerings
Executive-level interpersonal, verbal, written & presentation skills; strong listening & team building skills
Qualifications
Experience working with different regional cultures and within a virtual global practice team
An understanding of the Microsoft technology platform and previous experience in technology driven organizational change is preferred
Experience in behavioral economics; Agile delivery; and project management is valued
Solid understanding of Microsoft’s key ACM Practice solutions across the Domain organization workloads
A minimum of 8 years related work experience including Enterprise environments.
BS/BA or MS/MA/MBA in CS, EE, MIS, Business or related field, or equivalent work experience highly preferred.
ITIL Expert certification preferred and has applied that knowledge to real work situations around Service Strategy, Design, Transition, Operations and/or Continuous Service Improvement.
Applies advanced operations analysis skills and experience in principals of ITIL/MOF, Project Management, Six Sigma, ISO20000, BS15000, and CMM to define appropriate customer solutions.
Maintain and expand working knowledge of current and pre-released Microsoft systems and products, as well as their integration and methods of support delivery.
Demonstrated experience running an IT operation combined with consulting and project management skills.
Candidates should have familiarity with:
Azure/O365 or other cloud platforms
Large Scale Desktop/Laptop migrations or upgrades
Datacenter management and consolidations
IT Operations manager or director level experience
Consulting experience
Project management certification and or and experience
Other Service Management and IT Operating frameworks (i.e. IT4IT, COBiT)
Fluent in English. Spanish and Portuguese fluency a plus.
Role Location: Remote (Any major US or LATAM city)
Travel is an integral part of this position as are high levels of recognition and visibility. Travel can be as high as 70% as is demanded by the needs of our customers and our business. The position also will provide opportunities for Pre-Sales and participation in the delivery of key engagements with a billable utilization requirement.

Golin is looking for a Manager for our Strategic Planning team with a focus on culture and trends. At its core, your job is to help our teams come up with provocative, enviable ideas that get people talking about our brands.

We're in the business of earning attention, not paying for it, so we need people who truly understand what gets people humming. You'll be working with our team of planners, analysts, creatives and media and digital experts to create ideas that break the internet. In addition to having a quick analytical mind, you are a culture vulture with a keen sense for not just what's popular, but why. From gaming to fashion, the latest tech platforms to what's hot in sports, you're part investigator, part instigator.

We're looking for someone who's excited to help brands participate in and shape culture. You're as comfortable hanging out on Twitch as you are digging into mommy blogs about this season's hottest toys. You're everyone's go-to for the best memes, and you know all the songs on Spotify's Top Hits playlist. Maybe you're an active contributor to a subreddit for RuPaul's Drag Race or have a food blog of your favorite soup recipes. Most importantly, not only do you eat content for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, you're enthusiastic about using what you learn to inspire great creative.

What You'll Do:

Surface cultural trends and consumer behaviors across a variety of topics including entertainment, fashion, toys, gaming, and food.
Be able to tell a strategically sound story that converts cultural insights into actions
Collaborate across teams (strategy, creative, media, digital, account management) to ensure your work is relevant and buzzworthy
Develop creative briefs and briefings for both client and creative audiences
Work with creative teams to provide inspiration and validation for powerful, shareable ideas
Proactive thinking to identify new opportunities to shape culture

Requirements:

3+ years of strategic planning experience in PR or advertising
Comfort interpreting a number of data sources to craft a cohesive narrative
Ability to wow teams (and clients) with provocative insights and a clear POV
Master of culture and fluent in the language of the internet
Self-starter, with demonstrated ability to identify and manage projects without a lot of oversight
Must be able to work fast and smart – juggling multiple deliverables at a time and understanding how to apply relevant thinking over multiple projects
Experience with research tools like Gartner, Stylus, Global Web Index, Comscore, TalkWalker
Excellent writing and presentation skills
Positive solutions-based attitude to tackling challenges

About Us:

We are a progressive public relations agency designed to reach the profoundly diverse market. Inclusion is a core value for Golin and we are focused on establishing a culture that is intentionally inclusive, potently diverse and uncompromisingly equitable.

Our expertise ranges from brand-building and cutting-edge digital content to corporate reputation and healthcare advocacy. We align earned-first, data-driven creative with the customer journey to deliver maximum impact for clients. Our roster includes many of the largest CPG, retail, food, healthcare technology and consumer service companies in the world.

We were named PR Week's Global Agency of the Year – in both 2019 and 2020 - and winner of a 2019 Gold Cannes Lion. We go all in for our clients and our people. We challenge our employees to be Courageously Happy and have empowered them to do so by offering our LifeTime benefits including unlimited time off, enhanced family care, generous health and wellness benefits, the ability to work from anywhere one day a week and a monthly stipend for the gym or hobbies. Our culture is built around happy people who are the best at what we do!

Golin is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Golin recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, ethnic or national origin, protected veteran status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status or citizenship status.
We make our careers website accessible to any and all users. If you need an accommodation to participate in the application process, please contact us at JobAppAccommodation@ipgdxtra.com. This email address is not for general employment inquiries or vendors; rather it is strictly for applicants who require special assistance accessing our employment website. Due to volume, messages sent to this email address that are not related to an accommodation cannot be answered.

About Us:
 Threadless is a diverse, global community of artists and those who support them, with creatives from all over the world and all different backgrounds coming together to make great art.
We started with just tees, but tons of products make great canvases. While we work with partners to find these canvases for our artists, it’s our community who makes and picks the best art for us to offer. Whether it’s voted-on art at Threadless.com or designs artists choose to include on their very own Artist Shops, when people buy from us, they are supporting great, weird, geeky, and beautiful art. More importantly, here at Threadless, we feel that art plays a meaningful role in driving progress and creating cultural change.

About This Role:
While we're based in Chicago, having first opened our doors in 2000, we’re currently a remote-first company, giving our employees the flexibility to do their best work from anywhere. A healthy work/life balance is incredibly important to us.
Threadless. Make Great Together.

Threadless is hiring a full-time hourly Production Artist! In this role, you will be responsible for a variety of design needs as part of our Artist Shops VIP Team. You should have excellent design skills, with previous experience designing for products. You must also be a great collaborator, brainstormer and team player.
What you’ll be doing:

Collaborate with artist shop owners to create concepts, mockups, and a cohesive vision based on their assets and identity

Create mockup shop pitches for potential clients with logos, banners, and products that reimagine their existing work/IP

Consistently brainstorm new ideas to elevate the Threadless brand

What you got:

Excellent graphic design skills and strong eye for detail

Expert knowledge of Photoshop and Illustrator

Proficient within the full Adobe Creative Suite

Experience in designing for apparel and other merchandise

Innate passion for art with an eye for current trends and great design

Job Summary:
JLL has an exceptional opportunity for a Facility Condition Advisor to join our growing ProSite team. JLL’s ProSite assessment team provides clients with robust physical condition and operational assessments that provide actionable information for long-term asset planning, maximization of value and operational performance. We have extensive experience in asset condition assessments of building enclosures, mechanical, electrical, plumbing, fire and life safety systems on numerous large-scale assignments for healthcare clients, both public and private sector clients, developers, owner occupiers and investors.
ProSite serves ongoing client demands of strategic planning and infrastructure investment solutions, providing the primary services of facility condition assessments, strategic planning, risk assessments, preventative maintenance planning and asset tagging. Project scopes range from providing solutions for a single existing facility to hundreds of existing facilities. Our ProSite team utilizes several software applications such as VFA.facility developed and maintained by Accruent, FOScore developed and maintained by CannonDesign and Corrigo who was acquired by JLL.

Work as part of a team performing facility evaluations by applying architectural and/or engineering standards, practices, and techniques. The Facility Assessor at this level regularly exercises his/her familiarity of company and project practices and procedures, and is experienced in project mobilization, setup and orientation procedures. The incumbent is viewed as a fully qualified professional with solid experience and technical expertise in performing the duties of either an architectural/civil facility condition assessment assessor or a mechanical, electrical and plumbing assessor. Assessors are responsible for visually evaluating the architectural/MEP building systems, gathering data, and noting any deficient conditions.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Architecture, Engineering or Construction Management (or related field); non-degreed Assessors must have 10+ years of relevant work experience
8+ years of related experience
Proficiency in the application of engineering and architectural design standards, practices, and technique
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
Requires a working knowledge of commercial construction codes and their application to existing facilities
Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to walk for long periods (6 to 8 hours/day) and climb ladders
U.S. Citizenship
Applicants selected for employment may be subject to a federal background investigation and may need to meet additional eligibility requirements for access to classified information or materials
Project definition, planning and management experience
Must be able to obtain, maintain and/or currently possess a security clearance.

As a condition of employment, all JLL employees are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required timeframes and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.
JLL recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce. We are committed to equal opportunity. We consider all qualified employment applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, partnership status, protected veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. Individuals who hold legal work authorization applicable to employment at CannonDesign in the United States will be considered without regard to citizenship/alienage

Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
Synchrony is continuing to build a world class Performance Media and Creative Agency committed to driving results with our retail and payments partners while also delivering leading customer experiences. Within this agency, our Paid Media Team is focused on achieving growth by making data-driven decisions to create meaningful interactions with existing and potential customers. We are seeking an AVP, Paid Search Manager to serve as an SEM thought leader and client lead, supporting business partners across the Synchrony enterprise. This role will help lead SEM team in executing/optimizing campaigns, collaborating across digital channels.
This position is currently remote, where you’ll be work from home, but may be required to work in one of our offices in the future or occasionally commute to one our offices for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events.
We’re proud to offer you flexibility, so candidates will be considered who live near any of Synchrony locations: Chicago, IL, Alpharetta, GA, Altamonte Springs, FL, Bentonville, AR, Boise, ID, Canton, OH, Charlotte, NC, Costa Mesa, CA, Draper, UT, Kettering, OH, Marlborough ,MA, Merriam, KS, New York, NY, Phoenix, AZ, San Francisco, CA, Stamford, CT or St. Paul, MN.
Essential Responsibilities:
Responsible for paid search campaign planning, development, execution, optimization and forecast in collaboration with Paid Search Strategists
Work directly with business teams on initial campaign planning as well as weekly performance review and serve as the client lead
Present SEM capability, case studies and learnings to client teams and internally within Performance Marketing
Oversee keyword research/analysis, copy development, bid strategy and budget allocation
Collaborate with other channel leads (programmatic, social, SEO, etc.) on cross channel integration and strategy
Identify opportunity for automation leveraging internal/external tools
Collaborate with analytics on measurement, tagging and reporting
Manage external partner relationship and always be on the lookout for new SEM tactics/offers
Provide training to Paid Search Strategists as needed
Perform other duties and/or special projects as assigned
Qualifications/Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree or in lieu of degree, high school diploma/GED and 7+ Years Marketing Experience
4+ years of hands-on experience managing paid search campaigns from planning and execution to optimization and reporting
Experienced in training and managing junior team members
Demonstrated strength in analytical skills and analytical thinking; proficient in excel and PPT
Understanding overall digital media landscape. Hands on experience in other paid media channels (i.e., social, programmatic) is a plus
Desired Characteristics:
Experience working on both B2C and B2B campaigns; experience working in financial category is a plus
Proficient in the technical build of everything paid search as well as all Google Ads tactics (RLSA, Customer Match, Discovery Ads, GDA, Gmail, etc.)
Advanced level using platforms such as Google Ads, Bing Ads, SA360 (Preferred), and experience working in Google Marketing Platform (CM, SA360, DV360, GA360)
Excellent team skills; flexibility to pivot with strategy, regulatory and market evolution
Proven collaborative skill sets, experience developing plans and consistently meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Creative and resourceful; proven ability to problem solve and look for new ideas
Strong project management and communication skills; detail-oriented and organized
Comfortable presenting to senior client team stakeholders
Agency experience preferred
Eligibility Requirements:
You must be 18 years or older
You must have a high school diploma or equivalent
You must be willing to take a drug test, submit to a background investigation and submit fingerprints as part of the onboarding process
You must be able to satisfy the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
New hires (Level 4-7) must have 9 months of continuous service with the company before they are eligible to post on other roles. Once this new hire time in position requirement is met, the associate will have a minimum 6 months’ time in position before they can post for future non-exempt roles. Employees, level 8 or greater, must have at least 24 months’ time in position before they can post. All internal employees must have at least a “consistently meets expectations” performance rating and have approval from your manager to post (or the approval of your manager and HR if you don’t meet the time in position or performance requirement).
Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Job Details
About the Company:

Salesforce.com is the global leader in customer relationship management (CRM) software. We pioneered the shift to cloud computing, and today we're delivering the next generation of social, mobile and cloud technologies that help companies revolutionize the way they sell, service, market and innovate-and become customer companies. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For. Our "more human, less corporate" culture is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team and celebrating success Aloha-style. Ready to join the #SalesforceOhana?


About the Position:

The Sales Strategy & Operations Analyst 6 will play a crucial role in supporting the Global Public Sector Business Unit, the fastest growing business unit at Salesforce. This role is a hybrid of traditional jobs in strategic planning, sales operations, finance, and analysis - requiring a mix of market analysis, sales optimization and business operational support.

Success in this role means assisting the appropriate sales group or business partner to drive the continued success of Salesforce by supporting our sales growth strategy. Sample projects range from the strategic to the very operational including evaluating market opportunities, supporting the creation of product growth strategies, business planning, market segmentation, sales pipeline and forecast analysis, annual operating plans and regular review of key performance metrics.

Deliverables include detailed analytic models, custom performance analysis, building a scalable reporting infrastructure, and packaging findings into presentation-ready content for Salesforce executives. The role requires interaction with various areas of the organization and provides exposure to senior executives.

The successful candidate will have relentless curiosity and possess a passion for creating innovative analysis to identify opportunities. Moreover, this person will excel at extracting insights from data and converting ideas to action.


Responsibilities:
Ongoing analysis of business performance to support daily operations
Aid in managing business unit related day-to-day operations
Assist in developing and delivering presentations for senior executives
Analyze health of the business and interpret key performance indicators and performance metrics
Support strategic initiatives including fixing weak business areas and identifying areas of opportunity
Prepare analysis and recommendations for strategic decision making
Assist in development of Business Unit GTM Strategy
Design the sales coverage model for the Public Sector Business Unit

Desired Skills/Experience:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited university
2-5 years of experience in management consulting, finance or program management
1-2 years supporting government/Public Sector business a plus
Valuable work experience focused on quantitative analysis, Excel, and logical reasoning
Experience using Salesforce Sales Cloud
Experience using SQL a plus
Self-starter and high degree of motivation to go above and beyond the task at hand
Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, develop solutions
Strong presentation skills, especially related to building compelling PowerPoint presentations
Strong communication and interpersonal skills – both written and verbal
Experience with Tableau, and/or Business Objects (or similar analytical packages) a plus
Security clearance a plus
Work Location
National United States
In Person or Remote allowed

Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
Synchrony is continuing to build a best in class Performance Media and Creative Agency committed to driving results with our retail and payments partners while also delivering leading customer experiences. Within this agency, our Earned Media Team is focused on growth and engagement by identifying and seizing opportunities within Social, SEO and Content. We are seeking an AVP, Search Engine Optimization to deliver consumer research and own all SEO reporting. This role will coordinate with internal stakeholders, aiding in the development of monthly reporting, case studies and quarterly business reviews.
This position is currently remote, where you’ll be work from home, but may be required to work in one of our offices in the future or occasionally commute to one our offices for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events.
We’re proud to offer you flexibility, so candidates will be considered who live near any of Synchrony locations: Chicago, IL, Alpharetta, GA, Altamonte Springs, FL, Bentonville, AR, Boise, ID, Canton, OH, Charlotte, NC, Costa Mesa, CA, Draper, UT, Kettering, OH, Marlborough ,MA, Merriam, KS, New York, NY, Phoenix, AZ, San Francisco, CA, Stamford, CT or St. Paul, MN.

Responsible for the creation of dashboards or various tools needed in accomplishing requested analyses, including visualization tools and managing 3rd party data integration into those dashboards

Bachelor’s degree or, in lieu of degree, a high school diploma/GED and 7+ years of marketing or agency experience focused on analytics and digital marketing
4+ years of analytics experience forecasting, reporting and performance modelling on marketing campaigns across multiple channels (web, search, display, social media, email, etc.)
2+ years of digital marketing experience; preferably with SEO
Experience working with tools like Tableau, Microsoft BI, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Big Query and Google Search Console.
Working knowledge of API with the ability to help troubleshoot integration issues
Desired Characteristics:
Proven experience communicating with and presenting to clients/stakeholders
Strong data visualization skills and tool experience; ability to tell a clear story with data
Experience building dashboards and analytical or process tools for digital marketing stakeholders
Experience with or directing resources on using ETLs or using either Python or R for statistical analysis and data science
Experience building governing data management processes including integration setup, QA and ongoing analysis of data
1+ years’ experience with cross-channel journey planning and eCommerce strategy
1+ years’ experience working with MiniTab, SPSS, SEMRush, BrightEdge, seoClarity or similar tools strongly preferred
Fundamental knowledge of stats particularly on hypothesis testing and regression analysis

In addition to being a tenacious business developer, this position requires excellent communication skills, persistence, and great attention to detail.This a remote / work from home position.Responsibilities: Identify and target potential clientsMake cold calls to potential clientsSend cold emails to prospectsManage and update CRM database on a regular basisCoordinate quarterly email marketing campaignsConduct discovery callsQualifications: Bachelors Degree2 or more years of experience in a; business development, sales, marketing, or admin roleHighly motivated with ability to work independently and meet and or exceed goalsStrong communication skills and attention to detailThrives in a fast-paced, demanding environmentCompensation: Base salary + bonusesTotal compensation up to $80k / yearJob Type: Full-timePay: Up to $80,000.00 per yearBenefits:Paid time offSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplemental Pay:Bonus payEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:sales, marketing, customer support, or admin: 2 years (Preferred)Work Location:One locationThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousPeople-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsDetail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failAutonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little directionCompany's website:https://www.bmimergers.com/Work Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

This position will support our partnership with Northwestern University. Multiple, weekly campus visits are required (Downtown Chicago campus)

Anticipated working hours: Monday - Thursday 10:00am - 8:00pm Central Time; Saturdays (2 per month, average of 4 hour work day)

What We're Looking For:

A highly driven and passionate Student Success Manager to oversee all day-to-day activities and operations related to your assigned cohorts, classes, and/or market(s). Including oversight of instructional staff, and operations including classroom experience, learner outcomes, and cultivating a network within the University and the company sponsoring the program. We are looking for someone who can balance the administrative needs of the job with the relational dynamics of learner support. The goal is to keep learners & instructors SUPPORTED & ensure they're successful.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To:

Create a classroom experience that energizes learners and keeps them engaged.
Utilize data in SalesForce and other reporting tools to assess classroom satisfaction and provide feedback and solutions.
Manage classroom reservations, instructional staff, and operational logistics.
Assist learners in pursuing new career opportunities, work with Career Services to help learners become employer competitive
Develop positive working relationships with University contacts, working closely with University Relations to develop and grow the program.
Deliver outstanding events, work with the Industry Engagement Team to co-host in-person Demo Days and Virtual Tech Talks
Communicate system or process changes within the company and new approaches to student support and classroom management.

The Student Success Manager owns these metrics in the following ways:

Student Experience – The best marketing will always be referrals from our Alumni network. Our goal is to create a transformative learning experience that learners will always fondly remember. The Boot Camp is by its nature an extremely challenging program. You will create "magic moments" within the program that celebrates your learners' success along the way.

Instructional Management - You'll be responsible for managing instructional staff. Your ability to empower these individuals to own their classroom, create a dynamic learning environment, engage in meaningful connections with learners and skillfully present complex curriculum will undoubtedly contribute positively to the Learner Experience. You will provide weekly feedback from student surveys to guide the classroom experience.

Program Completion – It is up to the Student Success Manager to ensure our learners are supported and meeting the required metrics to complete the program successfully.

Things That Should Be In Your Background:

You have worked in a capacity where motivating others was essential to your success
You understand the importance of deadlines and streamlined communication
You have managed staff before
You know what makes a dynamic classroom learning environment
You have experience in making difficult decisions, tackling problems head-on, and can articulate lessons learned
You have a track record of delivering excellent customer/student satisfaction
You have successfully worked with a wide variety of individuals from diverse backgrounds
You have excellent communication skills and experience in being the main point of contact or representative for a brand
You can operate independently in a remote environment and cultivate strong relationships in a primarily remote capacity
You have been a part of a growing environment and are comfortable with evolving roles and responsibilities

Other Attributes That Will Help You In This Role:

This role is not required to report into a central Trilogy office, as it is important that all SSMs are physically present at their designated University to interact with their students and their University partners. Frequent interaction and collaboration with co-workers across the world at our other offices and University locations are built into our company ethos.
Full-Time Boot Camp programs run during business hours Monday-Friday. Part-Time Boot Camp courses run during the evenings Monday-Thursday and weekends. Office hours are held before and after classes. With the SSM's role focused both on student support and administrative follow up, hours of the SSM role are flexible, however, you will be expected to spread your working time over business hours, evenings, and during class every other weekend or as needed.

About 2U Inc. (NASDAQ: TWOU)

2U is comprised of 3 lines of business: Graduate Degree Programs, Short Course, and Boot Camps. Going beyond traditional learning management systems, we use tech, people, and data to help top universities and enterprise organizations transform in the digital era—and eliminate the back row in higher ed. We support lifelong learning which means thinking beyond a single degree. It means finding ways for students to gain the skills they need to change careers, evolve their expertise, and meet the challenges of the changing world head-on. We help our partners fill those needs—developing new digital education technologies and offerings capable of supporting students at different points in their lives. Whether they need a simple refresher, to learn something new, or to change their career trajectories completely, our partners are there to help them succeed. Together with our partners, 2U has positively transformed the lives of more than 275,000 students and lifelong learners.

2U Diversity and Inclusion Statement

At 2U, we are committed to creating and sustaining a culture that embodies diverse walks of life, ideas, genders, ages, races, cultures, sexual orientations, abilities and other unique qualities of our employees. We strive to offer a workplace where every employee feels empowered by the ways in which we are different, as well as the ways in which we are the same.

Benefits & Culture

Working at 2U means working with individuals that are passionate and mission driven. We collaborate on tough problems to deliver the best outcomes for our partners, students, and each other. You will find team members working together in our open office spaces, gathered in the kitchen grabbing a snack, or taking a break in our game rooms.

2U offers a comprehensive benefits package:
Medical, dental, and vision coverage
Life insurance, disability and 401(k)
Unlimited snacks and drinks
Tuition reimbursement program
Generous paid leave policies including unlimited PTO
Additional time off benefits include: volunteer days, parental leave, and a company-wide winter break from Christmas through New Years!

To learn more, visit 2U.com. #NoBackRow

Note: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

2U is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against applicants or employees and ensures equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of their race, creed, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, age, marital status, disability, citizenship, military or veterans' status, or any other classifications protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. 2U's equal opportunity policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, job benefits, pay and dismissal.

It’s an exciting time at Bright Horizons as we rebuild our talent acquisition function and expand our team! We seek an experienced Talent Acquisition Sourcer based in the Chicago market to join our team. Apply today to Bright Horizons, honored 19 times as one of FORTUNE’s “100 Best Companies to Work For!” This is a work from home position with minimal local travel necessary in the future.
As a talent sourcer, you will work in partnership with talent acquisition partners to develop, implement, and deliver creative, comprehensive, and strategic sourcing strategies to identify high-quality, diverse candidates for key positions across the organization. You will apply well-developed sourcing skills to find passive candidates and talent pools using a wide range of traditional and non-traditional techniques, including: competitive intelligence and research, social media, internet mining, industry events, market analysis, and knowing and networking with local partners in the territory you support. Acting as a subject matter expert in the field of Talent Acquisition, you will find the best talent that will support the growth and success of the business.
Major functions and Responsibilities include:
Define, design, and help implement the sourcing strategy for building talent pools of specific candidate profiles
Ensure the development and optimization of broad range sourcing channels that will improve the quantity and quality of Bright Horizons’ talent pools
Utilize Talent Pools to match candidate profiles to relevant roles, and may represent candidate needs to talent acquisition partners and hiring teams
Maintain a strong understanding of the external talent landscape through market research and competitive intelligence gathering; educates recruiters and business leaders accordingly to achieve optimal results
Ensure effective candidate relationship management strategies are developed and utilized to build strong relationships with the passive candidate community
Develop and drive strategies to build deep and diverse talent pipelines including managing the applicant experience
Assist recruiters to clearly execute on the employee value proposition and incorporate this into the sourcing strategy framework
Measure and monitor the effectiveness of the strategic sourcing framework against predefined outcomes
Present creative solutions to enhance results
Engage in timely and appropriate communications with all internal stakeholders and candidates
Ensure all searches and engagement strategies comply with Bright Horizons policies and procedures and with employment laws and regulations
Experience and education requirements include:
Associate degree required, bachelor’s degree preferred
Talent sourcing experience in a high volume dispersed model or search firm environment – a minimum of 3 years
Technology experience with applicant tracking systems, CRMs, and relevant social platforms – a minimum of 3 years
2+ years of experience developing and executing sourcing methodologies to include: market mapping, recruitment strategies, and Boolean searches
Experience leveraging a variety of sourcing avenues, including social recruiting channels and technologies, events and campaigns
Experience acting as a talent sourcing advisor through leveraging data, consulting and influencing skills, and application of business knowledge
Ability to present creative solutions and deliver against results
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word)
Outstanding customer service skills and ability to communicate the culture and philosophy of Bright Horizons to internal and external customers
Candidates must reside in one of these locations, Chicago, IL, for this remote position
Candidates must pass company background checks
