Job Description
About Conferences i/o
At Conferences i/o our mission is to make continuing professional education more effective and less BORING by building technology that keeps attendees engaged during presentations, trainings, and conferences. Through features such as polling, Social Q&A, and Session Evaluations, attendees learn more and have fun at the same time. Our technology has been used by millions of attendees across tens of thousands of events around the world.
About the role
We are looking for someone experienced in providing technical support for software services to lead our team’s customer support efforts. This is an important role for Conferences i/o because our customer support is second to none in the live audience engagement space — we go above and beyond to help our customers put on exceptional events.
This position will be remote (work from home), but we require a candidate to be located in the United States. The company operates on US Eastern Time, so West Coast candidates will be considered but must be available during standard US Eastern work hours.
What will you be doing?
Achieve full mastery of our product quickly. Become the subject matter expert and understand common use cases of the software.
As the main customer contact, you’ll lead our customer help desk, which means that you will:
Help our customers when they have questions about the software and resolve issues, primarily via email (we use Freshdesk), sometimes via phone or via a virtual screen share.
Resolve issues in real-time while customers are using product during live virtual events
Maintain our knowledge base which is stockpiled with solutions and helpful information for customers. Update our existing resources and create new ones.
Develop and implement a strategy for improving our customer support capabilities.
What are we looking for?
Friendly, outgoing personality even under pressure to fix an issue quickly.
Outstanding communication skills — both verbal and written — to break down the technical support issues into easy steps for our customers.
Highly organized.
A problem-solving mentality to think of creative solutions.
A passion for building relationships and making customers happy.
Tech-savvy and the ability to master the knowledge of the product quickly
Prior experience in a full-time remote work position.
2+ years of experience in a SaaS customer support role
Experience in the continuing professional education, learning & development, or event technology spaces are not required but are a big plus.
Compensation & benefits
At Conferences i/o, we love our team and we are always looking for ways to reward outstanding performance. Our compensation is competitive and based on skills and experience. We don't have a dress code, and want you to bring your whole self to work. And you'll have plenty of work flexibility, including opportunities to work from home (or wherever you work from) as long as you get the job done.
Competitive salary
Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage
Other Benefits - Identity theft protection, ST / LT Disability, Life insurance
401(k) with company match
Other perks like personal wellness and education allowances, company retreats, etc.
Conferences i/o is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
We require all candidates that receive and accept employment offers to complete a background check before being hired.

Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

The TalentSprout Learning Design and Development team is comprised of instructional designers, media developers, learning technologists, and trainers. We are a very creative and collaborative group, dedicated to developing engaging online training for our learners.

The Contract Instructional Designer will work closely with business clients, project stakeholders, and subject matter experts throughout each phase of the project. He/she will design and develop custom training materials for blended learning solutions—typically facilitator-led synchronous and asynchronous distance learning for delivery to a 100% work-at-home audience.


This position will require a strong background in learning design and development and comprehensive knowledge of adult learning theory. Aptitude for authoring and developing content as well as creative script writing and storyboarding is essential. This role requires an individual who can work collaboratively as part of a design team.


The Contract Instructional Designer will:

Design, develop, revise, or document custom training materials
Author design documents, media scripts, simulations, facilitation guides and asynchronous course materials as well as manage the development of their own projects.
Interview subject matter experts to collect necessary data, raw content and custom information necessary to define desired learning outcomes.
Research and apply best practices and approaches of presenting and delivering training materials to adult learners.
Demonstrate an understanding of clients’ needs and available budget and timeline to design and build memorable and engaging training solutions.
Design courseware that enables the student to achieve the learning outcomes, including appropriate assessment of student achievement mapped to learning outcomes and Bloom’s taxonomy.
Communicate and collaborate frequently and effectively with various project collaborators, team members, SMEs, consultants, and other stakeholders to ensure that objectives are being met.
Work with the appropriate team members to ensure that the technologies and delivery environment support the curriculum being developed.
Ensure overall project quality by creating learning solutions that achieve business results, and by building and maintaining good rapport with external and internal clients while effectively consulting and managing the project.


The candidate will ideally have:

A solid background in learning design and development and adult learning theory - we value our learners greatly and focus on developing training in a way that will benefit our learners and empower them to do their job well.
Excellent writing skills – to write clear, well-organized, engaging training materials, and to develop creative media scripts and storyboards.
Communication and collaboration skills - to work well as part of a design team, with subject matter experts, and with other project stakeholders.
Strong comprehension skills – this role may develop training for a variety of topics (systems training, customer service, tech support, etc.) so the candidate must be able to learn, understand, and prioritize new material, and then figure out how best to teach it to our learners.
Creativity - to come up with interesting and engaging ways to present content, to develop learning activities that are relevant and meaningful, and to come up with ideas for animations, interactives, or simulations.
Organizational skills – to effectively manage projects and content.
1-3 years of experience working in instructional design or a related field.
Bachelors degree required, masters degree or equivalent experience preferred
To apply, please email something awesome to careers@talentsprout.com

Welcome to the new standard of healthcare! Premise Health is the world’s leading healthcare access provider. We deliver purpose-driven career experiences in a culture-centric work environment—ensuring that employees at the nation's best companies get, stay, and be well. In a changing healthcare environment, we know there's a better way for organizations to help their people live healthier lives by delivering the right care at the right time, right where they work.

Partnered with visionary organizations around the globe, we offer a broad range of healthcare services and deliver an effortless patient experience that raises the bar, lowers costs, and redefines the meaning of quality care. By shifting the conversation from cost to return and from treatment to prevention, we are committed to help people, their families, and the organizations they work for be at their best. We are looking for a Strategic Advisory Associate to work remotely in support of our clients across the US. If you possess a “whatever it takes attitude” keep reading.

It’s hard to pinpoint a “typical” day here (and who wants typical anyway?), but as the Strategic Advisory Associate you are responsible for assisting in driving strategic initiatives with clients to meet their healthcare objectives. What You’ll Do for Us: Partner with Premise Operations and Business Development teams to lead strategic dialogue with clients in order to help meet client’s broad healthcare objectives Understand and advise clients on key strategic and innovative movements within the broad healthcare sector and provide perspective on how such actions could impact self-insured employer segment and specific client(s) Ability to respond to client needs through a deep understanding of key stakeholder objectives the development of creative solutions that effectively meets respective client needs through tangible growth opportunities Support the Strategic Advisory team in developing compelling content/intellectual capital that positions Premise Health as thought leader within healthcare innovation Understand current and emerging Premise product offerings and be able to clearly articulate value proposition with a focus on existing clients Support the development and operating model of newly created Strategic Advisory Group functional team in order to ensure that team is designed to maximize client strategic value and Premise impact Education: BA/BS required Experience: 3-5+ years of related experience with demonstrated career progression and increasing levels of responsibility Knowledge and Skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Previous management consulting experience advising clients on strategic initiatives Broad healthcare sector knowledge understanding around payer, provider, and employer segments, including knowledge of emerging/disruptive companies Ability to create and maintain strong internal and external relationships Ability to navigate comprehensive internal resources to connect the appropriate resources and products to achieve desired results What We’ll Do for You: At Premise Health, you’re not an employee – you’re a team member. We have health centers, pharmacies, fitness centers and offices scattered across the country, but we’re all working together to deliver exemplary and delightful service to our clients, their employees and family members. We’re proud of the culture we’ve built, and we aim to assist our team members in living their best life – in and out of the workplace.

That’s why you’ll find us taking a yoga class together or starting a book club. We know that we can only help people get, stay, and be well if we do the same for ourselves. We’re also not afraid to share what we’re up to – check out some of our smiling faces. As an employer, we want to compensate you for the work you do with more than a paycheck (although you’ll get one of those too).

Premise Health offers competitive benefits packages including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k), paid holidays and vacation time, and a company-sponsored wellness program. We are an equal opportunity employer of nice people and value inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Who We Are:

Welcome to arrivia. We specialize in making brands better through the power of travel. With more than 55 years of combined experience, we're a merger of three powerhouse brands (in case you've heard of us in the travel industry) combining ICE, SOR Technology and WMPH Vacations. With offices on both coasts of the US and around the world, we embrace diversity and a passion for travel across our global staff.

We're focused on building a customer-first culture, fueled by the best travel experiences for all our members at every point in their journey. Grow with us, as we continue our path to deliver innovative solutions and take charge of change. The adventure is only beginning. We're on a mission to help people around the world travel better and experience more. Our team members bring world-class skills to the table to create extraordinary memories for our partners and members.

Ad Hoc is a digital services company that helps the federal government better serve people. Our team of experts from across commercial industry and government brings the modern skills necessary to help agencies transform public services into digital services. Our work enables agencies to meet the needs of their users while closing the gap between consumer expectations and government.

The Candidate Care Coordinator works closely with the recruitment team to ensure candidates are receiving timely and appropriate communications with our team. This position serves as a liaison between recruiters, hiring managers, and candidates with a goal of expediting the recruitment process.


Requirements

All work must be conducted within the U.S.
As a contractor to the federal government, all hires may be required to complete additional background screenings at the time of hire or any time thereafter as requested.


What You'll Do

Acts as point of contact for candidates throughout the full lifecycle of the recruiting process
Acts as liaison between recruiters, hiring managers, and candidates
Evaluates and screens resumes and cover letters
Ensures transparency to candidates through the recruitment process
Builds strong relationships with candidates, recruiters, and hiring managers
Demonstrates knowledge of Human Resources best practices
Manages new hire offers and onboarding documentation
Conducts weekly 1:1 meetings with recruiters to consistently improve the candidate experience
Takes part in weekly stand-up meetings with hiring teams
Works closely with the engineers grading homework in the people app to ensure timely grading of homework and resolve any issues
Maintains ownership and accountability of assigned deadlines.
Ensures timely response to any inquiries in the recruitment@adhoc email
Conducts introduction calls to referrals and qualified candidates to level-set expectations
Maintains a high level of positive Glassdoor feedback by continuing to build strong relationships with candidates and employees.
Serves as backup for scheduling needs


This is a contract position and as such does not include benefits


Ad Hoc LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Neptune Retail Solutions is seeking a Program/Sales Coordinator to join our team. As a Program/Sales Coordinator, you will be supporting our sales team from a home/remote office. You will play an important role in ensuring all program/campaign executions are successful, keeping things organized, providing customer service to our clients, and contributing to the overall success of the team through effective communication, relationship building, and account management. This is a remote, work from home position but must be in the Central Standard time zone.
Responsibilities include:
Coordination of in-store and digital programs/campaigns in regards to advertising execution materials once the client has approved a sales contract.
Act as a liaison between clients and internal departments.
Generate and manage program timing in accordance to standard timing deadlines.
Collect and present internal executional data to the sales teams as part of presentation preparation. For example, collecting program restrictions such as available tactics and store counts.
Reviews finance system generated invoices for accuracy based on nonstandard payment terms and contract accuracy. Follow up with clients to ensure invoices are received and payments are submitted to the company by the due date. Escalates all past due invoices to Account Directors.
Proactively schedules calls with the sales team and clients to ensure implementation/materials are in order to maximize the success/program completion. For example, working with the client to kick off program details such as providing artwork specifications, store lists, and time lines of all due dates.
Requirements:
Experience in a coordination/account management role supporting multiple sales professionals in a team environment preferred
Very strong attention to detail and extremely organized.
Ability to manage competing deadlines and priorities.
Proficient in Office (Excel/Word/PPT), Salesforce experience is an asset.
Ability to multitask and work in a fast pace environment.
Strong interpersonal and professional skills.
Ability to work independently and to adapt in a continuously changing environment.

Neptune Retail Solutions is the nation’s premier retail marketing services company. We are experts at influencing buying behaviors through our disruptive, innovative, and results-oriented solutions, including in-store, home-delivered, and online media tactics combined with rich data and insights. Our powerful advertising and promotion programs are relied upon by the country’s largest consumer packaged goods manufacturers for an unparalleled consumer reach.
Neptune Retail Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities.

eXp Realty is one of the fastest growing real estate brands in North America, with thousands of agents operating across the United States, Canada and around the world. As a full-service real estate brokerage, eXp Realty provides 24/7 access to collaborative tools, training and socialization for real estate brokers and agents through its 3-D, fully-immersive, cloud office environment.
eXp Realty attracts the most talented people from all fields. Whether you're a real estate professional, engineer, marketer, accountant or in another field, you'll be challenged and inspired every day. Join us on this incredible journey!
We are fully remote!
Major Duties & Responsibilities:
Manage and maintain executive schedules, including scheduling/searching/booking travel and conferences, making appointments, and making changes to appointments.
Answering and directing calls to appropriate executives and parties, taking messages.
Greeting visitors in our cloud environment and determining access to appropriate parties.
Opening, sorting, and distributing correspondence, including email, Facebook, and Voxer.
Reading and analyzing submissions, letters, agendas, memos and route to appropriate personnel in a timely and efficient manner.
Prepare reports, collect and analyze information; prepare presentations.
Attend professional and technical educational seminars and workshops; review publications; establish professional and personal networks within the industry.
Prepare executive responses to routine memos, letters, or correspondence.
Provide clerical and general office support to other offices.
Delegate tasks and responsibilities to other staff members when appropriate
Knowledge and Skills Requirements:
Education:
BA/BS in business administration or related field strongly preferred
High School Diploma/GED required
Required Experience and Skills:
5+ years of experience in executive level support required.
Experience in the real estate industry strongly preferred.
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
Experience in coordinate travel.
Budgeting and expense report coordination experience required.
Experience in providing excellent customer service including conflict resolution required.
Advanced Microsoft Office experience and/or Google Suite required
eXp World Holdings is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability or any other characteristic protected by law.

JobTitle: Sales Rep. for Outsourcing Service Provider
Text: Company Name:  Remote OwlWebsite:  www.remoteowls.comLocation:  Cairo, EgyptAbout Us: We have been around Since 2018, we are located in Cairo, Egypt.We have essentially been working with small to mid-size real estate businesses in USA Providing a variety of different services.And currently, we have about 80 Clients and have a staff of 320 Employees, a steady funnel of new Clients & Fresh Applicants Ready to JoinBut as of now, we are looking to expand our portfolio and branch out to different Industries. Because Prior to finding our success in The real-estate field we have worked in more than one industry such as Customer Service and Medical BillingAnd now what we are looking forward to Building a path for us to come back to Projects That we are not just good at executing but actually projects we are passionate about.That is our strongest Suit and that is why we started this opportunity.We are looking for someone that can see the value Proposition and see the extent of our expertise and services and Pitch for us. Help us get our foot in the door where we can have a Conversation with Prospects because we can Provide Corporate Level Services at less than the minimum wage Rate.but at this point, it’s a matter of Would this be something you are interested to be a part of?Job Description: You will be responsible for full lifecycle sales efforts, from Identifying potential clients to the initial call through contract execution. This role requires a background in the Healthcare industry and Revenue Cycle Management or B2B Sales.We are looking for someone with industry knowledge, strong communication skills, excellent problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to start, develop, and nurture relationships.Technical acumen is essential to the success of this role. This role can be located anywhere in the United States.Having a pre-existing and established network in the Healthcare industry is a BIG PLUS.Payout Structure: This is commission-based pay.Per client, you will receive a cut of the profit (after expenses) on monthly basis as long as the client’s account is active.After successfully signing the first 5 clients you receive an extra bonus of $2000.Afterward a $3000 bonus for every 10 clients.*This is would be a contract-based job*Key Strategic Objectives: Generate leads through professional networking and cold calling techniquesInitiate and build prospect relationshipsAbility to understand unique prospect needs within the context of the healthcare industry and effectively communicate the value propositionCoordinate and schedule online and onsite meetings of key decision-makers (If need be)Develop prospect account strategy and planTrack record demonstrating strong “closing” skills and revenue growthMonitor customer, market, and competitor activity and provide feedback to the company leadership team and other company functionsManage key customer relationships and participate in closing strategic opportunitiesTravel for in-person meetings with customers and partners and to develop key relationships (If need be)Experience Requirements: 1+ year B2B sales experience; proven ability to identify and develop new business with prospects and existing accounts, build/maintain relationships with the decision-makersExperience in selling platforms and services.Demonstrated record of success at both large, complex organizations and in mid-sized environments is a plus.Part-time hours: 20-40 per weekJob Types: Full-time, Part-time, CommissionSalary: From $2,000.00 per monthWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Solution Consultant, Professional Services Automation
Los Angeles, CA

We will also consider candidates located remotely in the United States
WHO WE ARE
FinancialForce delivers the #1 professional services automation (PSA) and the only customer-centric ERP solution. We accelerate business value with comprehensive best practices and the most intelligent analytics—all on the leading business cloud platform from Salesforce.
FinancialForce knows that each individual brings something special to the team, exemplifying a diverse and inclusive work environment. We embrace your authenticity and encourage our employees to “Bring Yourself” to work every day!
THE ROLE

We are currently recruiting a highly motivated, enthusiastic Solution Consultant with strong consulting and Professional Services Automation systems implementation skills. This individual will be performing in the implementation of the FinancialForce PSA application in customer environments. Occasional travel within the region should be expected. A background in Professional Services Automation or Project Management software applications and solutions is required.

WHAT YOU WILL DO IN THIS ROLE
Perform key components of remote implementations of the FinancialForce PSA application. Components may include requirements discussion, solution configuration, deployment, data migration, knowledge transfer and general support.
Manage relationships with customers to ensure their satisfaction.
Presenting the FinancialForce PSA application via Web conference tools.
Understand client’s business process requirements and assist project team in translating those requirements into functional specifications for custom development and functional extension.
Assist with the implementation of complementary 3rd party applications as part of overall FinancialForce PSA implementation projects.
WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE
4+ years’ experience in mid-market or enterprise Professional Services Automation system implementations or Project Management system implementations.
Demonstrable experience of professional services processes and applications.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work in fast changing, team environment
Strong computer skills ideally including Salesforce.com, MS Office and web presentation tools
4-year University degree required
Of course, we look for talent and fit more than anything else. JobTitle: Business Consultant - Feed and Food market
Text: As a Business Consultant, you will be responsible for Adifo’s BESTMIX® customers in the US, coordinating and implementing all BESTMIX® projects. As the “project owner”, you will act as a mediator between the customer and the Adifo company departments accordingly (sales, development, helpdesk, installation, administration).Depending on your location, you can work from a home or flex office.Your responsibilities as Business Consultant US: · Coordinate and implement BESTMIX® projects.· Analyze the customers’ needs and convert them into an optimal solution within the BESTMIX® program.· Train end users.· Work in close collaboration with the sales department and give technical support during commercial activities.· Install BESTMIX® software.· Set-up interfaces with other software programs.· Adjust reports.Your profile as Business Consultant US: · An education equivalent to advanced scientific studies, preferably in bio and/or agriculture (e.g. Bio-engineer).· Working knowledge of computers and IT (knowledge of Windows, MS SQL, networks, reporting tools is a plus)· You speak English fluently· Good communication skills (both verbal and written) and adept at utilizing these skills within all levels of the company as well as externally.· Willing to travel (+/- 50%), either by car or by plane, including overnight stays, as business requires. Possess a valid driver’s license and maintain a good driving record.· The ability to work as an effective team member.· The ability to provide outstanding customer service to all customers, employees, associates and management staff, showing a sense of urgency relative to solving problems, performing assigned tasks, customer concerns, etc.· The ability to effectively organize work schedules and manage multiple assignments by utilizing time management skills to ensure that projects are completed within agreed upon timelines.Our offer: · A challenging job with an interesting diversity of tasks and responsibilities· An international work environment· A world renowned, technologically innovative product· An open and value-driven company culture· Personal coaching and training· Competitive salary· Paid vacation / floating holidays / company holidaysDo you recognize yourself in this profile? Don’t hesitate and apply right now!About Adifo: Adifo stands for innovation, reliability, passion, know-how and a drive for results. Based on these corporate values, Adifo has been adding value to the several nutritional industries for over 45 years. At Adifo, that became part of the Info Support International Group in 2017, you join an international team of more than 140 committed employees. Through our employees’ collected knowledge and dedication, Adifo continuously creates modern solutions that offer assistance in every step of the formulation and production process of food and feed products. Adifo’s ERP software MILAS® and formulation software BESTMIX® are well-known names in our sector.Starting or continuing your career at Adifo means developing all your talents, even those unknown to you. We appreciate any sector knowledge, but we predominantly count on your ability to function in team and your openness to work with other cultures. With more than 500 clients in over 60 countries you become partly responsible for the global food supply of both humans and animals.At Adifo, value is created by the staff. That is why flexibility and the well-being of employees are focus points in Adifo’s corporate culture. Do you still have any questions or do you want to know more about us? Don’t hesitate and contact us straight away or visit www.adifo.com.Job Type: Full-timeWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetings

Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty's (AGCS) Liability Insurance teams provide coverage tailored to the customer’s needs. We serve a diverse client list, which includes pharmaceutical manufacturers, construction companies, power and utility companies, automotive manufacturers, and specialized SMEs and mid-corporate businesses.

We offer a wide range of general and specialist liability insurance solutions, covering personal or bodily injury, property damage and (pure) financial loss. These can be provided through individual primary policies, excess layers and umbrella policies, or global insurance solutions for multiple risks in multiple locations.

As an intern, you will work in a virtual environment and gain real employee experience from a top Insurance organization. We place a high value on our interns and involve them in real work with a real business impact, making our internships in a class of their own. The intern will participate with and contribute to the Liability underwriting teams. The internship program is designed to provide the intern with an opportunity to apply a macro understanding of risk in the real world by working side-by-side with our underwriting and operational support team professionals. Interns will participate in a wide range of learning and development opportunities including job shadows, attendance at internal meetings, speaking engagements and events designed to expose the intern to other areas of AGCS.
Underwriting
Identification and analysis of new technological developments through the lens of insurance and risk. Processing transactions on (LoBs) underwriting; may include quotations, new business issuance, policy changes & renewals
Special Projects
Will collaborate on a proof of concept for a new product offering
Will be given other projects that can be completed within the length of the internship
On the Job Learning
Participate in a wide range of learning and development activities focused on immersing the intern into how insurance works and being able to apply a macro understanding of technology and technological developments in the real world by working side by side with underwriting, claims and support team professionals
Allianz is the home for those who dare – a supportive place where you can take the initiative to grow and to actively strengthen our global leadership position. By truly caring about people – both its 100 million private and corporate customers and more than 147,000 employees – Allianz fosters a culture where its employees are empowered to collaborate, perform, embrace trends and challenge the industry. Our main ambition is to be our customers’ trusted partner, instilling them with the confidence to grow. If you dare, join us at Allianz Group.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

 Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty (AGCS) is a leading global corporate insurance carrier and a key business unit of Allianz Group. We provide risk consultancy, Property-Casualty insurance solutions and alternative risk transfer for a wide spectrum of commercial, corporate and specialty risks across 10 dedicated lines of business.
Our customers are as diverse as business can be, ranging from Fortune Global 500 companies to small businesses, and private individuals. Among them are not only the world’s largest consumer brands, tech companies and the global aviation and shipping industry, but also wineries, satellite operators or Hollywood film productions. They all look to AGCS for smart answers to their largest and most complex risks in a dynamic, multinational business environment and trust us to deliver an outstanding claims experience.

 Worldwide, AGCS operates with its own teams in 32 countries and through the Allianz Group network and partners in over 200 countries and territories, employing over 4,300 people. As one of the largest Property-Casualty units of Allianz Group, we are backed by strong and stable financial ratings. In 2019, AGCS generated a total of €9.1 billion gross premium globally.
For more information, visit www.agcs.allianz.com or follow us on Twitter @AGCS_Insurance and LinkedIn.

Job Description:
Role Summary/Purpose:
Synchrony is continuing to build a best in class Performance Media and Creative Agency committed to driving results with our retail and payments partners while also delivering leading customer experiences. Within this agency, our Earned Media Team is focused on growth and engagement by identifying and seizing opportunities within Social, SEO and Content. We are seeking an AVP, SEO Content optimization to build, deploy and monitor content creation and optimization processes. This role will create guidelines and practices to democratize content optimization and collaborate with business units to build out comprehensive content strategies.
This position is currently remote, where you’ll be work from home, but may be required to work in one of our offices in the future or occasionally commute to one our offices for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events.
We’re proud to offer you flexibility, so candidates will be considered who live near any of Synchrony locations: Chicago, IL, Alpharetta, GA, Altamonte Springs, FL, Bentonville, AR, Boise, ID, Canton, OH, Charlotte, NC, Costa Mesa, CA, Draper, UT, Kettering, OH, Marlborough ,MA, Merriam, KS, New York, NY, Phoenix, AZ, San Francisco, CA, Stamford, CT or St. Paul, MN.
Essential Responsibilities:
Coordinate with marketing platform and performance teams to create and prioritize content and form cohesive content strategies
Conduct research for targeting high-volume keywords to help identify consumer search habits
Prioritize content optimization based on commercial impact, business priorities and organic search opportunity
Participate in internal content approval processes as needed to move projects to completion
Design and monitor content optimization governance models to help scale optimization efforts across organization
Build and lead content optimization trainings which will be used to improve content creation across organization
Assist with the creation, organization and cadence of a Content Council to bring content from different departments closer together
Evaluate competitor content to discover content gaps
Perform other duties and/or special projects as assigned
Qualifications/Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree, or, in lieu of degree, a high school diploma/GED and 8+ years of marketing or agency experience focused on analytics and digital marketing
5+ years of digital marketing experience dealing with written content creation and editing
2+ years of SEO content optimization experience
Experience as a content writer, copywriter, a hands-on content SEO analyst or similar role
Experience using platforms like Ahrefs, SEMrush, seoClarity, BrightEdge or similar SEO tools for keyword and content research; and ability to map that research to specific content recommendations
Excellent communication including writing and editing skills in English
Desired Characteristics:
Client or agency team experience, with exposure to cross-channel journey planning
1+ year exposure to eCommerce strategy, implementation and operations
1+ year or more experience with optimization best practices on video, local search/reviews, mobile experiences
Can highlight examples of leading content brainstorming sessions
Experience working in an Agile or Kanban project management framework
Proven forecasting and performance modeling experience
Experience with coordinating with web development teams
Eligibility Requirements:
You must be 18 years or older
You must have a high school diploma or equivalent
You must be willing to take a drug test, submit to a background investigation and submit fingerprints as part of the onboarding process
You must be able to satisfy the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
New hires (Level 4-7) must have 9 months of continuous service with the company before they are eligible to post on other roles. Once this new hire time in position requirement is met, the associate will have a minimum 6 months’ time in position before they can post for future non-exempt roles. Employees, level 8 or greater, must have at least 24 months’ time in position before they can post. All internal employees must have at least a “consistently meets expectations” performance rating and have approval from your manager to post (or the approval of your manager and HR if you don’t meet the time in position or performance requirement).
Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.
Reasonable Accommodation Notice:
Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.
If you need special accommodations, please call our Career Support Line so that we can discuss your specific situation. We can be reached at 1-866-301-5627. Representatives are available from 8am – 5pm Monday to Friday, Central Standard Time.
The salary range for this position is 70,000.00 - 150,000.00 USD Annual
Salaries are adjusted according to market in CA and Metro NY and some positions are bonus eligible.
Grade/Level: 11

Full Time
Insurance Career Opportunity
Come start a new career in the insurance industry by joining the Patra Team!
Patra is seeking dynamic and innovative individuals who are looking for a career opportunity in the insurance industry. In our training environment, you will learn the fundamentals of personal lines lines, servicing clients and policies as well as earn your state Property & Casualty License at no cost to you. As you gain insurance experience and obtain your license, you will have the opportunity to work from home.

We are looking to find and train great people to join our dynamic company. Patra is among the nation's largest and fastest growing companies in the insurance industry. Patra's training introduces new talented people to our business and help them establish a stable career in the insurance industry.

The Value Proposition
Patra will pay you while you train and learn the business of insurance and servicing clients and policies
Patra will prep and pay for you take the state Property & Casualty Licensing exam including any test materials
Patra's program will require hard work, a great attitude, and a customer service skill set

Candidate Qualifications
High school diploma or equivalent
Knowledge and understanding of computer and office skills
Strong communication both written and verbal
Good customer service skills
Ability to multi-task
Attention to detail, time management, and decision-making skills

Physical Requirements*
Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks
Frequent sitting
Occasionally stand/walk, writing by hand, use of telephone, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh 11-20 pounds
Sort/file paperwork, rarely twist/bend/stoop/squat
Consistent with its obligations under the law, the Patra Corp will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.

WORK STANDARDS
Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Patra colleagues and clients and with external organizations.
Promotes Culture of Respect and Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility, value for safety and respect; communicates concerns; uses and promotes safe respectful behaviors based on training and lessons learned.
Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable Patra Corp policies and procedures.

Job Description:
High Net Worth Service Associate
Fidelity Investments’ Racial Equity & Diversity Pledge
“Fidelity believes in, and is committed to, fair and consistent treatment for every associate and customer, and to creating a safe and respectful environment, in which everyone is treated with kindness, compassion and respect.” Abby Johnson | Chairman & CEO Fidelity Investments Is it time to explore new challenges in your career?
We believe your knowledge and expertise of managed portfolio products helps you gain trust with our clients. We know you will inspire client dedication and engagement to develop long-lasting positive relationships with Fidelity.

We have a new and exciting opportunity for a Remote Licensed Client Management Representative in the Greater Chicago area! The position is fully remote and requires you reside in the Greater Chicago area. We offer virtual interviewing and on boarding, as well as access to our virtual training and support. Full access to work from home capabilities to support our clients remotely.

Join a team that's an industry leader in innovation and invests in you with key product and service offerings, groundbreaking technology, and a world-class investment platform. We empower professional growth, flexibility and support thus enabling long-term success for you and our clients. Your desire to grow and learn within the industry will open the door to a career path full of professional rewards.

As a High Net Worth Representative, you will be an integral part of a fast-paced, team oriented environment that is focused on enhancing relationships with our high net worth clients who have assets of $250,000 to $1 million and therefore a complex service and investment need. In this role, you will help us to increase customer loyalty and drive business development opportunities.

The Team
While every Fidelity location has distinctive regional characteristics, each one embodies the core values that have been instrumental in building our proud past. Putting the customer first, respect, integrity, honesty, innovation and improvement as well as competitiveness are values shared across the organization. These simple but powerful values set us apart from our competition.

The Expertise You Have
Series 7 required
Series 63 or ability to obtain within 90 days
2-3 years of previous financial services experience

The Skills You Bring
Broad based knowledge and understanding of general financial planning concepts
Proven customer service, client support and problem resolution skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to effectively influence others
Robust time management and organizational skills

The Value You Deliver
Engage with customers, via inbound calls, responding to their inquires which may include providing product and service level guidance, processing transactions to include options, equities, mutual funds and fixed income trades and other specialized monetary requests
Deliver efficient and responsive resolution for various client situations. Own the management of the case, research the issue and communicate the solution to the client
Uncover opportunities and identify products and services that will enhance the client’s financial success and partner with the Financial Consultant to further discuss with the client
Collaborate with internal business partners to research and resolve complex client requests
Conduct pro-active outbound calls to communicate resolution to the client or secure additional information to close out the request
Certifications: Series 07 - FINRA, Series 66 - FINRA

Company Overview

At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. Text: WHAT YOU’LL DOCOACH | A manager at CTC is a coach to their direct reports. As PSeM, you are an extra set of eyes, ears, and hands across all accounts their Paid Search Buyer’s (PSeB) build and buy for. A sounding board for strategy and creativity, offering advice on when and how to scale. Moreover, how to scale effectively and efficiently. This means you are constantly looking for ways to make our PSeB's better. Testing new methods, challenging the status quo, and finding inspiration in building and buying to fuel our PSeB's drive.TRAIN | There is a general way of doing things and then there is the "CTC way." As the PSeM, we're depending on and trusting you to build up and bring out the knowledge, skills and abilities our PSeB’s will need to be successful here at CTC. This directly goes back to the PSeM being in service and support of the PSeBs. You cultivate an ecosystem of learning around creative testing, platform challenges, and workflow management. PSeMs train the PSeB’s to actively be part of the solution to their overall Growth Team's success, ADmission members and Expert Buyer clients.INNOVATE | The PSeM finds ways of expanding platform tools and features across all paid search channels as the driving force to keep CTC on the cutting edge. Search platforms are constantly evolving. That means that staying on top of updates and understanding root cause effects and chain reactions will become your middle name. Taking that one step further, it is your job to educate your PSeB’s (and the rest of CTC) on your keen understanding of cutting edge updates.WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE Success in Your Day to Day Looks LikeThe PSeM supplies the PSeB’s with the tools, training and insight to drive the best results. They are a consistent support to the buyers and come alongside them in the problems they face while at the same time challenging the PSeB’s to think outside the box and break “foam” walls.The PSeM fosters a culture of continuing growth and collaboration. They encourage the sharing of new learnings, tactics, and resources among the PSeBs and proudly celebrate the wins when they occur. The PSeM finds creative ways to keep the PSeB’s engaged and motivated in a remote environment.The PSeM is liaison between the various CTC departments and the Paid Search Buyers. They work with other department heads to implement company-wide strategies or systems. They are also the voice for the PSeB’s as they communicate with executive management on the challenges and opportunities that they see within the PSeB’s ecosystem.Success in Your First Three to Six Months Looks LikeThe PSeM brings learnings to the entire company and is the leader in paid search strategy. The PSeM is a public voice that not only shares learnings with the company but with other relevant communities helping maintain CTC’s position as a thought leader. The PSeM creates easily digestible learnings for people to share with clients and is always on the forefront of new tactics and strategies.The PSeM is always on the lookout to hire talented buyers and ensure that Growth Teams have buyers they need. They also assist in creating a smooth onboarding process for new PSeBs and set clear expectations of what success in the role looks like.WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO THE TABLE3 + years experience in building and buying Google Ads, preferred.1 + years experience working in a digital marketing agency, preferred.1 + years experience managing a team of talented, driven, and eager to learn individuals, preferred.Proven ability to influence teams and collaborate effectively.Competence in Asana, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Drive and Dropbox.Competence and/or experience in Google Analytics, preferred.Perception and understanding when it comes to navigating human relationships, especially when it comes to building trust and effectiveness across teams.Demonstrated ability to assess and resolve challenges independently through good judgement, deliberation, decisiveness, and ability to provide guidance to others.Must have a unique combination of humility (willing to do the dirty work) and ambition (vision for what your future holds).Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.Ability to organize, prioritize and manage multiple tasks with great attention to detail.Ability to complete short-term and long-term goals in a proper manner.An insatiable curiosity, and an inability to leave a problem alone until you’ve found one or many different potential solutions.A desire to take risks - but only after carefully examining the calculus and determining that your chosen course of action is most effective.ABOUT US*We’re storytellers, buyers, builders, designers, coaches, partners, leaders, entrepreneurs of our own lives, and in our hearts, we at the Common Thread Collective (CTC), are dreamers.With an untraditional take on marketing, CTC is an ecommerce growth agency helping entrepreneurs of all stripes achieve their dreams.A job is a job is a job. At CTC we don’t hire you for a job. We believe careers are a catalyst for your future self — because we’re not just interested in who you are, but in who you want to be. Come sell stuff online, tell stories, build websites, shape brands, create processes, scale accounts, and help fellow entrepreneurs turn their dreams into reality.We’ll come alongside you and care for you in your pursuits by offering full-time CTC entrepreneurs:Full health, dental, and vision benefits that fit your lifestyle and goals401k program with a 3% company match (post 90 days employment) to bring out the investor inside you4 weeks of paid time off on top of Holidays, your Birthday, and the week of Christmas paid. Go get your R&R on so when you’re at CTC you’re firing on all cylindersA wellness reimbursement program that inspires 360 degrees of health: mentally, physically, and spirituallyAccess to our Tell Me Your Dreams (TMYD) program where you explore life beyond what’s in front of you with a certified mental health coach. Maybe you’ll dream for the first time, we’re here for it. To top it off, if you opt in, we provide you with resources to realize your dreams through our Dream Fund**To be considered, please provide us with a cover letter on why you are interested in working at Common Thread Collective along with your resume*Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Google Analytics: 2 years (Preferred)Google AdWords: 3 years (Preferred)Managing a team: 1 year (Preferred)Digital marketing agency: 1 year (Preferred)

JobTitle: FT French Bilingual Customer Service Agent
Text:
Company Description
TOGETHER WE MAKE IT POSSIBLE
At H&M, we believe it’s possible to find what you love, space to create and room to grow. A place you can truly belong, being truly yourself. With a team that is full of life, in a company that feels as good as it looks. At H&M, we believe it’s possible, because together we make it possible.
As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, we have a myriad of career paths that can mean almost anything to anyone. We are tirelessly committed to the growth and development of our people, professionally and personally.
We offer endless career possibilities.
From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to in-the-know technology experts and business savvy planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Add to that an unparalleled eye for fashion and you’ve got a unique workplace to say the least.
With over 5,043 stores in more than 74 markets worldwide, we are continuing to grow and need the best people to keep our quality high.
Our values – the H&M spirit
Our values reflect the heart and soul of H&M. They define what it takes to work here and how we do things. When we interact with colleagues and customers around the world, our values ensure that we don’t lose sight of what we really stand for.
Individually, these values can seem like common sense, but together they form an inclusive culture that is unique and different from other companies.
WE ARE ONE TEAM
WE BELIEVE IN PEOPLE
ENTREPRENEURIAL SPIRIT
CONSTANT IMPROVEMENT
COST-CONSCIOUS
STRAIGHTFORWARD AND OPEN-MINDED
KEEP IT SIMPLE
Working together
We think of our organization as a large (and stylish) family.
At the core of it all, our approach is shaped by a strong respect for each individual. This applies to every aspect of the employment – from fair wages, working hours and freedom of association, to equal opportunities for growth and development within the company. Every H&M employee in the world receives fair employment, even in countries whose laws and regulations fall short of our own standards.
We see diversity and inclusion as central to our organization. This means that we stand up against discrimination and harassment wherever we operate.
At H&M, we endorse the “open door principle,” which gives every employee the right to discuss issues that matter to them directly with their leaders. Our employees also have the right to collective bargaining. We constantly strive for good relations with employees as well as employee associations and trade unions.
H&M is an equal opportunity employer that does not tolerate discrimination in the workplace.

Job Description
Title: FT French Bilingual Customer Service Agent
Function: Online
Department: Customer Service Center
Reports to: Team Leader
Direct Reports: None
Overall Job Function: Provide the best customer service to make the H&M Group our Customer’s First Choice. Follow H&M Group customer service procedures and standards to promote our products and to resolve customer questions and concerns.
Job Responsibility including but not limited to:
Provides excellent service to our online and in store customers.
Remain updated on knowledge about products and services.
Follow and execute the present H&M Group Customer Service procedures.
Maximize time available to customers to resolve concerns the first time.
Resolve customer inquiries and complaints in a professional manner.
Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, this role may require the ability to work from home.
Provide timely responses to customer phone communication.
Provide feedback regarding the customer’s opinions to the customer service organization.
Always strive for first contact resolution to efficiently and effectively solve customer service issues.
Communicate with Team Leader and internal departments when a case requires escalation.
Collect and track relevant customer data and maintain accurate records for received and shipped items.
Have thorough system knowledge needed to provide excellent customer service.
Offer the customer an alternative item if the item requested is out of stock.
Always try to upsell by offering additional products, product of the day, special offers, etc.Work together with team to ensure that all work areas, desks, and break areas are clean and well maintained.
Financial Accountability: None
Job Status: Hourly, Non-Exempt
EEOC Classification: OFC

Qualifications
Minimum Candidate Qualifications:
Associate’s degree or equivalent years of experience
1 year of continuous employment in a customer service role
1 year of H&M retail experience preferred
Flexible to work any shift between the hours of 655am-1005pm is required due to a rotating schedule
Must be completely fluent in both spoken and written for French and English
Competencies:
Strong customer service orientation including a friendly, helpful and professional demeanor
Strong, clear professional communication, both verbal and written
Courteous and polite telephone skills
Must have great active listening skills
Computer literacy, specifically all MS programs for Windows (Excel, Word, Outlook, etc...)
Good organization and time management skills
Ability to think independently and propose new routines
Strong current and working of knowledge H&M’s customer service policies preferred
Strong computer skills, such as browser navigation, software interaction and data entry are needed

Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Position Summary:

We have an incredible opportunity for an experienced and motivated Channel Sales professional who is ready to hit the ground running on day 1 to become a foundational member of our Global Alliance and Channel Partnership team. The Channel Manager will play a critical role in building out managing and growing our Partner Channel as we take it to the next level. The Qumu platform is Enterprise proven, but we need your expertise and thought leadership to help revolutionize how Qumu goes to market through the Channel.

The ideal candidate will find, train, and develop partners who will resell and distribute the Qumu platform. This is a quota carrying position with high visibly and a significant impact on Qumu's growth as an industry leader. If you thrive in an environment where you will be challenged and build something from the ground up, this is the role for you.

Note: This is a Remote opportunity, based in the U.S.

Job Role & Responsibilities:

Self-starter with strong leadership, executive communication skills, and the ability to work cross functionally.
Responsible for managing all aspects of the partner relationship including the initial recruitment, enablement, and the ongoing operation of the partnership.
Develop a cohesive plan to recruit and activate an appropriate community of channel partners, specifically resellers and distribution type partners.
Able to cultivate new business by building partner relationships with companies such as AppSmart, Insight, CDW, SHI and other by networking, and lead generation.
Able to identify key decision-makers and build strong relationships with channel partner's cross functional team.
Build and maintain an accurate channel partner pipeline and keep to a timely sales forecast.
Drive business planning between channel, sales, and marketing.
Collaborate with your partners to achieve a monthly quota.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in business or related field, required.

3-5 years of sales and channel partner experience selling SaaS solutions to Enterprise clients with a strong track record against quota.
Extensive experience with channel partners, service providers, or end-customers in a dynamic software environment
Enterprise video experience, working with partnerships and channels, preferred.
Thorough understanding of channel sales, partners, distribution.
Strong business development skills with demonstrable success in new partner recruitment.
Highly motivated individual with well-developed business acumen.
Proven ability to make strong connections and overcome rejection to achieve results.
Self-starter who is comfortable working independently with minimal direction.
Solid organizational skills with keen ability to prospect and follow-up.
High energy and collaborative team member.

REMOTE - Government Underwriter (New Purchase Loans)
We are a leading nationwide mortgage lending company, improving from achieving $1b in annual volume 12 years ago to over $20b in 2019. With our regions operating independently, our atmosphere is a small, local lender with the support of a top nationwide company.


With all the organic, consistent growth over the past 10 years, our avg. tenure is even still 6 years. This is primarily due to the close-knit, team environment we've established and continue to build with each new hire, and the fact that we only look to bring people on board who are looking for growth as we heavily invest back into our employees! Whether you're looking to get certifications, become a team lead or manager, or even step into a different department, we will lay out a track together to make sure you are reaching your goals!

Regarding compensation: Our minimum producing Underwriters are taking home $230k annually, not including OT!


We primarily do purchase loans. With the current environment, our current pipeline is about 55-60% purchases. Our primary loan type is Conventional, FHA, VA, some USDA and Bond Loans. Right now, underwriters are averaging about 4-8 files/day. With our long standing bonus structure, the avg. monthly bonus for Underwriters is $5500k with about $2-2500k in monthly OT. I've seen a few monthly bonus checks get cut for over $12k!

If you are interested in advancing your career, please apply today or e-mail your resume directly to Luke.Holm@CyberCoders.com

Multicultural Statement

At DePaul University, we are looking for candidates who want to join us in our mission to provide access to education for all. Successful candidates welcome ideas and perspectives from colleagues and students representing a wide variety of cultures, backgrounds, religious beliefs, and experiences. We seek collaborative, open-minded and hard working professionals to work in a real world urban learning environment. Are you exceptional, yet modest and open to challenges? We seek achievers and leaders that want to bring their passion and skills to our well-respected community of approachable colleagues. Build your career with us.


General Summary

The Applications Developer/Analyst (Associate Level) works with the University's enterprise application environments and associated custom web applications, and assists in maintaining other third party applications. Under direct supervision, conducts enterprise application development including processes and procedures associated with the technology life cycle (plan, design, build, test, deploy, support), applies technical, functional, and business knowledge to the customization of software solutions that provide seamless integration for client/server or web-based applications. Under direct supervision, conducts research, writes technical requirements, prototypes graphical user interfaces, and develops test plans for which software will be implemented; designs, codes, documents, tests, and debugs and supports implementation of software solutions.


Responsibilities & Duties
Code solutions to problems using a structured approach keeping in mind long term maintainability and accessibility.
Test coded solutions properly against customer acceptance criteria to ensure a quality application.
Learn business processes/functions in order to effectively research cause, troubleshoot and resolve production issues across all Oracle Cloud modules.
Document consistently and accurately on all application projects. All documentation (new development and maintenance) should be complete, understandable and accessible.
Learn business processes/functions in order to effectively participate in analysis, design, implementation and support of project work, tickets and work orders.
Improve knowledge in new technologies in order to use them in approved projects.
Participate as a team member following existing university and/or divisional processes and procedures. Maintain open communication with customers, team members and project leadership.
Within a broad framework, assists the intermediate and senior developers with moderately complex solutions.
Peforms other duties as assigned.
Education & Experience
Bachelor's or higher in Computer Science or related field of study.
0-1+ years of relevant work experience.
Preferred Requirements
Basic experience with Oracle/Peoplesoft and/or Microsoft development environments.
Other Skills & Abilities Required
Basic problem solving and organizational skills.
Ability to translate user requirements of simple to medium complexity into efficient and effective technology solutions.
Requires some communication and collaboration with business partners.
Functional knowledge of customers' business processes is beneficial.
Basic knowledge of operating and development environments.
Working knowledge of various development tools and programming languages (including experience with one or more of the following: SQL, PeopleTools, PeopleCode, C#, Visual Basic, ASP.NET, Java, AJAX, Oracle, SQL Server, XML, XSLT, HTML, JavaScript, JSON, CSS and web services).
Basic knowledge in various development methodologies including coding techniques, life cycle phases, client/server, distributed applications design and development, internet applications design and development.
Ability to function independently in a remote work environment.
Ability to utilize modern team communication tools (Teams, Zoom, Skype, etc.) to coordinate and collaborate with remote team members.
Additional Information

For consideration, please include a resume and cover letter.

DePaul offers a comprehensive package including competitive pay and benefits to attract and retain the best talent in order to further the University's mission. To promote continuing professional growth and lifelong learning, DePaul University offers a Tuition Waiver benefit for faculty and staff. For more information, please visit the following pages:

Full-Time Benefits

Part-Time Benefits


Required Background Check:

Employment at DePaul University is contingent on passing a background check. Only final candidates who are extended an offer of employment will undergo a background check.


Mandated Reporting of Child Abuse & Neglect:

Upon accepting an offer of employment with the university, you will also be required to sign an Acknowledgement of Mandated Reporter Status at the time of hire. A mandated reporter is required to make a report to the Illinois DCFS Hotline whenever there is reasonable cause to believe that a child known to them in their professional or official capacity may be abused or neglected. For more information, please visit the following pages:

Illinois Department of Children & Family Services (DCFS)

Illinois Abused and Neglected Child Reporting Act

Federal Title IX policy requires that all colleges and universities make known the contact information for the person responsible for coordinating its efforts to comply with Title IX responsibilities. At DePaul University, the Title IX Coordinator is Kathryn Statz. Her office is located in Lincoln Park on the 3rd floor of the Student Center, 2250 N. Sheffield Avenue. She can be reached at 312-362-8970 or titleixcoordinator@depaul.edu.

The Company
At Edovo, our mission is to help everyone connected to incarceration build better lives. We’ve created a secure digital platform to expand education behind bars, reduce recidivism and to support the vocational, rehabilitation and communication needs of the 2.2 million people in jails and prisons. Users have access to thousands of hours of self-guided learning materials. Upon release, our learners have the option to continue their progress on the outside. Edovo offers courses in subjects ranging from basic literacy and GED to career exploration and cognitive behavioral therapy. We’re also building tools to keep people in touch with jobs, social services, friends, and family. Our team is committed to supporting opportunities for justice-involved people.
Don’t take it just from us. Awards, publications, grants, and partnerships all around the country are recognizing the momentum and impact of Edovo. A select few: Global EdTech Startup Champion in London out of 1,000+ competitors; GIIRS Platinum Rating for social impact; MacArthur Foundation Grant Award Winner; Forbes article feature; Chicago Community Trust grant award winner; Impact Engine portfolio member; SXSW Civic Tech Innovation Pitch Competition runner-up; Chicago Innovation "Up and Comer" Award winner; and so much more.
Check out a brief picture of our program from the perspective of the people who use it. Visit Edovo on Vimeo for more.
The Team
We’re a tight-knit group with a passion for solving hard problems for the greater good. We’re involved in the delivery and support of the key systems that keep Edovo running. We focus on security, stability, scalability, fault tolerance, and automation. We strive to provide our customers and internal teams with 100% system and service availability. We’re unafraid of new technology and happily evaluate each on its merits to the organization and our team. That said, we prefer simple solutions and tried-and-true technology.
We are committed to continually improving ourselves, our processes, and our systems. We depend on each other to deliver on our commitments and to contribute to ideas on how we can improve.
At Edovo we believe that diversity of background and experience is key and work hard to build teams that reflect this.
The Role
The IT Support Analyst role is responsible for ensuring all the technology available to our end users is delivering Edovo’s mission and running smoothly. This includes supporting our internal users as well as remotely supporting external end users in our client sites across the nation.
This role will have support responsibilities in three main areas: network and infrastructure, tablets in the field, and internal IT needs. The range of responsibilities is highly visible, impactful, and provides numerous opportunities for growth and career development.
We support hardware including routers, switches, access points, thousands of Android tablets, employee laptops (Mac and Windows), and Linux servers. In the cloud we monitor and support a fleet of Linux and Windows-based instances, as well as the supporting AWS services.
We manage and support the software systems that are core to our business. This includes ticketing systems, project management tools, communication software, mobile device management, firewalls, and VPNs.
General Job Responsibilities
Network & Infrastructure
As a member of the Network Operations team you will provide internal “smart hands” services on datacenter hardware, switches, routers, and the wireless network with direct guidance from the Edovo NOC. Resulting actions may include off-cycle maintenance, communicating with customers, or coordination with other members of the engineering team. This also includes participating in the shared on-call rotation.
Internal IT Support
You will manage internal IT needs for all employees, including provisioning & ordering personal workstation hardware, office IT hardware, IT systems account configurations and remote access, and workstation software installations. You will manage and maintain end user desktop security via anti-virus, disk encryption, and remote management. Examples of tools that our employees use are the Google Suite, Slack, Zendesk, Sisense, and our VPN.
Tablet Support
You will serve as the second level of support in managing and troubleshooting our Android tablets in the field. This includes developing a proficiency with our MDM software to help distribute application and security updates.
Qualifications
Must-haves
Two of the following requirements
2 years experience
Associate's degree
CompTIA A+, Network+, Security+ or equivalent certification
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
Ability to independently troubleshoot general computer, OS, application, and network issues.
End User Wired & Wireless network maintenance and troubleshooting experience.
Experience administering Active Directory, Office 365, or Google G Suite.
Working knowledge of Mac, Windows, Linux, and Android operating systems.
Highly developed analytical troubleshooting skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to develop and execute a project plan.
Ability to prioritize work based on company needs.
Detail oriented.
Passion for Edovo’s mission.
Nice-to-haves
Experience operating and maintaining Mobile Device Management solutions.
Experience in network administration.
Cabling experience and knowledge of ethernet standards
Active home lab for exploring IT interests.
Experience administering Linux operating systems
Experience in criminal justice reform, social justice, adult education, or telecommunications
Experience working, volunteering, or personally impacted by the jail/prison system
Previous startup experience.
Travel Requirements
Travel while Covid-19 restrictions are in place is limited. Once back to normal, travel may be up to 5% and include travel to our data centers and/or our customer’s facilities.
Physical Demands
When in the office, on-site, or working in our data center you may need to be on a ladder and lift up to 25 lbs.
Details
Location: Chicago Area (Many work days can be remote, but on-site time will be required when we need hands on equipment).
Department: Network and Infrastructure, reporting to the Lead NOC Engineer.
Inquiries
Edovo is an impact driven private company. We offer our employees an exceptional workplace and subsidized benefits for team members and their families. We hire tenacious, innovative and passionate people and give them opportunities to grow and succeed.
Teams with bold missions need diverse ideas to generate the most impact. For that reason, Edovo is committed to building diverse and inclusive work spaces. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. And yes, we believe in second chances.
