JobTitle: Competitive Technical Marketing Manager - End User Computing - Opportunity for Working Remotely Chicago, IL
Text:
Sr Competitive Technical Manager – End User Computing
VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 350,000 enterprise and SMB customers to thrive in the Digital Workspace Era. Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today. In End-User Computing at VMware, we are leading the transformational journey to the digital workspace, helping our customers deliver on the productivity and user-experience promise of the next-generation of workspace technologies.
Job Role and Responsibility
The End User Computing Competitive team is seeking a talented, results-driven technical marketing manager, technical account management, solutions architect, or product management professional with a good understanding of the Digital Workspace technology and market dynamics. You will work closely with our product management, product marketing, engineering, and field teams to build and communicate a clear view of our competitive market positioning. Your main responsibility will be to provide technical comparisons and create differentiated technical sales tools against the competition. You will deliver timely technical analysis of competitive products and announcements with recommendations for VMware responses and strategy. You will also design and craft high quality technical assets for use by customers, VMware field technical teams and partners. This is a dynamic role with rapidly moving boundaries that requires a deep understanding of the underlying technology elements. You will need to interact with our customers and global teams, which will require some travel.
In this role, you will work independently and as a member of a team to design and craft content that helps our field teams and partners communicate our market-leading capabilities to customers. You have the ability to work in a fast pace environment demonstrating autonomy in conforming to strategic intent while adhering to team values. The successful candidate is a person who can:Impact and influence othersCreate compelling value propositions that technically differentiate our offerings in the digital workspace, end user computing and enterprise mobility management marketsTranslate your understanding of the digital workspace market into compelling value propositions differentiating our solution in the marketCreate customer-facing materials including technical teardowns, web content, whitepapers, webinars and training materialsCollaborate with product management, product marketing, engineering, sales, and sales engineering teams to help drive competitive take-out strategiesCreate and deliver technical sales enablement contentSupport and report back on competitive events and conferencesThrive in a dynamic and fluid environmentTravel up to 10% of the time
Required Skills:5-10 years successfully supporting global field teams by providing compelling competitive product differentiatorsEngineering, computer science or other technical degree; MBA a plusExcellent people and communication skills, written and verbal (writing samples will be requested)Ability to provide an impartial technical evaluation of competitor’s products compared to VMware’sAbility to deliver concise communication assets that support others in detailed conversations with customers that accurately and positively describe VMware’s unique value propositionExperience developing product marketing and technical marketing content to support competitive positioning campaignsProven track record of working with customers and partners, and ability to influence their decisions with timely evaluationsDemonstration of an understanding of digital workspace technologies, including EMM/UEM, VDI/RDSH and Identity managementEstablished knowledge of the end-user computing market and the competitive landscape
Preferred Skills:
Our team looks for individuals who embody our values of humility, empathy, collaboration above isolationism, respectfulness, trustworthiness, and good-natured fun. Additionally, we would like you to have:Proven grasp of the challenges faced by customers in digital workspace transformationExperience of agile development environmentsDemonstrated ability to work successfully across business units and with high-level executives
Category : Marketing
Subcategory: Product Dev Marketing
Experience: Business Leadership
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Posted Date: 2021-02-10
VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who loves to find creative solutions and lead change. High attention to detail, well organized, and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Experience in the use of business analytics, key performance indicators and dashboards
Deep understanding of marketing automation strategies and testing methodologies
Strong analytical skills and ability to translate complex data sets into concrete business recommendations for marketing and sales leadership, with the goal to optimize revenue-generating investments
Understanding of data mining, data warehousing, business intelligence, and lead management processes and technologies
Proven success building B2B marketing funnels, scaling profitable demand, optimizing lead handoff processes, and exceeding ROI targets at a growing startup
Knowledge of HTML and CSS
Experience in Project Management a plus.
We offer exciting career progressing opportunities and a friendly team environment

Something Digital has recently joined forces with Rightpoint, a global experience leader and a Genpact company.
Genpact, a global professional services firm focused on delivering digital transformation, today announced the expansion of its experience business, Rightpoint, with the acquisition of Something Digital. The addition of Something Digital’s deep commerce expertise to Rightpoint’s customer experience leadership, will further enable the company’s ability to drive experience-led transformation at scale for clients across industries.
Something Digital is an interactive agency with offices around the US. We have spent close to 20 years developing customer software, eCommerce sites, intranets, and websites for diverse clients ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies.
Something Digital is looking for Program Manager. Currently, this role is 100% remote.
We have offices in New York City (HQ), Los Angeles, CA and West Palm, FL.
 Intro:
The Program Manager will establish and lead over-arching program structure, processes, and procedures designed to achieve overall program objectives. T
In this instance, a Program shall be defined as a series of related projects, initiatives, and defined efforts connected to a single client or group of clients and managed by multiple teams within the organization.
 We’ll need you to:
 Program / Client Management
Ensure client and internal RP-SD stakeholder satisfaction through management of escalations and conflict, effective communication, appropriate expectation-setting, and achievement of agreed-upon program objectives
Produce accurate and timely reporting of program health and KPIs throughout its lifecycle for client and RP-SD stakeholders (utilizing tools such as Brightgauge, Jira, Smartsheet, Roadmunk, etc.)
Provide oversight of operations and performance of all program-related projects and initiatives
Identify and resolve program risks as they surface
Collaborate in leadership of program with Program Manager – Account Management & Delivery Executive
 Support program-related business development activities, including assessing initiative feasibility, budgeting, pitching, and resource planning
 Achieve program financial objectives by forecasting requirements, monitoring ongoing performance, analyzing variances, and initiating corrective actions
Process Management
Develop an evaluation method to assess program strengths and identify areas for improvement
Create new processes to align SD’s product delivery with client’s agile processes
Document and simplify SD’s delivery processes for client work
Own the setup/configuration/management of tools such as CW, Brightgauge, Jira, Smartsheet, Open Air etc., to support the team in their process and delivery performance
Lead internal onboarding processes for new team members
Create process for team transitions (members moving to other teams within the same program, to teams elsewhere within RP-SD, or entire existing teams moving from one product/service to another, e.g. Magento to New Web)
Modify and improve business operations through integration with RightPoint.
Team Management
 Directly manage Project Managers/Scrum Masters, who each lead their own delivery teams.
 Set the direction for the program’s governance and leadership structure within the Matrix
 Responsible for timesheet approvals, PTO requests, performance evaluation, training plans, onboarding, and employee satisfaction of direct reports
Focusing on the engagement with project leaders, project teams, technology and application / operational interfaces
Manage a team with a diverse array of talents and responsibilities, including assisting with recruiting, hiring, and retention efforts, and providing mentoring and coaching
Lead the prep and delivery of monthly reviews
 Weekly PM Meeting
 Bi-Weekly Internal Leadership Meetings
 Monthly Internal Full-team Meetings
 Participate in domestic and international travel as program circumstances dictate.
 Perform additional duties as they become necessary in support of the Program’s or RP-SD’s operation, to include standing in as a ScrumMaster when there is a need

You must have:

 Tools: Jira, Confluence, Smartsheet, Brightgauge, Roadmunk, etc.
 Knowledge and understanding of Scrum/Agile, with a strong background in planning, continuous improvement, and change management (particularly in the areas of process and operations)
 Expectation setting regarding process rollout (description, plan, and assignment of actions/ownership)
Apply if you:
Enjoy a challenge and are looking to grow
Want to work on diverse projects and platforms
Are excited to work on high profile brands with complex requirements
Are you looking for a company that places value on training and skills development!!

Invoice Specialist – Customer Operations / Customer Compliance
Reports To: Sr. Director of Operations
Location: Chicago OR Remote

For more than 19+ years, Redwood Logistics has been helping move businesses forward by connecting our clients to winning strategies. Redwood is a next-generation leader in third-party logistics. We focus brilliant minds, technology services, and performance excellence to modernize your supply chain. Your business was never designed to be ordinary. Your logistics partner shouldn’t be either.
See for yourself why The Chicago Tribune has named Redwood Logistics a Top Workplace for several years running!
Redwood Multimodal, a subsidiary of Redwood Logistics, is a full-service, non-asset brokerage company that takes pride in providing unparalleled transportation services to our customers while maintaining mutually beneficial relationships with our carriers. Our combination of mode expertise, operational excellence and focus on safety and compliance will get our customers’ goods to their destinations.

Position Description:
As an Invoice Specialist, you will be responsible for uploading paperwork into our systems, validating paperwork for accuracy and communicating paperwork discrepancies with internal team members as well as our carrier partners. You will also help streamline Redwood Multimodal’s invoicing process by utilizing reports and overseeing issue resolution. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, proactive, and possess good problem-solving skills.

Responsibilities:
Review and validate accuracy of paperwork
Upload and enter paperwork into our systems
Communicate with carriers about missing and incorrect paperwork
Reduce Multimodal’s non-invoiced totals by categorically assigning responsibility, reviewing and following-up on outstanding problems, and resolving invoice holds.
Participate in customer-specific functions both, internal and external, that support the invoicing process
Perform other clerical/office work as needed, including but not limited to answering phone calls, operating general office equipment (computer, scanner, fax)

Qualifications:
Ability to manage time effectively, prioritize tasks, and collaborate within a team environment
Ability to adapt quickly to changing needs/timelines while maintaining a strong attention to detail
Strong communication skills with both internal & external points of contact

Tools:
Basic understanding of Excel

Rewards:
Culture of unlimited growth with new positions and departments created regularly to support our growing customer base
Paid maternity and paternity leave policies
Medical, dental, vision and 401k plans (with match)
Flexible-spending, mass transit and dependent care plans
Health savings account, with company contribution
Short-term, long-term and life insurance policies subsidized by company
Cell phone discounts; reduced fees for health and fitness clubs
Additional benefits including pet insurance, accident care and more
Competitive referral bonus program
Competitive PTO plans, with extra floating holiday and time off to volunteer
Fundraising and volunteer opportunities to give back to our local and national communities

Job Title: Principal Strategist – Inspire Value
Location: Remote Bay Area, CA/Chicago, IL/Addison, TX
ServiceNow is creating the future of work. We help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.
We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.
ServiceNow is seeking a Strategist to join the Inspire Value team which is an integral part of the Global Sales Go-to-Market team. This is a customer facing role that leads strategic, consultative interactions to build consensus and alignment on how core capabilities of the ServiceNow platform can support CXO business transformation objectives. Through years of practical experience, executive gravitas and fundamental knowledge of business and technology trends, the strategist builds and develops trusted advisor relationships with customers, partners and internally across ServiceNow.
What you get to do:
Customer Advisory
Engage executives to expertly define and manage bespoke industry-aligned digital transformation advisory engagements at select key customers, leveraging ServiceNow methodologies
Lead discovery workshops with customer leadership and their teams to understand key business objectives, challenges of prospective and existing customers
Document and present insights and recommended solutions to meet customer business objectives
Create high-quality deliverables that communicate strategic alignment, present multi-year roadmaps and document the full business case to justify action
Expertly communicate and advise in 1:1 and 1: many environments
Sales & Customer Success Advisory
Work closely with sales & customer success to help define account plans and sales strategy for key accounts in the region.
Provide analytical expertise to help assess and prioritize accounts and strategies
Provide full lifecycle business outcome and value realization advisory
Thought leadership
Identify, lead and contribute to the creation of new IP (best practices, white papers, workshops, etc.)
Innovate on current methods and frameworks
Collaborate with and enable the ServiceNow teams on a business consulting approach to sales
To be successful, the ideal candidate would have:
A minimum of 12 years of relevant experience:
Management consultant/ ex-management consultant from a top tier consulting firm with exposure to cloud technologies or a customer-facing business strategy manager with a leading technology vendor
Executive / leadership experience working on digital transformation projects and/or enterprise software deployments preferred
MBA from a top tier institution is preferred
Adept at navigating cross functional business processes and Industry trends (Significant experience in a major industry (FSI, Telco, Manufacturing, Retail, etc.) is preferred
Experience developing and growing C-Level relationships with an ability to simplify and communicate complex topics to an audience with various functional knowledge
Excellent presentation skills including public speaking, meeting facilitation and white boarding
Deep customer connects in the Western United States
High level of executive gravitas with a humble demeanor
Exemplary analytical and financial acumen
Enjoy working in a highly collaborative, fast-paced and often ambiguous environment
Willing to travel up to 40% of the time

JobTitle: Manager, Competitive Intelligence - Opportunity for Working Remotely Chicago, IL
Text:
Business Summary:
VMware accelerates digital transformation through a software-defined approach to business and IT. The trusted platform provider of choice for more than 500,000 customers globally, VMware is the pioneer in virtualization and an innovator in cloud and business mobility. A proven leader, VMware allows customers to run, manage, connect and secure applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.
Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.
This individual will develop market and competitive intelligence, critical insights, and recommendations to positively influence strategic decisions with VMware’s executive team, senior leaders and key business stakeholders. The role reports to the Director, Corporate Intelligence.
Job Role and Responsibilities:
Develop competitive intelligence, critical insights, and recommendations to positively influence strategic decisions with VMware’s executive team and key business stakeholders.
Build in-depth studies analyzing top competitors (e.g. Microsoft, Cisco) and assess strategic, go-to-market, and technological gaps.
Compare and contrast VMware vs the competition in order to provide impact assessments and recommendations to improve VMware’s position in the market.
Develop market evolution hypotheses and anticipate competitive dynamics, including the identification of emerging competitive threats.
Evolve competitive program engagement model, with a focus on broadening internal customer base across VMware business units and increase frequency and depth of touch points throughout the year.
Forge strong relationships with business leaders to understand strategy and pain points, and ensure competitive content is strategically aligned and impactful.
Engage industry analysts to ascertain relevant research, scope custom projects, and build RFPs.
Become embedded in business unit strategy and planning processes, including long range planning, fiscal year planning, worldwide sales kickoff, and other strategic initiatives throughout the year.
Track major competitive announcements and proactively build awareness of key competitor moves (e.g. AWS shift toward distributed cloud model)
Develop detailed project plans, clear process for engagement with stakeholders, clarify intent and goals, establish strategic imperatives, etc.
Present competitive studies and key insights and align with VMware senior leaders on recommendations and areas of focus. Measure level of engagement and meaningful use of competitive content throughout the year.
Required Skills:
Executive level presentation skills. Capable of articulating recommendations clearly, handling objections, and switching between big picture thinking and detailed requirements.
Exceptional technical depth with competence to explain and debate at the architectural level. Consistent knowledge builder with an eye on leading edge technology and business models.
Ability to collaborate within a small team environment. Precision PowerPoint development required, with high attention to detail and format.
Self-starter with a bias for action and results orientation. Able to prioritize, focus, and execute through obstacles. Innovative thinker with analytical problem-solving skills.
Degrees in engineering, computer science and MBA preferred
This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by VMware.

JobTitle: Process Improvement Associate Manager (Associate Project Manager)- Life Sciences (Remote)
Text:
JOB SUMMARY

The purpose of this position is to lead individual, multi-disciplined real estate project solutions for clients, with direct accountability for project delivery.

Characteristics of responsible projects:
Complexity: Low to Medium
Risk: Low to Medium
Duration: Short term (less than 6 months)
Value: Typically < $100,000 USD


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Leads low to medium cross-functional projects and programs end-to-end using a formal PMO process. Facilitates the development of a charter and integrated timeline. Ensures all functions remain on schedule and issues get resolved or escalated. Responsible for program is competition.
Facilitates regular meetings to review project status for active and pending projects (project pipeline). Collaborates with core team to develop solutions and leads project team through implementation and completion.
Responsible for reporting status of individual and groups of projects and programs. Provides appropriate levels of detail, and summarizes complex issues succinctly.
Manages internal and external relationships in support of program. May contract and manage vendors. May provide consultation on complex low to medium scale projects that integrate into an organized program.
Creates, maintains & distributes routine PMO reports, including status reports and updated Gantt charts.
May manage/oversee a team who are responsible for the delivery of a portfolio of projects and programs. Serves as the primary client contact and escalation point for any staffing, bandwidth or delivery issues.
Other duties as assigned.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. Provides informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May lead project teams and/or plan, and supervise assignments of lower level employees.

QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from 4-year college or university.
Minimum four years of related experience.
Prior Supervisory experience preferred.
CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES
PgMP (Program Management Professional) or PMP (Project Management Professional) certifications preferred.
COMMUNICATION SKILLS
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.
FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE
Requires advanced knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and commissions. Conducts advanced financial analysis.
REASONING ABILITY
Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires advanced analytical and quantitative skills.
OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES
Strong process skills, negotiating, decision-making and analytical skills are necessary. Demonstrated ability in project management processes, tools and techniques.
Ability to build and maintain effective professional/client relationships.
Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite including MS Project.
SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY
Decisions made with thorough understanding of procedures, company policies, and business practices to achieve general results and deadlines.
Responsible for setting work unit and/or project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to department.

Qualifications: High school or equivalent (Preferred)Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)Driver's License (Preferred)

Kin + Carta is seeking a User Experience Discovery and Validation Researcher to join our UX Department on a contract basis. This role can be fully remote in the United States (must be comfortable working in Central and Eastern time zones). The ideal candidate will be analytical and have a proven ability to lead investigative conversations. If you are passionate about getting clients closer to their customers - read on!

What we are looking for in you:

You are excited and passionate about immersing yourself in the customer’s environment and searching out new opportunities to improve their experience.
You are able to speak to the value of research and “sell” stakeholders on a comprehensive research plan.
You are skilled at creating discussion guides and leading open-ended, contextual conversations to help generate answers to key questions as well as discover what the team didn’t know they didn’t know.
You have experience crafting and leading UX research using both qualitative and quantitative research methods and analysis. You are proficient in a variety of UX research methods and tools, including rapid experimentation, prototyping, usability testing (remote and in-person), ride-alongs, journey mapping, card sorting, prototyping, user interviews, usability testing, persona development - and know how/when to advocate for different methods.
You’re able to manage your own time, whether working on a team in a collaborative environment or working independently.
Proven ability to collaborate with designers to realize human-centered designs based on your understanding of HCI fundamentals.
Working closely with a development and design team is something you have done and enjoy.
You are an advocate for the user. You’re passionate about uncovering pain points and delights in a digital interface, as well as helping to solve difficult user experience problems based on your research.
You are able to effectively articulate issues and concerns to team members and clients as well as work to strategize potential solutions.
Experience working in a consulting capacity, specifically in a client-facing role is a plus.
You have a passion for FinTech, IoT, or other emerging tech enterprise verticals
Bachelor’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Cognitive Science, Journalism, or related field.
Any design experience is a plus however we are looking for a UX researcher first and foremost.

What you can look forward to in the job:

Your work at Kin + Carta matters. The research you do here will have a direct impact on the client projects on which you’re engaged. The designs you help inform will be seen and used by thousands of people every.
Taking a client’s vision from conception to completion and delivery. In addition, you’ll be a trusted advisor on the digital experience they will provide to their customers.
You will work with some of the brightest, most talented UX’ers around - you’ll learn something new daily, and we would like to learn from you.
Crafting research plans and discussion guides, conducting end-user interviews, synthesizing and analyzing research feedback, and developing lean documentation to keep your team focused on the user.
You’ll work closely with designers for our innovative digital application product suite.


About Kin + Carta

Kin + Carta exists to make the world work better by delivering transformative digital growth for our clients. As a digital transformation firm, we apply creativity, data, and technology to help clients invent, market, and operate new digital products and services that turn prospects into customers, and customers into advocates. Kin + Carta seamlessly integrates the strategic consulting, software engineering, and marketing technology needed to help businesses 'Make It Happen'.

Consultants at Kin + Carta have the opportunity to: engage with the most cutting-edge emerging technologies, solve difficult problems for some of the world’s biggest companies, and work within a breadth of industries.

Kin + Carta is headquartered in Chicago and London with offices across four continents. Our culture and shared ways of working unite us globally, but it’s our diverse specialisms, our connections, and our courage that makes our firm a recognized best place to work.

We welcome our Kin to show up as their full selves every day. Because this is so important to us, Kin + Carta is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. To read further about our commitment to Inclusion, Diversity, Equity, and Awareness, check out our IDEA page on our website.

If you need accommodations at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Description
Job Description:
No two career paths will ever look the same. At Leidos, we know the most talented and diverse IT and engineering professionals will always have a multitude of career choices; your time at Leidos will be a wise investment in your career and in yourself.
Our Civil business is helping to modernize and manage infrastructure, systems and controls, and cybersecurity for civilian agencies and commercial clients around the globe. With core competencies in information technology, energy and environment, complex logistics, and specialized engineering, we solve technical challenges and implement newfound efficiencies on a number of programs!
LEIDOS is searching for Airport Site Leads and has openings in multiple locations for Airport Site Lead/Project Manager(s) to provide technical, and project management support to TSA Contracting Officer Representative (COR) for the Security Equipment Deployment Services (SEDS) for the Deployment and Logistics Division (DLD).
This position encompasses the full project lifecycle management as the site lead / project manager. The position involves initial planning, site surveys/validations, risk identification and mitigation, coordination, communication, report development, drawing review/comment, construction management / oversight, schedule development and tracking, applying for and closing out local/state construction permits, subcontractor oversight, installation oversight, test witness, and project sell-off / close-out of security systems related to the checkpoint equipment deployments at federalized airports throughout United States. The position will support the TSA SEDS program to maintain, upgrade, and move the established airport security system to the next generation of capability.
NOTE: This position is contingent upon award from the government customer. We'll move forward with the interview process upon notification of Leidos securing this contract award.
This position will allow for telecommuting and remote work when not traveling.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
The successful candidate will be responsible for project management at assigned airports, including coordination, site survey/validation, design support, communication, developing statement of work bid packages, construction oversight, site/equipment layout evaluation, witness test/checkout, site clean-up and restoration.
The candidate will be responsible for managing up to 5 - 7 projects at various life cycle stages concurrently.
The candidate may be required to guide or direct the daily activities for geographically assigned teams ranging in size from 2-10 consisting of site technicians, including subcontractors, vendors, suppliers, and/or local general contractors.
The candidate will be responsible for facilitating communications and coordination between TSA HQ, local TSA, airport stakeholders, operations management, general subcontractors, other TSA Vendors, airport authority representatives and state/ local government officials.
The candidate will exercise expert judgment and assess project, construction, and equipment installation best practices to conduct requirements analysis; review design drawings, specifications, and deliverables; support connectivity construction, installation, and acceptance testing; and oversee site clean-up and remediation.
The candidate will successfully monitor the project schedule and keep the team appraised of any possible delays or modified plans to avoid any unnecessary costs to the customer.
The successful candidate will be a self-starter with high energy and initiative to easily adapt to dynamic, fast-paced work environments.
Physical work locations may vary depending on the assigned airports and the deployment schedule. This position requires up to 50-75% travel to airport locations as assigned. Some work may require non-standard work shifts (during evening or weekends) to accommodate TSA requirements for minimal disruption to airport operations.
Develop agendas and lead conference call meetings including ad hoc (periodic as requested by TSA or Leidos), weekly, integrated project team (IPT), and installation readiness (so called Go / no go”) meetings.
Be well organized, take meeting minutes and disseminate to the team as required.
Be able to multi-task in a fast paced, exciting environment.
Be very responsive to Leidos, TSA and other stakeholders request for information, schedule updates, status reporting and forward planning.
Be proactive and look forward in time to be fully prepared for future activities.
Punctuality is mandatory; always be on-time or ahead of schedule as the site lead is typically the lead for various elements of their projects.
MINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
All Airport Category – 3 years of Project Management (preferably construction management), 2 years of which occurred in an airport.
Requires a BA degree and 2 – 4 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with less than 2 years of prior relevant experience.
Demonstrated experience as a Project Manager (preferably construction management) with on-time, on-budget projects, taking into consideration complexities and schedule history for comparable projects.
Experience working with multiple stakeholders on a single project.
Experience in planning and formulation of design alternatives and solutions for construction projects.
Management experience on work performed by field staff and subcontracting firms.
Experience in resolving compliance issues with federal, state and local authorities on design specifications.
Thorough understanding of airport construction practices, processes, standards, and their impact on project activities. Including understanding of floor loading, electrical infrastructure, seismic requirements, and rigging complexities;
Familiarity with the Checkpoint Requirements Planning Guide for Checkpoint operations
Knowledge of MS Excel & Word are required.
ADDITIONAL DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
TSA experience in the field at a checkpoint, baggage or security outpost.
Spanish speaker is a big plus.
Professional certifications (i.e., Licensed PE, PMI® PMP, or General Contractor License is a plus).
Knowledgeable of MS Project or other scheduling tools.
Demonstrative ability to effectively work with, coordinate/make assignments, and manage multi-disciplined teams of technical and project management professionals and interact as the liaison with the customer and stakeholders.

Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world’s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company’s 38,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Va., Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $11.09 billion for the fiscal year ended January 3, 2020. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.
Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here.
Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

TopBloc is a startup that provides fixed-time, fixed-price Workday deployment services and on-demand Workday support. We quickly and pragmatically deploy Human Capital Management, Payroll, and Financials business processes and technology, letting our customers focus on their business while they gain immediate value. Once live, we provide expertise and resources as needed to operate and augment the solution.
 TopBloc is committed to providing employees with an environment that will foster morale and growth. We are looking for a Functional Product Manager – Deployment Tools who wants the intimacy of working for a small firm but has the ambition to be a driver for success.
Requirements (What We’re Looking For):
Workday Certification (REQUIRED)
At least 2 years experience configuring and implementing Workday
Functional and data-conversion experience with one or more of the following areas: Payroll, Time Tracking, Financials, Recruiting, HCM
Experience with all Workday data conversion tools, including Workbooks, Advanced Loads, Cloudloader and Migration Recipe
Experience in all phases of the technology implementation lifecycle (requirements gathering, design, build, go-live, testing).
Ability to clearly articulate product requirements and prioritize enhancement requests
Excellent analytic, problem solving, and multitasking skills
Strong communication skills, both written and oral
Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills
Strong planning and organizational skills
Ability to deal with the stress related to project timeframes and competing priorities
Bachelor's degree, preferably in Human Resources, Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline; or equivalent experience
Responsibilities (What You’ll Do):
Lead product readiness testing of internally developed tools
Identify and prioritize product defects with both development and delivery teams
Collaborate with development, delivery and sales teams to understand their requirements
Work with the development organization through design, testing and product release
Write detailed feature specifications based on requirements
Manage uptake of new enhancements by coordinating with internal development and delivery teams
Define a product roadmap and determine requirements for each release
Participate with delivery teams as a product expert
Pilot new programs and drive continuous improvement initiatives for both implementing and post go live customers
Benefits (What We’re Offering):
Fast-paced and result oriented work culture with competitive base salary
Health, Dental, Vision, Disability, and Basic Life Insurance coverage
Additional voluntary life insurance available
Paid Parental Leave & Pregnancy Related Medical Leave
Generous paid sick leave
Unlimited PTO
Monthly wellness/gym subsidy

Employee Assistance Program
Company sponsored volunteer opportunities, LinkedIn Learning access, company and team outings

Join a global team of highly engaged and collaborative software and marketing experts to help drive our continued growth in the analytical science markets. The eCDS product marketing team promotes Chromeleon through impactful marketing programs, sales enablement activities and regular interactions with customers through seminars or targeted 1:1 activities.
We are looking for a marketing specialist for Chromeleon’s IT networking and cloud capabilities to expand our eCDS team. This role is fully remote based from Western Europe or Eastern/Central United States.

As the ideal candidate you will
Have practical experience of managing a networked (ideally WAN) CDS installation, preferably Chromeleon, from an IT or system administrator perspective.
Have working knowledge of cloud models and deployment of applications both IaaS and SaaS
Be willing to travel up to 25% of your time
Be self-motivated and used to working towards challenging goals
Enjoy collaboration and interaction with your team and peers
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Market and promote Chromeleon capabilities to internal and external customers
Create high value marketing collateral for defined market segments and application areas with a focus on IT/cloud
Develop and deliver agreed marketing tactics on time as defined in the annual marketing plan and Marcom planning calls
Be a marketing product expert/champion for sales & marketing, distribution channel, customers, and press, media and industry analysts
Develop and deliver sales and support trainings for product positioning and competitive analysis
Represent, show and promote Chromeleon to internal and external customers
Support commercial teams in their sales activities for Chromeleon
Become the primary interface for IT and cloud related interactions with the commercial teams and business unit peers
Reply to written or phone requests for pre-sales support activities from the commercial team
Cooperate with sales support to drive training and product promotion
Conduct joint visits with the commercial team to key customers
Provide market insights, application understanding and sales messaging for specific market segments
Be the key subject matter expert and “go-to” person to eCDS peers on all IT/cloud market and application topics
Develop competitive position and winning points for Chromeleon Enterprise including IaaS/SaaS software
Understand, document and share market and customer needs for defined market segments
Understand market/customer dynamics to lead portfolio adjustments
Provide feedback to Product Managers and core team regarding key customer criteria for successful future product roadmap and feature enhancements
Requirements:
University degree in Software. Analytical Science, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or similar sciences OR minimum of eight years practical experience with CDS/LIMS software operation in a (WAN) network and/or the cloud
Five or more years practical experience in managing a networked (ideally WAN) CDS (ideally Chromeleon) installation in an IT or system administrator role.
Detailed knowledge on CDS system administration
Good understanding of cloud infrastructure and experience of running/deploying applications in WAN or VPC environment
Excellent written and oral presentation skills
Fluency in English language
Advanced communication skills
Highly desirable:
Experience in managing enterprise software deployed in the cloud (IaaS, SaaS)
Understanding of (regulatory) requirements of the pharmaceutical and/or food safety industries
High-level understanding of market drivers and applications in adjacent markets (biopharmaceutical, chemical/petrochemical, environmental)
Good product knowledge on LIMS software
High degree of personal initiative and self management
Ability to influence others without direct control (Matrix management)
Ability to connect with customer base to determine business issues and devise innovative solutions.
At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 75,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Description
Position at NP Digital
SEO Internship
NP Digital – Chicago, IL, San Diego, CA or Remote, US
About NP Digital:
Neil Patel has been recognized by the Wall Street Journal, Forbes, and the United Nations, to name a few, as one of the most influential and successful marketers and entrepreneurs in the world. NP Digital is the agency that brings his passion and insights to life for some of the world’s more important brands.
NP Digital focuses on creating innovative, adaptive, and data-driven digital marketing plans for our clients. Obsessed with helping companies grow and exceed their goals, NP Digital strives to continually help brands connect and engage with their audience.
NP Digital combines proprietary platforms with best in class talent the business of digital marketing, all with the ultimate goal of serving our clients.
About the Opportunity:
Neil Patel Digital (NPD) is seeking a highly talented, forward-thinking SEO Intern who can help assist in implementation of search engine marketing campaigns, including keyword research, technical audits, metadata creation, and authority outreach campaigns.
Responsibilities:
Reporting to the SEO Manager:
Conduct keyword research for client campaigns based on client feedback, website topics, organic search results, competitor analysis, and industry research.
Learn fundamentals and best practices for SEO. Using these learnings, execute activities as assigned from campaign leads. These activities can include meta data optimization, copywriting, internal linking analysis, and more.
Review client and competitor websites for gaps, opportunities, and strategic insights for the campaign lead.
Compile performance reports that show clients SERP visibility and traffic trends from natural search.
Support digital marketing client onboarding, campaign setup, and research.
Assist other marketing departments on an as needed basis.
Skills & Expertise:
Bachelor’s degree (or in progress)
Prior digital marketing internships or work experience preferred but not required
Knowledge/experience with Google Analytics and/or SEO tools preferred but not required.
Outstanding Communication Skills (verbal & written)
Basic understanding of natural/organic search and passion for learning more within digital marketing
Data driven, analytical mindset and desire to learn new tools for research and reporting
Microsoft Office Suite/Google Docs (including proficiency in use of Excel and PowerPoint)
Personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and commitment to the mission of NP Digital
Our internships are designed as opportunities for Senior year students or recent graduates to gain valuable experience and training that will position them for a continued career at NP Digital (if a position is available at the end of the internship).
Compensation:
This is a paid internship with an hourly rate between $15-$20 p/hr based on experience/technical skillset. Once the internship is completed, there may be opportunity for successful candidates to transition into a full-time position as an Associate SEO Specialist within the organization, if available and deemed to be a fit.
Due to the investment made in our interns to provide training for a permanent role on our team, we are currently unable to accept applications from students not yet in their Senior year but hope those students will revisit our opportunities once eligible.
If students are still in school, the internship will comply with school’s internship guidelines to be eligible for school credit in addition to compensation.
Duration:
3-6 months at 10-29 hours/week based on intern’s availability and agency need.
Targeting a March 2021 start.
This role will not be benefits eligible during the duration of the internship.
We value our best-in-class company culture, which is results-driven, innovative, fast paced and fun. We encourage our employees to work with an entrepreneurial spirit and apply a businesslike approach. As an organization, we take a proactive role in investing in our employee’s professional development. We believe our employees are our greatest asset and welcome those who share our vision and drive to build great things together.
If you meet all the requirements and are interested in this position, please submit your resume and cover letter outlining any digital marketing experience or specific interest in joining the agency at https://npdigital.com/careers/.

Text:
At HCSC, building a talent engine for the future is a key priority because we recognize that as our business evolves to reflect the changing world, we must adapt our workforce to meet this challenge. Additionally, with "excellence" as one of our core values, we are focused on improving our success measures and delivering the best possible customer experience.

Job Purpose

This role will be responsible for driving strategic activities associated with Request for Proposal (RFPs) and Request for Information (RFI) requests. By joining our team, you will be challenged to lead, research, customize, organize and synthesize information to ensure the highest quality of service is provided, while remaining consistent with the Company's policies. In addition, you will participate in the activities involved in the resolution of issues associated with the RFPs and RFIs, owning them from start to finish.

As part of a proactive and collaborative team, you will exercise strict adherence to detailed customer specifications, while also drafting proposal materials to utilize as a reference tool when completing future proposals or internal requests will be an additional responsibility.

Required Job Qualifications
Bachelor Degree in Marketing, Communications, English, Journalism or related field OR 4 years of proposal writing experience in lieu of a degree3 years of proposal management experience specifically in the national/major or public sector.Demonstrated experience in leading complex RFPs for large, national employer groups.Must be proficient in quickly reviewing and analyzing proposal solicitations and related documents to pull out all pertinent informationDemonstrated experience supporting highly customized proposal responses tailored to the client.Strong interpersonal and communication skills (written and oral) with ability to interface and work effectively as part of a team and cross-functionallyDemonstrated ability to autonomously lead the proposal process from beginning to end, while working multiple RFPs/projects simultaneouslyPC skills and experience in Microsoft products.Verbal and written communication skills to complete Response for Proposals, coordinate activities with many departments, and incorporate layman terms in the proposal.Demonstrated project management, organizing, planning and scheduling.Demonstrated creative and business writing skills.

Preferred Job Qualifications
Experience and skills with proposal automation software such as Qorus.Proposal writing experience in the commercial, healthcare industry.

Permanent telecommuting options available if based out of Illinois, Texas, New Mexico, or Oklahoma.

JobTitle: Business Consultant - Digital Marketing & CX Strategy Consultant
Text:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales
Job Details
Department Description:
Business Consulting is Salesforce’s pre-sales Marketing & CX Strategy Consultancy. We hire senior level, data-driven marketing and CX engagement experts to accelerate transformation & growth for our customers and for salesforce.
Business consultants are practitioners, thought leaders, innovators and problem solvers who apply our experience and executive-level consulting acumen coupled with our proven Salesforce consulting methodology to help marketing business executives take a data-driven approach to reimagining their consumer experience, personalizing the moments that matter and developing their strategic roadmap to realize value with Salesforce.
Role Description:
This role collaborates with internal team members and leaders (across sales, service, product, marketing, solution engineering and other Salesforce Innovation teams) and C-level client contacts (Focus on the CMO, the CDO and their teams) in the Retail and Consumer Goods industries. Business consultants help drive consensus in and across our customers' lines of business around digital strategic vision as well as key areas of focus through a value-based, pragmatic roadmap to execution. This person must assume the role of trusted advisor for driving innovative digital strategies forward with customers while also improving overall Salesforce business performance. The Business Consultant focuses primarily in these areas:
Business/Marketing/CX Problem Solving: Take ambiguous/complex challenges and, using research, personal experience, business assessment capabilities and customer experience acumen, clearly define problems, identify opportunities, drive innovative new ideas, and recommend actionable, prioritized next steps to make a big impact on customer needs/goals.
Innovation Management: Bring rigor to a client’s decision making process by performing detailed cost/benefit analysis, running workshops, presenting and evaluating solution options, and driving consensus among key stakeholders. In some instances, we help our clients develop new decision frameworks and governance processes that continue to deliver value far beyond a particular engagement. A Business Consultant is a seasoned story builder and storyteller, who can lead a room of executives to consensus.
Solution Planning: Define scope and plan new solutions for clients. This includes determining how to measure business results, modeling current/future business processes, gathering business requirements and identifying the organizational changes required to successfully realize the benefits of the solution.
Your Impact:
A Business Consultant at Salesforce plays a pivotal role in developing innovative B2C, B2B and B2B2C digital engagement strategies with key enterprise and commercial strategic customers, in a “pre-sales” environment to help expand, elevate, strengthen and grow customer relationships which fuels growth for all.
Minimum Requirements:
• 10+ years of digital marketing/CRM/D2C experience with at least 7 years focused exclusively on the digital space
• Proven experience leading digital strategy and digital roadmap projects in a complex business and marketing environment, including guiding C-level leadership to consensus
• Deep understanding of and passion for the customer lifecycle, managing the consumer experience and taking a data-driven approach to personalization
• Retail or Consumer Goods industry experience and focus
• Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills; dynamic (persuasive) in creating & presenting new ideas to current customers, prospective customers and internal stakeholders (VP to C-level)
• Strong understanding of marketing & advertising industry, martech trends and the overall SaaS landscape
• Ability to understand, communicate and manage across the entire project lifecycle
• This position is defined as a “remote employee “(work from home office), with expected travel to clients and for internal team collaboration (post-pandemic): ~30% (was 50% pre-pandemic)
Preferred Requirements:
• Ability to develop data-driven business value cases to support recommendations and inform prioritization
• Demonstrated success driving organizational change within client organizations
• Past experience in organizational design consulting, process design and optimization, digital governance, and team dynamics a strong plus
• New business opportunity identification
Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
Posting Statement
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com or Salesforce.org.
Salesforce welcomes all.
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

We’re hiring for a School-based Social Worker for the current 2020/21 school year: Remote High School and then onsite starting in April.
Futures Education is seeking to hire a Full Time Social Worker or our Charter-based partner schools in Chicago, IL.
Futures Education is a unique organization that provides management and clinical staff to schools located in several locations throughout the United States. First and foremost, we are hands-on practitioners and educators, committed to best practices, research, and data-driven decision making that provides authenticity to our work and allows us to provide unparalleled service to our client partners. Futures Education is therapist owned and operated, and our mission is to build better lives.
As a member of our team, the Social Workers’ responsibilities include:
Responding to the emotional needs of the children both in the group and in individual situations, with appropriate challenge, encouragement and behavior management.
Conducting initial or triannual assessments and develop treatment plans based on the outcomes of those assessments.
Participating in IEP and Eligibility meetings to present your findings and results and discuss how to best support students’ needs.
Providing parents with information regarding resources and therapeutic activities in the community.
Providing information, when appropriate, to outside support services to help students with economic, emotional, or physical issues.
Completing state and local mandated documentation and/or billing requirements.
How we support & invest in your career:
Dedicated Area Manager. We have a great support system in place with three on the ground Area Managers and always there for you to provide support & mentoring. In fact, our Area Managers are clinicians who work in schools, as well!
Professional development stipend.
School Social Worker Education and Experience:
Master’s Degree in School Social Work
Type 73 Certification (PEL) & Licensed Social Worker
Related school-based experience and familiarity with the Impact Service Capture program preferred, but not required.
Bilingual preferred, not required.
Each day offers a chance for us to improve someone’s life. Do you want to help make a difference? Reach out today! To apply to this position, please visit www.discoverfutures.com You may also contact Chris in the recruiting office at cmcdaniels@futureshealth.com or 904.295.2963

Lochner, a leader in transportation engineering, is seeking a Part-Time/Flexible Human Resources Recruiter/Sourcer to support our Recruiting, Onboarding, and Offboarding processes. You will play a key role in supporting hiring managers in identifying, selecting, and coordinating new employees at Lochner. This position can be based remotely and requires a commitment of between 20-30 hours per week.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES/CORE ACCOUNTABILITIES
Manage the full-cycle recruitment process, including posting jobs, sourcing candidates, screening, arranging interviews, interviewing, collecting feedback, reviewing offer letters, pre-employment processing, and onboarding new hires.
Utilize social media and web-based recruiting platforms to attract the most qualified candidate.
Mine and source candidate resumes from internet job boards and other sources for current openings and maintains a proactive pipeline for future needs.
Work with external recruiting resources, career fairs, colleges and universities, and professional organizations in expanding Lochner’s network.
Facilitate recruiting strategy meetings with individual hiring managers, providing guidance to identify and assist with hiring the best talent during all recruitment processes.
Track candidate lifecycle through the firm's applicant tracking system.
Coach Hiring Managers on the interview and selection process to ensure optimal top talent selection.
Manage new hire onboarding and offboarding processes.
Perform other human resources duties and responsibilities as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree required
4 years of Human Resources and Recruiting experience required
Experience in civil engineering and/or transportation industries preferred
Customer-centric attitude with the ability to work with varying people and cultures
Ability to establish credibility and engender trust with employees; Impeccable integrity, confidentiality, professionalism, and ethical standards
Must possess strong verbal and written communication skills; demonstrated ability to craft high-quality candidate communications
Demonstrated ability to manage data, create spreadsheets, and make meaning of large amounts of data
Working knowledge of State and federal labor laws
Working proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel; Adobe Creative and other Human Resources systems and tools

We prefer candidates with at least two years of experience in SEO, and require a minimum of one year of experience.Our Client is a boutique agency – instead of teams of subject matter experts who only do one thing over and over again, each consultant handles every aspect for each of the select group of clients he or she works with.As an SEO Consultant, responsibilities include:Timely completion of tasks designed to improve SEO performanceImplement strategies to increase site traffic through SEO best practicesPerform campaign set up, keyword research, competitor research, and identify a road map for improvementProvide SEO analysis, recommendations, and strategy during monthly reporting callsProvide SEO analysis for website and site structureBuild local inbound links to each client’s websiteMonitor and evaluate campaign results in order to communicate any issues to your team leadCommunicate and work effectively within a team structureQualifications & Skills:Firm understanding of SEO best practicesExperience in link-building is a BIG PLUS but not requiredProficient in keyword research and competitive analysisAbility to effectively multi-task and hit deadlinesCapable of working as part of a team and as an individual contributorCurious and active learner who seeks out professional developmentAdditional:Strong consideration for candidates with Local SEO experienceStrong consideration for candidates with 2 or more years of SEO experienceStrong consideration for candidates with experience using the following tools: Google Data Studio, STAT Analytics, Places Scout.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $45,000.00 - $55,000.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftExperience:SEO: 2 years (Required)

Job Description
We are looking for energetic, career-minded, self-motivated professionals to join our growing company and help families protect their futures with life insurance and other financial products. If you are new in the field, we will provide you the best training in the industry. If you are experienced in business management and marketing, we will give you the support you need to ensure your success.
The ideal candidate must possess a strong work ethic and fantastic communication skills. You must be passionate about helping people and driven—yet humble and coachable.
This sales position involves no cold calling, no door knocking, and no begging for business. No high-pressure sales tactics are needed—or allowed! We work exclusively with clients who asked for our help.
Here's how it works:
EARNINGS POTENTIAL:
Our typical broker working full-time in the field goes on ten appointments per week, sells five policies, and earns a commission of around $500 per sale. That adds up to around $2,500 a week, $10,000 a month, $120,000 a year.
The right person can be promoted to an Agency Manager within 12 months.

PERKS:
Be your own boss.
Work from home (pajamas optional!).
Set your own full-time or part-time schedule and work the hours that fit into your busy life.
Feel great knowing you’ve protected families from serious financial risks.
Travel to our national events where you’ll learn, collaborate with other professionals, and have fun!

OUR PRODUCTS:
As a broker, you’ll match clients to the products that best fit their needs from a number of insurance carriers. Our key products are simplified life insurance policies that require no medical underwriting and pay the client’s mortgage in the event of death to keep the family in their home. Many clients choose our return-of-premium policies that return every penny of premium to clients who survive their policies—we call it “money-back” life insurance. We also offer products like whole life insurance and annuities.
If you’re ready to join a group of passionate, honest, hard-working professionals making a difference in the lives of those they meet, please text the number below to schedule a phone appointment with the hiring managers Joe or Amanda Catran.
You may hit the "Apply" button but texting the number below will get a faster response!
You may also schedule a telephone interview with Joe or Amanda Catran by texting the word "LETSCHAT" to (727) 655-9277. I highly recommend the chat feature!
If commission scares you then please do not apply!

WE ARE HIRING!
Do you want to work for a top-rated Sales organization?
Are you looking to launch a successful career in sales?
Are you interested in providing products and services that help the environment?

Stericycle is currently seeking talented, competitive individuals to join our growing Sales organization. As an Inside Sales Executive, you would be responsible for incremental revenue through inbound and outbound sales calls. This includes lead campaigns and telephone prospecting targeting Small and Medium (SMB) existing customers and new prospects. Conducts business needs analysis and develops appropriate service solutions for the customer/prospect. Focuses sales activities on value-added service lines such as After-hours answering services, Automated appointment reminders and other revenue generating activities. Responsible for retaining customers that are considered 'at risk', have been identified as potential lost business, or have requested cancellation of service with Stericycle. Determine customers' needs/requirements and negotiate an appropriate resolution by right sizing, price adjustments, and/or resolving service quality issues. You will be provided with the latest technology, tools and training to ensure best chance of success. Top performers will be rewarded with lucrative commissions, opportunities for growth and advancement, recognition trips, and more. Stericycle was recently recognized as one of Selling Power’s “50 Best Companies to Sell For”!

The Inside Sales Representative will be working remotely but subject to change according to our company policy. Key Job Activities:
1) Makes Outbound and receives Inbound sales calls for potentially new and/or existing customers to sell our products and/or services. Acquires new customers and converts existing customers through prospecting in assigned territory, outbound marketing/lead campaigns and referrals
2) Effectively qualify clients through the use of Value-Based selling methods. Researches customer/prospect history and business needs in order to develop a complete service proposal, while targeting upgrade and cross-sell opportunities of additional Stericycle products/services. Sell the value of the recommended solution, and retain/up-sell revenue if possible.
3) Respond to customer concerns and proactively contact customers who have been identified as “at risk” for cancelling services using approved sales tactics and strategies to retain potential lost business. Utilize ‘Value Based Sales Skills’ to uncover client’s existing service issues and needs, explain contract obligations if any, and provide alternative solutions for consideration. Address assigned customer issues and concerns timely.
4) Builds a pipeline of potential future business by prospecting via the Internet, assigned territory lists, outbound marketing/lead campaigns and other sources as identified. Forecasts Quarterly, Monthly and Weekly sales metrics within 5% of actual results and provides reports to SMB ComSol Sales Management. Effectively meets assigned performance factors (key expectations) within assigned parameters.
5) Work with cross functional team members including transportation, billing, collections, sales, and customer experience departments to assist in providing satisfactory solutions from the customer perspective in order to retain business, and leverage communication from other departments to identify sales opportunities.
6) Effectively uses technology based CRM (Customer Relationship Management) SalesForce, tool for lead follow-up, sale cycle disposition, pipeline management, forecasting and lost opportunity tracking. Keeps comprehensive and accurate notes in the system.
7) Provide tracking data to the Inside Sales organization to assist in developing policies and programs to help drive sales. Identify sales trends when possible and provide management with updates.
8) Perform other miscellaneous and related duties as required or requested. Education: Required Education: in College graduate or Equivalent Disclaimer:
The above description is meant to provide a summary of the nature and level of work being performed; it should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and requirements of the job or person. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise. Stericycle will consider requests for workplace accommodations for protected physical or mental limitations in accordance with its human resources policies and local laws.To the extent permissible under local law, and consistent with business necessity, Stericycle reserves the right to modify the content formally or informally, either verbally or in writing, at any time with or without advance notice.
