Cloud Security Architect Manager
Location: Open Nationally/Remote

Are you passionate about technology and interested in joining a community of collaborative colleagues who respectfully and courageously seek to challenge the status quo? If so, read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity with Deloitte’s Information Technology Services (ITS). We are curious and life-long learners focused on technology and innovation.

Work you’ll do
As a Cloud Security Architect Manager, you will be responsible for evaluating new solutions and developing the supporting elements required to incorporate new technologies in a safe and secure manner. Deloitte currently maintains large number complex applications and your focus on security for infrastructure services and business applications will be paramount to our success. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in cloud-based development and security management in IaaS, PaaS and SaaS environments. For consideration to this job posting, candidates must possess hands-on experience in designing for both small and large-scale solutions with an emphasis on security and performance.
You will be responsible for gathering technical requirements, architecting solutions and executing on deliverables addressing Deloitte policies around on-premise and off-premise Cloud solutions. You will lead and coordinate the work of an integrated project team comprised of multiple technical disciplines, including developers, subject matter experts, database administrators, system administrators, and system architects to implement and maintain enterprise-level information technology applications. The role serves as a technical lead on all Cyber matters from best practices to Cloud controls covering required compliance requirements based on data classification. You will also serve as a senior advisor to leadership concerning the planning, development, design, procurement, maintenance and implementation of enterprise-level Cloud systems. Other key responsibilities will be to produce architecture diagrams, blueprints and to bring solutions to reality with a DevSecOps mindset & culture.
Responsibilities:
Provide technical guidance and foster a collective understanding of data flows and security issues encountered in cloud applications and services
Incorporate business drivers, needs and strategies to address future business / technology needs
Work in Agile methodology and partner with scrum teams for secure application and/or infrastructure solution architecture
Lead Cloud Security Architecture on assigned projects using any Cloud Service Provider (CSP)
Lead Cloud Security DevOps with different scrum teams and plan user stories for sprints while addressing requirements and orchestrating security impact
Work closely with development teams on Infrastructure as Code, Automation, and Orchestration
Provide Security posture and best practices for deploying web and service-based applications in Windows/Linux environments using containers
Provide expert knowledge of cloud security architecture and consult with business and other technology teams to address complex application needs
Communicating implications of architectural decisions, issues and plans to business and IT Leadership
Exhibiting a high level of professional flexibility and volunteering innovation and new ideas
Driving the collaborative development of the technology strategy, technology standards, roadmaps, and practices
The team
Information Technology Services (ITS) the engine that drives Deloitte, which serves many of the world’s largest, most respected organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.

The ~2,200 professionals in ITS deliver services including:
Security, risk & compliance
Technology support
Infrastructure
Applications
Relationship management
Strategy
Deployment
PMO
Financials
Communications
Cyber Security
Cyber Security vigilantly protects Deloitte and client data. The team leads a strategic cyber risk program that adapts to a rapidly changing threat landscape, changes in business strategies, risks, and vulnerabilities. Using situational awareness, threat intelligence, and building a security culture across the organization, the team helps to protect the Deloitte brand.

Areas of focus include:
Risk & Compliance
Identity & Access Management
Data Protection
Cyber Design
Incident Response
Security Architecture
Business Partnership
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems Security, or equivalent professional experience
Verifiable 6+ years as an Enterprise Security Architect and/or Systems Engineer; With an additional 4+ years in designing cloud frameworks or implementing cloud security
Experience in large scale enterprise Cloud projects from ideation to finished production product
5 or more years of experience doing application and/or infrastructure solution architecture
4 or more years of experience building cloud architecture with Azure, using Azure Resource Manager, Azure IaaS, PaaS offerings and services in Azure Commercial offerings or the AWS equivalent products and services
4 years or more of hands-on experience migrating customers to the cloud and designing DevOps operational processes, deployment checklists, etc.
Experience and understanding of Infrastructure as Code, Automation, and Orchestration
Experience deploying web and service-based applications in Windows/Linux environments
Demonstrate experience and knowledge involving the development of multi-tier and cross-platform architecture plans to include enterprise workflows, and distributed intranet/internet architecture
A background in general security practices such as identity and access management (IAM), encryption, multi-factor authentication, security information and event management (SIEM), and supporting technologies
Superior communication (verbal and written), problem solving, collaboration, presentation, executive presence and interpersonal skills
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Desired Skills / Certification:
AWS Certified Security
Azure Architect Certification
Google Architect Certification
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)
Broad knowledge and experience across IT infrastructure with security frameworks and standards such as ISO 27001, NIST, and other relevant security-related regulations

How you’ll grow
At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.
Deloitte’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.

Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

Major Market Sales Executive
Remote Territory covering Central US

Job Summary:
Are you a hunter and solution-driven seller who loves the thrill of cultivating new business and delivering results? As a Major Market Sales Executive, you will source, call on, and sell Paycor solutions to new prospects and clients within your assigned territory. The pace is quick, the activity is high and the rewards are great. If you’re a self-starter who can meet the challenge, keep reading.
This is the job for you, if:
Competition drives you. You were involved in sports, love a good game of trivia, and you won’t be beat at a friendly game of Monopoly.
In an alternate life, you would be a private investigator or a detective. You’re great at digging up prospective clients or referral partners in new and innovative ways.
You thrive under pressure. The thought of pushing and being pushed beyond your boundaries to introduce and sell innovative solutions in an ever-changing industry excites you.
You’re a natural seller. You had the best lemonade stand on the block as a kid and you’re consistently a top seller in your current role.
You’ll talk to anyone at a party. You’re a natural networker and can make conversation with everyone.
Getting in front of your clients and prospects face to face is invaluable to you. You’re ready and willing to rack up frequent flier miles and log road hours.
This is what you’ll do:
Source, engage and educate new prospective clients*
Sell the full suite of Paycor products and services in person and over the phone*
Develop and maintain excellent relationships with Bank, Broker, and CPA referral partners*
Assist in the conversion process for new clients to ensure a successful onboarding experience
Meet and exceed your agreed upon sales quotas and activity goals*
Drive client satisfaction by partnering with the Client Services team
Maintain accurate records of your interactions in our Salesforce CRM
Indicates essential job functions
This is what we’re looking for:
4 year business degree preferred
3+ years’ successful track record in B2B sales
Independent seller able to keep up with a fast-paced environment
Excellent communications and technical presentation skills to win over potential clients
Strong mathematical aptitude and problem solving skills
Record of success in sales

Experienced with a large enterprise project.

Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world’s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company’s 38,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Va., Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $11.09 billion for the fiscal year ended January 3, 2020. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.
Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here.
Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

Company Summary:
Alviere empowers every business to provide financial services to its customers quickly and easily. By providing an advanced single-integration plug and play software service, Alviere streamlines and automates the delivery of financial products like banking, mobile payments, card issuance, payment processing and cross-border currency exchange, enabling its clients to strengthen customer relationships, increase revenue and maximize profits.
Job Summary:
As the first Head of Sales for Alviere, you will work closely with executive leadership to bring on new Brands and Fintech customers to our platform. You will oversee core sales functions that enable us to develop new business, enable new customers, and delight our existing customers. You will partner closely with our initial set of customers to ensure they continue to successfully launch and scale our financial products. Position will report directly to the CEO.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Build and Manage your own Sales team, design sales targets and be responsible for team performance against those targets
Partner with the executive and Finance teams, you’ll build pipeline and sales goals to ensure Alviere hits its revenue targets
Own and evolve our sales strategy with a clear vision and articulation of the specific brand verticals/segments we’re targeting and our approach
Design and communicate a multi-year sales roadmap and share it with the wider company to provide insight into our focus
Oversee all sales activities around new clients, renewals, and upselling - ensuring customer success
Partner with our head of product and engineering to improve usability and refine our product strategy based on customer feedback
A successful Head of Sales will have the following:
Demonstrated track record of building a B2B sales organization at an early stage
Experience in a highly analytical, results-oriented environment with external customer interaction required
Experience hiring, retaining and developing a scaled team. You are an excellent motivator, and can also have tough conversations when needed
You can clearly and effectively collaborate across teams and can combine a “platform as a service” way of thinking with a very relationship-driven approach
Excellent written and oral communication, as well as presentation skills and the ability to express thoughts logically and succinctly
Experience working with legal, product, and internal business owners to reach mutually beneficial agreements
Education: Bachelor’s degree (four-year college or university) or equivalent combination of education and work experience
Years of experience needed: 10+ years of B2B sales experience, 3+ years in B2B sales leadership
We pride ourselves on developing and promoting talent as an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer - Veteran/Disability. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. We are a true merit-based organization and work hard so there are no artificial barriers to one's potential success. Alviere is committed to a workforce where everyone's opportunities are limitless.

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.


Your Impact:

At Jacobs, we don’t settle – always looking beyond to raise the bar and deliver with excellence. We apply our expertise and knowledge as we look into the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference.

As a Client Account Partner (CAP) you will have the opportunity to partner with client account leadership on our top clients to develop and drive sales strategy through market and industry research, leadership, communication, organization, and planning on both an account and opportunity level.

Jacobs’ CAPs exhibit strong strategic thinking, industry knowledge, business acumen, competitor knowledge and experience, and are ultimately able to translate sales strategies into client development and pursuit approaches that win projects.

You’ll be empowered to lead client account development, project positioning and pursuit leadership activities for out topic client priorities. This includes working with our account teams to:
o develop account plan(s) and support consistency in account development
o understand client business and priorities to align with Jacobs strategies
o track and develop pursuit opportunities
o support in client development and positioning activities, both internally and externally
o drive consistent sales strategies and key account messaging through proposal and interview

If you are a sales leader that is a strong collaborator and has a willingness to play several roles as an integral part of our account teams, this may be the position you’re looking for.
Here’s What You’ll Need:

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in marketing, journalism, engineering, construction, or other similar field related to our industry preferred.
At least 10 years of client development, and sales experience within the AEC (Architecture, Engineering, Construction) industry.
Experience in water/wastewater is highly desirable.
Ability to look at the big picture, think strategically and have excellent planning skills.
Self-motivated with a willingness to take initiative and solve complex problems
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Committed to success in support of the company’s strategic goals and profitable growth
Proven ability to work with people of multiple disciplines
Strong leader with ability to mobilize resources (people, material, support), solve problems, and work collaboratively with a team in a fast-paced environment; ability to handle multiple simultaneous projects and work under strict deadlines required.
#LI-Remote
Location is flexible, as the candidates can be located anywhere in the Midwest Region of the US
Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.

At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Together we are powering the future of Higher Education
Here at Ellucian, we are motivated by a mission ~ the power of education to transform lives and change the world. We are the global market leader in EdTech for Higher Education, serving more than 2,700 customers and reaching over 20 million students in 50+ countries. We are dedicated to helping Higher Ed thrive by transforming their institutions to agile, digitally connected campuses that enable student success.

INTERNSHIP PROGRAM DESCRIPTION:
For us, an internship is more than just checking a box. It's about learning and developing your skills and exploring your curiosity to figure out what you like or want to do next as you launch your career. You won't be getting coffee for your manager; you'll be given tools to learn alongside your team and work on relevant projects that make a difference on college campuses.
Some of our most senior leaders came-up through our program and have continued to make a mark because of our collaborative and supportive culture. Our 12-week paid program will allow you to share ideas with our executives, develop your professional brand, and live the #ellucianlife.

At Ellucian, our Experience Design Team is committed to creating empowering and innovative student solutions. In this position you will get a deep dive into the UX process, participate in user research, create design assets, and fine-tune your storytelling skills. If you are a student with a strong sense of design and looking to break into the world of Experience Design, please apply.

Req ID: 2777
Hiring Type: Full - Time

Remote: Yes

Internship Description:

Have you ever wondered how television commercials get to your TV? Or about the strategy behind which commercials air on which networks and why? If you ever had an interest in Advertising Sales or Ad Sales Marketing, an Ad Sales Internship could be the perfect fit for you! Advertising Sales is a key revenue stream for Discovery working with national advertisers and their agencies to sell commercial space on our networks.

As an Ad Sales Intern, your adventure could lead you to work on projects and tasks such as:Create client presentationsAnalyze ratings through Nielsen, MRI, Lake 5 and Ad-ViewsReport on trends and complete competitor analysesDevelop marketing plans and/or creative proposalsExecute inventory management & analysisMonitor performance indicators for sales campaignsGet an in depth view of how the advertising industry works!

Although our summer internship program will be completely remote (students can apply from anywhere), please be aware that this intern will report into a Chicago based manager and therefore should expect to work on central standard time.
Requirements:
Must be currently enrolled as a student (proof of enrollment will be required if selected for an internship)Must be a rising Junior, Senior, or Graduate studentMust have at least a 3.0 GPAMust have the legal right to work in the United States.
More About the Intern Program:

Discovery’s internationally recognized intern program attracts the country’s boldest and brightest students for a paid, for-credit, real-world work experience in the entertainment and media industry.

Like other Fortune 500 companies, we believe in immersing our students in all aspects of our business, giving them first hand experience working for the global leader in real life entertainment. So what sets us apart? We’re passionate about investing in our interns- both personally and professionally. Whether our program is in-person or remote, every semester is packed with speaker sessions with executives, LinkedIn profile reviews, recruiter panels, roundtable events and professional seminars- and that just scratches the surface.

Think our program sounds pretty awesome? Our former interns thought so too! This year, we were voted into Vault’s 2021 internship rankings for best overall internships, best media and telecom internships, best sales and marketing internships and best internships for diversity.

Ready to learn more? Here’s what we offer:
Mentorship from some of the industry’s kindest and most passionate entertainment veterans
Professional development seminars, panels with recruiters and former interns, intern-exclusive events, and so much more
Access to top level executives and employees through our Speaker Series and Roundtables
Incredible networking opportunities and a robust intern alumni network
A creative, collaborative and inclusive company culture

What you can expect to take away from the semester:
Opportunity to develop professionally and uncover skills you didn’t know you had
The insider scoop on the TV industry and what happens behind the scenes
Relationships that will go beyond your collegiate career
Real life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventure
And finally, what to know before applying:
We offer 12 week spring and summer opportunities
Our Summer 2021 program will be fully remote- the program will run from June 2-August 20.
The application deadline for Summer 2021 is March 19th. After this date, we cannot guarantee your application will be reviewed for the position.
Our internships are paid opportunities. Credit is not required; however, we will provide necessary documentation for school credit if desired.
We do not require a cover letter- please do not submit one. Instead, demonstrate your passion for the position through your resume and interviews.
Interviewing will take place from February through mid-April. A Discovery Intern team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open internship position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.

Global MidCorp provides expertise and insurance solutions to small and medium sized businesses. Our global offerings include Package products, Business Owners Policy, monoline Casualty and Property products, as well as Programs. Key differentiators in the market include expertise in Multinational Business, innovative loss control services (Allianz Risk Consulting) and capability to provide cross-LoB offerings. AGCS MidCorp team includes locations in Hong Kong, South Africa, Denmark and the United States.

As an intern, you will work in a virtual environment and gain real employee experience from a top Insurance organization. We place a high value on our interns and involve them in real work with a real business impact, making our internships in a class of their own. The intern will participate with and contribute to the Midcorp underwriting teams. The internship program is designed to provide the intern with an opportunity to apply a macro understanding of risk in the real world by working side-by-side with our underwriting and operational support team professionals. Interns will participate in a wide range of learning and development opportunities including job shadows, attendance at internal meetings, speaking engagements and events designed to expose the intern to other areas of AGCS.
Underwriting
Identification and analysis of new technological developments through the lens of insurance and risk. Processing transactions on (LoBs) underwriting; may include quotations, new business issuance, policy changes & renewals
Special Projects
Will collaborate on a proof of concept for a new product offering
Will be given other projects that can be completed within the length of the internship
On the Job Learning
Participate in a wide range of learning and development activities focused on immersing the intern into how insurance works and being able to apply a macro understanding of technology and technological developments in the real world by working side by side with underwriting, claims and support team professionals
Allianz is the home for those who dare – a supportive place where you can take the initiative to grow and to actively strengthen our global leadership position. By truly caring about people – both its 100 million private and corporate customers and more than 147,000 employees – Allianz fosters a culture where its employees are empowered to collaborate, perform, embrace trends and challenge the industry. Our main ambition is to be our customers’ trusted partner, instilling them with the confidence to grow. If you dare, join us at Allianz Group.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

 Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty (AGCS) is a leading global corporate insurance carrier and a key business unit of Allianz Group. We provide risk consultancy, Property-Casualty insurance solutions and alternative risk transfer for a wide spectrum of commercial, corporate and specialty risks across 10 dedicated lines of business.
Our customers are as diverse as business can be, ranging from Fortune Global 500 companies to small businesses, and private individuals. Among them are not only the world’s largest consumer brands, tech companies and the global aviation and shipping industry, but also wineries, satellite operators or Hollywood film productions. They all look to AGCS for smart answers to their largest and most complex risks in a dynamic, multinational business environment and trust us to deliver an outstanding claims experience.

 Worldwide, AGCS operates with its own teams in 32 countries and through the Allianz Group network and partners in over 200 countries and territories, employing over 4,300 people. As one of the largest Property-Casualty units of Allianz Group, we are backed by strong and stable financial ratings. In 2019, AGCS generated a total of €9.1 billion gross premium globally.
For more information, visit www.agcs.allianz.com or follow us on Twitter @AGCS_Insurance and LinkedIn.

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, and you’ll be valued and recognized for your performance. With talented managers and inspiring coworkers to support you, you’ll find the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.

How will you make an impact?

The Client Services Manager will be responsible for developing, launching, streamlining and managing global Licensing and Commercial Supply (LCS) processes and procedures related to pre-sale activities, quote-to-cash processes, and post-sale support. Specifically, the individual will support the LCS Segment Leads responsible for driving and supporting the Genetic Sciences Division (GSD).

What will you do?
Develop, refine and manage the methods and processes to enable the effective and efficient flow of information between internal Thermo Fisher Scientific teams (i.e., Operations, R&D, Product Management, etc.) and external-facing Business Development Managers (BDMs).
Coordinate the gathering, development, approval, and execution of activities to assist the BDMs and LCS Segment Leaders to address LCS customer needs and requirements. These tasks will include but not be limited to:
Interaction with R&D
Direct Customer support
Early access product support
Interaction with the following functions within Operations:
Manufacturing
Technical operations
Project Management Office (PMO)
Quality
Regulatory
Manage and own the relationships, communications and interaction with key operational partners at global sites in order to manage, improve and develop processes related to post-sale support of customers, BDMs, and LCS Segment Leader, and update customers as appropriate in partnership with BDMs.
Manage and own key performance indicators (KPIs) related to pre-sale activities, quote-to-cash processes, and post-sale support.
How will you get here?

Education
High school diploma required, Bachelor's degree preferred.
Experience
Minimum 1-3 years of direct experience delivering exceptional customer service within a life sciences/biotechnology company;
1-3 years of experience in supporting products in a variety of development stages; for example, the development of custom products and/or projects, including experience with costing models, stage/gate development, quality control procedures, life science kit production, etc.
Demonstrated experience in and familiarity with:
Managing customer communications
Order handling and logistics
Partnering with field sales to manage sales opportunities
Customer-facing experience
Driving projects to completion
Quoting process and procedures
Working within a highly matrixed organization to partner with Finance, Quality, R&D, Manufacturing, Business, and Regulatory colleagues
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Customer service mindset for both internal and external clients
Excellent written and oral communication; must be able to effectively communicate with internal and external customers
Ability to influence and manage Team members to drive results without having direct authority.
Problem-solving; must be able to quickly identify the root cause of issues and develop appropriate mitigation path(s)
Demeanor: must work well with others and drive an agenda with diplomacy
Builds relationships easily and manages relationships with integrity
Ability to work independently and/or in a group setting, with minimal supervision
Detail orientated
Big picture awareness
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon.

Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com

JobTitle: Manager, ESG Reporting - Opportunity for Working Remotely Chicago, IL
Text:
Job Title: Manager, ESG Reporting
Role Location: USA, Remote office
Reports to: Director, Sustainability & ESG
Job description
VMware’s Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) sits in the Office of the CTO. The ESG Office oversees and manages all ESG reporting, ratings and rankings. The Office facilitates ESG Steering Committees at the management and executive levels, as well as leads on VMware’s 2030 Agenda.
The position will lead and manage all of VMware’s ESG reporting. This role is both strategic and pragmatic; requiring that we execute on our annual reporting commitments, as well as continue to mature our reporting processes and outputs. You will be responsible for evolving VMware’s sustainability/ESG reporting and supporting in the development of meaningful public disclosure strategies. You will be responsible for gathering data and information, shaping and developing our sustainability stories, and translating key sustainability messages into mediums for different target audiences (e.g., investors, customers, employees, etc.).
Key responsibilities include:
Annual reporting & assessments
Manage, oversee and complete VMware’s ESG Indicators & Metrics
Manage, oversee and complete VMware’s Global Impact/ESG Report
Manage, oversee and complete CDP’s Climate response
Support Finance with ESG disclosures in Form 10-K
Respond to key ESG surveys, inquiries and ratings agencies (DJSI, EcoVadis, MSCI, JUST and others) and perform ongoing due diligence and regular monitoring of VMware’s ESG scores.
Support Investor Relations for all investor and board reporting of ESG including materials, reports, and presentations.
Continue to deepen alignment with GRI, SASB and TCFD
Partner with risk management and finance on TCFD
Lead on future materiality assessments
Build relationships across functions and business units to enable opportunities for improvement
ESG communications expert
Ensure ESG reporting and monitoring communication is aligned with VMware’s strategy, brand and purpose.
Play a leadership role in partnering with Marketing and Communications to develop communication strategies for internal and external stakeholders.
Drive internal and external communication and reputation of ESG progress, leveraging external partners, ESG awards, and other influencer initiatives.
Key requirements
5+ years of experience as a sustainability/ESG practitioner, with direct experience leading sustainability reporting projects.
Skilled at leading and managing without authority.
Ability to work at and navigate all levels of an organization, driving decisions and direction through influence, including executive and senior business stakeholders.
Highly organized with strong project management skills.
Strong interpersonal skills, with ability to lead complex stakeholder processes.
Strong execution skills, with ability to work independently while pursuing organizational and team goals.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; with demonstrated experience presenting to large, high-profile audiences.
Bachelor’s degree (advanced degree preferred) or equivalent experience

Category : Business Strategy and Operations
Subcategory: Project Management
Experience: Manager and Professional
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Posted Date: 2021-02-03
VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Product Designer

Chicago, Illinois OR Warrenville, Illinois OR Remote United States

Our agreement with employees

DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what's right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you'll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.


The team

Our Product Experience team focuses on our customers and their business needs. We contribute from the concept all the way to the building of world-class product experiences by partnering with Product Managers, Program Managers, Software Engineers and other cross-functional teams. Together, we are a team of craftspeople who aim to make the complex look easy. We employ insights, pixels, and words to solve big problems and make delightful experiences.


The position

To be successful in this role, you'll bring your talent, passion, efficient design methods, strong analytical skills and inventive storytelling into our team. You'll be skilled at collaborating to bring cross-functional teams together around a common vision. You'll welcome feedback from a wide variety of stakeholders and research ideas, and tap your intuition and experience to make the right decision in the absence of definitive facts. You'll adeptly balance business needs with simple, engaging, user-centered solutions.

This role reports to the Manager of Product Design


Responsibilities

Championing design thinking, pushing yourself to explore big ideas before narrowing in on feasible, inventive solutions that sweat the small details.
Partnering with product management, engineering, research and content strategy to define the product direction, own the design execution and measure ongoing improvements.
Participating or assisting in running cross-functional design thinking workshops.
Producing deliverables for every stage of the design process - design concepts, wireframes, user flows, interactive prototypes, and pixel-perfect visual assets for web and mobile.
Testing your designs and iterating on them, with support from our research team.
Using and contributing new patterns to DocuSign's design system to maintain scalable design across our product ecosystem.
Taking advantage of all data points, such as analytics and research, to inform your work - but rely on your experience and intuition to fill in the gaps.
Contributing to and enjoying a creative, supportive culture for the entire Product Experience team.


Basic Qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience
Minimum of 5 years of designing consumer, enterprise and/or mobile user experiences for a large-scale web service


Preferred Qualifications
You're a creative problem solver and natural communicator who clearly articulates design decisions and tells compelling stories that inspire action.
You believe that designers have a responsibility for what we put into the world and you care deeply about shipping work that reflects well on your team and your company's brand.
You're curious, open-minded and ego-free. You have a growth mindset and thrive on continuous learning.
You're a deep thinker and natural communicator who clearly articulates design decisions and tells compelling stories that inspire action.
Experience working with cross-functional teams and a network of stakeholders
Proficiency in or focus on interaction or visual design, with a desire to learn or experience with prototyping and design research.
Proficiency with a design toolset and the ability to evolve those skills - our current tools include Miro, Figma, Abstract, & Sketch.
Portfolio of work inspired by user research demonstrating product design strategy, interaction design, visual design, prototyping, articulation of design rationale, strong communication and storytelling skills.


About Us

DocuSign® helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that's a good thing.

DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the discussion and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected category.

Location: 100% remote working role (you can work from anywhere in the world)Salary:  NegotiableHours:  Flexibility of working hours, according to your rhythm (no more than 160 per month)We are currently looking to welcome to our Team an experienced and skilled Customer Happiness Specialist in order to take the company to the next level.We at Vimerson Health are creating the model for the companies of the future. We are a 100% remote and happiness-led company that encourages self-empowerment and radical transparency. We put happiness, fulfillment, joy, peace, and harmony before everything. And we have the double advantage of helping people with our natural Dietary Health Supplements.In just 5 years from our inception, we at Vimerson Health have sold more than 3 million bottles of our supplements and continue to grow and expand. Our Culture prioritizes team members’ happiness over everything else (yes, even over sales and profit). We recognize that it’s impossible to do two things at the same time, so having to put things in order of priority we decided that our Team Members’ happiness and fulfillment are First, our Customers’ Happiness and fulfillment are Second, and revenue and profit are Third.We are self-funded therefore we have the freedom to make these decisions. We do not respond to a board of directors whose tendency is to focus on the short-term monetary goal. We have no rigid hours and boast our very own dedicated in-house Happiness Coach. At Vimerson we are creating a company, not for the next 10 years, but for the next 10 generations. We endeavor with an infinite mindset, one day at a time.Your Mission: As a valued member of the Customer Happiness Team, you don’t just LOVE Customer Service, you LIVE it. You enjoy helping people and thrive on going above and beyond to ensure people’s comfort, happiness, inner-fulfillment, peace, and joy. You have initiative, are adventurous, and have faith in your abilities to truly help people and make them happy. You are patient, empathetic and an attentive listener. You work hard and smart, are dedicated, and can meet multiple goals within deadlines. Most importantly you put happiness and fulfillment first, proactively seeking your ideal life/work harmony.As our Customer Happiness Specialist, you will: Uphold Vimerson’s core values of leading with customer happiness;Provide excellent customer service to our customers through chat, email, and phone calls with friendly, upbeat, and genuine responses;Evaluate customer inquiries promptly, identify questions or concerns and provide the best possible solution efficiently;Assess customers needs or desires and provide personalized supplement recommendations;Collaborate with other departments serving as an internal representative and advocate for customer needs;Be motivated to meet or exceed key performance targets, both personally and as a teamFollow team communication procedures, policies, and guidelines;Perform each duty above with our customers’ happiness as your number one priority;Requirements: Have at least 1 year of relevant customer service experience;Have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written;Have the technological aptitude to manage online/telephone communication software (Intercom and Cloudtalk) along with spreadsheets and documents;Have previous experience working in a team-oriented and collaborative environment;Have self-motivation for learning;Have the ability to thrive in high-pressure situations;Are motivated, energetic, driven, and have an impeccable work ethic;Have excellent time management skills;Are amenable to 24/7 shifting schedule;Have full English language proficiency;We Offer: Working in a company that prides itself on our employees working as One Team, regardless of the department you work in. We all have the same goal (to be part of an amazing start-up company that is rapidly growing). You will be part of a supportive and friendly company with excellent team spirit;A full-time remote job which means the FREEDOM of working from any place in the world;Flexibility of working hours (work according to your rhythm);Great possibilities for personal and professional growth in a company that achieved amazing results in the E-Commerce world in just 5 years, and it's looking to keep growing and developing;A dedicated Happiness Coach;VimerDays: 20 accumulated paid days off per calendar year;Anniversary Gift;Birthday Gift;VimerTrips: One trip a year to meet the colleagues we work with and get to know each other in person;An unlimited supply of Vimerson Health Supplements, for your own personal consumption;Charity Match: The company will match any donations that you personally make to your charity of heart. We want to support each Team Member’s cause to make the world a better place;If you feel like you are the PERFECT FIT then send us an English version of your CV.Application Deadline: 04/03/2021Job Types: Full-time, ContractSalary: Up to $10.00 per hourBenefits:Employee discountFlexible schedulePaid time offSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication Question:Can you provide an example of a time you went above and beyond to provide exceptional service to a customer?Job Duties:Answer incoming customer inquiriesCollaborate with management teams to stay updated on new products, services, and policiesRecord customer information within our customer service databaseEngage with clients in a friendly and professional manner while actively listening to their concernsOffer support and solutions to customers in accordance with the company's customer service policiesOther duties as requestedWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

JobTitle: Technical Digital Applications Specialist - US Remote
Text:
Company InformationAbout Thermo Fisher Scientific

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with revenues of $17 billion and 70,000 employees in 50 countries. Our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We help our customers accelerate life sciences research, solve complex analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics and increase laboratory productivity. Through our premier brands – Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific and Unity Lab Services, we offer an unmatched combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and comprehensive support. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.
Job DescriptionJob Title: Technical Digital Applications Specialist

Reports To: Senior Operations Manager

Group/Division: Instrument Enterprise services
Position Location: Remote US
FLSA Status: Exempt
As part of the IES global operations, the Technical Digital Applications Specialist is responsible for providing onsite and digital remote support for internal and external customers on Thermo Scientific Liquid/Ion Chromatography and Mass Spectrometers. The Technical Digital Applications Specialist will partner within IES and drive digital, remote applications support and the One Thermo Solution. This candidate will be responsible for IES Digital Hardware & Applications to collectively and remotely deliver services utilizing digital training, augmented reality, virtual integration, thus improving the customer experience. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise in driving the overall One Thermo Solution.

Key Responsibilities:
Uses technical expertise, digital tools to guide FSEs and customers in resolving instrument issues.
Support of the One Thermo system Solution with hardware and applications support in delivering the workflow solutions to Thermo customers. Working with multiple Business units in driving work streams for faster, easier service deliverables.
Partner in delivery of digital training within IES Specialists teams globally.
Transitioning from onsite FSE support to content, digital, augmented reality support of applications.
Virtual Integration with Product Support Engineering enhancing services within IES global field service.
Support of the One Thermo system Solution with hardware and applications support in delivering the workflow solutions for our customers.
Working with multiple Business Units in driving work streams for faster, easier service deliverables.
Uses technical expertise, digital tools to guide FSEs and customers in resolving instrument issues.
Works in collaboration with the factories and Knowledge Base administrators to create knowledge articles and troubleshooting guides based on current field service experiences and instrument issues.
Partner with colleagues’ divisions in driving digital work stream solutions and system integration.
Brings issues and recommendations from the field to the Service Integration Group (SIG), Quality/Product Support/Manufacturing Engineering groups.
Partner with the team in driving digital application and hardware solutions.
Works with the IES Training Department, collaborating on material with the factories, service integration and the IES specialists’ teams to conduct virtual training.
Minimum Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor of Science degree: Science related, technical or other relevant degree, or equivalent experience
Minimum of 5-10 years of technical experience in service operations and/or commercial environment
Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria:
Proven ability to recognize and understand problems on sophisticated electronic, mechanical, and optical instrumentation maintained in a laboratory environment
Ability to manage deadlines accurately, effectively, and efficiently.
Ability to work independently.
Capable of influencing peer group to deliver required changes.
Demonstrate Thermo Fisher Scientific values – Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement.
Self-starter, with a high level of motivation and strong interpersonal skills.
Great sense of urgency and an ability to inspire others.
Solid communication skills, oral and written, and an ability to listen and process information.
Basic instructional abilities (training).

The purpose of this position is to increase traffic to our website and ultimately increase the number of clients served in the Chicago market. Job DescriptionTCA Health Inc. is looking for COVID-19 Contact Tracer. The primary goal of contact tracer is to interrupt the ongoing transmission of a disease and reduce the spread of infection. Tracers are responsible for contacting individuals daily who have been exposed to COVID-19, educate them on the need to self-quarantine, maintains ongoing communication with them for up to fourteen days from last exposure, and supports linkage to care if they test positive. This is a part-time temporary position. Part-time, Temporary positionPersons in this position will be conducting case interviews & contact tracing for individuals who have been diagnosed with COVID-19.Essential Duties: · Gather disease information from diagnosed individuals and assess disease symptomatology.· Provide guidance to individuals on self-isolation, including review of required monitoring procedures.· Assess individuals’ needs that may compromise successful self-isolation.· Collect information for all potentially exposed contacts of diagnosed individuals.· Notify contacts with prolonged close contact to index cases and link to appropriate support services, such as testing and supportive services through quarantine.· Utilize an approved script for conducting the case interview, contact elicitation, and contact notification.· Assess needs of index cases and contacts alike to link to appropriate pre-determined referral system.· Track and record all required data in approved data collection system.· Identify and elevate information to supervisor about complex cases and/or settings that may require enhanced attention (e.g., congregate settings, healthcare worker, etc.).· Maintain daily contact with supervisor.Minimum Qualifications· High school or equivalent (Required)· Bilingual proficiency is preferred· familiar with COVID privacy procedures· Experienced with Athena EMR software· Must be flexible to work mornings and evenings as neededJob Types: Part-time, TemporaryPay: $20.00 per hourLOCAL CANDIATES ONLYJob Type: Part-timePay: From $16.00 per hourSchedule:Day shiftMonday to FridayNight shiftEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Language:Bilingual (Preferred)Hours per week:20-29Company's website:http://www.tcahealth.org/Work Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Temperature screeningsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Are you passionate about helping others? Do you want to unleash your purpose and potential?
Come join our dynamic social service enterprise as we help over 200,000 individuals across the Chicagoland area.
Position Title: HUD Certified Housing Counselor
Company: YWCA Metropolitan Chicago
Salary: Commensurate upon experience
Classification: Full Time; Exempt
Reports to: Program Coordinator/Housing Counselor
Location: Chicago, IL
YWCA Metropolitan Chicago is the oldest and largest women’s organization in the region, with a mission to eliminate racism and empower women. To learn more about the YWCA Metropolitan Chicago, please visit our website at https://ywcachicago.org.
SUMMARY: The HUD Certified Housing Counselor is responsible for conducting homebuyer education and financial education workshops, housing counseling (includes pre-purchase, rental, and default foreclosure) and credit counseling services, including administrative responsibilities such as intake, tracking data input, monthly reporting and participation in community outreach.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Primary Responsibilities: The HUD Certified Housing Counselor is responsible for providing housing counseling and education to prospective first-time homebuyers, existing homeowners, and homeowners in distress. The HUD Certified Housing Counselor will focus on helping clients build financial capacity through credit counseling which includes financial capacity building for pre-purchase, post- purchase, and foreclosure prevention. Provide client assessments that enable the client to make informed decisions regarding their housing choices.
Member Contact: Educate clients and prospective clients about the available Financial Inclusion services, Economic Empowerment Services, and greater YWCA Metropolitan Chicago Services. Assist members with completion of required forms and assessments. Conduct member screening to evaluate need for immediate support and to facilitate referral and linkage to appropriate community services. Use appropriate judgment in upward communication regarding client or member concerns.
Administrative duties: Record all communications, and update log after each meeting or interaction with client/ lender for both (hard and electronic) file utilizing require client management system – mPact Pro. Conduct follow-ups via phone and/or email to determine whether or not the client is following their financial goal plan. The interaction with the client should always be in a professional, responsive, helpful and positive manner. Ensure all client files are securely stored and locked with all required documents and forms. Collect Closing Disclosure statements once a client fulfills homeownership. Prepare reports for management as required.
Office Management: Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following areas:
Responsible for day-to-day client scheduling and delivery of homeownership counseling and education in credit counseling, financial capacity building, pre-purchase, delinquency and foreclosure prevention counseling.
Conduct financial analysis and affordability assessment based on information and documents provided by the client.
Create an Action Plan that supports and builds client’s financial capacity.
Perform on-going case management to provide service and problem-solving assistance.
Assist management with facilitating homebuyer’s education, and post-purchase workshops
Participate in group education workshops at least once a month in accordance with U.S. HUD standards. (Note: Sessions held on evenings and weekends).
Represent Agency at events, seminars, and networking functions as needed.
Record all communications, and update log after each meeting or interaction with client/ lender for both (hard and electronic) file utilizing require client management system – mPact Pro.
Conduct follow-ups via phone and/or email to determine whether or not the client is following their financial goal plan. The interaction with the client should always be in a professional, responsive, helpful and positive manner.
Ensure all client files are securely stored and locked with all required documents and forms.
Collect Closing Disclosure statements once a client fulfills homeownership.
Prepare reports for management as required.
NON-ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Participate in staff meetings, and training as scheduled
OTHER DUTIES AS ASSIGNED: Other duties outside of the responsibilities of the position may be assigned, whether for a project, special needs task or other assignment.
QUALIFICATIONS: The ideal candidate will have demonstrated skills, strong knowledge and experience in the following areas:
Working experience with any aspect of the homeownership and post-purchase process: mortgage lending, realtor service, closing of mortgage loan, loan processing, and loan modification.
Must hold a HUD Certified Housing Counselor certification. (Must obtain by June 30, 2021)
Case management.
Computer proficiency with email software, Microsoft Office Suite and Outlook, client management databases, and uploading and downloading of documents.
Proficiency with spreadsheets and internet search applications are necessary.
Ability and willingness to learn new software and computer systems.
Public speaking and communication skills (written and verbal).
Ability to manage multiple tasks in a high-volume work environment.
Ability to work with people of diverse backgrounds.
Attention to detail with excellent internal and external customer service skills.
Bilingual: English and Spanish proficiency is required.
Experience and/or certification as a housing counselor or financial educator is a plus.
Minimum Associate Degree from accredited college, BA preferred
The position requires a proactive self-starter and skills that include: a demonstrated ability to work independently; to handle multiple assignments and tasks; and to apply and comply with various policies and procedures. Good telephone etiquette and ability to communicate in a courteous and professional manner are necessary to the role. Intermediate level of skills with MS Office and Outlook are required; skills with database management. A general knowledge of community resources is desirable.
Discretion is required for handling of documents and for member concerns. Demonstrated respect and appreciation for working in a multi-ethnic and multi-cultural work environment must be evident. HUD Certified Housing Counselor must be able to work effectively with members who may show stress and impatience.
Professional Training Required: Must be complaint to be able to offer both pre-purchase and foreclosure counseling.
Note: A bilingual Housing Counselor who works with a foreign language speaking community must demonstrate cultural competency with that community and fluency in both English and the community’s language (oral and written).
EDUCATION REQUIRED: A High School diploma, or GED, is required. An Associate’s degree or a progress toward completion of a degree is preferred.
CERTIFICATION(s) REQUIRED: HUD Certification
WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment includes remote working with at least one weekly office visit. While in the office, the noise level is usually moderate. Movement requirements include walking, stooping or kneeling. There may be a need to reach, lift or move objects, such as packages, supplies and computers. Normal (or corrected) vision range; ability to see color and to distinguish letters, numbers and symbols are necessary to the work, which may require close viewing. Occasionally may need to lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. Communication needs include seeing, hearing and speaking. While working remotely and/or in the office, there will be periods of sitting, holding a telephone and using computers. Reasonable accommodations will be made for an incumbent to meet the essential responsibilities of the position.
WORK SCHEDULE: Monday – Friday, 9:00am-5:00pm. This position may require work on some evenings and weekends. Schedule can vary depending on the needs of the agency.
Benefits Portfolio: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Flexible Spending (FSA), Transit, HSA, Short & Long Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program, etc.
YWCA Metropolitan Chicago is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. YWCA Metropolitan Chicago will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Company Description

Daxko’s mission is to power health and wellness throughout the world. We provide solutions, services, and insights for the health and wellness industry to engage members, deliver delightful experiences, and improve the businesses we serve.

Job Description

Part salesperson, part customer-service rep, an account manager is all about doing whatever it takes to get the job done. If putting a smile on someone else’s face tickles your fancy, this may be the job for you. As an Account Manager you are the liaison between our agency and its clients. You would oversee the agency-client relationship, determining clients’ needs—what they’re looking to achieve short-term and long-term—and ensures we deliver.
SKILLS:
Quick to think on their feet during client presentations or internal meetings
Does not get overwhelmed when a new problem arises and is instead, quick to solve
Can see the bigger picture when working on granular tasks/projects to ensure everything stays on track
Can speak with authority and confidence when addressing executive leadership and a “room full of people”
Strong but not aggressive leadership style
Extremely effective written and verbal communication. This means bullets not paragraphs and Haikus not Sonnets.
Ability to create client-ready presentations quickly that look beautiful and get the job done
Can “read between the lines” or ask the right questions to uncover a client’s real needs or concerns and translate that in a way that is effective for both the client and our internal team
Exceptional time management, analytical, and organizational skills

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage a group of clients exceeding expectations on the following:
Make sure all client contracts are upheld and delivered
Maintain and grow positive client relationships
Create marketing strategies
Create and support sales in all proposals
Manage all client communications
Create and deliver client reports
Coordinate internal agency team members to deliver on all client contracts
Monitor all client budgets for ad spend to prevent any overages or misuse of spend
Monitor time tracking and SOW balances to prevent any overages
Ability to explain
Coordinate with partner firm to deliver on all client contracts and facilitate client/agency communication
Balance the needs of the client with the bottom line of the agency
Provide business strategy support for our clients between their agency services and business solutions
Partner with internal business solutions teams to deliver on all client contracts

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree preferred
3-5 years of experience in marketing with strong preference on agency experience
Proficiency in marketing systems and reporting, including marketing automation, testing, and CRM tools

SS&C Eze is seeking an Associate Engagement Specialist to join the Chicago Product Specialist Trading Team. At SS&C Eze, we are passionate about investing in our employees and delighting our clients. This environment has helped us create a community focused on employee interests and well-being, innovation, and skill-building.
About the Team
The Product Specialist Trading team sits right in the middle of the action. Our responsibility is to become experts in our Trading product and collaborate with buy-side and sell-side traders, R&D stakeholders, and Engagement Managers to ensure the SS&C investment suite remains an asset for our clients. You will prioritize daily high-priority electronic trading requests with long-term projects to keep our clients’ Trading Operations up and running. The role will also help develop and apply best practices to team procedures with an eye on constantly improving the overall efficiency of the work.
Minimum Requirements
Manage a high volume of client connection and/or case requests
Build relationships and work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders
Set appropriate project expectations and follow through on deliverables
Implement foundational elements of the SS&C Eze product suite with an emphasis on FIX and electronic trading
Troubleshoot ambiguous software issues using internal resources and leveraging other product experts
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree from a related field
Ability to manage multiple tasks and small projects across multiple clients at the same time
Strong organization skills and must be detail-oriented
Consistent positive attitude, even when dealing with difficult situations
Must be able to manage expectations on deliverables to internal and external stakeholders
Ability to understand key interdependencies and impact of work
A motivated individual who is proactive about completing tasks and picking up projects
Existing knowledge or ability to learn complexities of investment trading workflows
It would be great if you also had:
Working knowledge of FIX protocols for version 4.0,4.2 and 4.4
Experience working with buy-side and sell-side traders or trading operations roles
SQL skills - comfortable composing complex queries to pull data and running statements to modify DB tables when necessary
From The Manager:
“Our team has embraced the growth mindset by consistently finding ways around roadblocks and technical hurdles. We no longer are satisfied with identifying the problem, but instead ask, “how can we make this better?” This mentality has increased productivity, helped create employee resource groups, and kept our team engaged with clients while working from home. We want an individual who has embraced the growth mindset and can bring new ideas and energy to the team . ”
Who We Are:
We are a trusted and proven partner to the investment community. We complement our award winning investment workflow technology with expert global customer service. We pride ourselves on fully understanding each client’s unique needs and advising them on best practices and processes to maximize their operational and investment alpha. Our team is made up of more than 1,000 global employees in 11 locations worldwide. We are headquartered in Boston, with offices in Chicago, Hong Kong, Hyderabad, London, New York, Rio De Janeiro, San Francisco, Singapore, Stamford, and Sydney.
Our Culture:
We are a highly dedicated team of innovators and experts who love to collaborate on the cutting edge. We service our clients’ unique and growing needs with highly configurable, expansive, and integrated products for the entire investment process and community and we are never satisfied until our customers are delighted. We celebrate this passion and commitment by fostering a culture that promotes innovation, growth, communication and achievement from the bottom up. We nurture the entrepreneurial spirit and welcome productive debate. We encourage open communications and upward feedback, we learn quickly from our mistakes, challenge the status quo – all while remaining accountable to our colleagues and clients. We also understand work is a big part of life, so having fun and celebrating hard work is core within our culture.
SS&C Eze is an equal opportunity employer.

HireArt is helping goPuff find a Contract Recruiter to play a vital role in attracting high-caliber candidates to propel and evolve their operations. You will consult with hiring managers across multiple departments and divisions in order to attract and hire the very best talent in the industry. The ideal candidate will have 3+ years of in-house recruiting experience at a high-growth company.
This is a full-time (40 hours per week), contract-to-hire position through HireArt and will be fully remote.
As Contract Recruiter, you will:
Identify and assess a diverse candidate pool and manage candidates through the full lifecycle of the recruitment process.
Build candidate pipelines and manage candidates throughout the interview process.
Partner with HR and hiring managers to create offers.
Maintain an expert level understanding of all recruiting processes in a rapidly changing environment.
Coordinate and attend recruitment events.
Draft job postings and interview questions.
Develop your knowledge based on goPuff’s business, culture, and market.
Stay up to date on the recruiting industry’s best practices employment legislation and latest trends.
Requirements
3+ years of in-house recruiting experience at a high-growth company
Skilled with technology and comfortable with applicant tracking systems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work with management to create a positive and thorough process for all potential employees
Ability to handle multiple projects and candidates simultaneously under minimal supervision
Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), contract-to-hire position through HireArt and will be fully remote.
HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.

Company Description

goPuff is the go-to solution for immediate everyday needs. Through centrally located micro-fulfillment centers, we deliver more than 3,000 products right to your door. Since its founding in 2013, goPuff has been committed to providing convenience and speed when you need it most.
As the fastest-growing, most affordable delivery service on the market, goPuff operates from 12 pm to 4:30 am and 24/7 in some areas to bring you what you need, when you need it–we deliver ice cream, toilet paper, cold medicine & more. goPuff also brings you all of the drinks you need–including wine, beer & alcohol delivery in select locations to customers 21+. goPuff’s model allows for fast delivery of daily essentials directly from facilities to your door, eliminating the middleman.
Headquartered in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, goPuff currently operates in more than 200 facilities in 500+ cities across the U.S., including Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Denver, Philadelphia, Phoenix, Seattle, Pittsburgh, Washington, D.C. & many more.
https://gopuff.com/
