Job Description: Regional Sales Manager, ARC Facilities
Location: Anywhere in the Midwest

We are looking for top-performing hunters ready to advance their career, disrupt an industry, and achieve tremendous success in an entrepreneurial, fast-growing enterprise app business targeting the under-served facilities and maintenance industry. Regional Sales Managers (RSMs) are the lifeblood of our organization. RSMs are individual contributor salespeople who leverage a combination of inside and field sales techniques to win new customers. Once a new customer is won, the RSM will expand our relationship with large expansion sales. RSMs are hunters/closers who can articulate the value of a modern enterprise mobile app to help customers achieve 10X ROI. Regional Sales Managers report to the Regional Sales Director.

Selling the award-winning ARC Facilities App
"Best Facility Software” 2019 & 2018, Facility Executive Magazine
“Top 10 Healthcare Compliance Solution Provider” 2018, Healthcare Tech Outlook
“Campus Safety Best Product Winner” 2018, Campus Safety Magazine

These are the exciting things you get to do:

Win NEW customers and achieve or exceed quota.
Hunt their own outbound opportunities as well as work inbound, marketing-generated leads.
Advise customers on the current best practices in the Facilities industry; understand their needs; and present the advantages of our solution.
Provide compelling product demos of our award-winning Facilities App
Identify decision-makers, project leaders and key influencers. Run an effective sales process to secure internal support and close deals.
Leverage inside sales techniques to cold-call, build pipeline, and conduct early-stage online demos to advance opportunities as well as on-site, in-person leadership of key meetings and relationship development to advance and close deals.
Accurately forecast revenue for your territory, leveraging a CRM tool, preferably Hubspot.
Be entrepreneurial. Identify new ways to succeed and drive growth.

This is what we are looking for:

 The ideal candidate will a proven track record as a top-performing inside sales and sales development rep, with successful experience hunting & closing. Candidates must understand how to sell mobile apps as solutions.
This will help you succeed:
3+ years of sales experience as a top-performing enterprise sales and sales development rep. selling SaaS solutions, preferably mobile apps.
Proven success calling on and selling to the CFO, handling objections, and selling value and ROI.
Comfortable working out of your home office environment.
Ability and willingness to Travel as appropriate for your territory.
A College degree in technology or business field is highly recommended.

We have Great Cultural Fit and are looking for similar:
We are one team, one company. We are blessed with an outstanding culture and maintaining this is something very important to all of us. The right candidate can succeed in a team environment.

This is what we have to Offer:
Excellent Company support and resources
Huge pipelines already developed for you
Excellent Company Reputation because we consistently receive 5-star customer reviews
Comprehensive Employee benefits that include full medical, dental, vision, and life insurance as well as a 401-K Plan with company matching
Employee Stock Purchase Plan giving you 15% money by allowing you to buy ARC stock on the NYSE at 15% BELOW street value
A management team that supports you and want to see you be successful
Tools that include a Laptop, iPad, and Smartphone
Culture of caring for our employees
A variety of products to take to market unrivaled in the industry.

WE ARE HIRING!Do you want to work for a top-rated Sales organization?Are you looking to launch a successful career in sales?Are you interested in providing products and services that help the environment?Stericycle is currently seeking talented, competitive individuals to join our growing Sales organization. As an Inside Sales Executive, you would be responsible for incremental revenue through inbound and outbound sales calls. This includes lead campaigns and telephone prospecting targeting Small and Medium (SMB) existing customers and new prospects. Conducts business needs analysis and develops appropriate service solutions for the customer/prospect. Focuses sales activities on value-added service lines such as After-hours answering services, Automated appointment reminders and other revenue generating activities. Responsible for retaining customers that are considered 'at risk', have been identified as potential lost business, or have requested cancellation of service with Stericycle. Determine customers' needs/requirements and negotiate an appropriate resolution by right sizing, price adjustments, and/or resolving service quality issues. You will be provided with the latest technology, tools and training to ensure best chance of success. Top performers will be rewarded with lucrative commissions, opportunities for growth and advancement, recognition trips, and more. Stericycle was recently recognized as one of Selling Power’s “50 Best Companies to Sell For”!The Inside Sales Representative will be working remotely but subject to change according to our company policy. You also have the option to work out of the Chicago sales office 1-2 times a week if preferred.Key Job Activities: 1) Makes Outbound and receives Inbound sales calls for potentially new and/or existing customers to sell our products and/or services. Acquires new customers and converts existing customers through prospecting in assigned territory, outbound marketing/lead campaigns and referrals2) Effectively qualify clients through the use of Value-Based selling methods. Researches customer/prospect history and business needs in order to develop a complete service proposal, while targeting upgrade and cross-sell opportunities of additional Stericycle products/services. Sell the value of the recommended solution, and retain/up-sell revenue if possible.3) Respond to customer concerns and proactively contact customers who have been identified as “at risk” for cancelling services using approved sales tactics and strategies to retain potential lost business. Utilize ‘Value Based Sales Skills’ to uncover client’s existing service issues and needs, explain contract obligations if any, and provide alternative solutions for consideration. Address assigned customer issues and concerns timely.4) Builds a pipeline of potential future business by prospecting via the Internet, assigned territory lists, outbound marketing/lead campaigns and other sources as identified. Forecasts Quarterly, Monthly and Weekly sales metrics within 5% of actual results and provides reports to SMB ComSol Sales Management. Effectively meets assigned performance factors (key expectations) within assigned parameters.5) Work with cross functional team members including transportation, billing, collections, sales, and customer experience departments to assist in providing satisfactory solutions from the customer perspective in order to retain business, and leverage communication from other departments to identify sales opportunities.6) Effectively uses technology based CRM (Customer Relationship Management) SalesForce, tool for lead follow-up, sale cycle disposition, pipeline management, forecasting and lost opportunity tracking. Keeps comprehensive and accurate notes in the system.7) Provide tracking data to the Inside Sales organization to assist in developing policies and programs to help drive sales. Identify sales trends when possible and provide management with updates.8) Perform other miscellaneous and related duties as required or requested.Education: Required Education: in College Degree or EquivalentDisclaimer: The above description is meant to provide a summary of the nature and level of work being performed; it should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and requirements of the job or person. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise. Stericycle will consider requests for workplace accommodations for protected physical or mental limitations in accordance with its human resources policies and local laws.To the extent permissible under local law, and consistent with business necessity, Stericycle reserves the right to modify the content formally or informally, either verbally or in writing, at any time with or without advance notice.Job Type: Full-timeSchedule:8 hour shift

Sourcing Manager - Plastics - 20124999

Hillrom is a $2.9B leading worldwide manufacturer and provider of medical technologies and related services for the health care industry, including patient support systems, safe mobility and handling solutions, non-invasive therapeutic products for a variety of acute and chronic medical conditions, medical equipment rentals, surgical products and information technology solutions. Hillrom's comprehensive product and service offerings are used by health care providers across the health care continuum and around the world in hospitals, extended care facilities and home care settings to enhance the safety and quality of patient care.

Description
Reporting directly to the Director Global Sourcing – Plastics and Soft Goods, the Global Sourcing Manager – Plastics is responsible for leading global efforts for the various Plastics sub-categories. The ideal candidate will have strong influencing, communication and collaboration skills proven within a self-directed and flexible environment.
The role is expected to work remotely. Consideration will also be given to candidates who can work based on one of our US Hillrom locations (our global corporate headquarters in downtown Chicago, or production sites in Acton (MA), Batesville (IN), St. Paul (MN), Cary (NC), Milwaukee (WI), and Skaneateles Falls (NY).
Basic Function and Principal Responsibilities
Manage spend and related supply base in support of site, division, and corporate goals (Cost, Quality, Delivery, People).
Support standardization and rationalization targets to drive spend to key strategic partners.
Responsible for overseeing development and deployment of holistic categories strategy.
Create and manage strategic supplier partnerships to ensure continuous performance expectations are met and year over year productivity targets are achieved, by conducting proper supplier management techniques.
Lead key negotiations and agreements / support sites and businesses on negotiation strategies.
Partner with key internal stakeholders to understand requirements and drive global, value based year over year sustainable sourcing strategies to ensure quality, value-cost optimization, service performance and business continuity are developed and sustained.
Keep current on categories market, cost drivers and economic outlook to guide strategy.
Develop a multi-year category roadmap ensuring proper alignment of requirements and supply base.
Be a thoughtful leader, building an internal customer-focused approach, fostering a motivating environment through leadership skills.
Lead, manage and support activities of supplier sourcing, supplier qualification, RFI-RFP, and supplier selection. Ensure a risk-based sourcing approach is considered.
Monitor, track and report on savings, projects and incremental value of sourcing activities.
Conduct business reviews with key suppliers.

Qualifications

Experience and Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required; Business, Engineering or Supply Chain highly desirable; Master’s in Business preferred.
CPM or CPSM certification (or equivalent) preferred.
Minimum of 7 years strategic global sourcing experience of which 4 must be in a manufacturing business environment.
Plastics category prior experience preferred (resins, injection molding, blow molding, tubes, rubber/silicone parts, subassembly / value added processes, tooling)
Sourcing in a Medical Devices or Life Sciences industry preferred
Experience operating within a regulatory environment preferred
Proven project management/execution and transformational management skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Global mindset with experience working in an international/multi-cultural matrix environment
Strong cross-functional leadership and coaching skills
Must have a balance of both strategic and operational performance
Experienced negotiator
Ability to listen, engage and influence internal and external stakeholders
Highly self-motivated with the ability to drive change in a global organization
Strong technical and commercial experience in the related categories.

Hillrom is an equal employment employer F/M/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Job: Sourcing

Primary Location: United States-Illinois-Chicago, IL

Other Locations: United States-Indiana-Batesville, United States-New York-Skaneateles Falls, United States-Minnesota-St. Paul, United States-Wisconsin-Milwaukee, United States-Massachusetts-Acton, United States-North Carolina-Cary

Schedule: Full-time

Travel: Yes, 20 % of the Time

Posting Entity: Hillrom

THE ROLE

Localcoin seeks to inspire the future of digital currency globally. We are looking for an ambitious, target driven Regional Sales Executive to join our growing Sales team and assist with our expansion throughout the United States.

As a Regional Sales Executive at Localcoin, you will acquire prime retail space for the placement of our Bitcoin Kiosks and other products. You will work directly with our current franchise partners as well as develop new partnerships.

This position is remote, based out of Chicago, Illinois and reports to our Director of Sales & Operations from Toronto, Ontario Head Office. Frequent travel is required within North America.

YOUR IMPACT

Acquire prime retail space for our Bitcoin Kiosks and other products in retail and franchise locations across the United States
Collaborate with Executive team for developing and executing a go-to-market strategy through leading market research
Lead the end-to-end sales cycle for placement of products by coordinating with retailers, operational and marketing team
Travel to client sites to conduct in person meetings which includes; client pitches, negotiations and contract closures
Develop and maintain strategic partnerships with retailers and franchises
Educate prospective clients on the benefits of Localcoin product/services within retail locations
Strive to achieve monthly sales targets and KPI's
Prepare sales reports for leadership team

THIS IS YOU

Minimum 3 years of B2B sales experience
Experience with Microsoft office suite (Word, Powerpoint, Excel)
The ability to operate in an entrepreneurial high-growth culture
A proven record of achieving/exceeding quarterly targets
Strong and demonstrated interest/knowledge in the cryptocurrency market
Have a valid driver's license and access to a vehicle

THIS IS NICE

Fluent in Spanish (verbal and written)


PERKS

Health & Wellness Benefits - We offer a comprehensive benefits package that covers up to 100% of traditional benefits such as dental, prescription drug coverage, vision care, critical illness coverage, life insurance and AD&D coverage. The plan also includes 100% coverage of unlimited personal and business travel insurance, on-demand online nurse assessments through Akira app. We offer a monthly spend on non-traditional medical expenses (massages, chiropractic) and a wellness account (gym memberships, spa, nutritionist).

Location - Localcoin is committed to ensuring that the team and areas we live in remain safe and healthy as the impact of COVID-19 is felt globally. The corporate team here has transitioned to a remote work set-up for the time being and have temporarily closed our head office until further notice. For essential staff in operations we work from our warehouse located close to Pearson Airport.

Events and Socials - Being remote hasn't slowed us down! Attend virtual company-wide teach and training days, industry events, themed monthly Fri-YAY happy hours, bi-weekly virtual team events like escape rooms, magic show, nutritionist lunch and learn series, coffee tastings and more!

Professional Development - We'll invest in your career. Our company is growing quickly, and we'll give you the opportunity to do the same. You'll have access to a number of professional development opportunities so that you can keep up with the company's evolving needs and grow your career along the way.

Compensation - We offer competitive compensation packages. We deeply value the talent and impact our team brings to the table, and believe that fair and equitable total compensation packages are part of our commitment to everyone who works here.

Purchase Cryptocurrency At Market Rate - You'll be able to purchase cryptocurrencies supported by Localcoin at the Canadian market rate with zero fees. You'll also gain exclusive coupons for all of our cryptocurrency ATMs nationwide!


ABOUT US

Localcoin is Canada's largest and most trusted cryptocurrency ATM network. We're on a mission to simplify the buying and selling process of cryptocurrency by providing transparency, accessibility and convenience.

With over 17 million people using Localcoin products, we pride ourselves on simplifying the highly technical (and at times confusing) crypto world through our industry leading customer support. Our ATMs, trading and online products help educate people on blockchain and cryptocurrencies by providing a safe and low cost avenue to gain a deep understanding of the basics: how to own and operate a digital wallet, how the blockchain network operates and how verifying a transaction works.

We are industry leaders in Canada and growing fast across the US with an eagerness to expand globally. Our team is working together to constantly innovate and build products that provide equal access of cryptocurrencies around the globe. Approximately 2 billion people in different communities worldwide are still unbanked. We believe that by providing an accessible product, we can help facilitate digital payments to these individuals and local communities.

Localcoin has been growing at an incredible rate over the last 3 years. We're looking for talented people that are eager to collaborate, innovate and make a huge impact in the future of digital currency!

POSITION SUMMARY:
Manages and leads the development of Account Managers, Key Account Manager, and Application Specialists in selling and servicing the Microbiology Food Safety portfolio. Supports the North America Commercial Leader, in driving growth, profitability and predictability. Administers all activities within the United States Food Safety Protection business.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Creates, develops and recommends goals, objectives and policies to ensure the most effective operation and staffing of sales activities within the region
Establishes and maintains sales force staffing to ensure that the company’s long term sales objectives can be met within a timely manner
Develops and manages processes for: creating sales strategies and tactical plans, sales assumptions and projections, sales goals recommendations, compensation recommendations, incentives, bonus, and expenses
Facilitates the management of key business and customer relationships and negotiates potential business opportunities for the company which are consistent with its long-term objectives
Provides leadership and management direction that enables the U.S sales organization to execute the tactical sales plan
Directs, manages and coaches the activities of the sales representatives within the U.S. Working with corporate recruiting, screens, interviews and recommends hiring of field sales personnel. Monitors sales performance and manages performance improvement plans.
Work in concert with MBD Sales Training to manage Account Manager and Key Account Manager training to include: selling skills, territory management, product portfolio, processes, pricing, competition, and account management.
Provides administrative control over responsibilities, written performance reviews and a development plan for each employee, completes written performance goals and quarterly reviews with each direct report
Maintains regular contacts with key Customer and Distributor accounts, continuously builds knowledge of industry trends, developments and all competitive activities
Provides periodic reports on sales activities and provide sales forecasts as directed
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, ABILITIES:
8 – 10 years sales/sales management experience within the Food Safety market or clinical diagnostic market
Strong track record of success in capital / consumable business model
Proven leadership skills, with financial and business acumen
Effective communication and impactful presentation skills
Proficiency in Windows 7 + and Microsoft Office Suite, CRM platforms, and other commonly used software
Ability to travel - 75%
This position is remote and must be located near major U.S. airport location.

Location: Mavens Komodo Health is a remote organization open to candidates located anywhere in the US.


Who we are: Mavens Komodo Health works to elevate healthcare worldwide. We connect people to cures using best-in-class cloud technology solutions.
Who you are: You enjoy solving problems and have a talent for understanding business needs and helping to translate them into solutions. You are precise and focused, but you also make work fun; all while working collaboratively and giving your customer a great experience. You work well with team members and enjoy sharing your vision and innovative ideas with peers and clients to build elegant solutions.

Why this role matters: This role works on our project teams to understand what our healthcare and life sciences clients need. Our consultants are business and technology experts who work collaboratively with internal partners and our clients to create innovative cloud-based solutions.
Responsibilities:

Engage with key stakeholders, leveraging business and technical resources, to facilitate discussions, analyze and evaluate options, and provide recommendations to the project team and client as appropriate.
Assist in eliciting requirements utilizing applicable tools and techniques including: Documentation Review, Interviewing, Shadowing, and Business Event Workshops.
Assist team in evaluating results to allocate and prioritize requirements to support defined project and business objectives.
Establish and support traceability from business objectives through functional requirements to technical specifications.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with key stakeholders to document requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Process Maps, Business Requirements, Functional Requirements, SIT, and UAT Test Scripts.
Keep requirement documents current; capture all changes as new revisions of systems documentation.
Define and develop test scripts to be utilized during SIT and UAT and play an active consultative role during testing.
Interact professionally with a diverse group of business leaders and technologists including executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Requirements:

Bachelor's level degree in business or technical discipline and 1-3 years or greater professional experience
Prior consulting industry experience
Prior experience in Life Sciences/Pharmaceutical / Healthcare environment
Skilled in process modeling and business process design
Experience authoring business and functional requirements documents and other technical documentation
Skilled in creation of workflow diagram creation, system mockups using wire frame diagrams, Actors, and Use Cases
Experience creating test plans and related documentation
Salesforce knowledge / experience would be ideal
Strong verbal and written communication skills

About Avidbots

Avidbots is a robotics company with a vision to bring robotic solutions into everyday life to increase organizational productivity and to do that better than any other company in the world. Their groundbreaking product, the Neo autonomous floor scrubbing robot, is deployed around the world and trusted by leading facilities and building service companies. Founded in 2014 and headquartered in Kitchener, ON, Canada, Avidbots is offering comprehensive service and support to customers on 5 continents.
About this role:

We are looking for an enthusiastic, talented Field Service Technician. Our ideal candidate loves to solve electrical and mechanical issues and understand how different pieces of our robots are put together. You are technically competent and will actively service and support our robots out of our Chicago area location. Our ideal candidate loves to be out in the field, build relationships with customers, and provide training to use our product successfully in their environment.
You thrive in a fast moving & dynamic environment and enjoy working independently while being part of a larger customer care team. The Field Service Technician will be critical to our customers’ success and will have a tremendous impact on the future growth of Avidbots in North America. This role is within Avidbots’ Customer Care department.
How will I make a difference:

Provide amazing customer and equipment support, from the depot and on-site.
Build positive relationships with customers in person and communicate well through email, and phone conversations.
Diagnose issues or technical problems that can include electrical, mechanical and software-related service issues.
Understand customer questions or concerns and make appropriate recommendations.
Support Avidbots product demonstrations, deployments and customer training across North America expecting to be on the road regularly.
Support robot operations remotely in our web-based monitoring software.
Present training materials to customers and teach them to use all aspects of the robot.
Document customer feedback, findings in the field, and work order details


Key requirements and experience:

Diploma, degree, or 3-5 years of experience in an associated field such as electronics, mechanics or robotics.
Ability to troubleshoot, test, repair and service technical equipment.
Exceptional manual dexterity and high attention to detail.
Comfortable and experienced at fault-finding by reading schematics and wiring diagrams.
Ability to work flexible shifts and adapt to changing work schedules.
Willingness and ability to travel anywhere in North America.
Hold a valid and up-to-date driver’s license and passport.
Driven individual, passionate about robotics, self-starter and works well as part of a small support team.
Previous experience in a customer-facing role


 Nice to have:

Experience working with electronics or electro-mechanical devices.
Experience servicing floor cleaning equipment.
Experience working with computers and software tools (Linux experience ideal).
Experience towing small to medium trailers.

Graymont Medical is a fun, fast paced and rapidly growing company in the West Town neighborhood of Chicago. We provide durable medical equipment (DME) and orthotics to patients recovering from orthopedic surgery. Due to growth, we are looking to add to our team. The DME Benefits and Authorization Specialist's primary responsibility will be to secure authorization from insurance providers for the equipment patients need to make their recovery and their lives better.

During the pandemic we have been working from home. As things get better, we may switch to working at our headquarters located in Chicago.

Responsibilities include:
Verifying insurance policies are active
Following up with physician offices to obtain any necessary referrals
Contacting insurance providers to submit for prior authorization for products prescribed
Ensuring we have met the insurance providers guidelines to successfully bill for supplies and equipment
Follow up on denied authorizations with goal of getting to approval
Sending orders to our submissions team once insurance checks have been completed and the order is ready to bill to insurance


Preferred Requirements:
Prior DME (Durable Medical Equipment and Orthotics) authorization experience
Strong organizational and task prioritization skills
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
Positive and professional attitude
Strong detail orientation
Team player
Effective at multi-tasking


What We Offer:
Generous PTO. We work hard. We’re passionate about what we’re building together. We also have lives outside work.
Benefits. Medical, plus voluntary vision, dental. (We are a healthcare company, after all.)
401(k) with employer match. We’re planning for the future—and we want to help you do the same.
Flexibility. We like spending time together in our West Loop office. We also work remotely regularly.
Competitive compensation.
A growth environment.


About Graymont Medical

Graymont Medical is a portfolio of patient-first healthcare brands. Founded in Chicago in 2012, we guide new moms along their breastfeeding journey, serve pharmacy patients with specialty medicine needs, and help athletes recover smarter with best-in-class orthopedics.

Graymont Medical is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Senior Project Manager – Fannie/Freddie Agency PCR Reviewer

Job Description
Senior Project Managers (SPMs) at Nova Group, GBC manage the project workflow and report preparation to both Nova and our Client standards and deadlines. SPMs engage in project setup and assignment with our scheduling team, communication with Field Managers on project requirements, progress, schedule, technical review and close out of the project (invoice, shipping, etc).
As technical reviewers, SPMs are responsible for the review and submittal of the PCNA report by the Field Manager, and resolution of outstanding report issues. They use their knowledge of Agency Guidelines to ensure proper report documentation. Ultimately, our SPMs are accountable for the technical merit of the Nova reports delivered to our Clients.
SPMs may also be asked to perform Property Condition Assessments (PCAs) as needed. Typical sites to be assessed would include commercial properties such as offices, warehouses, multi-family sites and hotels.
Our Senior Project Managers are a core member of our project delivery and client relationship teams working with our field teams, Account and Sales Managers to ensure the quality of our deliverables to our clients, exceeding their expectations along the way.
Required Experience and Skill Sets:
Bachelor’s degree in architecture, engineering, or construction-related field
5+ years’ experience conducting and/or managing PCNAs (preferably Agency scopes), and/or engineering and architectural consulting services
Thorough understanding of Agency Guidelines
Experience in the management/review of related due diligence projects
Knowledge of building components, systems and cost estimating
Strong technical writing skills and proven attention to detail
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook
Current, valid state driver’s license (position requires a motor vehicle record background check)
Candidates with professional registrations preferred (PE, RA, etc.) Familiar with Agency PCR scope requirements
Ability to analyze assessor findings to ensure the PCR accurately reflects the Property
Ability to coach assessors, both employees and associates, to complete accurate and scope-compliant deliverables
Ability to analyze client-provided documents, such as Capital budgets, repairs and projections and incorporate in to the findings and reserve analysis
Ability and willingness to work effectively as a member of the Nova Deal Team to support the needs and goals of CMG Clients
Ability to strictly adhere to deadlines on multiple simultaneous projects

Click here to apply now!

Working for Nova Group, GBC
Nova Group, GBC (Nova) is a privately held multidisciplinary advisory firm incorporated in 1987. We have a global footprint headquartered in Chaska, Minnesota, but our team services clients throughout the United States and abroad. Nova provides services in the areas of environmental management, compliance investigation, corrective action activities, strategic energy services, and construction services. Our diverse portfolio of services creates a multitude of career possibilities, and we strive to bring on talent who want to learn and build their skills across multiple sectors of our business.

A General Benefit Corporation (GBC), often referred to as a B-Corp, means Nova is aligning our values with our business practices. We recognize our role goes beyond profitability, and we value our environment, our communities, and our people. Beyond our articles of incorporation, we are making a commitment to measure our impact in four key segments: our environment, our communities, our customers, and our employees.

In efforts to remain competitive and to differentiate ourselves from others in the industry, we continuously review our benefit programs. One way we accomplish this is with flexible and remote work arrangements, because we realize that personal demands don’t just happen after 5 p.m. The great majority of our staff work from remote offices that allow the ultimate balance of work and personal life. Different work environment options are available to you, from offices in larger cities to offices available on an as-needed basis. Whatever your work-environment needs, we will make an effort to accommodate them. At Nova this culture is successful because we trust our teams to be accountable to each other and to our clients.

In addition, Nova is committed to supporting your professional development through career ladders, training programs, and continuing education to support your certifications and licenses. We look for opportunities to build skills on the job in particular, shadowing mentors and senior staff, leveraging all they have to offer. We always want our employees to feel challenged and to strive to grow their skills and careers.
Click here to apply now!

Are you passionate about helping others? Do you want to unleash your purpose and potential?
Come join our dynamic social service enterprise as we help over 200,000 individuals across the Chicagoland area.
Position Title: Intake and Program Support Specialist
Company: YWCA Metropolitan Chicago
Salary: Commensurate upon experience
Classification: Full Time; Non-Exempt
Reports to: Housing Program Coordinator/Housing Counselor
Location: Chicago, IL
YWCA Metropolitan Chicago is the oldest and largest women’s organization in the region, with a mission to eliminate racism and empower women. To learn more about the YWCA Metropolitan Chicago, please visit our website at https://ywcachicago.org.
SUMMARY: Intake & Program Support Specialist- educates potential clients about Financial Inclusion programs and available services and addresses caller concerns about any aspect of housing and related programs. The Intake and Program Support Coordinator assists in management of the office environment, answering the receptionist phone line, logging in calls and provides required administrative support. The Intake and Program Support Coordinator is the first point of contact for potential clients so this role is integral to the promotion of synergy across all Financial Inclusion programs and services. Must have experience working with communities or color and/or low-income earning individuals and families.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Client/Prospect Contact: Educate the public about Financial Inclusion’s available housing and wealth building services. Assist clients and potential clients with completion of required forms and applications. Conduct initial client screening to evaluate need for immediate support and to facilitate referral and linkage to appropriate community services. Enter client data into mPact Pro database. Use appropriate judgment in upward communication regarding client or prospect concerns.
Administrative Duties: Perform a variety of office support duties including processing and distribution of mail, copying, faxing and filing. Provide administrative support for the department.
Office Management: Assist with managing and updating the lobby and other areas of the office. Ensuring areas are cleaned and organized with all materials needed. Order and track inventory of office supplies and program materials. Manage client paper files to ensure they are in good order.
In addition, this position would be responsible for:
Providing technical assistance for workshops, getting intake applications completed, collection of paperwork from program participants, and scheduling the initial one on one coaching session for the participant to meet with a Housing Counselor.
Making sure clients are moving through the process from intake to engagement.
Handling initial entering of client data in company-wide system, mPact Pro.
Collaborate with Housing Program Manager on client data integration into ETO database from mPact Pro database.

NON-ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Participate in administrative, program meetings and trainings, as appropriate.
OTHER DUTIES AS ASSIGNED: Other duties outside of the responsibilities of the position may be assigned, whether for a project, special needs task or other assignment.
QUALIFICATIONS: At minimum, twelve months of customer service and administrative support experience, within a service-oriented environment, are required. The position requires a proactive self-starter and skills that include: a demonstrated ability to work independently; to handle multiple assignments and tasks; and to apply and comply with various policies and procedures. Good telephone etiquette and ability to communicate in a courteous and professional manner are necessary to the role. Intermediate level of skills with MS Office and Outlook are required, including the ability to download and upload documents to/from email and to pre-approved databases; skills with database management, proficiency with spreadsheets and internet search applications are necessary. Knowledge and experience using Google Docs is a plus. Experience in the organization and implementation of office projects and filing systems, databases and calendars is required. A general knowledge of community resources is desirable. Must be bilingual and fluent in Spanish, reading and writing.
Discretion is required for handling of documents and for client/prospect concerns. Demonstrated respect and appreciation for working in a multi-ethnic and multi-cultural work environment must be evident. The Intake and Program Support Specialist must be able to work effectively with members of the community who may show stress and impatience.
Note: A bilingual Intake & Program Support Specialist who works with a foreign language speaking community must demonstrate cultural competency with that community and fluency in both English and the community’s language (oral and written).
EDUCATION REQUIRED: A High School diploma, or GED, is required. An Associate’s degree or a progress toward completion of a degree is preferred.
CERTIFICATION(s) REQUIRED: NA
WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment includes remote working with at least one weekly office visit. While in the office, the noise level is usually moderate. Movement requirements include walking, stooping or kneeling. There may be a need to reach, lift or move objects, such as packages, supplies and computers. Normal (or corrected) vision range; ability to see color and to distinguish letters, numbers and symbols are necessary to the work, which may require close viewing. Occasionally may need to lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. Communication needs include seeing, hearing and speaking. While working remotely and/or in the office, there will be periods of sitting, holding a telephone and using computers. Reasonable accommodations will be made for an incumbent to meet the essential responsibilities of the position.
WORK SCHEDULE: Monday – Friday, 9:00am-5:00pm. This position may require work on some evenings and weekends. Schedule can vary depending on the needs of the agency.
Benefits Portfolio: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Flexible Spending (FSA), Transit, HSA, Short & Long Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program, etc.
YWCA Metropolitan Chicago is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. YWCA Metropolitan Chicago will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

JobTitle: Remote Property and Casualty Insurance Agent
Text:
In this position you will:
Assess the customer needs and advise clients and prospective clients on insurance coverage and protection options

Provide quotations, pricing and required information to clients and prospective clients and complete the sales process for each customer

Create presentations to clients and prospective clients that demonstrate our company’s unique culture, expertise and service

Understand each client’s decision process, the people involved, the business’ goals and how we can meet their expectations.

Uncover opportunities to cross-sell clients and add new product and coverage lines

Build and maintain relationships with business partners

Negotiate skillfully with internal and external partners

Develop comprehensive product knowledge to offer multiple insurance options

Preferred Qualifications:
Two years prior sales experience

Licensed in Property and Casualty

Demonstrate good decision-making skills and assertiveness

Ability to effectively interact, engage and communicate with internal and external partners

Able to act with a sense of urgency and set deadlines

Ability to work individually and within a team structure in a fun, fast-paced environment

About Guaranteed Rate Insurance:
Guaranteed Rate Insurance is an independent insurance brokerage offering an unmatched value proposition. Our unique business model allows us to consistently achieve new heights and redefine excellence, which has positioned us as one of the fastest organically growing brokerages in the country.

Since 2012, we have achieved double-digit growth, year over year, and now represent over 40 different property and casualty insurance providers in 40 states. Our core value is service. This guiding principle is reflected in our relationship with our team members. We invest in our people, provide support and create an atmosphere for maximizing potential.

Guaranteed Rate, Inc. and Guaranteed Rate Insurance, LLC are Equal Opportunity Employers that welcome and encourage all applicants to apply regardless of age, sex, religion, color, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reason, as protected by law.

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
This is a REMOTE Opportunity

The primary purpose of this role is responsibility for the overall recovery and management of accounts receivable as it relates to maximizing collections for clients. The position involves detailed research and follow-up on medical insurance claims and the careful preparation of appeals and responses to efficiently interact with insurance carriers and resolve the claim. The position supports the company's overall Operations and Client Services by efficiently and effectively driving the accounts receivable process and showing results.

Responsibilities:

Timely management and resolution of unpaid claims as assigned
Effectively manage complex payer denials by assimilating and submitting:
Supporting client clinical documentation
Payer criteria
Correct coding guidelines
Specialty Association recommendations
Federal/local regulatory guidelines
Supporting letter of medical necessity from the provider of service
Appeal letter consistent with payer requirements
Other documentation as applicable
Timely resolution of denials including follow up with payers and clients
Responsibility for information necessary to resolve claims is the responsibility of the AR representative.
Consistent and timely follow up with the client to provide clarification and/or missing information is critical.
Adherence to the Client Adjustment Authorization matrix using appropriate adjustment codes to ensure clean AR
Secondary claims management

Monitoring and reconciliation of claims to include:

Held vouchers
Unbilled vouchers
Patient balance report
Credits and refunds
Compliance with and enforcement of ASRCMS policies and procedures and Client specific billing guidelines
Achieve goals set forth by supervisor regarding error-free work, transactions, processes and compliance requirements
Specific goals include 1,400 accounts worked per month
Other duties as assigned

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Technical: Extensive knowledge on use of email, search engine, Internet and Microsoft products such as Outlook, Word and Excel; ability to effectively use payer and government websites.

Personal: Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills; Ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language; Highly self-motivated, self-directed, and attentive to detail; team-oriented, collaborative; ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Time management skills are critical.

Communication: Ability to read, analyze and interpret complex documents. Ability to respond effectively to sensitive inquiries or complaints from associates and clients. Ability to speak clearly and to make effective and persuasive arguments and presentations to senior management. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, financial forecasts and budgets.

Math & Reasoning: Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent, and to interpret financial reports and graphs. Ability to use critical thinking skills to apply principles of logic and analytical thinking to practical problems.

Physical and Environmental Elements:

Physical demands: Ability to sit continuously for up to 2/3 of normal work shift. Ability to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, and to reach with hands and arms occasionally. Ability to talk and to hear continuously. Finger dexterity is required frequently for up to 1/3 of the normal work shift.

Vision: Ability to see at close range (20 inches or less), at a distance (clear vision at 20 feet or more), ability to identify and distinguish colors, ability to observe an area that can be seen up and down or to the left and right while eyes are fixed on a given point, three-dimensional vision, ability to judge distances and spatial relationships, and ability to adjust the eye to bring an object into sharp focus.

Work Environment: Employees work in an office with moderate noise levels (such as computers and printers) and controlled temperature conditions. Employees may occasionally operate a vehicle and be exposed to traffic conditions that may include loud noises, fumes, and traffic congestion.

Qualifications:
Experience/Training/Education:

High School Diploma or GED
3+ years of physician billing experience required
Experience on the Epic or Allscripts practice management solutions is preferred

Our Story:

About you:

You’re a data driven individual who loves completing a puzzle. You enjoy exploring the city as much as you do working with computers. You take pride in owning work but are comfortable working with a team. You enjoy beginning each day reading news on local city, business, economic, company, infrastructure, demographic and real estate market activity. Well then we want you to help us populate our database!

You are striving to become a data analyst and are ready for the next step. You can work your way around Microsoft Excel and have serious organizational skills. You are also able to communicate clearly and concisely with both teammates and stakeholders, ideally being able to tell a story with the data.

Dedicated to data as an art and science? Passionate about cities and real estate? Enjoy talking with internal stakeholders around market activities daily? Well, this just might be the role for you.

About us:
Avison Young creates real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people. Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people.

Avison Young is the challenger in a sector that needs a shake-up. Our people power this change through every client engagement, colleague interaction and global initiative.

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

Do you value curiosity, diversity of thought, experience, expertise and sharing success? If your answer is yes, Avison Young is a place where you can achieve your career goals.
Overview:

Avison Young – Data Intern - Full Time – Chicago, Ill. or remote

About the role:

As a Data Intern you will work closely with stakeholders in local markets across all business lines. Leveraging your passion for cities, real estate and data we will optimize data processes utilizing automation to capture, review and enhance micro data resulting from daily real estate and real estate adjacent market activities. The focus on and enhancement of micro data will facilitate a more digitally based engagement around our people and clients utilizing the powerful intersection of data, analytics, visualization, automation and technology. This approach will allow Avison Young’s external clients to be more productive and push internal stakeholders to be more efficient, with both being more successful in their common ventures.
Responsibilities:

This role primarily will:
Reviewing products daily and ensuring that core real estate data recently added to platform including properties, images, documents, companies, leases, sales, scoop and availabilities appear complete, consistent, high quality and are displaying correctly
Collaborating, growing and optimizing best-in-class daily data collection processes to consolidate data sources, utilize automated workflows and engage with local resources to capture and enhance micro real estate data on properties, companies, availabilities, leases, sales and scoop, among other data verticals
Adding data to platform daily through news and conversations with data analysts, brokers, tenants, owners, architects and economic development organizations around market activity
Adding and enhancing data on platform through short and medium-term data sprints by reading, abstracting and adding data from industry specific websites, newsletters and publications and company and investor websites, newsletters, public filings, investor presentations and third-party data providers
Ensuring flyers, brochures, OMs, BOVs, rent rolls and stacking plans are added to properties or companies and utilizing technology to abstract and enhance data into database
Walking the market to capture missing photos, update status of properties under construction and enhance data on property, tenants and ownership
Adding and enhancing company data such as industry, headcount, revenue, website and locations
Focusing on short-term and medium-term data sprints for client pursuits
And, of course, other duties as assigned
Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree required or being pursued
Experience in commercial real estate preferred
Interested how micro data can help better tell stories around cities and real estate markets
Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills, advanced preferred
Strong project management skills
Highly strategic, organized and detail oriented
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely with both teammates and stakeholders
Team player and adaptable to fast-paced and quickly changing environments and work priorities
Highly creative with ability to identify and solve problems efficiently
Highly motivated, energetic individual with the ability to be self-directed and work with minimal supervision
Our Equal Opportunity Commitment:

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

Sincro provides local digital marketing technology and services to the automotive industry. We offer our customers cutting-edge solutions powered by AI that increase connections with car shoppers to drive sales and customer loyalty. Our name is new, but we have 25 years of experience and thousands of customers in North America and internationally.

At Sincro, our roots run deep, our passion is undeniable, and our people and technology are world-class. We value our people and their expertise, support them, and invest in them. Sincro employees have a voice that counts. They feel empowered to act. Our culture is authentic, transparent and inquisitive; we look for opportunities to disrupt the status quo.
This person can work remote from home in the US. Our US offices are located in Seattle, Chicago and Detroit.
The Sincro Digital Marketing Agency Team (“The Agency”) provides digital advertising solutions to OEMs and the Agencies that represent OEMs, OEM Brand/Channels, and Dealer Local Marketing Associations (LMAs). This team is responsible for crafting profitable solutions that are based on Sincro’s existing and future digital marketing products.

The Digital Strategist provides the strategic vision to create revenue opportunities, supports the Enterprise Sales team in delivering pro-active, strategic recommendations and closing deals, and delivers a phenomenal customer experience to internal and external stakeholders. They also own the planning, execution, monitoring, and reporting on any and all advertising campaigns for their assigned book of business. This role works closely with our AdOps and BI teams to deliver high quality performance for the OEM client and the Dealer Ad Associations and ensures we craft strategic solutions that focus on financial profitability and ROI messaging. A successful person in this role will establish strong collaboration with Enterprise Sales through strategic thought leadership and client management to generate a recurring revenue stream.

Day to day responsibilities will include launching and maintaining advertising campaigns as well as pro-active insights and strategic recommendations. You will create recurring and ad-hoc reports that will articulate current strategy and performance along with recommended strategy changes going forward. You will leverage internal and external data inputs to determine current success stories and future opportunities. At times, you may be asked to present these recommendations to our Agency partner and/or the client (i.e. the LMA). You will serve as the main contact between the Enterprise Sales team and internal teams and you will work closely with the AdOps team, the Business Intelligence team, and the Product team to deliver results and revenue. This individual will have a unique blend of digital marketing experience, data analysis, strategic acumen, and problem-solving skills.
Key Responsibilities
Become an advisor to the client and drive regular and productive contact with clients to review advertising campaign strategy and performance.
Provide campaign proposals and review performance results via phone.
Execute advertising campaigns across Search, Display, Social, and Video.
Monitor and analyze campaigns and suggest changes to improve performance metrics.
Collaborate with the Enterprise sales organization to uncover opportunities and to manage client relationships
Proactively identify opportunities to improve performance and efficiencies and work cross-departmentally to impact desired change
Apply advanced knowledge of general Digital Marketing and specific Search Engine Marketing best practices
Gather, analyze, and organize complex information, conduct comparative analyses, make recommendations supported by identified facts, and present clear recommendations to clients
Requirements
2+ years client relationship management experience preferred
2+ years digital marketing experience, with a strong focus on paid search required
Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, communications or related field preferred
Ability to build relationships with and influence internal and external stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills. Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills highly preferred.
Ability to think strategically across the team and the organization.
Proven account management and organizational skills showing the ability to manage multiple clients, internal and external, with competing demands.
Demonstrated ability to maintain poise under stress and to respond quickly, logically, and patiently to questions or requests
Google AdWords and Bing AdCenter Certification preferred, but not required
Local Marketing, Synchronized

At World Book, we invest in extraordinary, diverse, talented, and passionate individuals to help us in our mission to spark imagination, cultivate curiosity, and empower education in young learners across the globe.

We are seeking a new business development professional in your area to join our dynamic sales team. This is a remote position within the U.S.

Who We Are

An industry leader in both print and digital educational publishing, World Book delivers engaging content to equip students, parents, and teachers with the tools they need to reach academic success. We first launched the World Book Encyclopedia in 1917 and, since then, have expanded to produce nonfiction and mixed-genre children’s books, reference materials, digital learning platforms, teaching guides, and more—all upholding the same standard of innovation, trustworthiness, and readability upon which we were founded.

We recognize that equal opportunities for education can make all the difference in a child’s path. With our market-leading and award-winning digital and print products, you will be an integral part of our 100+-year mission to develop a passion for lifelong learning in every person we reach. In this role, you will interact with educators in schools and libraries as well as business leaders and organizations that share our vision.

We're looking for a self-starting, innovative, and strategic thinker that seeks to take ownership of their prospective clients and be “in the driver’s seat” of their own success. Does this sound like you?

A Successful Candidate Will Have the Following:


A proven record in developing new business and building strong customer relationships.
2+ years of experience in consultative selling digital solutions.
The ability to engage with clients and articulate our value proposition in a manner that makes you valued as partner.
An entrepreneurial attitude, with ability to roll sleeves up and get things done swiftly.
Strong communication/interpersonal skills.
High degrees of personal and professional integrity.
Great work ethic and ability to work autonomously.
Dedication and ambition.
Working knowledge of CRM systems and the Microsoft suite.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.


What will you get out of your career at World Book?


You’ll receive a robust compensation package with an uncapped commission opportunity, 401(k), medical, and other benefits.
Are you passionate? If so, you’ll be part of collaborative, creative and purposeful teams that are stewards of an amazing brand that immediately opens doors.
We will provide the training and ongoing support to ensure that you thrive as a sales professional in the e-learning and educational publishing industry.
You will have access to mentors and an amazing network of sales professional colleagues.
Every position at World Book makes an impact on the future of education. We value career growth and we are always seeking talent that can evolve into increasingly responsible roles!


Join a team of those who want to make a difference in education, are intellectually curious and have integrity! We can offer a means for you to achieve the goals you want to accomplish in your career. We can’t wait to meet you!

World Book is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

At SMITH, we develop world-class experiential commerce solutions to help brands architect the most relevant, frictionless commerce experiences possible. We work at a high tempo, we collaborate, we’re passionate about our work with clients, and we deliver.
The market demand for our services has fueled our growth. We're currently seeking a talented Project Manager that thrives in a fast-paced environment to join our team.

The Project Manager plays a vital role in keeping project activities on task. You will manage the entire project lifecycle of projects, from defining business objectives and project plan to managing successful execution and deployment—all while meeting strict deadlines and ensuring budgetary obligations. As an effective leader, you will oversee a delivery team of complex, cross-functional resources to an acceptable level of risk by balancing scope, time, cost, customer satisfaction, and quality
Who you are

A ecommerce professional with experience managing end-to-end implementations of enterprise level platforms, Hybris preferred
A detail-oriented self-starter, an exceptional listener, and a skilled communicator (both verbal and written)
A highly organized, mature problem-solver with sharp business acumen and in depth knowledge of ecommerce concepts
Articulate, direct and customer facing. You have the ability to present ideas in user-friendly language while keeping the customer’s needs front and center
Leads projects effectively through to completion expecting nothing less than excellence
A positive team player with proven ability to motivate and lead their team
A skilled decision-maker
A polished presenter
Results-oriented
Open to traveling, if needed
Adaptable to technology and platform changes
Experienced in customer management


What you’ll do

Document the project deliverables and scope in the Statement of Work
Develop, manage, and document (in the agreed format) all production schedules, milestones, projections, estimates, and budgets for customer-assigned projects
Deliver project outputs in accordance with project plans, costs, and customer expectations
Manage project scope, identifying, defining, and communicating risks and change requests before taking appropriate action to minimize impact on project success
Focus on prevention of slippage and overrun. Early identification of risk with suitable and proactive mitigation plans that are actively managed.
Manage the test and acceptance process to attain customer sign-off
Create and manage RFP responses and estimates for prospective customers and projects
Serve as customer’s primary point of contact to manage customer expectations and communications (including timetabled and ad hoc meetings), ensure that the customer is informed on the project status, and obtain customer approval and sign-off on all major deliverables
Manage the project team, including assigning individual project tasks, holding regular meetings to monitor progress, and ensuring all timesheets are completed on time
Coordinate input from all project members, including third-party suppliers and customer staff, to ensure successful delivery
Ensure that all work is produced in accordance with appropriate processes and that opportunities for improvement are identified and agreed upon
Ensure the relevant repositories are updated and maintained
Conduct regular meetings with practice director to report project progress
Lead end-of-project reviews and produce lessons-learned document at the end of the project
Upon discovery, advise the account manager of potential new business opportunities with the customer


What we look for

3+ years experience with implementation of enterprise level ecommerce platforms, Hybris preferred
Experience working in Agile and Waterfall software development environments
Experience working within teams building ecommerce systems or other high-availability web-based applications
Experience with issue and bug management systems such as the Atlassian suite (e.g., JIRA, Confluence) and/or Microsoft Visual Studio (TFS)
5+ years of project management experience managing projects through the entire lifecycle, from inception to go live
Experience writing Statements of Work or Project Charters
Experience with RFP responses
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and Microsoft Project


SMITH | The Architects of Future Commerce
The next big thing isn’t what you’ll buy, it’s how you’ll buy it. SMITH is a values-driven digital transformation agency with one mission: to make buying and selling awesome. For more than 20 years, SMITH has worked in partnership with the world's most respected B2B and B2C brands to deliver better business outcomes with design thinking and technology enablement that puts their customers at the center. Key partnerships with technology platforms include SAP Commerce (formerly Hybris) and Adobe AEM. We have the strategy, creative and the technology talent to deliver content and commerce solutions for some of the most recognized brands on the planet including AT&T, Microsoft, Barnes & Noble Education, Best Buy, Cisco, TopGolf, CDK Global and Honeywell. Our unique ownership structure is based on a philanthropic foundation which allows us to focus on client outcomes before quarterly earnings reports and empowers us to make decisions focused on helping our clients and not quarterly earnings reports with our profits enabling socially beneficial programs. SMITH has offices in Dayton and Ottawa-Gatineau along with our remote workforce distributed throughout the United States and Canada. Learn more at http://www.smith.co/.

About UPshow:

UPshow is a rapidly growing SaaS company providing innovative solutions to the Hospitality, Health Care and Fitness industries. Company growth has averaged 70% over the last several years. UPshow completed a $14M cash raise in the second half of 2020.

UPshow is the leading innovator in digital signage for businesses. UPshow increases customer engagement with interactive TV and mobile software, creating a unique in-venue network to advertise to and entertain customers. We offer a three-in-one platform that provides: entertainment options, engagement solutions, and a management suite to measure results. By using these tools, businesses can increase revenue; influence customer and employee behavior; become more efficient. Our clients range from healthcare providers to restaurant groups, to nationwide gyms — all looking to reach their customers with the right messages at the right time. Founded in 2015, UPshow now reaches audiences in thousands of businesses around the world. Learn more at upshow.tv


About the role:

This position will help fuel and accelerate the growth of UPshow by generating brand awareness and leads, which in the end convert into net new revenue.

You will be responsible for executing a demand generation strategy to results. You will identify and segment audiences and develop integrated campaigns that engage, re-engage, inform and activate leads. Our ideal candidate will be an acquisition maven that can roll up his/her sleeves, partner with stakeholders, and scale-out demand generation programs.


What You’ll Do:

Manage growth and optimization of online marketing programs to meet revenue goals.
Generate new leads by leveraging a variety of online marketing channels and strategies, including email, paid advertising, ABM specifically, landing pages, content marketing, and in collaboration with media, brand influencers, and social.
Develop inbound digital marketing campaigns in coordination with our Content team to generate demand and leads (eg white papers, new product releases, external media content, video, infographics, etc.) and package 360 multi-channel activation across digital marketing, events, trade-shows, webinars, thought leadership and content, video and email.
Create, execute, measure, and refine all aspects of integrated marketing campaigns. Strong focus on advanced inbound digital marketing activities along with traditional outbound methods to generate leads, including email marketing nurture and drip campaigns, webinars, AdWords strategy, LinkedIn advertising and optimizing organic website performance to grow traffic and increase conversions.
Data-driven experiments, reporting on campaign performance, and forecasting where to make adjustments to continue to drive results and improve our growth strategy.
Work with the Director of Growth to establish KPIs, track performance/success, measure, analyze and adjust campaigns based on performance. Prepare marketing reports and post-program analysis summarizing campaign results.
Evaluate our website and strategically build our referral traffic strategy.


Competencies:

What We’re Looking For:

Expert in lead scoring, nurturing programs, list management, segmentation, and targeting.
Someone with a quantified segmentation, targeting, and test and learn approach.
Solid understanding of SEO & SEM principles
Experience creating enterprise account-based marketing in addition to small-medium business marketing programs.
Demonstrated experience defining and measuring programs, including analytics and reporting, and translating information into consumable, executive-level updates.
Great track record of working across sales, marketing, customer success, and technology teams.
Results-oriented; highly analytical and metrics-driven.
Excellent time management and organizational skills with the ability to track numerous details.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written).
Ambition. You never settle for mediocrity, knowing your name is tied to everything you do.
Ability to receive and implement feedback immediately.
Proactive rather than reactive approach to handling and solving problems.


Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree required.
4-7 years of B2B demand generation/marketing automation experience.
Strong working knowledge of Hubspot (specifically the Marketing Hub)
Proficient CRM user (Salesforce or Hubspot).
Strong knowledge of and experience with advertising platforms, such as LinkedIn, Google Ads, or AdRoll
Experience with webinar technology


Benefits and Perks:

Competitive Compensation + Bonus opportunities
Stock Options
Medical, dental, vision, life, and short-term disability insurance
Professional Development Programs
Access to senior management and mentoring opportunities
Employee Recognition Program
Unlimited PTO
Parental Leave
401k Match

Summer Fridays
Employee Assistance Program
Work from Anywhere policy, to respond to an ever-changing work climate
Virtual Social Events including: Team Wins and Highlights from the Month, Cultural and Diversity Spotlights, and Happy Hours


This is a chance for you to join a challenging and inspiring environment where you will have the possibility to make a daily impact. Every day you will work alongside helpful and down-to-earth colleagues who are dedicated and ambitious. Together we create an innovative environment that drives UPshow forward. If you are the right person for the role you will be part of a fantastic journey in a dynamic, high-growth business.

We look forward to your application.

Are you a self-motivated and gregarious business development representative that wants to make money selling an innovative technology? Do you want to join a high energy company with an amazing culture? If you thrive in a competitive and collaborative team environment then this may be position for you!
About The Position:
ChowNow is unique among tech startups in the restaurant space. We power branded online ordering systems for independent restaurants across North America – via websites, Google, Instagram, and through branded iOS and Android apps – and we do it all for a reasonable monthly fee regardless of order volume. We operate this way because of our belief in being fair, sustainable, and equitable with our restaurant partners. And the same goes for our workplace.
Diversity, teamwork, and mutual respect are among our core company values. And we pride ourselves on giving our teams plenty of opportunities to make their mark. To date we’ve created over 18,000 apps for our restaurant partners – something that’s never been done before in our category. And as we expand to new markets, further spreading the word about the ChowNow difference, those opportunities to create, build, and grow will only increase. If this sounds like the kind of workplace, and the kind of mission, that appeals to you, we’d love to talk.
Learn more by checking out our reviews on Glassdoor (they’re excellent). Together we can preserve neighborhood flavor, one restaurant at a time.
About Us:
The Territory Manager role is a full-time, high base salary + generous commission outside sales position based in Chicago, Illinois. You will sell online ordering and marketing solutions in person within an assigned territory. Most of your time will be spent in the field or working from your home office…which provides lots of freedom and requires self-discipline. We’ll provide you with the right tools and on-going training while you grow our restaurant network and grow your career.
Within 30 Days You'll...
Progress through our Ramp Camp (ChowNow’s New Hire Onboarding Experience)
Learn the suite of ChowNow products; be able to discuss the ChowNow origin story with prospective clients.
Learn to navigate through salesforce (Creating Leads, Opportunities, Flipping Accounts to “Closed Won” - YESSS!)
Start to master your ChowNow pitch, from your elevator pitch to close.
Learn the lay of the land, begin to understand your territory at greater length and strategize on what’s your first and next move. (Start to generate leads/ opportunities out in the field)
Learn the sales process from A to Z (From finding the leads, to saying hello, to asking for the close and finally making sure everything is correct in Salesforce)
Gear up to hit the road and travel (Begin to manage your calendar and book your own travel)
Within 60 Days You'll...
Hit/ Exceed your ramp quota
Develop relationships with our current partnerships for US Foods (Territory Managers, District Managers, Regional Managers, ROC’s)
Learn to manage your calendar and travel schedule
Become a road warrior by driving activity out in the field
Start to maximize your efficiency and organization
Attend Local/ Regional Food Shows
Go on ride alongs with our partnership territory managers
Within 90 Days You'll...
Hitting/ Exceeding your ramp quota
Fully understand the sales cycle
Be on your way to be a sales guru
Build a book of relationships with our partnerships that you will use throughout your career here at ChowNow
Become a travel master (organizing your calendar, booking travel)
You Should Apply If:
You’re an experienced, hungry sales professional with 3+ years of experience, and a proven track record of winning deals in a short sales cycle.
You enjoy the entire sales process (prospecting, qualifying, positioning, closing, and supporting client onboarding).
You’re genuinely curious about people, local restaurants, and food trends. You enjoy build lasting relationships that enable you to build a book of business where referrals are the norm.
You practice as hard as you play. You’re a market expert, you know your competitors, you’re up to date on the latest trends, you’re coachable, and you’re willing to put in the time to master your craft to understand how your buyer makes decisions.
Sales to restaurants a BIG plus. The ability to thrive while working in the field with your own home office is a HUGE plus.
About Our Benefits:
Competitive Salary
Ongoing training and growth opportunities.
A "Best Place to Work" winner multiple times where we focus on creating a great employee experience
Rock solid medical, dental, and vision plans.
Mental Health Coverage - we offer several programs to support your mental health and wellness goals.
3 weeks paid vacation; paid holidays; we expect you to work hard, but still enjoy your personal life
6 weeks of baby bonding time for all new parents (within the first year of birth or adoption), 6 Weeks of Paid Pregnancy Leave.
401(k) Matching
Employer-contributing student loan assistance program.
Commuter benefits (including Uber Pool).
Employee Stock Incentive Plan.
Pet insurance for your fur babies
Quarterly Industry Speakers Series.
Quarterly Tech Events (Women, LGBTQ, Diversity, Inclusion).
Consistent & fair leadership: we’ll share info, set clear goals, show you respect, and treat everyone fairly.
Enough freedom to spread your wings while still holding you accountable.
Fully stocked kitchen and cold brew on tap.
We are committed to an inclusive and diverse work environment. ChowNow is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.
