Ashland Women's Health and Lactation Network are members of the Graymont Medical portfolio of healthcare brands.
Ashland Women's Health and Lactation Network are hiring a Revenue Cycle Manager. Based in Chicago and reporting to the Director of Revenue Cycle, this role is responsible for overseeing and optimizing the Revenue Cycle Management function for Lactation Network and more broadly for Ashland Women's Health.
We are a small, tight-knit, purpose-driven organization with aggressive growth goals in 2021 and beyond. We don't have all the answers and we don't expect you to, either. We do expect you to be curious, hardworking, and striving to be your best self.
Role Summary

The Revenue Cycle Manger oversees the operations of the billing department, encompassing medical coding, charge entry, claims submissions, payment posting, accounts receivable follow-up, and reimbursement management. He/she provides direction to the team under the oversight of the Director of Revenue Cycle. The Revenue Cycle Manager will work collaboratively with peers and subordinates to assure the smooth operation of the Revenue Cycle department while maximizing cash flow and return on behalf of Ashland Women's Health and the Lactation Network.

What you'll do
Responsible for leading and managing all revenue cycle activities related to professional charge capture, and review and edit (clearinghouse, claim, payer), to ensure timely and accurate charge capture, billing, and maximization of reimbursements.
Lead the department through process improvement opportunities, standardization of work flow (best practices), and optimization of team performance through strategic evaluation and staff development activities.
Must understand all aspects of the billing and coding duties to include:
Proper entering of patient demographics and insurance information
Verification of patient eligibility and benefits for upfront collection on unmet deductibles and co-insurance
Personally responsible for reviewing all operative reports within three business days of procedure/surgery
Correct entering of charges according to insurance payors/contracts
Submission of clean claims with attachment of necessary documentation for payment
Follow-up on electronic and paper claims
Posting insurance payments to patient accounts
Submission of all secondary claims when necessary
Refunding of overpayments owed back to the patient orpayer
Collaborate with organizational leadership to help resolve any barriers to accurate and timely claim submission and remittance processing.
Coach and mentor the team to develop staff and improve teamwork, morale, and overall performance and results.
Manage and analyze KPI (key performance indicators) Dashboard to identify opportunities for process improvement and maximized reimbursement.
Develop department goals to support the business objectives.
Demonstrate excellent initiative and judgement. Work independently to apply effective approaches to prioritizing tasks, managing time, delegating of tasks, while meeting deadlines.
Exhibit outstanding decision making and customer service.
Work collaboratively to improve processes, communicate barriers within revenue cycle, and works towards resolution.
Promote a work environment of accountability and ownership.
Conduct one-on-one meetings with direct reports, providing a structured time for coaching, to discuss accomplishments, and to review the status of revenue cycle operations within their scope of responsibility.
Discuss areas of professional development as well as goal tracking/reporting, projects, and other pertinent topics.
Perform other duties as required.


What we expect from you
Five or more years of management experience in healthcare industry
Five or more years of professional billing experience, specific DME experience strongly preferred
Experience and enjoyment of managing direct reports
A strong work ethic
Close attention to detail
An aptitude for problem-solving
High EQ
A glass-half-full attitude
What you can expect from us
Generous PTO. We work hard. We’re passionate about what we’re building together. We also have lives outside work.
Benefits. Medical plus voluntary vision and dental. (We are a healthcare company, after all.)
401(k) with employer match. We’re planning for the future—and we want to help you do the same.
Flexibility. We like spending time together in our West Loop office and we believe that leadership is a contact sport. We also work remotely regularly. (We are currently fully remote during the pandemic.)
We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identify or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

JobTitle: Global Market Development Manager - Biotech Loyalty
Text:
When you are a part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work to help make the world healthier cleaner and safer, like helping researchers find cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and support to help you achieve your long-term career goals.

How will you make an impact?

We are looking for a talented and results-driven Global Market Development Manager - Biotech Loyalty to join the Biosciences Division’s (BID) Integrated Marketing Programs team. This dynamic, strategic and creative individual will be responsible for retention and advocacy marketing focused primarily on the Biotech market. Their charter will be to develop multi-channel marketing programs that leverage an enticing customer loyalty program to drive increased product adoption, repeat demand, life-time value and incremental revenue primarily from the Biotech market for Thermo Fisher Scientific.
The appointed Marketing Manager will use their comprehensive marketing experience targeting or working in the Biotech market, scientific knowledge and customer-centricity to identify and execute against the most effective go-to-market strategies to gain new customers and grow share of wallet. This highly collaborative individual will need to work effectively across multiple marketing, sales and operations functions, leading and influencing cross-functional teams to drive results.
The successful individual will enjoy working with intensity, can drive strategy to action, have exceptional organization and communication skills with a diverse marketing skill set. A scientific education is a necessity with a background in cell, protein or molecular biology a plus, combined with solid business acumen to achieve goals on time.
Their ability to prioritize and manage multiple parallel projects and work comfortably in a highly matrixed environment will allow them to demonstrate that they are a keen team player while being able to complete projects independently that make a positive impact on the business and customers.

What will you do?
Develop and execute against tactical marketing plans to drive customer acquisition, retention and advocacy for primarily but not limited to BID consumable products
Create and deploy marketing content across multiple on and off-line channels for both acquisition and retention marketing
Utilize analytical tools and revenue reporting data to make sound marketing decisions to exceed financial and marketing performance objectives
Develop sales and marketing training material to excite and activate commercial and Business Unit teams to be successful in target segments
Lead, without direct authority, dynamic cross-functional project teams to complete tasks on time and within budget
Develop product and application workflows to drive cross-sell and up-sell activities within loyalty program
Interact with varying levels of leadership to report on progress and escalate challenges
May perform other related duties as required and/or assigned
What skills will lead to success?
Identifies problems, answers questions, gain cooperation of others and implement efficient solutions.
Exceptional project management skills, attention to detail, strong time management skills and deadline driven
Fast and self-starter learner, with ability to work in a dynamic team adapting quickly to a changing environment
Strong understanding and experience with digital media and how they influence customer behavior
Customer journey mapping
Analytical and able to make justifiable data-driven decisions to drive growth, maintain a designated budget and provide metrics to ensure strong return on investment
Ability to lead and provide functional area guidance and expertise to the broader team.
Provide regularly oral and written communication of metrics, successes, failures, best practices etc. to improve the overall operating efficiency of the team.
Must be willing to learn and take coaching from peers and supervisors/superiors, both in success and failure.
Must have a can-do attitude, as well as the ability to overcome failures to produce success with a “never give up” approach.
How will you get there?
6+ total years of marketing experience with a minimum of 3 years successfully and independently developing and implementing marketing plans
Experience in life sciences, biotech or related field required, with intimate knowledge of the North America market
Demonstrated knowledge and experience of retention and advocacy marketing, particularly through digital marketing channels
Collaborates easily and effectively with an ability to influence without direct authority
Minimum Education:
Bachelor's Degree

This position may be remote for the ideal candidate.

Position Summary
In 2020 a new Workday Operations Post-Production Support program was established under the direction of the Firm’s Finance, Operations, and Human Resources Leadership; to support the newly implemented Workday Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Solution. This program (“Enterprise Solutions”) partners with users, analysts, project managers, and executive stakeholders to understand business needs and requirements to implement solutions for complex business issues. The goal(s) of Workday Operations Support program include:
Work with functional business owners and subject matter experts (SMEs) to gather high level and detailed requirements for Core HCM, Talent & Performance, Benefits, Onboarding, Recruit, Compensation, Advanced Compensation and Payroll features in Workday.
Capture detailed enhancements requirements for various Workday Business Processes (BPs) for Core HCM; including job changes, onboarding/offboarding, time-tracking, security administration, workflow, and reporting.
Create a proof of concept for new enhancement requirements; with ability to present to Steering Committee by creating presentations and demonstrating the design in a Workday environment.
Create change requirements documentation for review and approval by the Change Control Board.
Configure various BPs for Core HCM, Recruiting, Benefits, Payroll, Compensation, Advanced Compensation, Talent and Performance, etc.
Perform resolution of post-production tickets within the given SLA for Core HCM, Recruiting, Payroll, Benefits, Compensation, Advanced Compensation, Talent and Performance.
Facilitate the migration of changes / fixes from Sandbox to Production, including reports and integrations.
Support testing for all Core HCM updates after configuration and creation of user testing documents for plans configured and tested.
Monitor integrations to ensure there are no errors / failures in the delivery.
Ensure data is clean in Workday via ongoing governance, reconciliations, and audits.
Communicate of all release notes and post-production issue fixes to the business users.
The Workday Operations Manager will be responsible for supporting the ideation, execution, and evaluation of Workday Operations solutions. The position requires a talented professional who can envision a new and improved user experience along with supporting corporate functions by using process improvements and Workday solutions to streamline Spence Stuart’s operations. He/she will need to participate in a broad set of initiatives in collaboration with other functional teams such as Services Management, Operational Excellence, Finance, Accounting, Legal, HR and Learning in addition to core business stakeholders in the Executive Search and Leadership Advisory Services service lines.
Key Relationships
Reports to:
Director of Enterprise Solutions
Other Key Relationships:
Human Resources
Talent Acquisition
Services Management Leaders
Portfolio Management
Operational Excellence
Director of Development in Chicago
Chief Information Officer
Change Management Team
Global Practice and Function Leaders
Consultants, Associates, Research Analysts and EAs
Chief Financial Officer and key finance stakeholders
Chief Talent Officer and key HR stakeholders
 Ideal Experience
Four-year degree. HR Management or MIS a plus. Post graduate degree a plus.
Three or more years of direct Workday-HCM experience.
Two or more years of System Administration/Production-Support experience, including advanced configuration, workflow management, and user management.
Understanding of business needs, particularly from an HCM perspective.
Strong understanding of environment management, release management, configuration, best practices, and deployment methodologies.
Experience architecting solutions that match to a set of business requirements or cases.
Ability to identify gaps in business requirements and ask the right questions to address gaps.
Developed a Customer Experience focused mindset.
Exposure to application architecture, development and integration practices.
Very strong analytical and trouble-shooting skills, strong partnering/relationship building skills.
Self-motivated and well-adapted to meet deadlines with speed, accuracy, and a professional attitude.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work with and through others to resolve issues.
Ability to resolve conflict in a constructive manner and work around obstacles to ensure success.
Understanding of basic Agile principles.
Exposure to Jira or similar work management tools.
Other Personal Characteristics for Success
Good presence and self-confidence.
Strong communication skills.
Flexibility and adaptability to continuous change.
Team oriented and can work in collaborative culture
Desire to make a positive impact on the Firm, our Clients, and our Culture
Location
Corporate Office in Chicago, IL
Applicants may work from other US locations (remote / virtual) 50-75% of the time, with expectation that travel to Chicago occurs on an as-needed basis.
Spencer Stuart is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer F/M/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Description
Come grow with us! Flint Hills Resources, a leading refining, chemicals and biofuels company is growing and we are looking for the best people to grow with us. We are looking for candidates who want to create long term value, who are not afraid to challenge the status quo, and who want to find fulfillment in what they do.
If this sounds like you, then we invite you to apply to join the Flint Hills Resources team. We are a privately held fast growing company, so the opportunities for development and advancement are abundant.
Flint Hills Resources is looking for an Account Manager to work from home to support our commercial business. As the Account Manager, you will manage our existing customer base by understanding and managing customer needs within a polypropylene market as well as providing knowledge on products, handling procedures, and applications and assuring the sales contract process is administered efficiently. You will also leverage relationships to capture demand, investigate new market opportunities and work to grow Flint Hills’ customer base in the market.
What You Will Do In Your Role
Understand and manage customer needs within the assigned polypropylene territory or “book of business”
Provide knowledge on products, applications, and end uses
Understand and manage converter/brand owner relationships within the market
Assure sales contract process, accounts receivable, claim, pricing and forecasts are administered
Communicate supply needs/commitments to ensure efficient management and delivery of supply
Communicate and share various customer knowledge internally with entire business team
Understand the customers demand and ensure plan is in place to address
Manage overall customer base to optimize netbacks and profitability.
Active role in new product identification, development, roll-out and launched
Leverage FHR PP strengths to be the preferred supplier
Optimize existing customer base and develop profitable new relationships with customers
Coordinate with technical and business capabilities to achieve sales, business goals and customer needs
The Experience You Will Bring
Requirements:
6 plus years of technical sales or polymer industry experience
Bachelor’s Degree
Must be willing and able to travel up to 50% of the time
What Will Put You Ahead
10 plus years of polyolefin sales experience, with emphasis on polypropylene


Salary and Benefits Commensurate with Experience.
Equal Opportunity Employer.

Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.


This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

Job Description

The Account Executive (AE) in the Small Law Channel is responsible for retaining and growing their existing account base and acquiring new accounts within their area of responsibility. Their territory consists primarily of an existing client base of approximately 230 accounts in 1-10 attorney size firms. The AE position is field based, requiring excellent face to face, telephone and writing skills. The successful AE draws on their high level of initiative and ability to apply strong business acumen to conduct a thorough needs analysis within their accounts. The successful AE has the ability to develop trust, demonstrate their credibility with all account stakeholders through their knowledge of Thomson Reuters’ products, and services and acquired knowledge of the legal industry. The AE tailors their presentations to the unique needs of the individual account and articulates their proposals through ROI justification to shorten the sales cycle.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Networks and partners with customers both over the phone and in person in order to build confidence and develop win/win solutions; proactively stays on top of additional sales opportunities while navigating through customer organizations, balances frequency of contact with potential for new sales.
Effectively manages his/her territory via phone and in person by allocating appropriate time to prioritize goals, requirements, renewal opportunities and sales opportunities.
Demonstrates an excellent ability to meet the demands of selling to a large customer base by strategizing customer contact methods; operate with effectiveness and determination; acts promptly to take advantage of multiple opportunities; remains realistically positive in sales situations; persists to achieve sales goals despite barriers or difficulties by changing strategies, doubling efforts, or employing other techniques.
Uses appropriate interpersonal styles to consistently build trust and confidence with users, key contacts, managers and executives at Thomson Reuters’ customer sites; communicates and interacts effectively with internal team partners to achieve goals.
Exhibits a deep knowledge of Thomson Reuters products, as well as the legal profession and the legal publishing industry: Relishes on-going, self-initiated learning; assimilates new information quickly; welcomes feedback and applies knowledge to practical use on the job.
Responsibilities
Attains sales and renewal targets and quotas on a monthly basis by both in person customer visits and meetings over the phone.
Demonstrates the use of Small Law products to the customer
Obtains and provides territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
Confers with and assists in customer-related issues, including collections and complaints, as needed to maintain good customer relations
Completes weekly sales performance reports and completes all Salesforce.com reporting in a timely and accurate manner
Attends sales meetings and conventions as required
Qualifications
Minimum 5 years successful sales experience (both over the phone and field sales); Legal industry preferred.
4 year college degree or equivalent experience, JD a plus
Software as a Service Sales (SAAS) Experience a plus
Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
Excellent communication skills and closing skills
Effective time management skills
Able to work from home office and travel to customer locations
Proficient in MS Office/Internet
High level of competency with regard to internet, periodical and internal prospecting.
Proficient database management skills
Ideal Candidate Profile/Success factors:
JD, legal sales experience, or SAAS experience
Consultative sales skills, specifically working with clients on a series of small sales over an extended period of time
Demonstrated success in a sales positions requiring a high activity level
Strong listening skills and ability to ask probing questions
Proficiency with sales related tools, ex. CRM systems
High level of integrity and strong understanding of sales ethics
Continuous learner, flexible and open-minded
Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.
We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.
Accessibility
As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.
More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Something Digital has recently joined forces with Rightpoint, a global experience leader and a Genpact company.
Genpact, a global professional services firm focused on delivering digital transformation, today announced the expansion of its experience business, Rightpoint, with the acquisition of Something Digital. The addition of Something Digital’s deep commerce expertise to Rightpoint’s customer experience leadership, will further enable the company’s ability to drive experience-led transformation at scale for clients across industries.
Something Digital is an interactive agency with offices around the US. We have spent close to 20 years developing customer software, eCommerce sites, intranets, and websites for diverse clients ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies.

Something Digital is looking for a Strategic Engagement Manager. Currently, this role is 100% remote.
We have offices in New York City (HQ), Los Angeles, CA and West Palm Beach, FL.

We’ll need you to:
Manage a set of SD’s ongoing engagements, expanding client relationships by discovering, understanding, and documenting client requirements through regular interaction
Create, maintain, and oversee implementation of client roadmaps (Roadmaps include technical, creative, marketing, and business objectives)
Estimate resource requirements for creative, development, and marketing tasks and identify steps required for completion
Coordinate and manage the team’s effort and code release cycles
Participate in resolving operational challenges, including billing, staffing, and utilization management
Work closely with SD’s sales team to educate customers on services and solutions through conference calls, site visits, presentations, technical evaluations, proposals, and follow-up
Assume responsibility for client emergency issues (including after-hours support) in collaboration with SD’s technical team
Keep clients happy and contribute to SD’s gross-profit objectives
You must have:
Background working in an interactive agency and/or experience supporting and collaborating with external clients
Strong English communication skills (written and verbal) and keen emotional awareness
At least 3 years of experience in a website development environment
Familiarity with ecommerce practices
Experience with technical and UX requirements gathering
Understanding of SEO/SEM, social media, digital advertising, and Google Analytics
Ability to prioritize and meet deadlines independently and lead a group to task completion

 It’d be great if you had:
Experience with Magento Commerce or Shopify production
Experience with WordPress, Drupal, or other PHP-based platform development
Understanding of source control
Experience with LAMP stack and the UNIX shell

Apply if you:
Are passionate about ecommerce, web experiences, and software development
Have a love for process and exceptional attention to detail
Enjoy a challenge and are eager to grow
Enjoy fostering and developing strong relationships between the members of your team and client base to efficiently and effectively deliver upon project requirements
Are excited to work on high traffic, high profile websites with complex requirements
Are looking for a company that values training, skills development, and individual growth

Medical Communication Company (MEDCOMCO) is a boutique medical communications agency that partners with leading pharmaceutical companies to develop high-quality publications and medical education supporting materials. We are currently seeking an experienced medical writer to join our growing team. Preferred are candidates with extensive experience developing external-facing publications (with additional consideration to those with previous medical communications agency experience), and candidates with experience in the hematology/oncology field. This fully remote contract position could be long-term for the right candidate.Your responsibilities: Lead agency development of scientific publications, including congress reports (abstracts and presentations) and full-length manuscripts reporting key trial/registry outcomesPartner with key opinion leaders on expert review articlesWork with publication managers to meet required deadlinesProvide support for and critical review of content led by other MEDCOMCO medical writersRevise according to client and author feedback throughout the project development processDevelop supporting materials based on key publication dataParticipate in regular virtual meetings with MEDCOMCO and client teamsMay require flexibility to work outside normal business hours to support deadlines, customer expectations, and/or provide surge capacityYour strengths: Advanced verbal and written communication skillsAdaptability and creativity; ability to synthesize complex datasets to create clear, concise publicationsAbility to receive and utilize constructive feedbackA keen eye for detail and a commitment to accuracyFlexibility and willingness to adapt to changing deadlines and priorities; ability to work well in a fast-paced team environmentAbility to provide critical, constructive, and timely review of materialAbility to establish effective working relationships and maintain open communication with MEDCOMCO team membersHighly organized and motivatedYour qualifications: Postgraduate scientific degree required (MS, PharmD, PhD, MD)Experience writing peer-reviewed narrative review manuscripts and primary/secondary clinical manuscripts required. Applicant must provide at least 5 publications on which they participate as an author or are acknowledged for writing/editorial support.Previous medical communications agency experience strongly preferred (2+ years)Professional association (eg, ISMPP) membership and certification (MWC, CMPP) preferredExperience writing about hematologic malignancies preferredWorking knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry and key stakeholders in the publication development processUnderstand key industry guidelines (ICMJE, GPP)Good PowerPoint, Word, Excel and Reference Manager/Endnote skillsJob Types: Full-time, ContractPay: From $40.00 per hourMedical Specialty:HematologyOncologySchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:This position is fully remoteEducation:Master's (Preferred)Experience:Medical Affairs: 1 year (Preferred)medical writing: 3 years (Preferred)Contract Length:VariesWork Location:Fully RemoteCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking an Administrative Manager – Business Development to join our winning team in any of our California offices, located in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Menlo Park, San Diego, or Costa Mesa or our Chicago or Houston offices The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.


As an Administrative Manager, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Administrative Manager must have excellent leadership and team-building skills, the ability to lead multiple teams (i.e., organizing, planning, problem-solving, and decision making) necessary for effective management, and knowledge of project management principles with the demonstrated ability to develop, implement and manage large, long-term projects. The ideal candidate will also have the advanced ability to facilitate discussion and consensus-based decision making, to work in a team environment with a customer service focus, and to manage work of others to ensure compliance and accuracy.


The Administrative Manager will serve as a central resource for the Business Development Leadership Team. You will be responsible for providing administrative, operational, project management, and communications support to the Chief and Director Leadership team, including the coordination and status of inter-departmental projects and initiatives. You will also lead the implementation of new administrative procedures and strategies that are consistent with the goals and objectives of the firm. In this role you will also:


Act as a trusted advisor and a resource for the BD Chief and Director Leadership team.
Serve as a project manager to the BD Chief and Director leadership team for special projects, including projects that may require cross department coordination and regularly update the Global Project Management Tool
Be a point-of-contact to others at the firm regarding the administrative responsibilities of the BD Department, including but not limited to managing department calendar and department SharePoint site, drafting agendas and managing deliverables for BD leadership meeting, drafting announcements and other department communications.
Consult with key stakeholders, preparing analysis, proposals and recommendations including reports, financial/ budget (OPEX and Headcount) reports, and presentations to senior management in the department.
Serve as a project manager to the BD Chief and Director Leadership team for special projects, including projects that may require cross department coordination and regularly update the Global Project Management Tool.
Provide logistical support which includes coordinating meeting materials, recording meeting minutes, and providing follow-up on agreed actions.
Develop and maintain strong, interactive relationships with all members of the department and other administrative groups, particularly Finance, Technology, Attorney Development, and Human Resources for training programs and roundtables, and relying on these positive relationships to identify areas where firm resources can be leveraged in new and creative ways to implement the strategies and plans.
Promote effective work practices, working as a team member, and showing respect for co-workers


The Manager must have advanced communication skills, both written and verbal, strong analytical skills, and the ability to define problems/issues while using a logical approach to develop and implement appropriate solutions. The successful candidate will have the ability to perceive and analyze complex problems, and a capacity to make or recommend sound decisions, as well as advanced organizational skills needed to manage time well, prioritize effectively, and handle multiple deadlines. The candidate must also have excellent computer and technical skills, including PowerPoint, Excel, and other programs necessary to complete thorough analyses and reports.


The Administrative Manager – Business Development will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.


A minimum of five (5) years of management/supervisory experience at a professional services organization is desired. A Bachelor's degree is required.


As the global outbreak of COVID-19 continues to unfold, Latham has taken precautions to help protect our people, clients, and the communities where we live and work. This includes a temporary shift to remote working for the majority of our lawyers and staff. This role will likely start remotely while the firm continues to evaluate the situation.


Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link.


Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.


Please click here to review your rights under U.S. employment laws.

*Please note that while this role will operate remotely, it is required that the candidate resides in the Midwest Region and within 50 miles of a major airport. States included in Yelp's defined Midwest Region include: North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Kansas, Minnesota, Iowa, Illinois, Missouri, Indiana, Ohio, Michigan and Wisconsin.*

Do you love helping businesses succeed? Are you ready to take your sales career to the next level? Yelp’s mission is to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s Enterprise team partners with National businesses to provide industry leading digital advertising solutions. Yelp’s premium native search advertising products deliver strong ROI by helping clients connect with potential customers at the bottom of the purchase funnel. Yelp has become an essential part in our clients’ local advertising mix and the Enterprise team is growing fast!

The Yelp Enterprise Account Executive works with National corporate clients selling Yelp’s diverse advertising products. You will develop a sales territory and drive new business from prospecting to close. To succeed in this role, you will need to have relevant digital or advertising sales experience and a demonstrated track record of exceeding goals. The Enterprise Account Executive role is key to Yelp’s success and offers significant career growth opportunities within Yelp’s Enterprise Sales team!

#LI-REMOTE
Where You Come In:
You will have an impact on Yelp’s Enterprise business, which is in its early stages and growing fast!
You will work across a territory of key accounts while prospecting for new accounts that are a strong fit for Yelp’s advertising solutions
You will own the full sales cycle from prospecting to close
You will map client organizations and build relationships with multiple contacts focusing on decision-makers
You will have a solid understanding of our clients' business objectives and challenges and align with Yelp’s proven advertising solutions to accomplish their goals
You will partner with clients to develop a cohesive Local strategy utilizing Yelp’s Branding & Conversion products, Local Search campaigns and customer engagement tools
You will identify budgets within the client’s organization tied to driving in-store sales and digital conversions to fund new Yelp campaigns
You will collaborate with Yelp’s Account Management and the Client Partner teams to ensure strong client experiences and program performance post-sale

What it Takes to Succeed:
You have 4+ years experience in Mid-Market, National, or Enterprise Sales
You have experience and success prospecting new business and growing a diverse contact set across an account
You are hungry to grow your career and tackle new challenges with a clear desire to have a big impact on Yelp’s revenue and client set!
You have a proven track record of exceeding revenue targets and comfortable closing $50,000+ deals
You have a demonstrated ability to use strategic selling skills
You are comfortable with Executive level outreach and communication to Mid-Market and National Accounts
You have strong time management and creative problem solving skills
You are a self-starter
You have an understanding of online media and metrics
You have experience presenting over the phone and in-person to mid-large size groups
You are proficient in Powerpoint, Excel and Salesforce
You are able to travel 20% of the time

What You'll Get:
Base salary and uncapped commission
Effective your first day: Full medical, vision, and dental (100% paid employee only coverage)
15 days PTO (accrual begins on date of hire and increases with 2+ years of tenure thereafter), 12 paid holidays, plus one floating holiday
Up to 14 weeks of parental leave
Monthly wellness subsidy
Flexible spending account
401(k) retirement savings plan
Employee stock purchase plan

At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 415-969-8488.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

From private, to hybrid, and the hyper scalers there is no doubt that cloud is transforming our clients approach to IT. VMware, the world’s leader in virtualization, private cloud and hybrid cloud, helps our client take on the complex task to managing and navigating the many cloud offerings existing in our customer’s environments today. From a client’s first private cloud, building of a multi-tenant environment, understanding and managing cost across disparate cloud infrastructures, or deciding how and when to move workloads back and forth from the public clouds, VMware’s Cloud Management portfolio helps clients take on this ever-growing challenge.

Job Role and Responsibility
The Cloud Management Specialist will work at multiple levels within the organization to: Working to drive solutions for customer’s intelligent operations and automation initiatives.
Work effectively as both a specialist (subject matter expert) in support of a core account exec, as well as, directly leading independent sales cycles Create demand and execute pipeline generations programs in conjunction with the sales leaders in each market. Support the Regional Directors to understand market trends and strategic direction around the cloud operating model Develop strong relationships with key decision makers and influencers within customer accounts by providing insights and value that establishes credibility and trust Maintain a strong technical knowledge of VMware’s Cloud Management products and services, as well as, industry trends, customer adoption and competitive solutions
Required Skills 5+ years in enterprise software sales at industry leading companies. With a proven track record of achieving business objectives, in a highly competitive environment, working with enterprise and/or commercial clients. Consultative sales skills with demonstrable selling experience at the C-level, and ability to work as part of a team in a matrix organization. In-depth knowledge of the IT Management business vertical, industry trends, end-user challenges and competitive landscape.
Experience selling SaaS or Cloud solutions Strong business acumen, planning, and the ability to execute Strong communication and presentation skills Demonstrated solutions selling skills to drive solutions (product and services) that reduce cost, improve agility, and delivery reliability to IT stakeholders Advanced knowledge of value selling methodologies, processes and tools Strong business analytical skills including developing business cases and Financial Models including ROI/TCO Ability to understand and present VMware's vision, strategy and organization BA/BS degree or equivalent experience; Ability to travel a minimum of 50% of the time.
 Preferred Skills:Bilingual : Spanish speaking

ADDA Infusion is a unique company in the HR sector. We are looking for an Assistant Recruiter to join our growing team. We are a fun, fast paced international company that is growing with lots of opportunities. We are looking for someone who wants fast paced action with work diversity. Consultancy is not for everyone, but if you have what it takes, the rewards are there. We offer a wide range of benefits including medical, dental, vision and Flexible time off.

Duties:

Perform administrative Duties:

Answering phone calls, scanning documents, and making photocopies is integral to the recruitment process. Recruiting assistants ensure that all the necessary paperwork is filed and that applicant forms are completed and processed.

Interview Scheduling in Gmail and within our HRIS:

Recruiting assistants schedule interviews for up to 40 applicants a week. This involves coordinating schedules with applicants and interviewers, creating calendars, sending interview confirmations, monitoring inboxes, and reconciling interview cancellations.

Initial Screening of Applicants:

As the first point of contact between applicants and the hiring manager, recruiting assistants screen applicants before moving their applications forward. To screen applicants, recruiting assistants review application material, read resumes and cover letters, and set up phone interviews.

Update Applicant Information

Recruiting assistants perform candidate updates, dispositioning, candidate messaging, screening notes within the HRIS.

Process Background Checks

Recruiting assistants process background checks to verify applicant information and ensure that the minimum hiring requirements are met. This may include contacting references, screening for drug use, and checking for criminal background.

Requirements:

Proven experience as Recruitment Assistant or other recruiting-related role
Familiarity with hiring practices and stages (screening, interview, assessment, onboarding)
Experience using HRIS and ATS, job boards and social networks for recruiting,
Ability to work independently, remotely, and as part of a team
Strong organizational and time management skills
Great attention to detail
Outstanding communication skills and customer service skills
Problem-solving ability

An Architecture Lead will help us win new business, primarily in the Cloud / Data Analytics space, and help guide those efforts to success throughout the engagement. This role will also oversee a billion-dollar healthcare organization’s analytics environment. The environment is completely cloud-based (AWS) and serverless. The successful candidate is comfortable with a broad scope of technology, in particular Redshift, Lambda, Python, SQL, and all SDLC best practices using Github and Agile practices. This candidate must have excellent communication skills, including walking the technology team through design ideas and business through solutions. The ideal candidate would have experience with strategic IT planning, consulting experience a plus.Candidates must be able to work for Vertical Trail as a W2 employee. Vertical Trail is not considering 3rd party or contract candidates for this role.Our Architecture Lead will be responsible for:· Providing oversight and guidance to teams to ensure delivery of strategic technical goals· Working with our internal team to present, discuss, and defend architectures for potential clients in the sales cycle· Working with project teams to develop strategic (target) architectures· Building working plans to achieve those strategic goals through manageable iterations· Gathering business requirements through interactions with key business stakeholders and observation· Assisting with strategic planning and prioritization through Agile methodology· Mentoring junior members of the team on design patterns and best practices· As a part of the senior technology team, identify new tools, processes, and best practices for the consulting practice as a wholeArchitecture Lead  Requirements:· 8+ years of hands-on enterprise-level data architecture experience in a consulting environment· 3+ years of proven technical leadership experience of small- to medium-sized teams· Strong knowledge of SDLC best practices and technical project delivery· Experience with application development in cloud environments, data modeling, and master data managementEmployment with Vertical Trail is an exciting opportunity that offers ample avenues for professional growth and development, as well as features including:Attractive Benefits:· Comprehensive Health, Dental, and Vision insurance· Employer-Paid Life and Disability insurance· 401(k) / Retirement Plan· Professional Development PlanIf this opportunity sounds like the right one for you, please contact us today!Job Type: Full-timePay: $79,645.00 - Company: US Department of Health And Human Services
Text:
Duties
Summary

This position is located in the Department of Health & Human Services (HHS), Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS), Office of Program Operations and Local Engagement,(OPOLE) Division of Special Programs & Innovation.

As a Supervisory Health Insurance Specialist, GS-0107-14, you will assure compliance with program policy and operational requirements across all Division activities.
Responsibilities
Directs the work of health insurance specialists, social science research analysts, public health analysts, administrative support assistant, and Commissioned Corps staff.
Provides direction, guidance, and technical assistance to all types of drug and health plans assigned to the Division, implementing CMS policies and instructions.
Directs and oversees Division staff to give guidance and technical assistance to all types of drug and health plans assigned to the Division, implementing CMS policies and instructions.
Oversees staff performance in audit, compliance or other studies related to contractual compliance with CMS laws and regulations; implementation of corrective actions; and makes recommendations to Deputy Group Director for enforcement actions.
Serves as the region?s internal and external primary point of contact for matters relating to all types of drug and health plans assigned to the Division.
Travel Required
Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position.
Supervisory status
Yes
Promotion Potential
14
Job family (Series)
0107 Health Insurance Administration
Requirements

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
You must be a U.S. Citizen or National to apply for this position.
You will be subject to a background and suitability investigation.
Time-in-Grade restrictions apply.
Qualifications
ALL QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS MUST BE MET WITHIN 30 DAYS OF THE CLOSING DATE OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT.


Your resume must include detailed information as it relates to the responsibilities and specialized experience for this position. Evidence of copying and pasting directly from the vacancy announcement without clearly documenting supplemental information to describe your experience will result in an ineligible rating. This will prevent you from receiving further consideration.

In order to qualify for the GS-14 , you must meet the following: You must demonstrate in your resume at least one year (52 weeks) of qualifying specialized experience equivalent to the GS-13 grade level in the Federal government, obtained in either the private or public sector, to include:
(1) Develop, implement, monitor or evaluate activities and processes used by CMS stakeholders who provide services in support of Medicare Parts C or D or other managed healthcare programs (2) Serve as a lead in assigning, prioritizing, reviewing work, and providing guidance; and (3) Making decisions or recommendations to improve existing department-wide, Medicare Parts C or D, or other managed health care program operations.

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Time-in-Grade: To be eligible, current Federal employees must have served at least 52 weeks (one year) at the next lower grade level from the position/grade level(s) to which they are applying.
Click the following link to view the occupational questionnaire: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/11020515
Education
This job does not have an education qualification requirement.
Additional information
Bargaining Unit Position: N0
Tour of Duty: Flexible
Recruitment/Relocation Incentive: Not Authorized
Financial Disclosure: Required

Full-Time Telework Program for CMS Employees: CMS employees currently participating in 100% Full-Time Telework Program may be eligible to remain in the program. If an employee in this program is selected, the pay will be set in accordance with the locality pay for the applicable duty station. The listed salary range reflects the locality pay assigned to the duty location(s) listed in the vacancy announcement. For more information about pay based on locality, please visit the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Salaries & Wages Page.

The Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP) and Career Transition Assistance Plan (CTAP) provide eligible displaced federal employees with selection priority over other candidates for competitive service vacancies. To be qualified you must submit the required documentation and be rated well-qualified for this vacancy. Click here for a detailed description of the required supporting documents. A well-qualified applicant is one whose knowledge, skills and abilities clearly exceed the minimum qualification requirements of the position. Additional information about ICTAP and CTAP eligibility is on OPM's Career Transition Resources website at www.opm.gov/rif/employee_guides/career_transition.asp.

Additional Forms REQUIRED Prior to Appointment:

Optional Form 306, Declaration of Federal Employment and the Background/Suitability Investigation - A background and suitability investigation will be required for all selectees. Appointment will be subject to the successful completion of the investigation and favorable adjudication. Failure to successfully meet these requirements may be grounds for appropriate personnel action. At Verizon Media, we connect people to their passions. With brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and more, we help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. From XR experiences to advertising and content technology, Verizon Media is an incubator of innovation and is revolutionizing the next generation of content creation in a 5G world.
This internship position will be fully remote. Since location is not relevant, you can be based from anywhere domestically in the U.S. during your internship.
A little about Verizon Media Platform

The Media Platform business at Verizon Media provides industry leading content delivery, application security, edge compute and streaming capabilities via its global network and global team. Our platform is trusted by emerging brands and Fortune 500 companies alike. Our team is full of industry innovators and passionate uber-geeks. Our scale makes it possible to deliver double-digit percentages of the world’s internet traffic and stream the highest profile entertainment events. In fact, if you have used the Internet today, you have probably interacted with us already (Hi! it’s good to see you again!) As we invest and grow, we are looking to build the most talented and the most diverse team around. If you think you’ve got what it takes, then we want to chat with you!


Job Description

As a Product Manager Intern, Edge Computing, you will be responsible for defining, driving, and scaling our Edge Compute Functions-as-a- Service (FaaS), Container-as-a-Service (CaaS) and Edge Applications offerings built using open source Kubernetes based container orchestration system. You will work with customers, external partners and internal stakeholders to better understand product requirements and work with engineering teams to deliver market leading solutions. You will also partner with our infrastructure team that is helping us deliver a K8s platform that can be remotely monitored, have a mechanism to automatically apply security patches, upgrades, proactive monitoring and overall auto-healing processes. You are passionate about how 5G, MEC and Edge Computing will revolutionize Retail, Finance, TeleHealth and other industry verticals. You will work with customers, product teams, and engineering to drive requirements and delivery of solutions that are innovative and market driven.


Responsibilities
Develop feature strategy, roadmap, and business plan for our Edge Compute product
Responsible for creating wireframes, user stories and process flow diagrams
Translate customer and market analysis into a product strategy that delivers on high-value customer requirements with a differentiated product and user experience
With Product Engineering, define product requirements, prioritize features, and support product development
Minimum Qualifications
BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
1+ years experience with technical product management, Cloud/Edge Computing, Kubernetes, Containers/Virtualization, and Orchestration technologies
Experience executing product strategy based on industry trends, research and data
Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals within a matrix organization
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Preferred Qualifications
Some MBA experience MBA preferred
Experience with Kubernetes, Content Delivery Networks (CDN), internet-scale Networking and Computer Systems, DNS, and Web Hosting
Software and/or web application development experience is a plus

Location: Mavens Komodo Health is a remote organization open to candidates located anywhere in the US.


Who we are: Mavens Komodo Health works to elevate healthcare worldwide. We connect people to cures using best-in-class cloud technology solutions.
Who you are: You have dedicated experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud and marketing automation. You enjoy using your technology and industry subject matter experience to provide comprehensive technology solutions to business challenges. You enjoy solving problems and have a talent for explaining complicated solutions to business and technical audiences. You are precise and focused, but you also make work fun; all while working collaboratively and giving your customer a great experience. You work well with team members and enjoy leading others and sharing your vision and innovative ideas with peers and clients to build elegant technical solutions.


Why this role matters: Marketing Cloud Consultants help to develop and continuously expand the Commercial Practice area’s offerings and capabilities in the area of Marketing Automation to create scalable and innovative cloud-based solutions. This role is responsible for the overall design and implementation of marketing automation systems and recommending best practice solutions to customers in the pharma and life sciences.
Responsibilities:

Translate business requirements into a practical, scalable solution leveraging the functionality and best practices of Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Work with customers to shape marketing automation design and strategy
Strategically build relationships with relevant client sponsors and stakeholders within each project to actively identify and create future opportunities, client references, and to develop a robust industry network for the Practice area
Couple industry knowledge with technology understanding to define and develop comprehensive solutions that help clients overcome business challenges
Stay current with business challenges clients are facing in relation to the practice area including new trends, market conditions, regulatory requirements, and the competitive landscape
Navigate ideas from the whiteboard to polished business applications for our healthcare and life sciences customers
Lead clients through design reviews to define and prioritize requirements and collaborate with project team members to design appropriate solutions and execute projects in a timely manner
Participate in client training and other implementation initiatives as a part of overall project deliverables


Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree preferred
5-7+ years of consulting experience
Salesforce Marketing Cloud Consultant and Email Certifications
Expert knowledge of Salesforce Marketing Cloud with technical expertise and experience suing the Salesforce Marketing Cloud platform for at least 2+ years
Experience with Marketing Cloud design and building custom data models in Marketing Cloud using data extensions
Extensive experience using the Marketing Cloud Automations Studio and AMPscript
Knowledge of Mobile Studio and Email Studio
Experience in building custom preference centers and cloud pages
2+ years experience with Salesforce implementation of full project lifecycles
Experience working in a collaborative environment to meet client business needs
Demonstrated analytical skills and experience with the complete lifecycle of complex enterprise projects; understands core project management concepts, data modeling, theories, practices, and methods
Ability to effectively design and configure a scalable solution to meet client business needs
Experience defining business requirements, writing user stories, and providing detailed Salesforce system and functional designs
Experience in documenting current state business processes and wire framing system designs using process flow diagram tools, sequence diagrams, as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs


Desired Skills:

Experience with Marketing Cloud Social Studio and Audience builder
Knowledge of other marketing automation solutions such as Adobe Marketing Cloud
Life Sciences, Financial industry, or other regulated industries experience is a plus

JobTitle: Technical Lead (Data Infrastructure), Permanent Remote, U.S.
Text:
Aledade is in search for its next Technical Lead working within our Data Engineering division. This particular opening will lead a team in the Infrastructure zone at Aledade and be responsible for the overall planning, execution, and success of complex software solutions to meet our customers’ needs. Our customers include: the application zone team, business intelligence and analytics teams, the ACO management zone team, and the outreach zone team. A Technical Lead should always have our customers in mind with a focus on delivery, security, and overall innovation. This is a hands-on Technical Lead role that will encompass mentorship and guidance to other internal team members, heavy interaction with other teams outside of Engineering including Product Management, as well as coding on a day to day basis.

What We Value:
 Foster an atmosphere of collaboration between our team and stakeholders in other departments. Identify and clear roadblocks in collaboration with other team members. Model good work behavior for team members to follow. Serve as a mentor for other engineers. Provide frequent and thorough feedback for other developers. Evangelize for best engineering practices within the team. Help to manage technical debt in effective ways that ensure it doesn’t excessively impede iterating on the product. Participate as a leader in backlog grooming. Identify where large tasks can be further decomposed. Make decisions that will shape the landscape of our future technical stack. Embrace new technologies that help us achieve our goals and reject tasks that stray from those goals. Promote a culture of observability. Establish and maintain best practices for logging, metrics, and alerting. Drive the team to use observables when selecting work for development. Comply with HIPAA requirements and be proactive about protecting the confidential data we work with on a daily basis, communicating any potential concerns through the appropriate channels.
What We Value: Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. 6+ years of programming experience or 4+ years with a Master’s Degree. 3+ years of experience with Python We care deeply about core modern Python Itertools, functools, unittest, type hinting Familiarity with unit testing, integration testing, and continuous integration 3+ years of experience with SQL Experience with PostgreSQL is a big plus 2+ years of experience working with data, including analyzing and understanding data Strong foundational Unix/Linux experience (BASH, Linux utilities, Makefiles)

Nice to haves: Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes and other container platforms Knowledge of process orchestration systems Experience with Airflow would make a candidate stand out Familiarity with Flask, RESTful services Working knowledge of health information systems

Personality Traits: Attention to Detail & Planning Eye towards performance, data consistency, and testing Fearless in the face of uncertainty Desire to learn innovative/new technologies, keep abreast of trends Desire to work on complex problems
 Collaborative - pairing/PRs, working jointly with highly skilled non-programmers on projects Scalable mindset - You don’t like to prototype and forget

If you are passionate about transforming the healthcare system into one that best serves the needs of patients, doctors, and society, we’d love for you to join us!
Who We Are:
Aledade is a leader in population health that is using innovative, value based solutions to transform the way physicians interact with their patients. We are on a mission to change healthcare for the better and solve complex problems within the healthcare system.
We follow the simple but radical idea that Aledade only succeeds when our partner practices succeed. From our cutting-edge technology platform to practice transformation services, we provide physicians with everything they need to create and run an accountable care organization (ACO), revamping the way they practice and getting them back to where they should be: quarterbacking their patients’ health care!
Our customized solutions help clinicians in communities across America preserve their autonomy, deliver better care to their patients, reduce overall costs, and keep independent physician practices flourishing.
What Does This Mean for You?
At Aledade, you will be part of a creative culture that is driven by a passion for tackling complex issues with respect, open-mindedness, and a desire to learn. You will work with team members that bring a wide range of experiences, interests, backgrounds, beliefs, and achievements to their work, united by a shared passion for public health and a commitment to the Aledade mission.
We’ve recently been recognized as a Top Workplace by The Washington Post, Best Workplace in HealthCare & Biopharma, Top 100 Best Small & Medium Workplaces, Glassdoor Best Places to Work, a Best and Brightest Companies to Work for in the Nation, a Tech Tribune 10 Best Tech Startups in Maryland and Bethesda, Best Tech for Good, Best Workplaces for Millennials, Best Workplaces for Women, Best Workplaces for Parents, and a 2020 Inno on Fire by DC Inno.

That’s because the things that matter to you also matter to us!
In addition to time off to support work-life balance and enjoyment, we offer the following comprehensive benefits package designed for the needs of our team-members:
Flexible work schedules and ability to work remotely available for many roles
Educational Assistant Program
Robust time off plan (21 days of PTO in your first year!)
Paid Volunteer Days
10 paid holidays
12 weeks paid Parental Leave for all new parents
6 weeks paid sabbatical
Health, dental and vision insurance paid at 80% for employees, dependents, and domestic partners
401(k) with up to 4% match
Stock options
Monthly cell phone stipend
Weekly catered lunches
Jeans everyday workplace
Gender neutral bathrooms
And more!
At Aledade, we don’t just accept differences, we celebrate them! We strive to attract, develop, and retain highly qualified individuals representing the diverse communities where we live and work. Aledade is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Employment policies and decisions at Aledade are based on merit, qualifications, performance, and business needs. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), gender identity or expression, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

*Please note that while this role will operate remotely, it is required that the candidate resides in the MidWest Region and within 50 miles of a major airport. States included in Yelp's defined MidWest Region include: North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Kansas, Minnesota, Iowa, Illinois, Missouri, Indiana, Ohio, Michigan and Wisconsin.*

Yelp’s mission is to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s Enterprise team partners with National and Mid-Market businesses to provide industry leading digital advertising solutions. Yelp’s premium native search advertising products deliver strong ROI by helping clients connect with potential customers at the bottom of the purchase funnel. Yelp has become an essential part in clients’ local advertising mix and the Enterprise team is growing fast!

The Enterprise Client Partner works with Yelp’s existing clients to grow their spend on Yelp. You will have a defined book of business and will be tasked with driving new revenue with those accounts. You will understand your clients’ business goals, marketing strategies, timelines and budgets to ensure Yelp is a prominent part of their marketing mix. To succeed in this role, you will secure investment in Yelp to drive sales at the local level for your clients. This is a high-energy, client-facing sales role requiring industry expertise and proven sales prowess. The Enterprise Client Partner role is key to Yelp’s success and significant growth is expected from our existing National Account base as we scale the Enterprise team!

#LI-REMOTE

Where You Come In:
You will map out client organizations and build relationships with multiple contacts focusing on decision-makers
You will build relationships with agencies that represent the client
You will partner with the National Account Management team and work collaboratively with cross functional teams to drive revenue growth with existing customers
You will identify and capitalize on all aspects of client’s marketing spend
You will create and present solutions that meet the unique needs of each client
You will identify additional up-sell and partnership opportunities
You will develop strong relationships with clients to enable open communication and support between clients and Yelp’s Product and Marketing teams
You will gather and share customer feedback internally to improve Yelp’s ad products and customer experiences
You will track and accurately forecast revenue to our executive team

What it Takes to Succeed:
You have 4+ years of strategic sales experience with Enterprise/National clients
You have expertise in performance based digital advertising products (CPC auction preferred)
You have a track record of significantly growing a $3M+ book of business and exceeding goals in an Enterprise organization
You are excited to take a hands on, creative approach to capitalize on Yelp’s opportunity with an existing account base and build deep relationships with National Accounts
You have a demonstrated ability to use strategic selling skills
You have strong presentation and listening skills
You are able to analyze and develop key insights and sales messages through numbers
You have experience presenting over the phone and in-person to mid-large size groups
You have proficiency in Salesforce, Excel, Word, PowerPoint
You are able to travel up to 30% of the time

What You'll Get:
Guaranteed base salary plus uncapped commission
Effective your first day: Full medical, vision, and dental (100% paid employee only coverage)
15 days PTO (accrual begins on date of hire and increases with 2+ years of tenure thereafter), 12 paid holidays, plus one floating holiday
Up to 14 weeks of parental leave
Monthly wellness subsidy
Flexible spending account
401(k) retirement savings plan
Employee stock purchase plan

At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability.

Cardinal Intellectual Property is actively seeking QA Analyst who will be a part of building the next generation of web-applications for patent and trademark services.

If you are inspired for long term opportunity and professional growth, we can offer you challenging and well rewarding opportunity.


As a full-time employee, you will be eligible for Paid Time Off, Insurance Benefits, Retirement Plan, and through performance receive annual discretionary bonus.


Job duties and responsibilities:
Developing functional, integration and regression testing approaches, plans, and scripts for all applications
Coordinating with business and technical members in determining the testable elements of functional and technical designs
Executing testing scripts, and where required overseeing the execution of testing scripts in the execution of functional, integration and regression testing
Logging and tracking to closure the bugs discovered in functional, integration and regression testing
Summarizing and providing reporting and analysis on the progress of testing on a daily and weekly basis
Documenting the end results of functional, integration and regression testing
Handling level-2 customer support calls related to application issues, triaging them with the development team on the fixes and providing resolutions to the end-users on a timely basis
Documenting the issues notified by the end users, their underlying root-causes, and troubleshooting information, to help speed up the future issues handling and fixing underlying issues


Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Extensive experience in Manual Testing
Proven ability in making important decisions, problem solving and analytical skills with attention given to detail and accuracy
Experience with Agile methodology for application development, and familiarity with tools such as Jira for application development task/sprint management
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrate a cooperative positive attitude and effective interpersonal and communication skills with clients, coworkers, and other stakeholders
Experience with test-driven development
Experience with automated test tools such as Selenium is a plus


Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree: Science/Mathematics related fields
3-5 years Quality Assurance experience
Experience with both front-end (UI) and back-end (API’s) testing
Experience with Jira and TestRail


Company Benefits:
Full Time employees are provided with Insurance Benefits (Health, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, V-Life)
Paid Time Off, Paid Company Holidays
Retirement Plan (contributions from employer to retirement plan is in the form of profit sharing)
QA Analyst is authorized to work from home in the United States.
