Who we are: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 375 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.
Job Description Summary: As a marketing strategist, you will have the opportunity to work with cross-functional teams across the org to develop marketing and content strategy for the large enterprise customer segment.
Job Description:
Enterprise Marketing Strategist, PayPal enterprise solutions
Beyond offering one of the world’s most popular digital wallets, PayPal provides end-to-end payments processing services that enable digital, mobile, and in person payments for our enterprise merchants worldwide. Through a combination of innovation and strategic partnerships, our platform creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility with modular, enterprise-grade solutions.
PayPal is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Available in more than 200 markets and in 100 currencies around the world, no other payments partner can match PayPal’s global scale, reliability, and innovation.
As a marketing strategist, you will have the opportunity to work with cross-functional teams across the org to develop marketing and content strategy for the large enterprise customer segment.
Responsibilities
Work with the core Enterprise marketing team and stakeholders in Sales, Sales Enablement, Product Marketing, and Comms among others to develop a segment strategy that aligns with the rest of the organization’s objectives
Contribute to a diverse range of projects, including a global content plan, promotional support, brand support, and market research efforts
Inform strategy by studying global trends, performance data, our customers and competitors
Liaise with technical subject matter experts to understand our offering and craft messaging
Work with agencies to develop content and multi-pronged marketing campaigns
Drive revenue growth with your recommendations and strategy implementation
Keep management and executive leadership informed by preparing reports and developing compelling presentations
Help implement operational rigor for a growing business unit
Skills
Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to distill and crystallize insights for executive audiences
High level of organization and attention to detail
High-energy, resourceful attitude
Curiosity in an environment of constant learning
Ability to multi-task and prioritize in a deadline-driven atmosphere
Comfort working with cross-functional groups and executive leadership
Demonstrated problem solving and independent, critical thinking skills
Qualifications
4+ years experience in Marketing or equivalent education
Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s in Marketing, Business, Communications or a related field strongly preferred
Experience in content development and managing creative agencies
Payments, Fintech or Tech Marketing background preferred
Key offices are in San Jose, San Francisco, Chicago and New York; remote candidates may also apply
We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.

Job Description:
Position is Remote

Review loan files to ensure complete and accurate documentation, adherence to Guaranteed Rate and investor standards and to test for data integrity including a full re-underwrite of sampled loans including but not limited to:

Re-calculation of liabilities

203 (k) experience preferred

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Excellent customer service skills with strong attention to detail

JobTitle: Spring Internship Program – Business Analyst Interns
Text: INTRODUCTION:At Bigge, we are elevating America with over 1,500 cranes in our fleet.  We buy, rent, maintain, and sell a fleet of cranes that are deployed throughout the contiguous United States. Since 1916, we have been building America’s landmarks, and we are proud to have created one of the highest performing equipment companies in the world.Bigge is leading the transformation of the crane and rigging industry with a unique approach to maintaining the best experience, equipment, and technology in the market. Leveraging our innovative technology platform, we are forging new ground in the areas of safety, equipment utilization, and employee growth. Bigge was recently featured on Inc. Magazine’s list of 1,000 largest private iconic companies, or “Private Titans.”SUMMARY: Bigge is building a World Class Remote Workforce. As part of this effort, it is building upon its successful summer and fall internships and launching a Spring Internship Program. We are looking to hire talented, hard charging, and curious students as Business Analyst Interns. Each intern will have the opportunity to learn a breadth of business topics and skills from an industry leader, while at the same time work closely with the departments in which they want to specialize. Intern positions will be available focused on the following fields: Accounting, Marketing, Finance, Sales Support, IT, Data Analytics, and other areas.The Bigge internship program allows for flexible hours for students. Bigge wants this program to work with your spring academic schedule. Hours will be tailored by candidate and Bigge need. Interns will have a defined point of contact throughout the program, work on projects with Bigge team members, and work on projects with other interns. Interns will have hands on exposure to practical tools and skills that will make them more effective with Bigge and their work experiences beyond (Examples include: PowerBI development, smart workflow development, financial analysis, web site development, marketing, and many more).Interns will interface with executives, division managers, sales managers, and department heads. This is a paid internship opportunity and starts at $16 an hour, with the opportunity to interview for a permanent position at the end of the program. This is a remote program: work from home or your dorm room. As opportunities and work restrictions allow, we will encourage job site and company office visits.Interns will have the opportunity to gain valuable real-world experience and become part of an innovative team at one of the largest crane companies in the US.The program will start in February and run through the Spring Semester. Onboarding will be done virtually.RESPONSIBILITIES:Work alongside Bigge team members in their day-to-day roles and responsibilitiesBigge is outcome oriented. We want you to help drive better outcomes for the businessHelp Bigge support its mission to buy, rent, maintain and sell cranesFind inefficiencies and provide creative solutionsAssist with existing projectsWork across departments and support various stakeholdersAs progress allows, lead a project team to complete a defined projectPlan, organize, and prioritize own daily work routine to meet established scheduleThe spring intern class will work together on a defined project through the program and present the final work to the executive teamDESIRED SKILLS:Desire to work hard, learn, ask curious questions, and contribute. We want self-starters who want to drive better outcomes, will raise their hand and ask questions when needed, and use good judgment in working with teammates across the companyProficient in ExcelExperience with R or Python *specific to the Data Analytics position*Great interpersonal communication skills and a friendly demeanorStrong problem-solving skills and resourcefulnessEDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: To be considered for the program applicants must be a full-time student in either an undergraduate or graduate programMinimum requirement of 10 working hours per weekStart date is targeting mid-February 2021Bigge provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, military or veteran status. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functionsJob Types: Part-time, InternshipPay: $16.00 per hourBenefits:Flexible scheduleSchedule:Monday to FridayWeekendsWork Location:Fully RemoteThis Job Is:A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to applyCompany's website:https://www.bigge.com/careers/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/biggecrane/Benefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processTemperature screeningsSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Our Harris Health Care Group is seeking a Business Development Specialist to work closely with the Group’s Senior Management team in continuing the company’s success in mergers and acquisition (M&A) activity. This position will play a key role in identifying and qualifying acquisition opportunities.

You will be successful if you are a true people-person, inherently curious, and have a passion for creating and maintaining relationships. Prior inside business development experience is critical. While no formal financial training is required, basic financial literacy and a knowledge of software or healthcare is an asset. As the Business Development Specialist, you will report to the Business Development Manager for the Healthcare Group.
There is opportunity to work out of either our Ottawa, Ontario or Niagara Falls, New York offices depending on your location, however remote applicants will also be considered.
What you impact will be :
Support the M&A team in screening and researching potential company targets
Directly solicit and engage companies via telephone for acquisition; call with good purpose and qualify target companies to ensure they meet our investment profile
Maintain relationships with our existing network of acquisition targets through frequent telephone calls and e-mails
Effectively communicate Harris’ investment strategy, while ensuring that the investment process is handled with care and professionalism
Track activities and maintain relevant information in Salesforce CRM
Generate and report on leads, set up qualified appointments and move opportunities through the M&A pipeline

What we are looking for:
3+ years of direct experience in inside sales, business development, or M&A sourcing
Aptitude and passion for inside sales, lead generation and mining of new business opportunities
Exceptional organizational, written and verbal communication skills

What will make you stand out:
Self-starter with exceptional organization, prioritization and multi-tasking abilities who thrives on new challenges and takes initiative
A passion for corporate social responsibilities or volunteer experience

What we offer:
3 weeks' vacation and 5 personal days
Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision coverage from your first day of employment
Flexible work options (with some work from home options)

About us:
From the start, Harris Healthcare has focused 100% on healthcare and providing solutions to improve productivity, efficiency and accessibility, ensure regulatory and legal compliance, and enhance the quality of patient care and safety while keeping the financial side of hospital operations securely in the black. Within Harris Healthcare you will find an extensive suite of clinical, financial, scheduling, and planning solutions as well as all the related services you would expect.
Our solutions can be mixed and matched to meet the needs of small practices or large IDN networks, and are used in hospitals and health systems and their associated facilities throughout the world.

The 8x8 Open Communications Platform (TM) uniquely brings together Voice, Video, Collaboration, Contact Center, and enterprise-class API solutions, helping businesses across the globe transform their customer and employee experience, and empowering workforces worldwide to work smarter.

For additional information, visit www.8x8.com, or follow 8x8 on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook.
The 8x8 Professional Services team is seeking a Project Manager (PM) to help deliver successful unique customizations and 3rd Party integrations for the 8x8 product suite, including UCaaS, CCaaS and CPaaS. The PM will lead the services engagement and will work with the customer and our internal PS team of SW Developers, Solution Architects and Testers to deliver against the agreed upon SOW.

During the project, the PM will be responsible for defining roles and responsibilities, managing through dependencies, overseeing issue resolution, managing project financials including budget and actuals, hitting milestones on time, and ensuring customer satisfaction. As a successful PM, you will develop and build healthy relationships with 8x8 customers, partners, and vendors in order to promote new and ongoing business opportunities and ensure customer satisfaction and retention.

About our Team
The 8x8 Professional Services team is passionate about delivering a cutting-edge product with white-glove service. We constantly leverage the skill sets of our teammates and our colleagues throughout the company in order to provide our customers with the best possible experience.
*PLEASE NOTE: This is a REMOTE role with the ideal candidate located in either US-Mountain or US-Central Time Zones.*
What You Will Be Responsible For:
Own and lead multiple, simultaneous customer engagements following the 8x8 methodology and utilizing project management best practices.
Maintain and report on key project metrics such as budget to actuals, resource consumption, risk register, project timelines.
Manage project team activities and oversee completion of deliverables, managing schedules, meeting milestones, and ensuring technical success.
Generate and maintain documentation that supports the collection, management, and reporting of all project related information.
Develop, document and distribute contingency plans for critical events.
Maintain constant communication with the customer, identify potential issues in advance, and drive appropriate solutions.
Collaborate with other departments in 8x8 to reduce time to value in delivery, increase customer retention, and channel input on product development.
What You Need To Be Successful:
Strong experience in SW development, telecommunication, technology, or IT field (5+ yrs)
Proven experience in project management for customer-facing software projects, preferably SaaS based (3+ yrs)
Demonstrated experience with delivering customized solutions to a packaged application software solution
Experience and clear understanding of Software development practices in a Professional Services delivery model
Proven ability to work with teams of professionals with diverse technical and business backgrounds
Ability to plan and manage logistics involving multiple teams
Superior technical and business problem-solving skills
Client-focused attitude and ability to be a customer advocate
Experience interfacing with business clients, support groups and 3rd parties
Proven experience working with project management techniques and tools
General knowledge of VoIP, Network technologies and SW development tools
Strong organizational and analytical skills that include the ability to respond to changing needs and shifting priorities while minimizing project impact
Strong presentation and leadership skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Undergraduate Technical or Business Degree or equivalent required

Position Overview: Tempus nP Regional Sales Manager (RSM) will be responsible for leading a Regional Sales Team and exceeding sales goals for Tempus' Psychiatry division. This encompasses the creation and implementation of regional and territory business plans as well as the selection, hiring, training, development, and management of Clinical Account Executives within a defined geographic region.

The RSM will manage business results, sales activities, and cross functional initiatives in a specific regional geography. The successful candidate will make the day to day decisions required to manage a business function including deploying resources, allocating costs, and directing business activities. This is a front-line sales management/leadership position covering several states requiring frequent travel to work with Account Executives in their assigned territories. This position reports directly to the Vice President of Provider Sales, US, for Psychiatry.

Responsibilities:

Achievement of regional sales objectives; unit goals and expenses.
Development and execution of regional and territory business plans.
Direct execution of sales strategies and tactics, and implementation of sales and marketing plans.
Develop and maintain key customer relationships with target audiences; assist in developing business solutions that are mutually beneficial; apply broader business scenarios and customer-focused models to achieve breakthrough results.
Plan and conduct regional sales meetings designed to inform and convey existing and new product knowledge and applications and enhance and develop sales and business skills.
Evaluate performance of Clinical Account Executives
Maintain high level of product and market knowledge.
Identify opportunities with academic medical centers, large cancer centers, health systems, and other strategically important key accounts.
Management oversight of Tempus's CRM solution for the defined geographic region.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional partners to access resources and maximize outcomes.


Preferred Skills:

Deep domain knowledge of the Diagnostic Services industry. Molecular Diagnostic experience strongly preferred.
Experience selling Psychiatry based tests and products into the clinical community is preferred.
Experience within complex selling environments required.
Demonstrated success in recruiting, hiring, developing and retaining talent.
Ability to prioritize and align organizational goals and objectives; enable innovation.
Ability to develop and utilize cross-functional relationships to facilitate the accomplishment of work goals and objectives.
Ability to engage in a consultative selling process that overcomes objections and indifferences while connecting client needs with Tempus's capabilities.
Comfort and success selling at the executive level (CEO, COO, CFO)
Keen understanding of the payor and reimbursement environment in the Psychiatry and molecular diagnostics space
Ability to work independently, communicate proactively, manage multiple projects and prioritize daily tasks while managing critical deadlines
Problem solving, decision making and technical learning.
Advanced written and oral communication skills.
Strong administrative skills. Sophistication to manage business in complex environments.
Knowledge and application of strategic planning, and development sales strategy and tactical implementation.
Experience and understanding of managing the financial dynamics of a commercial organization.
Expertise in health care with emphasis on molecular diagnostics, genomics, biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, and Psychiatry.
Superior listening and problem solving skills
Ability to handle sensitive information and maintain a very high level of confidentiality
Demonstrate consistent closing abilities throughout the sales cycle
Possess a very positive attitude and an understanding of the dynamics involved with organizational growth and change
Impeccable oral and verbal communication and presentation skills
Must be very proficient with all G Suite & Microsoft Office products, as well as app based products
Effective and regular utilization of Salesforce.com
Ability to develop and utilize cross-functional relationships to facilitate the accomplishment of work goals and objectives.
Advanced presentation skills and business acumen a necessity
Demonstrate Tempus' Values by acting with integrity, respect and trust and representing our company culture at all time to external and internal constituents
Frequent travel ( ~50%) throughout the territory as needed


Preferred Education and Experience:

A minimum 3+ years of experience in a relevant industry/commercial environment (pharmaceutical, diagnostics, research products) as a sales manager, leading a team of 8+ reps
Bachelor's degree required, MBA or other relevant advanced degree preferred.
A proven track record of success in a management role


Note to Employment Agencies:

Tempus values our relationships with our recruitment partners and will only accept resumes from those partners who have been contracted by a member of our Human Resources team to collaborate with us. Tempus is not responsible for any fees related to resumes that are unsolicited or are received by any employee of Tempus who is not a member of the Senior Leadership team.

Great benefits. Competitive pay. We know these are some of the things people look for in a job.
But if you’re the kind of person who also cares about making an impact and serving our nation’s wounded warriors and their families, then you’re exactly the kind of person we’re looking for.
Change the life of someone who served their country, and join an organization that not only supports you, but empowers you to make that change a reality.
When you join the Wounded Warrior Project family, you’re committing to making a difference. We make a commitment to you too – helping you to find that spark, ignite your passion to serve, and embark on a career with meaning and purpose.
A mission that matters is just the beginning, so if you’re ready to get started, we’re ready for you.
Wounded Warrior Project’s (WWP) Veterans Benefits Coordinator will serve as the first point of contact for inquiries related to DoD and VA benefits, provide administrative support to a regional team, and assist WWP Benefits Liaisons in the development of Warriors’ claims.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work within DoD, VBA, and VHA systems to ensure timely and professional care of Warriors
Provide effective, timely, and responsive customer service to Warriors, Family Support Members, and internal and external stakeholders
Manage, screen, and prioritize a high-volume incoming queue of program referrals for benefits assistance
Manage incoming calls and emails, vetting and responding to basic inquiries within a specified timeframe
Communicate general information related to VA and DoD benefits, eligibility, and evidentiary requirements
Work with Warriors and Family Support Members to gather evidence in support of claims for benefits
Provide regular updates to Warriors represented by WWP in open claims or appeals, and ensure that any questions and concerns about their case are timely addressed
Maintain and update records in WWP’s case management system (SalesForce)
Assist WWP Benefits Liaisons with claim-development, research, and advocacy in cases pending before the VA and DoD
Assist and participate in educational outreach efforts, collaborative events, and claims clinics
Other related duties as assigned
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES:
Outstanding customer service
Basic knowledge of DoD and VA Benefits, medical terminology, and applicable laws and regulations
Excellent organizational and communication skills
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential medical information with discretion and compassion
Ability to timely complete required assignments in a fast-paced environment
Self-motivated, positive, personable, and able to relate well with diverse populations and age groups
Organized, diligent, and able to troubleshoot, problem-solve, and prioritize
Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office programs
Proficiency in the use of SalesForce preferred
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
High School Diploma/GED required, Bachelor’s degree preferred
Minimum one (1) year customer service experience required
Familiarity with military culture preferred
Salesforce experience preferred
CERTIFICATIONS & LICENSURE:
Valid state-issued driver’s license
OTHER REQUIREMENTS:
If this position is designated as field, the field teammate must have high-speed internet connectivity for his or her remote work space, with download and upload speeds of at least three megabits per second (3 mbps).
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & ESTIMATED FREQUENCY:
Walking: Rarely
Speaking: Intermittently
Hearing: Intermittently
Vision: Frequently
Sitting for extended periods: Frequently
Standing for extended periods: Rarely
Extended periods viewing computer screen: Frequently
Lifting/carrying up to 20 pounds various items: Intermittently
Lifting/carrying more than 20 pounds various items: Rarely
Pushing/Pulling: Rarely
Bending/Stooping: Rarely
Reaching/Grasping/Manual Dexterity: Rarely
Writing: Intermittently
Climbing: Rarely
Exposure to outdoor elements: Rarely

We are currently looking to hire a talented Territory Sales Manager who will manage our users and dealer accounts in the Chicago Metropolitan Area. This person will become a sought-after expert and the main point of contact for Franchise and Independent Dealers.

This is a fantastic opportunity for the right person to become part of the globally growing team right from the start. Find yourself working with an exciting startup right from the beginning and share our journey to the top.

The Ideal Candidate

The ideal candidate will be someone who loves sales and working with automotive dealers. You will need to have previous automotive account/sales experience as well as outstanding communication and customer service skills. You must be willing to take ownership and responsibility for your region while building relationships in the field. The ideal candidate will also be required to build and nurture relationships with an existing customer to secure brand loyalty and increase business. The role requires someone who isn’t afraid to roll up their sleeves and lead from the front, is this you?

Who we are

We are Win360 - a digital merchandising company that is empowering dealerships to accelerate their businesses online. Our products were created to bridge the gap between the offline to online experience, helping our partners increase engagement and drive sales in the digital age. We are launching with our digital imaging product, which utilizes cutting-edge technology to help our dealers create a 360-degree dealership online. Visit Win360.io to learn more.

Our culture

Our team of determined experts are passionate about creating a strong brand and securing the leading position in the market. We combine traditional values with a modern environment to offer continuous challenges and development opportunities in a friendly yet professional place. We recognize that people are our greatest asset and we value each individual contribution. We want to share our successes by recognizing and rewarding the highly skilled, like-minded people for their ideas and achievements.

What we are offering


Competitive base salary
Highly attractive commission structure
Bonus structure in addition to commission
Travel allowance
Work from home office subsidy
Health Insurance


Responsibilities


Know our product inside-out, becoming an expert in its functionality and features
Identify, build and continuously grow new accounts using professional and excellent sales techniques and strategy
Visit key accounts and auto dealers and assist them to maximize the use of our digital merchandising solutions while providing excellent customer service
Networking, setting up new accounts, answering questions, training/ instructing users, creating a well-connected network of customers
Passionately promoting Win360 to automotive dealerships and other buyers
Broadening your knowledge of the current automotive industry, markets, trends, etc.
Providing continuous sales and support to existing users
Identifying, managing and following up on leads generated through our website, trade shows and referrals
Creating and keeping records of all activity with clients and prospects up to date using our CRM
Ensuring all issues indicated by our clients are dealt with in an efficient and professional manner
Other ad hoc duties may be required


Requirements


3+ years of experience managing client accounts (preferably multiple accounts) in a target driven environment
Previous automotive or vehicle software sales industry experience highly preferred
Passionate & professional sales personality, with outstanding negotiation and communication skills
Analytical, strategic thinking and ability to identify opportunities in the market based on existing trends, changes and implications
Experience in dealing with clients in all situations with diplomatic and professional manners
Strong reporting skills
Self-driven, team player with startup mentality are all pluses

As a Customer Success Specialist you will be responsible for providing high level customer support to approximately 50-70 automotive dealerships in a defined area. Functioning as a consultant, you will be responsible for providing excellent support for our products and ensuring that our customers are using the software that they purchased to their full potential. You will provide both on-site and video conference support to customers (50/50 split throughout the week).
Customer Success Specialists work from a home office and will be provided a company car, iPhone, tablet, and printer/scanner equipment.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree
Must be a self-starter with good time management skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent customer service and organizational skills
Ability to build strong customer relationships
Good driving record
Ability to travel during training (very minimal overnight travel after training)
Training:
Paid Training! The nature of the position requires you to successfully complete an intensive training program. Training for this role will consist of classroom instruction at our office in Houston, TX and online courses where you will receive in-depth product training as well as automotive industry knowledge. In addition, you will be paired with mentors across the country where you can apply your classroom knowledge in a real-world setting.

Remote Opportunity/Work from Home. AdHoc has a remote workforce

Contract length 6 months + extended for a successful candidate

A pioneer in insurance technology, Insureon operates the largest online insurance marketplace for small businesses in the U.S. Our proprietary technology platform enables business owners to easily compare and purchase the insurance they need. We also license this platform to select industry participants who are looking to more effectively service their own clients. We are integrated with every major U.S. carrier, manage over ~$400M in premium annually and are licensed in all 50 states. For more information, visit http://www.insureon.com.
The company employs approximately 150 people nationally, with its corporate location in the heart of the financial district in the Chicago Loop.
We place a high value on having fun at work, personal and company integrity and teamwork, and we believe our success is truly a team sport. We foster a service mentality inside and outside our company and our fast-paced team is driven by results and is energetic about servicing our clients.
 Summary of the Role:
Objective: To provide assistance and support to the AM (Account Management) Team Leads daily job functions as well as growing knowledge of the AM desk and products to gain experience to eventually service own book of business as an Account Manager. The priority function of this role will be to assist the AM Leads of a specific Desk, followed by the rest of the AMs.
 This role is viewed as a developmental position with the objective of obtaining the skills, proficiencies and sustained performance necessary to migrate to an Account Managers role over the course of time.
 Essential Functions and Responsibilities;

Approved State Licenses needed
Prepare and submit renewal applications
Identify and execute cross-sell opportunities
Broker the terms and conditions of insurance contracts
Coordinate and monitor account servicing
Other duties may be assigned

Additional or Daily Responsibilities:

Assist the AM team members to act on alerts in the agency management system.
Follow up with Carrier/ Client on new business quotes and renewals.
Review renewal data and assist AMs to maximize our book retention rate.
Support policy cancellation process.
Assist with customer servicing requests from clients by working with internal teams and carrier service centers.
Deliver excellent customer service to delight our customers in every online and offline interaction.

Qualifications:

1-2 years of relevant experience.
Familiar with Customer Account Servicing in regulated/financial services experience preferred.

Education/Experience:

High School Degree Required
4 Year Degree Preferred
Approved State Licenses needed

 Computer Skills: Word processing, spreadsheets, email software and other related programs. Comfortable working with 3rd Party or Agency management systems, Various Web Applications, Client or Insureon Agent portals and other related online applications.
 Physical Demands or Requirements: This role requires sitting at a workstation for extended periods of time, while working in an office environment.
Notice: Insureon does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee
This is a remote position.

JobTitle: National Recruiter & Talent Acquisition Specialist (Remote Position)
Text:
Primary Job:
The National Recruiter & Talent Acquisition Specialist provides recruiting support by recruiting eligible production and driving business development opportunities to APM. In addition, identifying and engaging with potential Branch Managers in assigned target markets determined by strategic planning and leadership.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Recruiting activities and competitor awareness
Support APM with recruiting of new branches, loan officers, and branch staff to achieve the production goals and strategic initiatives. Recruiting involves identifying prospects, making contact, creating interest and follow up until hired. Individuals must align with the corporate values and be a great representative for APM.
Creation of business opportunities or other branch development through networking and membership in various associations, being the brand ambassador for APM.
Attendance at local realtor boards/affiliations or similar
Trade shows or various industry events as needed
Supporting branches with education & consumer outreach opportunities
Have a good working relationship and understanding of the branch make-ups and opportunities to, identify and source good production for the APM branches in the region.
Align with Director of Recruiting, RVP, Channel Leaders and Branch Managers to identify potential Originators and move through the interview and engagement stages.
Maintain strict daily CRM adoption. Utilization of HubSpot for all recruiting activities, including conversations and task follow-up, is mandatory.
Achieve thorough understanding of APM’s value – tools, technology, products, resources, models, etc. as well as those at each local branch – to effectively sell the values to prospect. Adapt APM messaging as identified and communicated through leadership.
Discuss any branch opportunities identified with Director of Recruiting, RVP, or Channel EVPs for initial buy-in and approvals.
Assist in achieving 95% capacity in existing branches. Recruiting activities will be in all areas as instructed by the Director of Recruiting.
Recruiting & Business Development Specialist to work with the Director of Recruiting to provide a detailed business plan for expansion of existing offices and recommendation for new opportunities on a quarterly basis.
Recruiter agrees to run all recruiting activities through Recruiting CRM for tracking and Metrics.
Recruiter will provide pipeline reports to Director when requested.
Recruiter agrees to run special project and recruiting blitz campaigns as necessary.
Provide a detailed business plan for expansion of existing offices and recommendation for new opportunities on an annual basis with quarterly reviews.
Qualifications/Requirements:
Previous Mortgage Recruiting Experience
Commitment to company values, policies and procedures
Excellent interpersonal communication skills
Customer Service – the ability to provide and maintain effective and positive communication
Adaptability – an ability to quickly learn new or different techniques, products and computer programs
Problem Solving – an ability to effectively analyze and resolve problems at a functional level
This person must live our culture every day! (Respect, Transparency, Scrappy)
Other duties as assigned

International Institute of Business Analysis™ (IIBA®) is a professional association dedicated to supporting business analysis professionals deliver better business outcomes. IIBA connects almost 30,000 Members, over 100 Chapters, and more than 500 training, academic, and corporate partners around the world. As the global voice of the business analysis community, IIBA supports recognition of the profession, networking and community engagement, standards and resource development, and comprehensive certification programs.


All IIBA staff are based virtually and utilize modern technology tools to collaborate and work as a team. As a result, the organization offers unique lifestyle and work-life balance opportunities for highly professional and self-motivated staff members.


IIBA is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.


For more information on IIBA or to join our association please visit our website at: www.iiba.org.

Role Mandate

This Community Engagement Manager will be responsible for the operations of our Global Chapters.


Chapters are located internationally and provide us with a conduit to share and gather information to and from our membership. Chapter growth, roadmaps, and relationships with global Chapter committees are key areas of focus for this position. The role will also be responsible for providing the gold standard of customer service to our global Chapter network. This will involve building strong relationships, Chapter maturity, growth, and overall stability of the model.

This is a home office position that could be located anywhere.

Responsibilities


Provide overall leadership and direction to the global community to engage all members focusing on those that are not close to a physical Chapters.
Establish both short and long-term objectives and goals in conjunction with the Chapters team
Recruit and manage volunteers to coordinate community activities
Seek to actively engage members
Source and deliver webinars across multiple time zones
Build and nurture relationships with external and internal teams to accomplish IIBA and community engagement goals
Schedule & support all global Chapter & Member webinars & identify format & takeaways
Track and report all relevant Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) information for Score Card preparation
Prepare and communicate monthly/quarterly reports of global Chapter data regarding reach & stats
Track and review global Chapter information and recommendations for improvement
Participate in global Chapter-oriented working groups and support committees
In collaboration with the Global Operations Manager, manage & develop Chapter policies and guidelines
Identify Chapter program improvement opportunities
Track and analyse engagement
Responsible for all Chapter technology implementations and maintenance
Participate in monthly Global Chapter Council meetings


Qualifications


Minimum of 5 years’ experience managing a global program, including experience managing a global community/chapter
Post-secondary education in business, social sciences, human resources, community development or equivalent experience
Excellent business acumen.
Excellent communications skills, including presentation development and facilitation.
Excellent relationship building skills.
Experience leading and managing a team of volunteers
High degree of decision-making capability and experience.
Personality to motivate and engage diverse stakeholders.
Strong leadership skills and achievement oriented.
Ability to network with other organizations/professionals.
Complete working knowledge of Microsoft Office.
Solid understanding of the Business Analysis profession is required; an IIBA certifications (I.e. Certified Business Analysis Professional™ (CBAP®) and/or an IIBA membership would be considered an asset).
Experience working with a membership driven organization, international association and/or working in an virtual role would be considered an asset.
Must possess strong oral and written communication skills in English. Ability to communicate (written and orally) in multiple languages would be an asset.
Experience tracking members using Association Management Software (AMS/CRM)
Ability to support after-hours to support community events in multiple time zones
Ability to travel to international locations if required

Sales Development Representative Sales Development Representative Earn While You LearnFuel Sales Academy is hiring Sales Development Representatives with the goal of helping people start their career in Business to Business Software Sales. You will earn a competitive wage while you learn a proven sales development process, grow through our on-the-job development academy, and work directly with our clients in the Edtech field.How are we different?“How do I get the experience if I cannot get the job?” When it comes to learning and developing in a sales role, classroom experience is not enough. Gaining hands on experience and knowledge of what to expect and how to excel in sales is what makes us so effective. Our program provides you with the tools and “real world” experience to set yourself apart in the employment market.With Fuel Sales Academy, you are paid to practice your skills with a leadership team devoted to helping you develop and improve everyday while you work with our client companies. Our team gets to know you, your goals, and your career ambitions. We then work to connect you with our partner companies to continue your career in sales.Who are you?Naturally curious, helpful problem solvers with an internal motivation to help others.Dedicated to pursuing a career in salesMission Driven Personality including self management and motivationExcited about how technology solutions can help any businessAbility to carefully listen and respond with empathyExceptional verbal and written communication skillsWhat will you do?Proactively engaging and prospecting new business opportunities and customersEducate potential customers and generate interest in our client’s solutionsWork directly with client Account Executives to schedule demonstrations of their software solutions for qualified opportunitiesWhat will you learn?How to focus on the right prospects with the right messageHow to build an effective outreach approachHow to manage objectionsEffective discovery processes to ensure quality opportunities are provided to the account executivesEffectively use contact management technology (Salesforce, Hubspot, etc.)What will you earn?Every SDR starts at $14.00 per hour plus commissions and bonuses. You are equally compensated for all training time.Where does this take you?The ultimate goal for every Academy SDR is to develop their skills and land a full time position with one of our vetted partner companies.A bit more about us: We are process driven, executing on a strategy to generate awareness and demand for our client’s solutions. Our team calls on prospects to educate, gain interest, qualify leads, and schedule product demonstrations. Pairing our startup experience with demand generation expertise, we are building unique teams bringing cutting edge solutions to potential clients in Education Technology, Healthcare and Financial Services. mentalityIndividual who can ‘think’ and ‘do’ – and isn’t precious about getting his/her hands dirtyTeam player who is able to work on own initiativeWorking at InstantAbout the Instant Group The Instant Group is a workspace innovation company that rethinks workspace on behalf of its clients. Instant help their clients to move their business forward by providing insight on the real estate market and creating and delivering bespoke workspace solutions. Instant put their customers’ business at the heart of the workspace solution and specialise in injecting agility and flexibility into solutions, reducing cost and driving enterprise performance. Instant delivers solutions for FTSE 100, Fortune 500, and SME clients. Instant has offices all over the world and clients in more than 150 countries and is a market leader in flexible workspace. Its listings’ platform Instant Offices hosts more than 15,000 flexible workspace centres across the world and is the only site of its kind to represent the global market,In 2019 Instant acquired Incendium Consulting Ltd, an independent corporate real estate consultancy that provides large real estate services procurement, consulting, talent, and change management programmes to blue-chip clients. Together, Instant and Incendium give clients access to independent market-leading consultancy, world class data and delivery options that transform their approach to workplace in what is a truly distinct offer in the market.It’s not all noses to the grindstone though; this is a dynamic place to work, where colleagues solve challenges and grasp opportunities together and support one another. With a common purpose that glues the organisation together, everyone is pulling in the same direction with a truly client centric focus. About Company

We bring 18 years of mortgage excellence to Chicago and surrounding areas.

Jellyvision is hiring a Manager of Business Development

Who we are

We at Jellyvision are the proud parents of ALEX, a platform that saves employees and their employers money by making tricky decisions—like choosing and using employee benefits—less confusing and more enjoyable. The success of ALEX has exceeded our wildest work-related dreams, which is why we need an experiencedBusiness Development Manager to help us continue on our journey.

How you'll help

As the experienced manager of the business development team, you will lead a team of 10+ business development reps handling inbound and outbound activity, targeting enterprise and mid-market companies across the country. You will be a key player on the Pipeline and Revenue Leadership Team, and will report to the Director of Business Development to help grow and support a young, eager team focused on generating opportunities that convert to sales qualified meetings. Our team's mission is clear: fill the top of the funnel pipeline and drive company revenue goals. You will be responsible for the collaboration with Revenue leadership, Marketing, Sales Enablement, Account Executives, and our Channel team to ensure teams are aligned.

What you'll do

Bring a high level of energy and a positive attitude that embodies our core values and keeps our team of BDRs engaged and motivated while working remotely and eventually in person
Hire & onboard new BDRs while providing ongoing coaching, training and development to the team
Manage and support individual BDRs, ensuring each is fully prepared and focused on achieving their pipeline goals
Develop and implement processes and regimen to help BDRs hit their weekly, monthly, and quarterly objectives
Forecast monthly and quarterly performance metrics
Analyze performance data, understanding which actions drive desired results.
Identify areas of opportunity for learning and development
Develop and maintain relationships with internal teams (Sales, Marketing, Operations)
Lead our intern program and create a continuous talent pipeline

Experience & skills you'll need

2+ years of people management experience and ideally 3+ years of proven success in a B2B SaaS sales environment
Clear understanding of core sales fundamentals: prospecting, objection handling, value propositioning, sales qualification process, etc.
Experience hiring, onboarding, and training new reps on a growing team
Strong performance management skills and ability to hold direct reports accountable
Strategic mindset that will bring ideas to the table to increase pipeline efforts
Excels under pressure, and adapts easily to a rapidly changing environment
Experience with Salesforce, Outreach/Salesloft, LinkedIn Sales Navigator
Excellent analytical, written and verbal communication skills
Strong background working with data and spreadsheets
BONUS: Experience with ZoomInfo, Gong, Sendoso, Vidyard, etc.

Skills:

Action Oriented
Being Resilient
Builds Effective Teams
Drives Results
Develops Talent
Ensures Accountability
Interpersonal Savvy

Anything else?

Our credo is a simple one: be helpful. And we think we can be most helpful if our workforce is as diverse in thought, perspective, and culture as the people who use our products. We are looking to add amazing people to our team who will bring diversity across many lines, including race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity, sex, and country of origin.

Jellyvision's headquarters is in Chicago, and, post-COVID, many of us will be returning to the Chicago offices (by choice, not requirement - our philosophy is "Flexible First"). But this position is also eligible for work by a remote employee out of CA, MI, MN, NY, OR, TX, or WI.

Thanks for your interest in Jellyvision!

Envisionit, an award-winning digital marketing agency based in Chicago, is seeking a Client Experience Manager to join our growing team. Our clients span a number of industries including CPG, Emerging Tech, Hospitality and Travel and our teams boast many talents across the spectrum of digital. We firmly believe you should enjoy what you do every day, so we make passion a priority. You will work alongside a tight-knit bunch of seriously talented people who genuinely like each other, have fun and work hard for the collective success.

We are headquartered in Chicago and have a beautiful office overlooking Millennium Park and Lake Michigan that is available for our employees to use while practicing social distancing guidelines, however for the remainder of 2020 we are allowing the entire business to work remotely from home and will be making future determinations about 2021 as we know more. Above all, we are prioritizing our employees’ health and safety.


The role:

As a Client Experience Manager, you will fully own and communicate vision, goals and solutions to the clients and internal team. You are the captain who always knows our destination, how we’re going to get there and will steer us back in the right direction if we veer off course. You are a relationship builder who understands that one size does not fit all and are able to adapt your approach to the context and constraints of each project. And under your watch, we will always deliver a highly superb product at the highest possible value.


Key functions:

Provide an absolute best-in-class, special and highly personalized client experience; learn clients’ businesses, brands, industries and competitive landscape.
Manage day-to-day client communication; provide crystal clarity to all stakeholders through effective comms, project briefs, status reports and project plans.
Manage the internal team as lead project manager for your accounts by creating plans, scoping, managing budgets, organizing/communicating tasks and maintaining the project schedule which defines activities, deliverables, dependencies, effort, timing and staff needs.
Ensure project delivery is strategically on-point, on-time and on budget.
Be the ultimate point of accountability for quality of work delivered; provide feedback and direction before presenting to clients, raise awareness of all project issues/risks and proactively find solutions.
Be the point of escalation and problem-solver to address any challenges that arise, providing solutions that meet both client and agency success criteria.
Proactively ensure client relationships are in growth mode or take action to get help from account team leadership if necessary.


What we’re looking for:

A real people-person. You live for building relationships and thrive in interpersonal settings. You are genuinely happy in collaboration mode.
Passion for crafting enjoyable experiences, and knowing how to create a best-in-class client and agency experience.
An innate sense of accountability and effortless ability to take ownership of initiatives. Someone that will drive outcomes and meet expectations. You are not afraid to follow-up and give/take feedback.
A critical thinker with a natural ability for thinking strategically, asking “why” and making business decisions. A true problem-solver.
An organized individual that is able to help people of diverse skills and personalities stay organized and on track.
Proven ability to push past challenges with a positive attitude.
A team player that is an asset to the agency, willing to work on internal initiatives, share knowledge and thought leadership in service of education and promoting agency expertise.


What’s in it for you:

A tremendous opportunity to drive the growth of your career in a very entrepreneurial, nimble and open-minded organization.
A real voice in the company. Your ideas and feedback will have an impact, guaranteed.
A supportive and collaborative leadership structure that truly cares about the people.
A smart, innovative and fun-loving group of people to call your work family.
A stable workplace with a 5-year average employee tenure and competitively low turnover rate - people like it here!


The ideal candidate for this position will have at least 3-5 years of professional experience managing clients and projects in the digital marketing space. The role requires both experience in project management and experience working directly with clients in an agency setting.


Due to the high volume of applicants, we are not currently accepting phone calls about employment opportunities. In addition, we cannot pay for relocation expenses or act as an immigration sponsor at this time, nor is this position eligible for telecommuting. Please visit our website to learn more about Envisionit: http://www.envisionitagency.com

Envisionit is an equal opportunity employer and works in compliance with both federal and state laws. Envisionit. Enjoy your agency™

About Beekeeper Marketing’s Media Group:
The Media team within Beekeeper promotes our clients’ brands on Amazon and other eCommerce platforms by driving discoverability, traffic, and conversion through Search and Display campaigns. Our team of fully Amazon accredited campaign managers have an impressive track record for success and world class proprietary technology at their fingertips. We also have tight connections to Amazon’s media teams, participating in joint business planning with them and receiving great media rates to pass on to our clients.
About the Media Manager role:
The Media Manager will work closely with the Business Management team members while independently managing his/her own list of clients.
Responsibilities include:
Work with BKM Business Managers, clients, and Amazon and other eCommerce companies to help deliver strong sales growth and excellent customer support:

Sponsored Ads (Amazon’s search advertising platform)

Introduce clients to Sponsored Ads and develop advertising strategies based on client’s goals and the role of Amazon media in driving their brand growth

Be prepared to discuss common concerns from the traditional digital media landscape (automation, dayparting, head/longtail keywords) along with Amazon-specific metrics and how to interpret the information (CTR, ROAS)

Set up/monitor/optimize/report on Sponsored Ads campaigns to clients and identify trends along with recommendations of how to maximize media dollars in the future

Keep Business Managers and Content team in the loop about high or low-performing keywords to optimize SEO efforts

Amazon DSP (Amazon’s self-service programmatic display platform)

Introduce clients to Amazon DSP where appropriate and outline strategic importance of running display in conjunction with search campaigns

Independently set-up, monitor, optimize and report on Amazon DSP campaigns

Begin to understand all levels of targeting available within DSP to upsell current or potential clients on DSP campaigns

Additional responsibilities

Have a thorough understanding of Amazon retail fundamentals to understand the Amazon flywheel and how promotions fuels growth on Amazon

Manage promotional budgets for multiple clients (20+)

Consult with clients via email, phone calls, in-person meetings, and reports, sharing best practices and recommendations

Help train Marketing Coordinators and Marketing Associates to develop their knowledge of Amazon and the advertising industry

Qualifications:

Must be authorized to work in the United States

5+ years experience in media and advertising

Experience with eCommerce channels (Amazon, Instacart, Kroger, Walmart, etc)

Paid search experience on multiple platforms

Programmatic display knowledge preferred

Successful client/account management experience, including providing thought leadership on campaign strategies

Detail-oriented with strong organizational and project management skills

Demonstrated experience as an effective team member with strong communications skills, reliability/integrity/maturity, and ability to self-start

Must be comfortable with the learning curve/constant change that comes with operating in a fast-moving, ever-changing world of eCommerce

Comfortable in spreadsheets and doing analysis

We operate on G-Suite (Gmail, G-Drive, Sheets, Presentations, Calendar, Drawings, etc); experience using G-Suite is a plus.

Job Description:

W.W. Norton & Company is seeking a Sciences Sales and Market Development Specialist to join its College Marketing team. The Sales and Market Development Specialist is responsible for developing and executing marketing and sales strategies in the field, driving revenue growth and digital product adoptions, training and working with sales representations, and market development. The Sales and Market Development Specialist will investigate course markets, test messaging, develop relationships with potential customers while building target lists, provide extensive feedback to the editors and discipline teams, and implement strategies for getting digital products assigned, and successfully close business. This position requires a person with demonstrated sales and training skills, and the ideal candidate will be an enthusiastic salesperson who loves books and educational digital products and creatively solves problems. Excellent presentation skills and a high level of comfort with digital products are a must. Please note this position is remote and can be located in the Rocky Mountains, the Midwest, or Texas.
Essential Job Responsibilities Include:
On-campus market development consisting of investigating new course markets, prepublication selling and research, and messaging feedback on 1st editions and important revisions for prepublication titles.
Prepare for and participate in calls and meetings with fellow marketing managers and editors, analyzing messaging, sales results, pipeline progress, and solving problems. These meetings will occur for both front list and prepublication lists throughout the year, some will be held in New York office.
Collaborate and communicate regularly with inside marketing managers and fellow Sales and Market Development specialists.
Attend marketing and prelaunch committee meetings.
Create, develop, and co-own target lists for prepublication and front list books.
Campus visits focused on training sales representatives to sell in your disciplines. This job requires about 30% travel covering roughly a quarter of the country.
Work and win business across your discipline type for front list titles and important second and third-year titles.
Increase assignment rates for digital media tools.
Serve as book content and media experts for the disciplines for which you’re responsible.
Respond to Salesforce Action Plans with strategic and content-focused guidance and drive Salesforce activity from the field.
Monitor and analyze Salesforce pipeline, working with marketers, specialists, sales reps, and regional managers to develop strategies to improve pipeline movement.
Prepare and conduct campus presentations.
Manage January sales conference presentation and take responsibility for the outline, the presentation materials, and all logistics.
Conduct implementation webinars or meetings.
Create sales tools designed to market books to college instructors, support our sales efforts, and train travelers.
Participate in new traveler training program.
Please note - this job description is not designed to cover all activities required of the employee.
Required Experience:

Bachelor’s degree.
3 years of proven experience in higher education publishing sales preferred.
Must be highly disciplined, creative, and self-motivated.
Must be collaborative and enjoy working on a team.
Must have the ability to analyze results and strategize to win prospective business.
Must be able to effectively work with newer reps on campus, while also collaborating with experienced reps.
Must develop content knowledge and expertise in several discipline areas.
Excellent presentation skills are required.
Must have the ability to multi-task and effectively prioritize, both when working on projects, but also tracking the progress of potential adoptions across an academic year.
Must have superior verbal and written communications.
Must be organized, detail-oriented, and responsive.
Must be willing to travel approximately 30% of the time during the academic sales year, with more travel possible during peak presentation and adoption periods.
Employment eligibility to work with W.W. Norton & Company in the US is required.
Must be able to work full business hours.
About Norton:
W. W. Norton & Company is the oldest and largest publishing house owned wholly by its employees. W. W. Norton & Company strives to carry out the imperative of its founder to "publish books not for a single season, but for the years." In college publishing, that imperative applies not only to books, but also to an ever-growing list of essential print and digital resources that support teaching and learning. For more information about the Company, visit us online at: http://www.wwnorton.com.
From: W.W. Norton & Company, Inc.

This salesperson model has been created by life-long salespeople, not a CPA or CFO. Together, our team carefully crafted this role and designed it based on creating “the dream” sales role that you’d want to stay in forever.

Olumo is a next-generation SaaS company that helps organizations build a people-focused culture through a data-driven approach.
Because at Olumo, we've shown that People Data + Intentional Actions = Business Results. Olumo helps solve the age-old challenge of employee retention and developing the company culture and Olumo’s system pays for itself, thus making it an easy sale.
In today’s “experience economy”, organizations need to be working harder than ever to create cultures that attract, engage, develop, and retain their people, all while delivering business results.
We have endless and proven support for our sales team including:
Personal and group coaching… designed to take your skills and abilities to the next level.
Technology tools and automation created to allow you to get rid of the mundane, repetitive tasks that bog down most salespeople.
Lead generation, CRM, and communication tools
The time to dominate this new and dynamic market segment is now, and it’s time for you to come and show off what you can accomplish and finally be rewarded for your efforts!

Technologically proficient; not necessarily an expert, but knowledgeable

CRM experience a HUGE plus

Working from anywhere in the world
We appreciate your interest in joining our team!

Redfin is redefining real estate in the consumer's favor. We combine our own technology and real estate agents to make buying or selling a home faster, easier, and more efficient. At Redfin, you'll have the tools and support you need to thrive in a dynamic, tech-savvy environment where you can grow your career. And unlike other brokerages, we offer all full-time employees the same top-tier benefits. If you're passionate about delighting customers and transforming the real estate industry, join us.
As a Redfin Tour Coordinator, you’ll be on the front lines of customer service, coordinating with Redfin real estate agents and clients to schedule home showings for buyers.
This position is currently 100% remote. In office work will resume at a later date, yet to be determined. Technical equipment will be provided and training will be conducted virtually.
The Role
Take inbound requests to tour properties via email, phone, and the Redfin site and apps
Coordinate with listing agents to confirm that properties are available for showing
Coordinate with buyer's agents and clients to schedule and reschedule home showings
Benefit from online tools that allow you to track customer progress and share information across teams
Hours may vary and can include evenings and weekends
Skills & Experience
Customer service experience, including the using email, phone, and customer relationship management tools in a high-volume workflow
Ability to juggle many tasks and transition smoothly from one to the next in a fast-paced setting
Excellent attention to detail; nothing gets past you
Commitment to delivering the best client experience in real estate
What We Offer
Competitive hourly wage
Paid vacation, sick leave, and flex days
50% work from home, 50% work from office schedule flexibility
Amazingly smart and fun teammates and a management team invested in your growth and success.
Redfin is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce.

You will develop, implement, and execute a broad sourcing and outreach strategy and think creatively about how to build a candidate pipeline.

What You’ll Be Doing


Partner with recruiters and the business to develop a diverse candidate pipeline
Work with engineering leaders and recruiters in defining and maintaining hiring needs while understanding technical requirements of a role, the engineering challenge, and how it fits into the organization.
Identify prospects through strong research by using sourcing platforms such as LinkedIn Recruiter, Stack Overflow, Github etc., and by targeted networking through alumni groups, meet-ups and conferences
Execute on tactical outreach, craft custom outreach messaging, and screen prospective candidates Work with coordinators and recruiters to ensure a remarkable candidate experience.
Work with schedulers and recruiters to ensure a remarkable candidate experience.


Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd


Experience recruiting for Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, or Machine Learning
Ability to manage time and juggle multiple priorities to execute high quality deliverables
Consistent track record of finding creative ways to identify talent
Solid oral and written communication skills with attention to detail
