JobTitle: Principal WW Marketing & Operations Strategy Specialist
Text:
At least 7+ years’ experience in Sales operations or Sales strategy in a mid-to-large scale hi-tech company.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience is required.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, and technology. AWS customers are looking for ways to improve their utilization of AWS services and our portfolio of AWS Premium Support services can help them solve complex business challenges and improve overall customer satisfaction.

We are seeking a WW Sales Specialist (WWSO) Strategy & Operations (S&O) Leader to drive strategic programs, initiatives and processes that accelerate revenue growth and drive specialist productivity. They will identify and prioritize the most impactful opportunities through developing empathy for our customers’ needs, understanding the AWS business systems, applying best practices and analyzing root causes. They will be adept at presenting and engaging senior stakeholders across diverse organizations to pilot the program, with clear success criteria. Based on the outcome, they will simplify, optimize and improve the proposal before working with various stakeholders and operating teams to implement the program at scale, ensuring adoption among users and excellent customer experience and satisfaction.

The ideal candidate has experience in leading business strategy, innovation and transformation at scale in complex environments. They will have high business acumen and strong analytical skills coupled with strong collaboration and influencing skills. This is a hands-on position - the candidate must be willing to “roll up the sleeves”. The candidate will be a self-starter with a bias towards independent problem solving, a passion for identifying and eliminating bottlenecks, and has the foresight to anticipate business needs, make tradeoffs, and balance business dynamics despite constraints. The lead will thrive in a fast-paced environment, will be able to manage through ambiguity and complexity, and constantly seek ways to invent and simplify across the business.

This position can be remote, but candidates must be based near an AWS office location (Arlington, Atlanta, Austin, Boston, Chicago, Cupertino, Dallas, Denver, Detroit, East Palo Alto, Herndon, Houston, Irvine, Minneapolis, Nashville, New York City, Pittsburgh, Portland, San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle, Washington D.C., Sunnyvale, Santa Monica, Seattle, Tempe)

Key Responsibilities Include


Define key sales support mechanisms and programs to meet the rapid growth of the business and achieve revenue attainment and market development objectives
Drive pilots and change management and communications for new mechanisms and tools for the business unit
Development and facilitation of C-level engagements focused on improving customer engagement and developing long-term strategic relationships. This involves interfacing with multiple stakeholder groups and subject matter experts to understand customer needs, account planning activities, and the art of what’s possible.
Ability to understand long term strategic needs of customers and assist in development of AWS and Amazon business plans to meet these needs
Coordination across multiple Amazon teams to bring the right experts to discussions to maximize productivity of vision workshops.
Coordinate with other functional units within Amazon to ensure alignment of efforts and sharing of best practices.
Collaborate with other team members to develop a scalable methodology and framework for the Executive Visioning program including design process, framework structure, metrics/impact measurement, and handoffs to appropriate teams (post workshop).
Obsessively improve customer interactions by capturing feedback, iterating, and developing a continuous improvement cycle for the Vision Workshop program.
Constantly innovate and improve programs and program management mechanisms, suggesting new ideas and best practices for improving the business and customer engagement and sharing artifacts within the AWS Knowledge Management system.Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills; able to articulate customer and stakeholder recommendations, balance tradeoffs, drive consensus, and gain support by utilizing excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication.
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills; able to articulate customer and stakeholder recommendations, balance tradeoffs, drive consensus, and gain support by utilizing excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication. · Experience working with Enterprise and B2B Tech Sales teams as a strategic and operational partner. Knowledge of enterprise customers and cloud technologies, products and market landscape.
Program management knowledge spanning planning, execution and project delivery.
Ability to navigate a fast paced environment with limited direction, balance competing priorities and multiple time-sensitive projects at once and make decisions and recommendations with quick turnarounds.
MBA or other relevant advanced degree.
Ability to conduct sophisticated and creative analysis of complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables, messages, and presentations.
Demonstrated ability to define, refine and implement sales processes, procedures and policies.
Highly organized, detail oriented, and efficient in ambiguous situations.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If located within the city limits of Columbia, SC, this position is subject to a background check for any convictions directly related to its duties and responsibilities. Only job-related convictions will be considered and will not automatically disqualify the candidate.

For employees based in Colorado, this position starts at $122,300/year. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. For more information regarding Amazon benefits, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/benefits. Applicants should apply via Amazon’s internal or external careers site.

Who we are:
About Guaranteed Rate Companies:
We’re Guaranteed Rate, the 5 th -largest retail mortgage lender in the U.S. with more than $73 billion in loans funded in 2020 alone. We’re based on a philosophy that We Grow For Good and that the more we grow, the more we can help people—and we’ve been growing exponentially by partnering with the best real estate agents, hiring the best people, and offering industry-leading tech, low rates and the highest level of customer service. Headquartered in Chicago, our 9,000 employees are in every state across 350 offices. We know anything is possible as long as you believe. Do you believe you’re a perfect fit? We’d love to hear from you.

We are currently seeking a hard-working, dedicated National Underwriting Trainer to join our innovative and passionate team.

Job Description:
The National Underwriting Trainer establishes Guaranteed Rate’s process, practice, and culture, along with providing ongoing support to new and existing employees. The primary focus of a trainer is spent delivering and developing relevant interactive instruction to our mortgage Underwriting team through live classroom presentations, recorded training videos, and various published materials. The trainer monitors trainee attendance and participation. Uses tests/ quizzes to measure trainees’ comprehension of class material and certifies a trainee who has successfully internalized and completed their education.

Responsibilities:
Facilitate:
Host virtual, recorded, and on-site training sessions for underwriters.

Interact and engage audience with questions and hands-on practice.

Track attendance and active participation levels

Create recorded training sessions for continued or refresher education.

Administer tests/quizzes to measure participants retention of class material.

Deploy surveys to measure class experience/perception and collect feedback for improvements.

Training Administration:
Develop and maintain current and accurate training and reference materials for classroom and continuing education instruction.

Training Support:
Monitor and respond to emails in the training inbox and the training phone line.

Find common patterns in areas that need to be emphasized in initial trainings.

Qualifications:
5 Years of mortgage underwriting experience is required.

An inherent passion and desire to innovate and teach others.

Excellent disposition, mindset, communication skills and work ethic

Outgoing, dynamic, and infectious personality

Strong listening, problem solving skills and out of-box thinking.

Ability to multi-task with strong attention to detail while meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment

Ability to create training material presentations and innovate in training media.

Encompass experience is a plus.

Government and Jumbo underwriting experience are a plus.

Previous mentorship experience is a plus.

#LI-LC2

Guaranteed Rate is an Equal Opportunity Employer that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, sex, religion, color, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reason protected by law.

Description
We are seeking an experienced Demand Analyst to join our Portfolio Management team at KGS. We are actively maturing the Global Portfolio Management capability internally within KGS and with our customers.
The right team member will focus on servicing our customers project portfolio needs while working as a team to mature KBS Portfolio Management capabilities. A strong understanding of project portfolio -demand and capacity management in an IT organization is a must.
This role is open to remote/ work from home candidates with preference to sit in Wichita, Atlanta, Chicago, or Auburn Hills.
What You Will Do In Your Role
Assessing incoming requests for work and assigning to the appropriate resource manager
Collaborating with resource managers, product owners, and internal teams to efficiently review demand, coordinate, prioritize and schedule activities and requests
Creating a master schedule in collaboration with resource managers, senior leaders, and portfolio managers across the organization
Meeting with customer groups to gain understanding of upcoming projects, dependencies, and business needs
Developing and maintaining strong relationships with customers
Facilitating prioritization and resourcing discussions
Creating, maintaining and disseminating dashboards, metrics, measures and trend analysis visibility associated with demand and capacity
Compiling “what if” scenario-based analysis to determine impacts on capacity, capability and delivery
Continually evaluating and improving processes and procedures to maximize efficiencies
Effectively handling and resolving customer escalations
Educating customers, resource members and team members on leading practices and process related to project demand and capacity
Executing some PPM Tool Administration tasks
Delivering Demand and Capacity governance and managing data integrity
The Experience You Will Bring
Requirements:
Experience implementing and or supporting project/product Portfolio Management processes and procedures
A minimum of two years’ experience in IT demand management planning, IT capacity planning, or IT project management experience
Experience with Project Portfolio Management tool
Experience coordinating with stakeholders or customers
What Will Put You Ahead
Experience in the Infrastructure and application IT space
Experience in an Agile environment
Experience with Service Now ITBM or Planview
Experience with Digital Transformation
Executive communication and reporting experience
Bachelor’s degree
Customer Portfolio Management experience
Experience in prioritization processes that not only include value, but also factor in readiness, likelihood of success, and a resource consumption index
Familiar with Organizational Change Management (OCM) concepts
Technical product management / program management experience
Backlog management/road mapping facilitation experience


Salary and Benefits Commensurate with Experience.
Equal Opportunity Employer.

Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.

JobTitle: VMware Field Sales Enablement Business Partner for Synergy Channel, - Opportunity for Working Remotely Chicago, IL
Text:
VMWare is seeking a highly motivated, results-oriented Enablement Business Partner for driving strategic global enablement projects for VMware Dell EMC Enablement. Reporting to the Director, Worldwide Readiness and Customer Education and a strong dotted line to the Synergy Channel Director, the EBP will be responsible for managing programs designed to drive sales skills and productivity for Dell EMC Channel partners on VMW joint solutions.
VMware has a fast-paced, rapidly growing environment and will require the ability to build relationships and respond to top business priorities by helping to implement sales enablement programs in a repeatable and scalable fashion. The individual is proactive, organized, results-oriented, collaborative, assertive, and influential; and is committed to delivering impactful outcomes in a team environment.
This role is responsible for the creation and delivery of Partner sales-role specific training strategies and frameworks aligned to DT/VMware synergy sales/business priorities for the enablement of sales-makers using a variety of modalities. This person will partner with their peers in the DT and VMware (VMW) enablement teams, as well as functional organizations to ensure consistency, scalability and quality of enablement solutions. Learning and development responsibility includes defining role competency needs, evaluating as-is, creating training frameworks and strategies for sales-specific job tools, company products and selling skills.
The position requires a self-starter with robust project management skills, great communications and presentation skills, and the ability to understand the sales process and work with a variety of stakeholders at both Dell EMC and VMware to document and solicit their requirements, feedback and commitment to execute projects.
Lead the Global Channel Enablement business: be a trusted advisor to VMW & DT Channel Leadership and stakeholders to identify and prioritize enablement requirements aligned with synergy sales/business priorities
Accountable for channel sales enablement for key partners TBD
Develop strategies, frameworks and enablement plans focused on audience need, cross-functional consistency, and scalability
Execute and share best practices for ensuring excellence in sales facing aspects of learning and development
Perform detailed analysis of current skills and abilities and prescribe role-based learning paths for specific Dell channel partner roles in learning about VMware
Provide feedback to channel leadership on Learning and Development and audience experience
Continually measure the effectiveness of training, content, and delivery, while designing and executing plans for improvement
Responsibilities:
Working with the Channel Director, build the Channel Enablement Strategy yearly and quarterly
Build the Plan of Record for co-development of content & learning plan for Dell’s Partners (in tandem with RACE, who owns the learning plan for VMW sales and other VMware partners)
Conduct organizational level, program level, role level, and individual level needs analysis to identify strategies and frameworks to allow the development of high-impact sales training programs.
Manage and Lead Solutions messaging/content into T1 Channel Enablement Events (i.e. Heros Program, Dell Tech forums, etc.) with support from both RACE, Dell and VMware resources
Assist with the development of new and innovative approaches to improve the quality and effectiveness of sales enablement programs
Assist with onboarding and mentoring new Channel Partners
Build and/or maintain a stakeholder matrix within DT and VMW
Lead and facilitate virtual teams as necessary to execute training and enablement programs
Oversee effective measurement techniques for programs
Lead and track ongoing projects within DT in collaboration with VMW Enablement team includes project scoping, tracking, reporting for major initiatives and supporting activities
Communicate and drive standardized ROI metrics by program/activity
Support VMware Enablement & DSAT quarterly planning process to prioritize, plan and budget enablement events and ensure alignment with DT GSL&E
Coordinate regular cadence with DT and VMW enablement leads for program/activity metrics, team alignment, and project and status updates
Align closely with Dell GSL&E organization and the global enablement calendar for planning and execution of VMware training and enablement
Collaborate cross functionally with GSL&E, VMW Race, DSAT and regional stakeholders to ensure DT/VMW synergy priorities are embedded within NA DT Field Sales Enablement programs

Category : Sales
Subcategory: Field Enablement
Experience: Manager and Professional
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Posted Date: 2021-01-12
VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

JobTitle: Remote Accountant (Virtual Bookkeeper PART-TIME) – Chicago, Illinois
Text:
Overview:

Are you an experienced accounting professional who would love a part-time, virtual position that would allow you to achieve the optimal work/life balance that you have always dreamed of? Would you enjoy using your bookkeeping expertise to remotely help small businesses thrive, all from the comfort of your own home office? Tired of commuting through nightmarish weather compounded with 50+ hour work weeks? If you’re interested in working between 20-30 hours a week during traditional daytime business hours for an award-winning organization leveraging cutting edge technology to pioneer the work-from-home revolution, then we may have the perfect opportunity for you!

About Supporting Strategies

Since 2004, we have been empowering business owners by taking bookkeeping and operational support functions off their plates allowing them to focus on their core business. Supporting Strategies’ experienced professionals use our cutting-edge cloud-based platform, virtual infrastructure and proven process to deliver a full suite of outsourced services, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, bookkeeping, financial reporting, controller level services and payroll administration.
Supporting Strategies has over 100 offices throughout the U.S. and is continuing to grow rapidly! This momentum has created fantastic opportunities for accountants who thrive on providing exceptional client service while seeking optimal work-life balance as well as the strength of a network community of over 400 employees nationwide.

Why Work for Supporting Strategies?
SOUGHT AFTER FLEXIBILITY!
MEANINGFUL WORK/LIFE BALANCE – Our unique, virtual, work-from-home opportunities allow you to harmoniously balance your family obligations, passions, and love of ‘getting into the numbers.’
DISTINGUISHED REPUTATION – Supporting Strategies has received the distinction of being a Top 50 Franchisee Satisfaction Award winner by Franchise Business Review for the past 4 years running. Franchise Business Review has also named Supporting Strategies as one of the Best Franchises for Women consecutively over the past 3 years.
LEADING EDGE TECHNOLOGY – Opportunity to advance your technical skills using the latest and most innovative cloud-based platforms.
Responsibilities:

The responsibilities associated with this role are organized into areas that are very important to Supporting Strategies as an organization. We have purposely chosen the word “delight” when defining these responsibilities because it appropriately captures how passionate we are about these initiatives and we naturally hope you will share in our sentiment.

Client Delight – Building Great Client Relationships
Provide exceptional accounting and operational service to our clients.
Demonstrate thorough understanding of professional accounting and bookkeeping practices.
Keep abreast of the latest developments in technologies to deliver outstanding quality service.
Support client onboarding process for all assigned client engagements in accordance with defined process.
Execute, as applicable, processes related to accounts payable and accounts receivable management, bookkeeping entries, closing the books monthly as well as preparing financial reporting and analysis. May also include payroll, HR administration and special projects as assigned.
Collaborate with your manager and other Associates on your team to ensure all clients are delighted with our services through timely and effective communication, delivery on deadlines and stellar accounting support.
Manage day-to-day relationships with clients while performing within established processes and budget parameters.
Identify and recommend to your manager areas where Supporting Strategies may be able to provide additional services or tools to drive additional client value and efficiency.
Team Delight – Creating a Satisfying & Collaborative Virtual Environment
Complete virtual training with guidance from your manager in accordance with established Supporting Strategies procedures.
Communicate with your manager regarding your established schedule, desired hours and any potential capacity issues.
Participate in recurring team and one-on-one check-in meetings to ensure you are aligned for success.
Embrace coaching and feedback provided by your manager and implement changes as needed to help meet team and client goals.
Qualifications:

Does everything you have read so far sound appealing? We hope so! If you meet the qualifications below, we would absolutely love for you to apply!
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field.
5+ years of demonstrated ability to provide detailed level bookkeeping support – accounts payable, accounts receivable, closing books on a monthly basis and preparing financial reporting and analysis for small businesses.
1+ years of transactional accounting experience using QuickBooks for/in a professional organization.
Capacity and commitment to work 20-30 hours a week during traditional daytime business hours supporting clients.
Ability to communicate clearly and professionally, both orally and in writing.
Willingness to consistently and accurately follow established policies and procedures.
A passion for and sense of personal satisfaction in delighting clients and helping small businesses succeed.
Confidence in learning and embracing new technology to solve client issues.
Experience in developing strong remote team relationships based on trust, accountability, integrity, and sharing of best practices.
Commitment to maintain the highest level of confidentiality while working with client data.
A dedicated office space that has a reliable, high-speed internet connection.

Is this opportunity not for you? Would you be more interested in owning your own Supporting Strategies franchise? In that case, please visit our webpage, scroll to the bottom and select the "Franchise Opportunities" link to learn more!

The Associate Director, Cloud Infrastructure Operations leads the planning, design, and engineering of enterprise-level infrastructure and platforms related to cloud computing. The Associate Director, Cloud Infrastructure Operations requires a solid understanding of how organization capabilities interrelate across department(s).
Responsibilities
The Associate Director of Cloud Infrastructure Operations will be focused on the design and implementation of cloud compliance, metrics/reporting and cost optimization in multi-cloud environment – offering advisory services, strategic analysis, compliance and financial reporting and governance. The position will act as the lead on collaborating with Application & Product teams, Finance, Legal and Supply Management Services partners as well as with Cloud Engineering teams so they can optimize their practices for Cloud Operations. This will include generating and providing recommendations on how Humana should optimize usage of cloud services, compliance controls through analysis and develop automated reporting that enables teams to leverage best practices for running efficient cloud solutions.
If you’re passionate about innovation and love working in an environment where you can constantly improve and adopt new technologies to drive business results, then Humana’s Cloud Infrastructure Operations team could be the place for you!
Key Responsibilities:
Drives moderate to complex processing improvements through optimization, enhancements and implementation of new operational features and functions around cloud compliance, metrics/reporting and cost optimization.
Reporting and Analytics: design and maintain the technology and processes to automate data ingestion of compliance, forecast, usage, utilization, and other data to offer insight and optimization opportunities.
Provide senior level expertise on decisions and priorities regarding the enterprises overall cloud operation strategy, consumption and optimization opportunities.
Identifies, drives and assists in the implementation of opportunities to standardize cloud environments.
Knowledge of monitoring software for infrastructure monitoring as well as application performance monitoring including SLAs/KPIs and reporting approaches for the multi cloud platforms.
Experience creating advanced product level visibility/metrics that will help drive better business decisions and accountability.
Evaluate data patterns/outliers and derive insightful knowledge that will direct strategic and operational decisions.
Deliver the tooling and capabilities needed to enable cloud compliance, metrics/reporting and cost management roadmap/strategy.
Act as subject matter expert in advising on new and different cloud services and resources.
Executes data-driven decisions by delivering operational metrics by analyzing operational data to identify trends and potential problems.
A developmental mindset with the ability to discern patterns, drive efficiencies, and lower total cost of ownership for technology processes and solutions.
Define short, mid, and long-term cloud production operations strategy and roadmap.
Collaborate with vendor partners, maintain strategic relationships and identifying continuous improvement opportunities.
Develop opportunities to optimize costs and operational improvement with key infrastructure and service providers.
Monitor cloud consumption in various accounts and projects to determine areas for resource efficiency.
Experience providing chargeback, show-back, budgeting and forecasting as core capabilities of cloud financial management.
Ability to communicate at all levels within an organization and influence leadership.
Partner with clients on ongoing basis to help them understand their cloud spend and optimize it based on their unique needs.

Required Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
10 or more years of technical experience
5 or more years of resource management experience
Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced understanding of cloud platforms, consoles, and services (Azure, Google and AWS).
Deep understanding of the key concepts and practices of cloud observability, coupled with experience implementing robust systems that leverage metrics, logs, and traces to provide holistic state of the cloud operations.
A technical business acumen that ensures the organization is operating efficiently and effectively in a hybrid cloud environment.
Solid understanding of infrastructure and operation landscape with a focus on public cloud (Azure, GCP and AWS) technology and how it differs from traditional computing.
Ability to work with minimal supervision, making decisions based upon priorities, schedules and an understanding of business initiatives.
Passion for and skills in resource optimization to improve cloud efficiency.
Ability to apply critical thinking to all aspects of the position.
Detail oriented with excellent documentation skills/methodologies, who is able to successfully manage multiple priorities.
Proficiency in developing repeatable and efficient automation to codify and simplify end-to-end processes and methods in public and private cloud landscapes.
You have a deep understanding how to apply best practices around monitoring, alerting, and logging, and have implementation experience with one or more monitoring, alerting, and logging systems (Azure Monitor, AppInsight, SignalFX, Log Analytics, Splunk, Dynatrace, SentryOne, etc…).
Deep understanding of core public & private cloud billing, cost management, and data visualization tools (e.g. Cloudability, Azure Pricing Calculator, AWS Cost Explorer).
Senior experience in Ansible, API queries, and Power BI is a plus.
Knowledge scripting using Python, as well as Perl, PowerShell, JavaScript, or similar scripting languages.
Strong analytical and reporting skills.
Leader and a team player with transformation mindset.
Strong organizational, task, and project management skills.
Self-driven and able to work across diverse technical and non-technical teams.
Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills.
Ability to operate successfully in a lean, agile, and fast-paced organization.
Ability to communicate at all levels within an organization and influence leadership.
Azure and/or AWS certifications preferred
FinOps Certified Practitioner preferred

Overview
Do you have a minimum of 3 season of paid Tax Preparation experience, with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year? If you're a tax professional, we need you to help our customers complete thier taxes using TurboTax. You’ll advance our goal of “Powering Prosperity Around the World” by providing expert guidance and explanations of tax and technical terms to our customers. You’ll also play an important role in our effort to enhance our brand by delighting our customers and empowering them to prepare their taxes.
What you'll bring
Minimum 3 season of paid Tax Preparation experience, with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year required.
Prior tax preparation experience in a tax practice or retail setting required.
College degree a plus. The ideal candidate will have a background in business, finance, accounting, or tax
Knowledge of tax laws, tax concepts and familiarity with form 1040 and schedules
PTIN required
Ability/motivation to expand expertise and obtain a tax credential or certification - Intuit offers a program to obtain your EA
Strong customer service skills with ability to empathize and instill confidence
Ability to work within a team to assist in preparation of accurate tax returns in a timely manner
Strong Research skills and the ability to quickly use online resources to find answers
Critical thinking and problem solving
Persistence and determination
Willingness to utilize audio/visual tools to communicate with customers
Comfortable interacting with customers through video, in a professional way that represents the Intuit TurboTax brand well
Friendly and reassuring on camera
Bilingual (English/Spanish) communication skills (written & spoken) a plus
For internal use: tst assoc
How you will lead
This is a seasonal position providing assistance to customers both assisting them in preparing their own returns and/or fully preparing customer tax returns
Compiling/preparing tax returns for TurboTax Customers
Gathering/organizing and accurately entering customer data in the federal and state tax returns for review
Communicate directly with the customer as needed
Coordinate customer meetings and follow-up
Communicate updates to credentialed tax experts on assigned customers
Will help customers who are working on their tax return with both product/software inquiries, as well as with tax questions and calculations
Apply defined practices, procedures and company policies to troubleshoot and resolve product and tax support customer inquiries
Will interact with customers utilizing strong written and verbal skills as well as deep customer empathy
Typical Deliverables:
Accurate and complete customer data entered in tax returns for credentialed tax expert review
High quality customer interactions and experiences
Application of defined practices, procedures and company policies to troubleshoot, resolve issues and address routine Tax Support customer questions
Proficient with technology and solid knowledge of computer operations and software.
Utilize and leverage government websites and toolkits to seek out and deliver the right answer to the customer
Document customer interactions
Represent the Intuit TurboTax brand and spirit by demonstrating empathy for the customer, empowering and partnering with the customer, personalizing the experience, and providing them the confidence that they can do their own taxes

JobTitle: Certified Recovery Support Specialist/Peer Mentor - Acute Community Treatment Program
Text:
Certified Recovery Support Specialist/Peer Mentor
Acute Community Treatment Program

Are you looking to make a difference in people's lives? Do you want to learn and grow professionally while experiencing meaningful work?

Join our community mental health and wellness program and help people achieve success every day. Envision is a premier provider of recovery based mental health services in the Chicago Metropolitan Area. We inspire hope, inspiration and resiliency to hundreds of people each year.

Description:
The ACT Program is the integration of crisis intervention; treatment services and rehabilitative supports focused on skill building and stabilization to promote and maintain community living. ACT services are available to the client 24/7 are provided by a multidisciplinary team under the direction of an LPHA, and include the following rehabilitative services: 1) All Mental Health services funded by Medicaid that an MHP-level staff member can provide, 2) crisis services, 3) medication services, and 4) individual and group therapy 5) all Case Management services.

General Functions:
Peer Mentor will serve as a member of a multi-disciplinary team together with doctors and nurses, clinicians and case managers under the direction of a team leader. The Peer Mentor will use life experiences and knowledge of the mental health system to engage clients in active treatment, provide encouragement and support, education and recreational opportunities to help clients thrive in a community setting.

Key Responsibilities:

Provide outreach and engagement services to individual clients participating in the ACT Program
Share stories of own success in accordance with comfort level
Facilitate group conversation with clients, family members and legal guardians about available resources at Envision Unlimited and the MH system at large.
Have input in the development of treatment plan goals
Accompany clients on recreational activities and Drop-in Center events
Assist staff to develop resources for clients and link them to appropriate services
Provide individual and group peer counseling
Develop Crisis and medication adherence plans with clients

Minimum Qualifications:

High School Diploma or GED.
Must be able to pass criminal background check
Applicants must have lived experience with recovery from mental health, and/or addiction together with working knowledge of larger systems such as the State Department of Mental Health
Knowledge of Medicaid is a plus.
Must feel comfortable with public speaking and have excellent oral and written communication skills.
Must be able to drive or utilize public transportation to multiple locations.
*Preference given to Certified Recovery Support Specialists. Must be willing and able to secure certification within one year of employment if not already a CRSS.

ABOUT ENVISION UNLIMITED:
Envision Unlimited offers competitive salaries and a generous benefit package to our professionals:

Flexible Schedule

Work at Home Opportunities

Work at home Options

Blue Cross/Blue Shield Medical Coverage: HMO, PPO

Dental and Vision Insurance Options

Company paid Life Insurance

12 Paid Holidays + Birthday Off

Paid vacation, sick time and personal days

401K plan

In house training and CEU's

Employee Assistance Network

Support for pursuing clinical licensure (financial and time off)

Opportunity for career growth & development

JobTitle: Workday Time Tracking and Absence Consultant II
Text:
CHICAGO, IL OR REMOTE
TopBloc is a startup that provides fixed-time, fixed-price Workday deployment services and on-demand Workday support. We quickly and pragmatically deploy Human Capital Management, Payroll, and Financials business processes and technology, letting our customers focus on their business while they gain immediate value. Once live, we provide expertise and resources as needed to operate and augment the solution.
TopBloc is committed to providing consultants with an environment that will foster morale and growth. We are looking for a Workday Time Tracking and Absence Consultant II who wants the intimacy of working for a small firm but has the ambition to be a driver for success.

Experience implementing Workday Absence and Time Tracking configurations for customers of all sizes

The Federal Savings Bank, a national bank and “50 Best Companies to Work For” winner is currently seeking an Appraisal Desk coordinator. The Appraisal Desk coordinator fulfills an important role at TFSB by providing an exceptional customer service experience to our loan teams and vendors. This role would include monitoring of all appraisal orders via our Mercury platform as well as collaborating with our appraisal partners and processing operations team members to ensure timely receipt, review, and delivery of appraisal. This position will also be responsible for ensuring adherence to all AIR guidelines, compliance, and operations standards, as set by the bank.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Fully understand workflow within Mercury Network(appraisal platform) and Encompass so can navigate in both platform
Upon order of appraisal, track and follow up with appraisal partner to ensure appraisal turn time is met
Pull daily reports in Mercury including fee increase, hold orders, turn time, and duplicate appraisals and address accordingly
Review notes in Mercury to ensure all messages are being responded to in a timely manner and respond to AMC/AC when additional information is requested to keep the appraisal processing moving
Maintain effective communication between Operations team and Appraisal partners
Ensure UCDP/EAD/ECOA runs appropriately or reach out when error occur for assistance
Problem shoot with Mercury helpdesk on errors received within the platform
Job Requirements:
2 year degree or commensurate mortgage experience
Favorable credit history and background
Applicants must demonstrate attention to detail, the ability to multitask, and a strict adherence to deadlines
1 year of experience with Encompass loan origination software
1 year of experience with an Appraisal platform like Mercury Network
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and Outlook
Knowledge of all appraisal guidelines and AIR requirements
Flexible with work schedules especially during peak volume periods & month end.
Excellent communication skills both inside and outside the organization
Must be an overall awesome person with a great sense of humor!
 What We Offer:
Remote/work from home benefit
Base Salary and room for career advancement
Generous Vacation days and sick days
Health, Dental, and Vision insurance plans available
50% 401k match
Employee appreciation events (Pizza days, Food Truck days, Pajama day, annual Halloween costume contest, and holiday parties just to name a few)
Ongoing in-house training opportunities to sharpen your saw
Employee recognition on a national scale
Small bank culture with big bank capabilities!
The Federal Savings Bank is an equal opportunity employer that respects its employees and understands that our success is derived from hiring individuals with true character and a focus on Efficiency, Quality and Productivity.

Project Manager

This position may be filled at these alternative locations: Kansas City, MO / St. Louis, MO / Cincinnati, OH / Missoula, MT / Fully Remote

ATG believes in advancing inclusion, acceptance, and understanding amongst our team by employing individuals who bring unique perspectives and diversity of experiences to the company. We encourage all interested individuals, including people of all races and national origin, people of all ages, people of all religions, people with or without disabilities, and/or people with any gender identity and sexual orientation, to apply.

Position Overview:
The Project Manager (PM) acts as the project’s leader, driving ATG projects forward to a successful project delivery. This role is responsible for the planning, execution, and delivery of client projects for ATG’s Quote to Cash (Q2C) solutions. The PM must be effective in juggling multiple fast-paced client implementations/integrations of various sizes and at the same time establish a trusted partner relationship with ATG clients. Project Managers will deliver projects using ATG’s methodologies and governance practices.

Key Responsibilities:
Collaboration: Owns responsibility to manage relationships throughout the client organization including all project team members, business contributors and stakeholders, and executive management
Communication: Duties involve exercising project communication to efficiently task and manage internal and external teams, contain scope and execute change requests as necessary, and identify and mitigate risks to the project.
Lead: Guide technical/business engagement teams to deliver a flexible and scalable solution, provide mentorship and supervise project team members, as well as activities and internal initiatives as required in non-client engaging situations.

Key Experience:
Demonstrated success and experience in the following areas:
Mid-level PM: Proven experience as a project manager and knowledge of the software development lifecycle process with hands-on experience utilizing current project management tools and methods
Senior- level PM : Successful proven experience leading CRM, Billing or ERP enterprise implementations (including e-Business, SaaS applications or cloud-based transformation/integrations)

Strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills to juggle competing demands and to ensure development and implementation of proper systems and processes in an agile environment
CPQ and/or Billing experience is a plus

Preferred Knowledge and Skills:
Experience with cloud software implementation highly desired
Knowledge of iterative methods for deploying software
Customer-centric attitude - committed to the client and successfully consults and negotiates when necessary
Exhibits high energy and drive, brings enthusiasm and the ability to engage with people at multiple levels on projects and meetings

Relevant Technologies:
Experience in the following technologies are preferred (but not required): Salesforce CPQ, Salesforce Billing, Apttus CPQ, Apttus CLM, Gotransverse TRACT, Spring CM CLM, Conga CLM and other related solutions, Xactly SPM solutions, Aria billing platform, Salesforce Communities and Cloud Craze

Salesforce Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Zuora, Oracle Big Machines, Calidus Cloud Solutions, Netsuite, Mulesoft, other SaaS/Cloud Q2C and related Solutions

Education:
4-year degree in a technical or business field of study preferred

PMP certification a plus

Certified scrum master highly desired

Location and Travel:
Willingness and ability to travel up to 50%
Desired locations are ATG Delivery Centers, located in Missoula, MT, Cincinnati, OH, Kansas City, MO or St. Louis, MO, however for senior experienced professionals working virtual may be an option.

The Opportunity

The Clinical Program Manager is a registered nurse (RN) position that focuses on supporting Teladoc's Virtual Primary Care (VPC or Primary 360) robust quality assurance (QA) program. This includes: review, research and report member complaints and inquiries, sample and review provider consults for documentation standards/clinical appropriateness, and create policies and process for quality monitoring of care delivery and provider training.

 This role is also responsible for collaborating with the VPC MD in identifying areas for quality improvement and designing, implementing and measuring QI activities. In addition, this position is responsible for writing clinical guidelines, policies and procedures, clinician training materials and other clinical quality content. This role is responsible for coordinating the quality committee for VPC, including data gathering, meeting preparation, and follow up items to support the medical leadership. This position will work closely with and support the VPC MD on quality care related responsibilities and will serve as the primary clinical quality resource collaborating with other departments such as Clin Ops, Product, and Legal.

Responsibilities
Serves as lead RN to work in collaboration with lead VPC MD on quality care, complaints, quality improvement initiatives and patient safety issues for large health plans, key accounts and other clients
Writes clinical materials including but not limited to CPGs, protocols, policies, and procedures, clinical training content for MDs and other clinicians
Work closely with the Associate Director Clinical Quality to ensure internal stakeholders understand applicable standards, policies and procedures, and efforts needed to maintain compliance.
Serve as internal liaison to identify, track, and meet deliverables, escalate any issues or barriers that remain unresolved by the team, and manage all work-streams to meet deliverables and deadlines
Leads organization wide initiatives for quality improvement using established quality improvement methodologies.
Develop client facing communication and reporting
Coordinate and lead Quality Improvement projects as identified by medical leadership.
Collaborate with Credentialing professionals in provider performance evaluation.
Generates departmental performance statistics. Monitor, track, and trend through incident reporting and facilitate appropriate provider reviews.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Candidate Profile
Bachelor's Degree required and Certified Professional in Healthcare Quality (CPHQ) preferred.
RN required
5 years' experience as an RN required, with at least 3 years in a Healthcare Quality role required. Patient Safety/Risk Management experience preferred. Previous FPPE/OPPE , or provider evaluation development a plus. Familiarity with population health management, MIPS, or pay-for-performance reporting helpful. Familiarity with national quality measurement standards helpful (HEDIS, Stars, CAHPS, etc.)
Strong medical writing skills
Strong background in quality and process improvement
Ability to set up project teams, necessary work streams and executive steering committees
Experience with project management tools, spreadsheets, tracking deliverables and issues, meeting deadlines
Excellent written and verbal communication, and presentation skills
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Familiar with drafting and implementing policies and procedures
Attention to detail
Ability to understand health data and prepare reports both manually in Excel, and from an electronic health record (EHR)
Positively collaborates with other employees and departments to complete objectives
Comfort with change, uncertainty, and proceeding without a previous roadmap
Comfortable working independently and communicating through multiple levels in the organization
Why Join Teladoc Health?

A New Category in Healthcare: Teladoc Health is transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives.

Our Work Truly Matters: Recognized as the world leader in whole-person virtual care, Teladoc Health uses proprietary health signals and personalized interactions to drive better health outcomes across the full continuum of care, at every stage in a person's health journey.

Make an Impact: In more than 175 countries and ranked Best in KLAS for Virtual Care Platforms in 2020, Teladoc Health leverages more than a decade of expertise and data-driven insights to meet the growing virtual care needs of consumers and healthcare professionals.

Focus on PEOPLE: Teladoc Health has been recognized as a top employer by numerous media and professional organizations. Talented, passionate individuals make the difference, in this fast-moving, collaborative, and inspiring environment.

Diversity and Inclusion: At Teladoc Health we believe that personal and professional diversity is the key to innovation. We hire based solely on your strengths and qualifications, and the way in which those strengths can directly contribute to your success in your new position.

Growth and Innovation: We've already made healthcare history, yet we remain on the threshold of very big things. Come grow with us and support our mission to make a tangible difference in the lives of our Members.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never have and never will discriminate against any job candidate or employee due to age, race, religion, color, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, membership in an employee organization, medical condition, family history, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, parental status or pregnancy (including breastfeeding – we have a mother's room in both our offices). In our innovative and inclusive workplace, we prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Role:
We are looking for a Marketing Campaign Manager to assist in the development and execution of marketing programs. Could this be you?
As the Marketing Campaign Manager, you will have the opportunity to help define our demand generation strategy for prospects and our dedicated customer base. You will develop and lead a comprehensive portfolio of campaigns. The campaigns will be designed to nurture, engage and convert our prospects as well as drive adoption and cross/up sell for our existing customers.
This is a great opportunity for a sharp, eager marketer passionate about jumping on board with one of the fastest growing companies in the Big Data space. Are you ready for the challenge?
Key Responsibilities
You will build strong, data driven marketing campaigns to drive engagement and tie in with product specific campaigns
You will run the campaign calendar and email cadence to ensure optimal engagement and prevent list fatigue
You will connect GTM priorities with Sales success by defining, instrumenting, measuring and executing end-to-end campaigns
You will partner with digital, content, field, social marketing and marketing operations to align multi-channel execution
You will align with Regional Marketing Managers (RMMs) to develop/incorporate region specific programs
You will develop and project lead integrated campaigns, both online and traditional, in partnership with the rest of the marketing team, stepping in to fill in gaps as necessary
You will analyze and segment customer data to help define prospect and customer with high engagement and revenue potential
You will establish goals and critical metrics for campaigns based on historical or projected results, and tie back actual performance and revenue impact
You will test new tools to innovate and scale programs, with an emphasis on integrated marketing
Requirements
3 - 5 years of experience leading and running demand generation programs for enterprise software and/or SaaS services
Deep experience working with Salesforce.com and Eloqua (or other marketing automation tools) to execute integrated demand generation programs and measure their effectiveness
Experience working with personas and mapping to the buyer’s journey
Exceptional teammate who has partnered with sales and marketing teams to deliver integrated marketing programs
Track record of marketing results and strong analytical mindset

Fullstack Academy is a top-ranked immersive school for web development and cybersecurity training based in New York City. Fullstack offers comprehensive in-person and remote training opportunities across the U.S. and prepares students with the in-demand skills they need to launch fulfilling tech careers.
"Fullstack Academy has been a life-changing experience" is something we hear often and the reason why we come to work everyday. We’re looking for a well-networked Community Engagement Consultant to help us understand the landscape of potential entry points into key communities in the Chicago market.

ABOUT THE ROLE
As a Community Engagement Consultant, you’ll serve as a subject matter expert at the intersection of your local community and tech education. You’ll help us understand the highest value communities to engage with to drive student enrollment in your local market and you’ll make introductions or support cold outreach to leadership in those communities. You’ll help us build a strategic plan to get the highest value out of our community engagement efforts.
This is a part-time Contract role (5-10h per week, for ~3 months) that will report to our Community Manager. Most of the work in this role can be done remotely, but we are looking for a community expert in Chicago.

RESPONSIBILITIES
In this role, you will:
Research key communities in your locations and introduce them to Fullstack Academy (warm and cold outreach)
Build a strategic events calendar for your location timed around the launch of a new Fullstack program within your local community
Work with potential community leaders to understand key metrics around community (size, alignment with target market, engagement + activity, etc.) to help Fullstack qualify and prioritize appropriately
Work with the community manager on partnership launch events

QUALIFICATIONS
You are a great candidate if you have:
Deep connections within your local community, ideally in the area of career education
A deep knowledge of the most impactful communities related to tech, education and the intersection between them in your community
Comfort with networking, building relationships and being “the face” of Fullstack Academy to a variety of audiences and communities
An interest in tech education and a strong belief in education’s power to change lives, communities, and economies
You are an exceptional candidate for this role if you also have:
Existing relationships in local tech or education communities in which we may find potential students

Do you have experience in healthcare? A background in medical social work, nursing, or case management? Are you looking for a different approach to helping others navigate the complex health care system? Join our team of dedicated and passionate individuals at PinnacleCare!
This position is a 100% remote, Monday-Friday position based in the Chicago area, with an on-call rotation generally every 4 weeks, in a non-clinical setting. After COVID 19 restrictions are lifted, the advisor may accompany members on local appointments occasionally. The advisor will support both the Midwest team as well as teams on the East and West Coast.
Competitive pay and benefits package which includes voluntary health, dental, vision, and company paid life insurance, short and long-term disability, and critical illness benefit. Additional benefits include 401k with company match, PTO, and 10 paid holidays.
Who we are: PinnacleCare is a private health advisory firm that connects individuals and organizations to the world’s most advanced healthcare and facilitates access to top specialists for more streamlined and personalized healthcare experience. PinnacleCare extends a broad range of support for families and organizations to facilitate more efficient access and better outcomes - through Comprehensive Health Advisory Memberships for individuals/families, and Connection Group Benefits available through employers/organizations.
 https://www.pinnaclecare.com/
What you will do: As a PinnacleCare Health Advisor, you will provide high-touch, customer service to our members, building strong relationships while helping them navigate the healthcare system in order to receive the best and most expeditious healthcare available. Your member and their family will look to you for competent, efficient, caring, and unbiased support and assistance in any medical situation.
Our Health Advisors coordinate all aspects of the Member’s healthcare, including a collection of medical records, scheduling appointments, and facilitating second opinions with top physicians when needed. You will collaborate with our team of Medical Directors and Researchers, to provide your members with the latest information on medical conditions, treatments, clinical trials, as well as options of highly qualified physicians to consult for care.
You will also develop and maintain relationships with physicians and hospital staff.
Other Duties: These job duties do not cover or contain a comprehensive list of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
What you will need to be successful in this role:
Master's degree required in social work or other health related field, or RN certification
Background in medical social work, nursing, case management, or related background
Minimum of 5 years in clinical medicine, direct patient care, or case management
Proficiency in MS Office, CRM database systems, and research required
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, English fluency a must
Excellent time-management skills, agility in multi-tasking, decisiveness, bias towards action and proactive approach to medical needs of members
Essential Functions: To perform this job successfully, you must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.
Physical Requirements: While performing the duties of this job, you must be able to walk occasionally. You may occasionally be required to bend or stoop, and you may occasionally be required to lift objects up to 10 pounds. Work will be performed sitting at a desk in an open office and home office setting using office machines such as a copier and fax machine, and a computer, and phone.
When applying, please provide a cover letter.

JobTitle: Data Protection Compliance Specialist (Chicago or Remote)
Text:
If you are a current Motorola Solutions employee, please click this link to apply through your Workday account.
Company Overview
At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Our technology platforms in communications, software, video and services help our customers work safely and more efficiently. Whether it’s helping firefighters see through smoke, enabling police officers to see around street corners, or reliably keeping the lights on in homes and businesses around the world, our work supports those who put their lives on the line to keep us safe. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions, and help us usher in a new era in public safety and security.

Department Overview
The Global Data Protection Compliance Specialist is a key member of the Global Data Protection Office - Products Team

Job Description
Note: while we have a preference for someone in the Chicago area we will consider a U.S. based remote employee as well
As a key member of the Global Data Protection Product Compliance Team, the Global Product Compliance Specialist will collaborate with personnel across Motorola Solutions business lines and in particular product and engineering groups, legal, cyber security, and support organizations to ensure that Motorola Solutions products and services comply with applicable standards, laws and regulations for the purpose of (i) building trust in Motorola Solutions products and services and (ii) documenting and demonstrating that compliance to customers, regulators and other stakeholders. The role requires working successfully in a complex, multi-product/service ecosystems, at multiple levels, with a wide variety of constituents requiring a strong compliance and business background.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Support coordinating data privacy impact assessments and develop corresponding risk mitigation plans; manage periodic updates to same; generate related report
Master and manage data protection program management tool, OneTrust and integration with other tools as needed within MSI, such as LogicGate. Establish governance for use of tools
In coordination with multiple departments, implement and manage automated privacy and security controls crosswalk.
Develop and implement consolidated product/service compliance dashboard within applicable tool displaying product compliance or lack thereof to control sets based on security and privacy assessments.
Serve as point of contact for data inventories and data flow mapping
Assist in the continuous improvement of MSI privacy and data protection posture by designing and developing processes to mitigate data privacy risks
Stay current on the impact of established and emerging laws, regulations and standards on MSI’s customers, products, services, and technology infrastructure.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree with preferred focus in IT, computer science or technology
Hold at least one data protection and/or privacy certification such as CIPP, CIPT, or CISM
Minimum 3 years experience in privacy compliance
Legal background a plus
Experience of working in a large, global organization preferred
Strong project management skills, including the ability to manage time well, prioritize effectively, and handle multiple deadlines
Detail-oriented approach needed to recommend and implement strategic improvements on a range of data privacy and data protection issues.
Knowledge and exposure to the following standards, laws or policies, NIST 800-53 r5, ISO 27001 et seq., ISO 27701, SOC2, CJIS, GDPA, CCPA
General understanding of cloud industry technologies IaaS, PaaS and SaaS platforms
Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to communicate and drive initiative at multiple levels.
Proven ability to quickly gain trust, negotiate business objectives, have constructive debate, and work directly with a broad group of personnel

Basic Requirements
Bachelor’s degree required with a preferred focus in IT, computer science or technology
Hold at least one data protection and/or privacy certification such as CIPP, CIPT, or CISM
Minimum 3 years experience in privacy compliance
Experience working with OneTrust privacy management platform

Travel Requirements
Under 10%

Relocation Provided
None

Position Type
Experienced

Referral Payment Plan
No


EEO Statement
Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.

Our Story:

About you
You’re a high potential, high achiever looking for the right fit where you can gain exposure to senior management and advance your career. Your ideal job would entail building the deployment strategy, communicating the positive effects RPA can have on the business, and building some of the initial RPA processes.
You have a BA/BS in Computer Science or equivalent along with 2-4 years experience working with global Finance, Accounting and HR Systems. You enjoy building robots and have attention to detail and self-auditing controls.
We will be looking to this role as a growth position, where as more requests come in for RPA work you will have the opportunity to assemble a team of RPA analysts that would report directly to you.
Are you an self-motivated individual, and able to effectively align a team? Have an entrepreneurial mindset? Well, this just might be the role for you.

Avison Young creates real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people. Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people.

Avison Young is the challenger in a sector that needs a shake-up. Our people power this change through every client engagement, colleague interaction and global initiative.

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

Do you value curiosity, diversity of thought, experience, expertise and sharing success? If your answer is yes, Avison Young is a place where you can achieve your career goals.

Software Project Management Core Team Lead
 At iA, we are on a mission to provide continuous innovation in pharmacy technology. iA is a leading provider of high-volume pharmacy automation solutions, partnering with pharmacy providers to create high volume centralized solutions that help optimize prescription fulfillment providing patient choice for how they get their prescription while pharmacists deliver impactful patient care. Our scalable solutions deliver critical patient data across local and remote systems, enable better-informed decisions, increase efficiencies, and create a safer environment for patients. Pharmacy automation and software solutions work hard behind the scenes so pharmacists can get out front and work with patients.
 Why work at iA? At iA, we know the most important assets of our company are the people who work here, and we hope our optimism for the future of iA is shared by each and every one of our employees.
Job Summary
The Software Project Management Core Team Lead monitors technical project activities and track project progress across the Enterprise Governance and Software Engineering team. The Core Team Lead will coordinate activities between the Product and Operating Teams to prioritize technical development schedules while working with other iA teams. The Core Team Lead will also develop and review documentation, as well as report status, risk, and schedule to internal and external stakeholders. This job can be supported remotely for those near a major city airport .
Duties
This job description is not totally inclusive of all the job functions required of the Core Team Lead. An employee assigned to this role may have additional, job-related duties.
Essential Functions: Works with the Product and Operating teams to prioritize technical development schedules and define the detailed requirements by project. Communicates software designs with product and business stakeholders, obtain approval, and transition designs to the Software Development and Quality teams. Create software short and long-term plans, including setting target dates for milestones and adhering to deadlines Reviewing situations, presenting options, and working through effective decisions when presented with project challenges Serving as the point of contact for multiple areas when multiple resources are assigned to projects to ensure team actions remain in synergy Performing quality control on the software project as needs/requirements change Coordinating cross-functionally with iA staff members to provide technical information, notional designs, requirements, pricing, and customer feedback
Supervisory Responsibilities:
The Core Team Lead will not have any supervisory responsibilities.
Systems Used:

Software – Microsoft Office Suite & Project, ERP System, Smartsheets, other as necessary
Education, Experience, and Skills
Basic Qualifications 4 year accredited degree 3+ years’ experience in Project Management
Preferred Skills Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Business or Engineering field.. Masters Degree Preferred Certification or formal training in Project Management Proven experience supporting Software related projects or previous Software Developer experience Ability to work in a fast-paced environment Proficiency in using Microsoft Office applications Ability to work independently Customer-focused Results driven Excellent verbal and written communication skills Attention to detail Project Management Certification within 9 months of hire
 Physical Activities and Requirements Prolonged periods of computer-based work Ability to lift up to 15 pounds at a time Ability to travel as necessary
E. Work Schedule & Required Availability
This is an exempt salaried position (expected to work as many hours as necessary to fulfill job duties)

About the Team
The Outside Sales team has been the face of DoorDash to our merchant partners since our founding in 2013. Stationed locally, this team is responsible for creating deep partnerships with the most coveted local and regional merchants in any given geography. At DoorDash, these partnerships play a critical role in strengthening operations, accelerating consumer growth, and improving our bottom line. About the Role
As a Regional Account Sales Executive, you'll be joining a team of experienced operators who have excelled in the art of leading highly deliberate sales processes. The team is laying the foundation for what will eventually be the single biggest competitive advantage for DoorDash — industry-leading partnership terms with the best merchants. You’re excited about this opportunity because you will…
Interact with and empower business owners every day
Sell merchants on the value of partnering with DoorDash through revenue share agreements
Accelerate a highly organized sales cycle with the goal of closing deals within a few weeks
Develop and adopt new ways of gaining access, building trust, overcome objections, and create urgency
Share on-the-ground learnings with sales leadership and operations team
Mentor teammates on how to be the best version of themselves after establishing yourself in the role
Travel into different markets in your region (up to 40% travel)
Have flexible hours and the option to work from home We’re excited about you because…
You have experience exceeding goals
You pride yourself on your relentless work ethic
You have prior experience with leading an end-to-end, outbound sales cycle
You have a growth mindset
You approach challenges from first principles
You demonstrate creative sales tactics to engage with prospects
You display emotional intelligence , whether leading client-facing conversations or partaking in internal meetings
You pride yourself on your excellent written and verbal communication skills
You are tech-savvy and navigate sales and internal tools quickly (Salesforce, Google Apps ) Why You’ll Love Working at DoorDash We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. It’s something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies. We are doers - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and our industry is what we do -- on every project, every day. We are learning - We’re not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even if it’s scary or inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if we’ve been in a role for one year or one minute. We are customer obsessed - Our mission is to grow and empower local economies. We are committed to our customers, merchants, and dashers and believe in connecting people with possibility. We are all DoorDash - The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights. We offer great compensation packages and comprehensive health benefits. About DoorDash
DoorDash is a technology company that connects customers with their favorite local and national businesses in over 4,000 cities and all 50 states across the United States and Canada. Founded in 2013, DoorDash empowers merchants to grow their businesses by offering on-demand delivery, data-driven insights, and better in-store efficiency, providing delightful experiences from door to door. By building the last-mile delivery infrastructure for local cities, DoorDash is bringing communities closer, one doorstep at a time. Read more on the DoorDash blog or at www.doordash.com . Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Company Description

Everything’s in place for you to win at Veeam – the global leader in Cloud Data Management. We provide trusted back-up solutions that deliver cloud data management and protection, keeping the world moving for over 360,000 customers including the vast majority of Fortune 500 companies. We’re extremely successful: a billion-dollar company and Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant that’s won over 170 top industry awards. But we’re always looking forward. Everyone here plays a part in finding new opportunities and winning new deals, and you’ll be backed by a best-in-service product and an unrivalled reputation for delivering customer satisfaction – our net promoter score is 3.5x the industry average.
Ultimately though, we grow together, so we’ll support you fully to be successful in your role. We’ll invest in you through our on-demand learning systems. Mentoring, training and coaching will help you to find your feet, take big challenges in your stride and perform at your best. There are acceleration programmes that could propel you further forward than you imagined. And whether it’s learning additional skills, gaining a new experience or taking the next step in your career, there will be lots of scope for development.
All this in a place where people talk from the heart. We have a culture of focus and excellence. We encourage innovation and iteration. And since our achievements are tangible, we can keep it real and be genuine with each other. We’re inclusive, diverse, open and honest people who collaborate, support each other and have fun together. And we’re nimble enough for people to speak up. We play to win; we’re competitive, hungry and driven, but we remain humble. If that’s you, get ready to do Veeamazing things.

Job Description

This position can be done remotely from anywhere within the U.S.A.
Do you have a passion for driving high touch marketing campaigns to accelerate demand? The Veeam Global Campaigns Team is seeking an experienced ABM Campaign Manager to lead programs targeting Enterprise accounts, Veeam’s highest growth segment.
As part of this role, the ABM Campaign Manager will work closely with sales teams, regional marketing teams, and demand generation functions to develop an integrated program mix that takes an account-first approach to driving demand for the enterprise. The ideal candidate will have experience launching cutting edge ABM technologies and tactics to successfully engage enterprise accounts, generate pipeline, and move them effectively through the buyer's journey.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Understand the buyers within enterprise accounts – pain points, demographics, and how they buy.
Define ABM strategy and execution plans, encompassing multiple ABM tools and technologies.
Partner with regional marketing and sales teams to develop a high touch marketing strategy with the goal of building and accelerating pipeline for Enterprise accounts.
Collaborate with cross-functional marketing teams on campaign concept, content requirements, buyer’s journey development, and digital marketing execution to ensure effectiveness execution.
Determine and manage program budgets
Analyze data to monitor the success of programs and optimize activities based on data-driven findings

Qualifications

Demonstrable experience working in a B2B technology marketing
Strong track record of driving successful Global ABM campaigns
Strong leadership and communication skills to drive consensus and articulate program recommendations to senior executives.
Have a balance of strategic thinking, project management, execution, and analytical skills to manage cross-functional teams across different geographies.
Additional Information

Veeam Software is an equal opportunity employer and does not tolerate discrimination in any form on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law. All your information will be kept confidential.
