Associate’s degree or equivalent years of experience
1 year of continuous employment in a customer service role
1 year of H&M retail experience preferred
Flexible to work any shift between the hours of 655am-1005pm is required

Competencies:
Strong customer service orientation including a friendly, helpful and professional demeanor
Strong, clear professional communication, both verbal and written
Courteous and polite telephone skills
Must have great listening skills
Computer literacy, specifically all MS programs for Windows (Excel, Word, Outlook, etc...)
Good organization and time management skills
Ability to think independently and propose new routines
Strong current and working of knowledge H&M’s customer service policies preferred
Strong computer skills, such as browser navigation, software interaction and data entry are needed
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Major, Lindsey & Africa’s Interim Legal Talent group has an immediate need for a Senior Commercial Real Estate Paralegal.
Overview: Major, Lindsey & Africa is seeking an experienced commercial real estate paralegal to join its client, a national mid-sized law firm, on a permanent and remote basis. This paralegal will work hand-in-hand with a Partner in the firm’s Chicago office while also managing two other members of the team. The practice focuses on sophisticated and high-value real estate deal work including acquisitions, dispositions, real estate-secured financing and commercial leasing transactions. This is a great opportunity to support a well-respected Partner’s high-end real estate private equity practice. The role will require a commitment of 40 – 50 hours per week allowing for a comfortable work/life balance.
Company: National, mid-sized law firm.
Experience: 10+ years of experience handling a broad scope of commercial real estate matters gained in a large law firm environment. A background managing junior paralegals and/or other team members is also required.
Location: Remote.
Responsibilities Include:
Serve as the Partner’s right-hand providing support on complex commercial real estate matters including acquisitions, dispositions, real estate-secured financing and commercial leasing transactions as well as other issues related to the purchase, sale, development, construction, financing and leasing of commercial real estate.
Day-to-day management of two team members including workflow delegation.
Assist in drafting purchase and sales agreements and drafting and reviewing commercial leases.
Assist with transaction and closing requirements for single-state and multi-state, and single-site and multi-site transactions, including preparing authority documents, ordering certificates of standing and addressing local and state closing requirements with transaction parties.
Order, review and analyze title reports, surveys and zoning reports.
Prepare objection notices and work with counter-parties and service providers to clear matters for closing.
Assist with entity formation and maintenance.
Perform other duties as required.
Qualifications Include:
10+ years of broad and sophisticated commercial real estate transactional experience gained in a large law firm environment.
Background assisting with complex commercial real estate acquisitions, dispositions and leasing transactions.
Extensive experience addressing title, survey and zoning matters in complex real estate transactions.
Experience managing other team members and the day-to-day responsibilities involved. Ability to operate independently and manage a small team while working remotely.
Ability to produce quality work under tight deadlines.
Strong communication, drafting and analytical skills.
Excellent proofreading and editing skills. High attention to detail. Strong organizational skills.
Background working on a small, collegial team is a plus but not required.
Bachelor’s Degree and/or Paralegal Certificate.
All interested and qualified candidates should apply directly with Major, Lindsey & Africa for review and consideration.
Major, Lindsey & Africa does not discriminate against applications on the basis of age, sex, race or any other protected characteristics pursuant to applicable state or federal laws.

SVS Group is currently looking to hire 2 Mortgage Loan Funders to work for one of our best Wholesale Lenders Remotely.The primary role of the Loan Funder/Doc Drawer is to oversee the funding and doc drawing on a company-wide basis.Funder Doc/Drawer reviews final docs, issues conditions as necessary and to prepare, upload and request funding wires from the company warehouse lines, uploads closed packages to the take-out investors.Funder/Doc Drawer is responsible for clearing the underwriting and closing conditions from the warehouse line to facilitate loan purchase, is responsible for confirming recording has occurred for each respective loan, to prevent floating wires and MUST reconcile all Closing Disclosures against the Settlement Agents Settlement Statement.The function of the Loan Funder is to analyze loan documents, employment, homeowner’s insurance, flood insurance, and documentation from escrow/title to render a decision by company guidelines and standards for quality, risk, and profitability as well as calculate and disburse funds. Summary
Our client is seeking an experienced Architectural Sales Manager to consult with architects, contractors, and builders on commercial ceiling and wall systems. The individual is responsible for generating new business and growing existing accounts in a highly productive sales environment. A strong candidate will have a proven track record in the architecture and design industry and will have excellent communication skills. The Architectural Sales Manager position is remote role, serving clients all over the US.
Architectural Sales Manager Responsibilities
Drive sales by identifying opportunities, developing relationships, and building brand awareness
Maintain a strategic understanding of market conditions and be able to adapt to and maintain a competitive advantage
Interact regularly with architectural companies, contractors and developers to specify products for future sales on projects, then ultimately close those sales and convert into revenue. Must have exceptional presentation skills and be able to organize and conduct webinars, online conference calls, and in-person AIA lunch and learn presentations (when/where safe to do so). Conduct workshops, contractor learning webinars and demos as needed and when/where safe to do so.
Work with company design and pricing software to create estimates, pricing information and visual details for customer proposals.
Provide AIA Continues Education accredited courses to architects and professionals.
Provide technical support for projects as needed
Architectural Sales Manager Qualifications
Proven success in architectural sales and exceeding sales targets.
Technical aptitude enhancing the ability to read, interpret and review architectural construction documents including door schedules, floor plans, elevations, submittals, and shop drawings
Cohesive interpersonal and relationship-building skills at multiple levels
Strong communication skills and a professional presentation demeanor
Ability to meet multiple project deadlines and exercise effective time management.
Ability to travel as required for the role.
Ability to lift and carry up to 50 lbs. of sample and display material for sale presentations
College bachelor or Technical College associate degree in an industry related program (i.e., Architectural Drafting and CAD; Architectural Engineering; Architectural Technology; Construction and Building Management) is strongly preferred.
If you are ready to take the next step in your career or just want to explore other opportunities, contact me directly at adam.kragh@gogpac.com.
You can email me directly at: adam.kragh@gogpac.com
All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

What does our client do?They are building a digital approach to funeral planning that is similar to the model that The Knot uses for wedding planning. Their mission is to ease the strain of the planning process and to empower our customers to celebrate the lives of their loved ones in a way that is personal and meaningful to them. Their vision is to disrupt the funeral services industry and create a more uplifting atmosphere around end-of-life planning.Who are we looking for?Our client is looking to add a highly motivated individual to lead company operations. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with experience in Operations Management.Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Owning and driving the key operational areas of our client’s business:Internal Operations: Standing up the processes/procedures to help us standardize our internal operations as we grow and scaleCustomer Service Operations: Standardizing our interaction model for engaging with our customersVendor Operations: Developing/executing a strategy for vendor acquisition and management, including coordinating delivery of vendor products/services to our customersManaging the day-today complexities of an “on demand” businessCoordinating with cross-functional team members leading strategy, marketing, technology, and customer service to develop and execute company’s ongoing growth plansCoordinating with software development team to create the customer-facing and backend technology needed to scale while also delivering a superior customer experienceDeveloping new revenue streams by identifying vendor products and services to incorporate into our planning packages; negotiating business-to-business contractual arrangementsManage daily business operations, profit & loss, key performance indicator performance, market growth, continuous process improvementsWhat you bring to the table: Bachelor’s degreeMinimum of 5 years of experience in operations, vendor management, e-commerce, and/or customer service operationsAdaptable to changing circumstances or requirementsA self-starter with effective project management skillsStrong written and verbal communications skillsHighly accountable with ability to handle multiple projects, manage competing priorities and workflowExperience working at an early-stage startup is an assetValues fit - the individual must be aligned with our company values, particularly as it relates to: a passion for helping others, a dedication to our mission to redefine the funeral services industry, a desire to create uplifting and fulfilling experiences for our users, and a willingness to have open and compassionate conversations about end-of-life and griefWhat you will enjoy: An opportunity to be a part of a promising startup in its early stagesA values-driven culture that encourages transparency and open communicationJob Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousWork Remotely:Yes

JobTitle: Product Line Manager - Tanzu App Services - Opportunity for Working Remotely Chicago, IL
Text:
Ready to build? So are we. Come join VMware’s new and exciting Modern Applications Business Unit (MAPBU) team, made up of products and services under the Tanzu portfolio to help customers build, run, and manage their most important applications. We build VMware Tanzu Application Service (TAS), which is used by many of the world’s largest companies.
Tight feedback loops drive our processes. We value test-driven development, pair programming, retrospectives, continuous integration, data-informed decision making, and working at a sustainable pace. We nurture psychological safety within teams and empower them to drive the changes necessary to obtain successful outcomes. We build software and solve problems collaboratively. Teammates are always accessible to lend a helping hand. The TAS teams are distributed around the US and Canada and try to overlap their hours of work between 9-3 PST to ensure in-person and real-time communication.
About You
As a Product Manager of the Tanzu Application Service, you will be responsible for a product that’s purpose-built for developers to boost feature velocity and for operations teams to deliver world-class uptime. You have seen the power of empowered, balanced teams and believe in Outcomes over Output. You have strong product instincts, but more importantly have an appreciation for and understanding of data-informed decision making, lean startup, agile and user-centered design values, principles, and practices. You are excited by the user and business value that technology can unlock. You thrive in a complex ecosystem, collecting, sharing, and synthesizing input from many directions and enabling the teams that you work with to continuously deliver customer value. You believe in doing the right thing and doing what works. To learn more about Tanzu watch this video. #TeamTanzu
Interested? Here is what we look for:
Excited to build developer-focused tooling that streamlines the software deployment process, enabling enterprises to focus on their core business.
A strong collaborator who actively fosters safe and inclusive teams. You enjoy mentoring others as much as you like learning from them.
You work well with others to jointly define and drive product strategy, vision and roadmap while evangelizing to internal stakeholders, partners and users of our product.
You are well versed in methods to discover customer problems and create valuable, desirable and feasible solutions.
You enjoy writing user stories and helping the dev team prioritize the backlog in order to continuously deliver measurable value towards the vision with your team.
You are excited to innovate and iterate on agile PM processes.
You are excited to engage with customers and the larger open source community of users.
The following are attributes we see in successful candidates, but they are not “requirements.” You are strongly encouraged to apply even if you don’t tick all the boxes because we want to hear from you and learn about what you can bring to the role:
5+ years of Product Management experience, especially with large scale, distributed products.
Previous experience in a Release Management role.
Ability to break down technically complex customer needs into simple solutions.
Strong leadership and communication skills and the ability to teach others.
Focused on data-driven approaches to solving problems, and accelerating the learning process to validate solutions.
Ability to collaborate well with engineers, designers, and other partners.
Experience with Lean and User-Centered Design methodologies.
Experience with agile development methodology, ideally Extreme Programming.
Understanding of the IT operations or software development space with a passion for understanding the life of Enterprise IT Operators and Application Developers.
Experience working on enterprise software is a plus. Experience with Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry and platform automation is a plus.
Experience with our technologies and processes is a plus (Ruby, Go, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry, Linux systems, Agile, TDD, XP).
Professional experience with relevant domains, such as distributed systems, API design, and release engineering and automation practices.
Interested in working in diverse and highly collaborative environments.
Past contribution to thriving open source communities.
Familiarity with common development tools/stacks, such as Unix, command-line interfaces, and CI/CD.
This position is eligible for JoinTeamTanzu referral campaign

JobTitle: Product Manager - App Stack Platform - Opportunity for Working Remotely Chicago, IL
Text:
VMware is looking for a Product Manager to join Tanzu and the Modern Applications Platform Business Unit (MAPBU) product team. VMware customers are increasingly deploying containers as the foundation of their application modernization efforts. The MAPBU team delivers best-in-class enterprise cloud-native solutions – supporting container frameworks such as Kubernetes.
This Tanzu team is chartered with providing application teams with a “native” Kubernetes experience that complements our existing Tanzu App Service (TAS) offering. They are a fast-paced, startup-like team where you will have the opportunity to make meaningful contributions to the product roadmap while developing skills in cutting-edge technologies. You will be part of an action-oriented team that has a culture of open communication, empowerment, innovation, teamwork, and customer success. We are looking for someone with a strong technical background to help define and evangelize the core capabilities of our next-generation app development and operations solution.
Given the current state of the program, we are looking for Product Manager’s that thrive and excel in the early phases of product definition, are not scared of large, complex problems, are truly passionate about users (developers & platform teams), knowledgeable about the Kubernetes ecosystem (or willing to learn!) and work well in fast-moving, quick-adjusting, and collaborative environments.
Job Role and Responsibilities:
As a Product Manager, you are a member of the Product team and in charge of product definition, roadmap, and direction of a specific area of the Tanzu feature set. You will work cross-functionally with user experience, engineering, and open source communities to create innovative solutions that build on top of a healthy ecosystem of internal and OSS tools.
You will be responsible for customer and market research that you will use to define the strategy for your area of responsibility and present that strategy to internal stakeholders and customers.
Working collaboratively with engineering to execute on the product roadmap through proper prioritization.
You will work to bring the customer and their needs closer to the development team through research, customer engagements, and involving customers in the incremental progress of the development team.
 Partnering with users, customers, and account teams to facilitate successful customer proof of concept deployments.
You will present technical presentations to customers, partners, and the field, and also gather feedback to influence product and solution offerings.

Required Skills:
 Able to breakdown complex problems into simple solutions
Obsess with customers, users, and their needs
Passionate technologists, ready to evangelize within and outside of VMware, not scared of going deep and broad and straddle OSS and commercial worlds
Positive attitude and strong team players
Strong communications skills
Some experience as a systems engineer, product manager, technical product marketing, technical marketing or experience working in a customer environment as a practitioner.
Experience working with and understanding the needs of enterprise IT executives, CIOs, system administrators, and cloud infrastructure providers
Good technical skills and comfortable in front of internal solutions architects, customers, and partners
Understanding of agile software development methodologies and tools.
Strong propensity to drive for results as part of a high performing team
Willingness to travel approximately 10% of the time
Experience working with Kubernetes and its ecosystem a plus
Hands-on development experience with distributed application concepts, SaaS and SysAdmin/DevOps tools a plus
Applying
If you are interested (or would like to nominate someone else), please fill out the application here. We believe diversity is important at all levels. We encourage everyone who is interested in the role to apply! #teamtanzu

JobTitle: Inbound Business Development Associate (m/f/d) - North America
Text:
If you are a fearless sales professional (m/f/d) who is looking to get in on the ground floor and grow something big, here is your once in a lifetime opportunity! Join us, the leading provider of real-time rendering and Virtual Reality technology to the global Architecture, Engineering and Construction market. Help prospects understand the amazing benefits offers and assist them as they navigate the Consideration and Decision stages of the buyer's journey. You will close deals when you can and have a team behind you when you need help.

Help us refine our story and process to make it easier for people to pick Enscape as their software of choice.
Deliver accurate metrics to ensure success against plans and targets, and track activities precisely to feed reports and dashboards to provide visibility into our sales activities.
Maintain effective time management to maximize sales time, including pre-call planning and customizing scripts to market segments and prospect types.

Your Profile:
At least 2-years' experience on a professional B2B inside-sales, lead generation, prospecting team, or business development team with a fast-growing organization with a proven track record of quota achievement as an individual contributor
Bachelor's degree is suggested; however, a combination of education and experience will be also considered
Fluent command of written and spoken English at the native level required; additional language skills are considered advantageous
Good IT skills like Microsoft Office as well as experience with Salesforce.com, SalesLoft, or other sales tools
Ideally, knowledge of CAD Software used in architecture (Revit, Sketchup, ArchiCad, Rhino, or Vectorworks) and/or Enscape software
Superior time management and very organized with excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills; a strong phone/video presence is required
Have a collaborative and consultative work style, the ability to thrive in a high volume, highly dynamic work environment, and love being in a customer-facing influencing role
Comfortable in a work environment that requires you to be connected and available from time-to-time outside standard working hours
Based in North America and willing to work from home-office permanently, no anticipated customer travels
You want:
Freedom of design and make a difference
To be part of a competent and dynamic team that celebrates success together
To develop yourself continuously and learn new things - free of prescribed courses or similar
Agile processes and software development according to SCRUM

Benefits:

Short decision-making paths that leave room for creativity and free space for experimentation and discussion
Language courses, regular corporate events, and shared leisure activities
Attractive salary and diverse career development opportunities
Occupational pension, optional capital-forming payments

Company Description

FireEye is the leader in intelligence-led security-as-a-service. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. Learn more about FireEye's world-class solutions and global footprint at https://www.fireeye.com/company.html.

Job Description

FireEye Mandiant has been at the forefront of cyber security and cyber threat intelligence since 2004. The FireEye Mandiant Services provides industry-leading incident response, assessment, transformation, managed detection and response, and training services with hands-on tactical support. Mandiant helps organizations effectively detect and respond to threats and reduce overall impact of business risk before, during, and after an incident. Our world class incident responders are able to resolve security incidents quickly, effectively and at scale with complete incident response including investigation, containment, remediation, and crisis management.
The Mandiant Incident Response team is seeking Consultants with deep understanding of both existing and emerging threat actors, as well as experience identifying rapidly changing tools, tactics and procedures of attackers. You must be able to see the big picture, understanding evolving attacker behavior and motivations, participate and manage large client-facing projects, and help to train/mentor other security consultants. The successful candidate will possess sound business acumen, strong consulting skills, current technical skills and be adept in leading multiple projects under tight deadlines. If you are interested in investigating computer crimes and breaches that make the headlines – and many more that don’t, then this opportunity is for you.
What You Will Do:
Conduct host forensics, network forensics, log analysis, and malware triage in support of incident response investigations
Utilize Mandiant and FireEye technology to conduct large-scale investigations and examine endpoint and network-based sources of evidence
Recognize and codify attacker tools, tactics, and procedures in indicators of compromise (IOCs) that can be applied to current and future investigations
Build scripts, tools, or methodologies to enhance Mandiant’s incident investigation processes
Develop and present comprehensive and accurate reports, trainings and presentations for both technical and executive audiences
Work with clients security and IT operations teams to implement remediation plans in response to incidents

Qualifications

Requirements:
3+ years of comparable experience
Experience with at least three of the following:
Windows disk and memory forensics
Network Security Monitoring (NSM), network traffic analysis, and log analysis
Unix or Linux disk and memory forensics
Static and dynamic malware analysis
Thorough understanding of enterprise security controls in Active Directory/Windows environments
Experience building scripts, tools, or methodologies to enhance investigation processes
Additional Qualifications:
Ability to travel up to 30%
Effectively communicating investigative findings and strategies to technical staff, executive leadership, legal counsel, and internal and external clients
Effectively develop documentation and explain technical details in a concise, understandable manner
Strong time management skills to balance time among multiple tasks, and lead junior staff when required
Must be able to work in the US without sponsorship
Additional Information

This is a regionally-based role that can be remote; candidates must be located in the Central region of the US.
At FireEye we are committed to our #OneTeam approach combining diversity, collaboration, and excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Overview:

Working 100% remotely as a telecommuter, the Information Solution Designer works within the Digital and Innovation team to establish a strong information foundation for the Digital Front Door and Human Experience Products at Common Spirit. Our applications touch consumers, patients, and care providers across the country and around the world. Designer establishes a consistent data implementation strategy and roadmap for the Office of Digital products. The role focuses on elements required to ensure data lineage, data linkages, data quality, consistent data domain definition/classification, business value of information assets, usage and integration across disparate platforms, and data availability requirements. Healthcare information is the most important asset driving the need for digital transformation. In this role a successful candidate has the opportunity to directly impact our ability to virtual deliver care to patients across the enterprise.

CommonSpirit Health was formed by the alignment of Catholic Health Initiatives (CHI) and Dignity Health. With more than 700 care sites across the U.S., from clinics and hospitals to home-based care and virtual care services, CommonSpirit is accessible to nearly one out of every four U.S. residents. Our world needs compassion like never before. Our communities need caring and our families need protection. With our combined resources, CommonSpirit is committed to building healthy communities, advocating for those who are poor and vulnerable, and innovating how and where healing can happen, both inside our hospitals and out in the community.
Responsibilities:

Expectations:
Successfully meet goals and objectives while working from home as a telecommuter
Establish standards for data naming and data domain classifications. Defines data attribution for key data domains. Retains standards in a metadata repository.
Works with Product Owners, Subject Matter, and Domain experts to support definition and refinement of backlog features and user stories, acceptance criteria, data lineage and data validation rules for Office of Digital Products.
Develops, maintains, and publishes a prescriptive architecture for Data Implementation practices which includes; a) identification of system of records, b) data flow diagrams, c) data domain definitions, d) information mapping to business usage, stewardship, and value e) data lineage, and f) conceptual data model(s).
Provides prescriptive guidance and input into DDD (domain driven design) for the data & service layer design of the Application Development teams developing Office of Digital products.
Develops repeatable data ingestion and provisioning designs for data providers and data consumers
Applies minimum necessary principles in all data decisions and designs
Creates an Information Directory/Catalogue for business data, including Master Data Management (MDM).
Oversees development, registration and usage of data services placed in a reusable technology service layer.
Qualifications:

Required Education and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Computing, Engineering or similar
Minimum of 5 yrs experience working as an application data architect / engineer where the majority of time was spent analyzing data requirements, producing data models and implementing those models in partnership with AppDev teams for ”Internet scale Web Applications”
5 years of hands-on Database (SQL/NoSQL)Development & Implementation experience
Previous healthcare experience in a HIPAA regulated environment is a plus
Senior leadership experience in a complex health care environment is highly desirable.

Required Minimum Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, Training:
Understanding dependencies of different systems in terms of data and interlinkage of them.
Capable of understanding “Tribal Knowledge” of various systems and work with data stewards and owners of those systems so overall data quality can be improved.
Working through different groups to achieve a goal of “Master Data Management”, pertinent to Office of Digital.
Understanding digital transformation and how web traffic data is used to enhance business outcomes and consumer experiences.
Previous experience with ETL and data transformation tools like Informatica, Scribe or Talend is a plus.
Experience in using an electronic metadata repository products.
Experience in developing Data Quality capabilities for Data Stewards.
Experience in developing Data Validation rules within Extract Load & Transform processes.
Demonstrated understanding and implementation of a service oriented architecture and big data. Understand supported transport protocols and messaging capabilities.
Experience with Microsoft Azure cloud based computing services, Big data, NoSQL, RESTful APIs and Security models
Experience with Visual Studio Team Services or Team Foundation Services.
The ability to work in fast past agile environment to evangelize best practices and clean architectures
Ability to communicate technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences
Self-directed, with the ability to engage and influence product and technology leadership in driving measurable results

Desired Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, Training:
Working knowledge of HL7 and FHIR or related standards would be helpful.
Experience in Healthcare industry is desirable
Familiarity with compliance standards such as HIPAA, PCI, OWASP is a plus
Experience working with the SAFe scaled agile framework

related skills: adobe experience manager (aem) / amazon web service (aws) / agile / scrum / rally / ca agile central / information technology infrastructure library (itil) / information technology service management (itsm) / the open group architecture framework (togaf) / website design / application portfolio / enterprise architecture / application portfolio roadmap / product analysis / vendor analysis / electronic medical records (emr) / clinical integrations / health level 7 (hl7), work from home, telecommute, virtual, remote, immediate hiring,

TrueBlue continues to broaden its service offerings, reaching more markets, and offering greater technology and innovation to benefit employers, staff and contingent workers.

Allianz is the home for those who dare – a supportive place where you can take the initiative to grow and to actively strengthen our global leadership position. By truly caring about people – both its 100 million private and corporate customers and more than 147,000 employees – Allianz fosters a culture where its employees are empowered to collaborate, perform, embrace trends and challenge the industry. Our main ambition is to be our customers’ trusted partner, instilling them with the confidence to grow. If you dare, join us at Allianz Group.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

 Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty (AGCS) is a leading global corporate insurance carrier and a key business unit of Allianz Group. We provide risk consultancy, Property-Casualty insurance solutions and alternative risk transfer for a wide spectrum of commercial, corporate and specialty risks across 10 dedicated lines of business.
Our customers are as diverse as business can be, ranging from Fortune Global 500 companies to small businesses, and private individuals. Among them are not only the world’s largest consumer brands, tech companies and the global aviation and shipping industry, but also wineries, satellite operators or Hollywood film productions. They all look to AGCS for smart answers to their largest and most complex risks in a dynamic, multinational business environment and trust us to deliver an outstanding claims experience.

 Worldwide, AGCS operates with its own teams in 32 countries and through the Allianz Group network and partners in over 200 countries and territories, employing over 4,300 people. As one of the largest Property-Casualty units of Allianz Group, we are backed by strong and stable financial ratings. In 2019, AGCS generated a total of €9.1 billion gross premium globally.
For more information, visit www.agcs.allianz.com or follow us on Twitter @AGCS_Insurance and LinkedIn.

Qualifications: High school or equivalent (Required)US work authorization (Required)Day Shift (Preferred)
Text: A large National Title Insurance Company is looking for reliable, outgoing, organized individuals with the ability to multitask and work in a fast paced, team environment. Candidates must have strong customer service skills and must possess solid computer skills. Positions available for both full and part time employment across the Greater Chicagoland area including the following counties. Cook, McHenry, Lake, Will, Kane, DuPage, and Grundy Counties.Duties include but are not limited to:· Fielding customer requests via phone and email· Working closely with escrow, title and sales to complete customer requests· Support for other departments as needed· Monitoring office email, handling and distributing accordinglyJob Types: Full-time, Part-timeBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceDisability insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offRetirement planVision insuranceEducation:High school or equivalent (Required)Shift Availability:Day Shift (Preferred)Work Location:Multiple locationsFully RemoteBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place
